name: Here to Slay: Fierce Panguardian Promo Card
description:
"At the beginning of your turn, you may switch The Fierce Panguardian between Guardian and Fighter.
Each time you CHALLENGE another player's card, that player cannot play Modifier cards until the end of the turn." - Card Text
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Interrupts, Role Playing, Set Collection, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Seven Grievances: The Rise of Manchuria
description:
“七大恨：滿州的崛起 Seven Grievances: The Rise of Manchuria” is a strategic wargame to simulate the Manchuria invasion of Ming dynasty in 17 century in China. It is a fast-paced and card-driven wargame for 2-3 players in 2 to 3 hours. Players commands the Army of Manchuria, Ming Dynasty, and Mongolia and use Strategy cards to maneuver tactics, develop technologies, and build infantry, cavalry, or artillery units to conquer areas and win the victory.

Every player takes a turn by selecting one roundel action and playing one strategy card. Roundel action includes special actions of different seasons and Strategy card includes events, technologies, and country actions. Card also represents your resource and you need to control more civilians to support your armies. You can get cards from the taxation or raiding enemy areas. Player wins the game by conquering 16 areas, collecting 3 victory points, or controlling enemy capitals.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 3
description:
Iconic Heroes is the latest release in the Pathfinder Battles series of pre-painted plastic miniatures from WizKids Games and Paizo Publishing.

Iconic Heroes Set 3 includes six all-new miniatures featuring legendary characters from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game universe:

Alahazra, Iconic Oracle
Damiel, Iconic Alchemist
Imrijka, Iconic Inquisitor
Alain, Iconic Cavalier
Balazar, Iconic Summoner
Padrig, Eidolon

Each Iconic Heroes set also includes exclusive Cards (one for each miniature) for use in the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game! These special Cards are only available in this Pathfinder Battles product!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: Across Four Oceans
description:
"Across Four Oceans" is a free Nautical wargame rules set for use with World War II era miniatures. The base rules are tactical, but there is also an operational game that features secret objectives. The rules can simulate almost any kind of encounter, varying from carrier clashes to convoy battles. There is no tape measuring required. Instead, the players move and fight on a hexagonal map. All ship statistics have been simplified, and the system uses only six-sided dice.

All of the rules and navy lists can be found in the files sections. Navy lists include ships, aircraft, bases, and special rules. Operational maps can be downloaded in both the files section and under the web links. Future maps covering the Arctic and Indian Ocean will be available in the future.

The following navies are represented in the game: America, Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Britain, Canada, Chile, China, Colombia, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Peru, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Soviet Union, Spain, Sweden, Thailand, Turkey, and Yugoslavia.

Also, for fun there are hypothetical navies for the Confederate States of America and the Austro-Hungarian Empire.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: The Captain is Dead: Lockdown – Minimum Security Promo
description: The Captain is Dead: Lockdown is a challenging attempt to escape an alien prison without your brave captain! Sometimes it can be a little... too challenging. For those who might want some new variety, we offer Minimum Security! This promo expansion includes new crew members, equipment, and more that will make the prison a little more friendly, assuming being locked in a strange alien prison whose guards still want to kill you can be called friendly.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – Wave 1: Evil Warriors Faction
description:
Skeletor appears on the battlefield and summons the terror-awakening evil ghost, Scareglow, from the dimension of Infinita along with his trusted henchman, the wild Beast Man. He will provide his allies with teleports to facilitate movement around the arena.

EXPANSION PACK INCLUDES:

1x Set of additional rules
1x Manual
2x Evil Warriors miniatures
16x Various cards
2x Terrain accessories
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Stat Check Resolution, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Warfighter: Expansion #14 – Israel #1
description:
The Israel #1 expansion adds Israel national forces to the game. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


10 Player Soldiers
7 Non-Player Soldiers
9 Squad Soldiers
20 Weapons
5 Equipment
5 Skills


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Fracture
description:
Fracture is a new kind of territory control game where players fracture and rebuild the entire board on each turn. From a simple set of rules emerge surprisingly complex strategies.

SETUP:
Distribute Blinks evenly to all players (minimum 4 Blinks/player). Each player chooses a team color and sets their Blinks to that color by double-clicking. Once all players are set, recombine all Blinks into a starting arrangement with colors segregated.

GAMEPLAY
The object of this game is to make your Blinks “happy.” In order for a Blink to be happy, it must be:
a) touching at least two other tiles, AND
b) not touching a tile of its own color

On their turn, a player makes a fracture by splitting and separating the cluster into two smaller clusters. The clusters can be of any size; they do not have to be equal. You can choose to only move a single Blink, and you can move any tile, not just the ones of your own color.

Fractures must be able to be slid into and out of place while remaining flat on the table. They also cannot split the board into more than 2 halves.

The player then reconnects the two clusters in any way they choose. Once a player has finished their move, play passes to the next clockwise player.

WIN CONDITION:
The game ends when, at the end of a turn, a player has made all of their own color Blinks happy. In games with neutral Blinks, they must make all neutral Blinks happy as well.

This game is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Map Deformation, Modular Board

name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Lawless Badlands
description:
The Sacred Land expansion contains the following:

42x Bandit miniature (in 9 different designs)
1x Nil miniature
Tiles, cards, tokens and all components needed to play


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Box Seat Baseball
description: Another tabletop baseball simulation where players are rated based on actual performance. This game uses park factors, wind ratings, and other "game day" factors to separate it from the competition.
mechanics: Simulation

name: Nuclear Renaissance
description:
Nuclear Renaissance is a post apocalyptic themed, turn based, table-top strategy game.
It uses 28mm figures and vehicles. Players play a gang of hardened fighters, pitting themselves against others in the wastelands of the future.

The Tome of Tridlins is a supplement for the game Nuclear Renaissance that really completes the game. The core game rules can be downloaded for free from the Ramshackle website or a printed version can be had from the web store. The Tome of Tridlins adds much more detailed gang design rules, along with a full campaign system and more background.

The main aspects of playing Nuclear Renaissance that sets it apart from other games are that it is great for multiple players and that the gang creation rules are really versatile.

The multi player aspect of the game makes it great for gaming groups. Three player games are easily handled, while even five or six players can get through a game in three hours or so. The rules are really designed so that any sized gaming group can have fun together without feeling that the person to go last is at a disadvantage, or that one player has to get left out. The game is biased towards playing campaigns, where players develop their gangs. The new book, the Tome of Tridlins, gives full rules for playing campaigns. This means that players can always get a game in a campaign even if only three people show up for a gaming night! What this comes down to is that gaming groups can easily fit the game around the players that show up and the boards that are available, rather than the other way around.

The gang creation rules were made with the idea of letting players play any type of gang that fits their fancy. Players can choose to play biker gangs, zombie hordes, all animal beast packs (monsters included), bands of mutants, robot death squads and even military conclaves. Players can even mix them all up, to have robot driven battle trucks packed full of mutants, zombies and wild animals with a mighty hero in charge! Vehicles are fully integrated into the game play and there are comprehensive but simple rules for designing ones that suit your gang. Within the gang design rules, players are set very few limitations. There are hundreds of options for making really unique forces. This complexity is condensed down onto simple gang rosters that can easily hold all the information you need to play with, without having masses of notes, counters, cards and other paraphernalia.

The problem with having very open gang design is keeping the game balanced. After six years of testing, the final result balances player gangs in a number of ways. The first is a points system, where each player is given a set amount to spend building their gangs. In campaigns the players are awarded more points as they play more games but the campaign system keeps players who miss gaming nights in the loop. Its easy to catch up, even if you lose! The second way to balance the game is that more power leads to less versatility. Power hungry "one man armies" don't get many tactical options and are often left waiting while the other players take their turns with larger gangs. The game works with players alternately activating characters, so gangs with the average ten or so members keep playing throughout a turn.

The game is aimed at players who want a new gaming system, nothing too complex to learn but with a lot of options. The game features solid mechanics and balance, which means that its robust enough to play well, but loose enough to let players use their imaginations. Power gamers can indulge their lust for super armoured laser cannon wielding death knights mounted on super bikes but will find that the other players in their gaming group will have the flexibility to constantly undermine their power gaming tactics. On the other hand, players who want to concentrate more on the theme of their gang will find that its easy to build forces that are powerful but have plenty of room for idiosyncrasies and whimsey!

Ramshackle Games already produces hundred of miniatures to play Nuclear Renaissance with. Players will find that most of the options in the books are covered in one form or another, so its easy to get a really thematic gang together right from the get-go.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: HeroQuest: Running the Gauntlet
description:
This is a Solo Quest for a Wizard.

Description in the book:
This is a HeroQuest adventure for which you will require the HeroQuest board game. You will need a GamesMaster and one player. Rules are the same as for any HeroQuest game, but the adventure has one difference: it is only for a Wizard.

Additional note:
This Solo Adventure was published in the book: The Screaming Spectre.
The book has 3 parts:
- Story to read
- Solo Adventure for Heroquest Bordgame
- Gamebook Soloadventure
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Role Playing

name: Great War at Sea: Prizes of War
description:
Another DIY product for the GWAS series, adding the French and Russian Navies as prizes of the British and Germans. From the APL website...

"Different courses of the Great War might well have seen warships of the Marine Nationale or Imperial Russian Navy serving under British or German colors: taken as booty by a victorious Germany (the actual fate of Russia’s Black Sea Fleet), seized by Britain to prevent their falling into enemy hands following the defeat of an ally, sold in the face of more pressing priorities on land or a different ending to hostilities. Transferred to the North Sea arena across which the war’s two principal naval antagonists faced each other, the more modern of these ships could well have played critical roles in determining whether Britannia or Germania would ultimately hold Neptune’s Trident.

Prizes of War is a supplement for the Great War at Sea series that allows players to examine this question of alternate history. French and Russian ships from our Jutland and Mediterranean games are allocated to the Royal Navy and Kaiserliche Marine, and included in a series of 10 battle and 11 operational scenarios set in and around the North Sea.

Prizes of War includes 70 playing pieces (you will need to assemble these yourself) and this booklet. Playing all the scenarios in this supplement requires the included pieces plus maps and pieces from our Jutland game (and no others!).

Prizes of War is sold exclusively via .pdf download. The playing pieces are not die-cut and mounted, nor is the scenario book printed. Instead it comes as a series of .pdf files that will need to be assembled into the game’s components."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Command at Sea: Volume IX – Emperor's Fleet: The Imperial Japanese Navy in World War II
description:
(from the back of the book:)

Emperor's Fleet provides statistics for the Japanese ships and aircraft, and all their weapons and sensors extant in the Second World War. Over 200 ship-classes and over 130 aircraft are included, many of which have not appeared in print before. All earlier listings for these ships and aircraft have been updated to include information from newly available references, and great strides have ben made in reconciling conflicting or incorrect sources. Damage data and other game-related information has also been updated to Command At Sea 4th Edition standard. More than making the information compatible with Command At Sea, the data is now in the same format and uses the same standards as "Harpoon" and "Fear God and Dreadnought", the other core games in the Admiralty Trilogy.

All ships and aircraft extant from 1939 to late 1945, including several projected and/or hypothetical platforms are also here, such as the Tosa class battleship, cancelled after the Washington Treaty. A detailed listing of Japanese merchant ships is included. Late or post-war platforms include the Ibuki and B64 and B65 classes, as well as the A7M1 Reppu and the Ki-94 interceptor.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Dust Tactics: KV47 Walker – "Nadya / Natalya / Natasha"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The KV47 Walker is a versatile new walker for Dust Tactics! While the SSU once lagged in walker technology, they have since developed the KV47, a walker platform capable of trading blows with any opposing armor. This impressive machine can be fielded in three different variants: the Nadya, Natasha, or Natalya.

Whether you want to field the Nadya with its Sulfur Throwers, the Natasha and its 45mm Howitzers, or the Natalya featuring twin Circular Saws, there is a KV47 for any situation. Take command of this devastating SSU walker!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Interdiction
description: A two player strategy game of space combat. Players take turns acting out their orders from the previous turn and then recording secret orders for their next move. Players can gain variable amounts of knowledge about their opponent's next move using their Interdictors to intercept enemy communications. Some notable elements of the game are secret orders, interception of orders, and facing-dependent piece movement.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Legend of Dead Man's Hand
description:
The Legend of Dead Man´s Hand is a campaing source book for Dead Man´s Hand. It includes rules for running multi-player campaigns, 11 new scenes (Scenarios), rules for rogues (Named characters) and has rules for four new gangs: Banditos, Renegade Indians, 7th Cavakry and Pinkertons.

Trough the campaing system the gangs are getting into schemes, gets reputation and experience and suffers injuries and death.

The book also comes with four sets of playing cards. One set for each of the new gangs.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Hive Colony (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
Posted with permission of John Yianni, designer of Hive.


Hive Colony is a collection of unofficial expansions for Hive designed by Stephen Taylor. It includes Hive: Original, Venom, Swarm, Predators, Guardians and Honeycombo.

Hive: Venom – Includes all the original pieces in addition to some new creatures on the reverse sides. You must decide which face up to place the pieces depending on the current state of the board and your future plans. You can flip the pieces but this will cost you a tempo. The new pieces are designed not to over power the Originals be rather to compliment them and present the player with more strategic choices.

Hive: Swarm – A mode of play which adds in a little bit of randomness to Hive and challenges the player to make the best use of the hand they are dealt. It can be played with Hive Original or any of the expansions and even allows you to place your opponent's pieces!

Hive: Predators – Introduces some powerful pieces with killer moves which can permanently remove an opponent's creatures from the Hive. It also introduces the alternative victory condition of removing your opponent's Queen Bee which encourages even more interesting ways to play and the greater possibility to come back from a losing position.

Hive: Guardians – Dominate the top of the Hive with these high flying creatures. You now have to fully surround the Queen Bee so even the top must be covered to win. They can also be very useful in neutralising some of the new expansions when playing with all the expansions together.

Hive: Honeycombo – This piece is shared by both players which allows you sacrifice your current turn in order to then play two moves in your next turn. This opens up many new possibilities such as being able to place and move a piece without it getting pinned, or moving two pieces in to surround the Queen without your opponent being able to move one away with the Pillbug.

Please see attached files for the rules and print and play stickers.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Buck: Legacy – Cold Snap
description:
Out of the Fridge and into the Freezer! Cool off in in this frosty expansion for Buck: Legacy!
Features the new race- Gryphon!
The pack features 13 new cards, adding new items, treasures, dungeons and areas to explore!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Giant Mutant Ant
description:
This expansion contains:
1 Giant Mutant Ant, 1 Bug Trainer from the Science Division.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Junkers Ju.87 B–2 "Stuka" Squadron Pack
description:
The Junkers Ju.87 B–2, best known as “Stuka,” was a single engine German dive bomber, easily recognizable by its inverted gull wings and fixed undercarriage. The Stuka’s design included several innovative features, including automatic pull–up dive brakes and a famous siren, the Jericho–Trompete, which would unleash a morale crushing whine when diving. The Stuka was widely used with great success during the first period of the Battle of Britain, although it later showed its vulnerability against well–organized opposition.

Sturzkampfgeschwader 77
StG 77 spearheaded the German blitzkrieg in Poland and France, but suffered heavy losses of men and machines during the earliest part of the Battle of Britain, when it was used to raid on enemy shipping and islands.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Double-seven binary-coding Hexdominoes
description:
Double-seven binary-coding hexdominoes is a dominoes-like set that includes 36 tiles (with numbers from 0 to 7) composed of two adjacent hexagons. Instead of the standard ‘pips’, this set uses a special concentric binary representation. A central pip equals 1, a small circle equals 2 and a big circle equals 4. This set is the brother of the double-seven binary-coding dominoes set by the same publisher.

The tiles are made of 8mm thick laser-cut, engraved and painted black acrylic.

It's been devised as a game system. Apart from any dominoes game, you can also play Hexdominimum, Hexdominomega, Hexdominup and Hextra, among others.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: King Arthur's Vortex Chess
description:
Fast tactical game, Chess like, set in Arthurian's mythology universe.

You will be commanding minions as you’ll be casting powerful spells to achieve victory. Special dice will help to control changing board every turn and power hexes give you cards for conducting key maneuvers.

Goal of the game is to defeat opponent mage: Merlin or Mordred.

Every turn you will draw a number of cards depends on how many power hexes your minions are controlling on the board.

Cards in your hand are your actions. Spending them you can move your minions, you can boost attack skill or defenses and at last you can cast special spells, like: tornado, run or stone.

Every player at the beginning of their turn is forced to roll a special die which change an element on the board, making it different each turn. It is the player's choice when the turn ends whether or not he/she has any cards left on a hand or not.

In a tournament version you can use a Chess Clock for a fast and full of emotion game.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Neutral Stormcrow Mercenaries
description:
With war happening regularly in Westeros, certain groups have formed around the idea of selling their armed services to anyone who can pay their price.

The Stormcrow Mercenaries are one such group. This unit has moderate stats, but is a perfect addition for players who like Unit Attachments, as their special rules let them take one for fewer points than usual.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: FinanCity (Second Edition)
description:
This games simulates the processes of managing household resources and everything that implies:
• Planning income and expenses
• Deciding when and how to invest
• Dealing with unforeseen events
• Balancing health and wellbeing

Over 10 years (rounds) players will have to get jobs, invest, save money, buy things that give them wealth, take some debt, etc.

All players must have accomplished the goals in their household card by the end of year 10. Among them, the player that most successfully accomplish that will be the winner.

This is a re-implementation of FinanCity: Organiza tu dinero with new features, new mechanichs, new graphics and new components.
mechanics: Income, Investment, Loans, Worker Placement

name: Bear Flag Republic
description:
Bear Flag Republic is a card-enhanced game for 2 players based on California in 1846-47 at the time of the Mexican-American War. The game map shows most of California (known as Alta (upper) California. The owners are Mexico & the Californios or Californians). The object of the game is for the Californians to retain Alta California while the goal of the Bear Flaggers and United States troops and sailors is to seize the soon to be Golden State. The fighting itself was not particularly bloody and involved relatively small numbers of troops. There are two major events that influence the course of the game. One is the outbreak of the Bear Flag Revolt just before the formal Declaration of War between the United States and Mexico is known of in California. The other is the rebellion of Southern California over the initial occupation by the Americans. The game is a TWO-ACT play. Several key and often-random events may play a powerful role in he final outcome of the fighting. The game will take 1-3 hours to play to completion.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Solarion: Foundation of Empires
description:
A galaxy of conquering species have come up from a vast array of histories. Their desire for exploration and expansion throughout the galaxy to propagate their kind foretells a dark time for the peaceful ancient species on existing planets. Destructive events are on the horizon.

In Solarion: Foundation of Empires, players will be attempting to control a hex-tile galaxy with a deck of technologies and strategies hoping to gain control of resource producing planets, worlds habitable for colonists, and valuable Solarion planets for end game scoring. The game uses a technology deck divided into 3 parts fueling a card row for purchases similar to other deck builders. Three scorings occur over the course of play with different scoring cards for each. The game ends when either the last deck of cards is depleted, or a player has used their last colonist.

After these galactic ages, players count up their points and the most epic species is the new overlord of the galaxy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Resource to Move, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Unsullied Swordmasters
description:
The Unsullied have one of the most difficult training regimens of any unit. Only about one in three survives to the end. However, those that do are swordsmen of unparalleled skill. Though they look slight compared to most western swordsmen, that does not mean they’re not as strong or effective on the battlefield. When joined with an officer, their skills are only enhanced, trading blow-for-blow with any foe.

The Unsullied Swordsmen unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Targaryen players an effective melee unit on the field. Their melee attacks hit at the weak points in enemy armor, granting numerous bonuses when they strike. The Officer Unit Attachment adds to their strengths, trading wounds with the enemy when being attacked, making this unit able to dish out wounds both when attacking and on the defensive.

Contents:
13 Miniatures
‣ 1 Officer
‣ 11 Swordmasters
‣ 1 Swordmaster Bannerman
1 Unit Card
1 Attachment Card
1 Movement Tray
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement

name: Gascony's Legacy: The Count of Monte Cristo
description:
The adventures of the Musketeers continue in this expansion for Gascony's Legacy

Follow the punishments enacted by the Count of Monte Cristo against his enemies in new outdoor environments.

Includes a new 3-story campaign, with 2 new playable characters, more weapons, reactions, and enemies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Gascony's Legacy: The Man in the Iron Mask
description:
The adventures of the Musketeers continue in this expansion for Gascony's Legacy!

Join Aramis on his quest to free the Man in the Iron Mask from prison and swap him with the King of France!

Includes a new 3-story campaign, with 2 new playable characters, more weapons, reactions, and enemies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Symbiotes – Lethal Protector
description:
Lethal Protector introduces an all-new team of skillful and powerful symbiotic aliens. They can protect your deck against a frantic frenzy of card battles and defeat your opponents with their symbiotic talents. As the host, you can now bond with them and wield their ultimate powers!

This expansion includes 1 Rulesheet and 55 cards including fan favorites Venom and his symbiotes.
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Symbiotes – Maximum Carnage
description:
As the symbiotic story arc continues, Carnage rules! In this second instalment of Vs.System 2PCG, Carnage will bring an unthinkable level of brutality and chaos to the world of Vs System. Carnage is sure to make your deck stronger with his terrifying talents but at what cost?

This expansion includes 1 Rulesheet and 55 cards including Carnage and his symbiote villains.
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: Parade of the Bruges Fools
description:
The government of Maximilian, who inherited the reign over Bruges in 1482, is harsh and taxes are high, leading to public discontent. When Maximilian visited Bruges in 1488, the people decided to revolt. They were able to imprison their monarch for over four months. Out of vengeance, Maximilian imposed a prohibition to organize festivities and fairs. To calm him down, you as the people of Bruges decided to organize a celebration to honor Maximilian.

In Parade of the Bruges fools players take on the role of a medieval labourer living in Bruges. Together, you try to gather musicians, acrobats and jesters to join a big parade in honour of Maximilian in order to earn his respect and therefore more freedom. However, the player who surpasses the expectations of grumpy Maximilian, wins this game and becomes mayor in Bruges.

Each turn, players perform one of three actions:

persuade an artist by offering a drink in the local bar
play an artist into the parade and score (some artists have the possibility to move other cards one space or to swap with a card)
rest (by taking back into your hand all of the cards you needed to persuade artists)


When an artist reached the seventh column, the parade is complete and the game ends.

In the advanced game mood bonusses are dealt to the player(s) who took most notice of the King's temper (3 out of 20 mission cards).
mechanics: Deck Construction, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: Gataria
description:
Nyx is a cat who lives with Petunia, the cutest apprentice witch you have ever seen, and they take care of each other, along with doing a lot of trickery. Nyx is getting old, though, and preparing to retire, so Petunia will be need of a new companion soon! That's why they're looking to adopt a new kitten to learn all about being a witches' cat!

Each player controls a magic copy of a cat, who will try to showcase their skills to either reach the tower at the center of the board or capture 3 cats from other players.

Every turn they will place their movement tile on the table and, in ascending order, jump to an adjacent roof with the same color or number. They can also use magic portals to navigate from one edge to another. If at any point they meet another cat, this one will be captured unless they yield a treat to distract!

Petunia also offers treats that can be traded for attack, defense and trick cards, or by keys to the tower. At the end of every round, one of the players moves Nyx, shattering a roof and creating new portals and connections!
mechanics: Action Drafting, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Take That

name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander Legends
description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering is the first-ever draftable Commander experience!

In the Commander format, players have a legendary creature who serves as the deck's commander. That creature is set aside at the start of the game, and can be cast as if it were in your hand. Normally, this is done with a 100-card singleton constructed deck. However, Commander Legends gives it a new twist. When drafting Commander Legends, each player opens a 20-card booster pack, selects two cards from it, and then passes the pack to the player sitting next to them. They then pick two more cards from the pack they've been handed, and so on, going around the table until all cards are picked. This is repeated with a second booster pack, and again with a third, until everyone has picked a total of 60 cards. Players then choose a commander (or a pair of commanders that both have the Partner ability) from among the cards they drafted, add any number of basic lands, and build a 60-card deck. Then everyone shuffles up their decks and battles in a free-for-all! (A larger pod of drafters splits into two groups first.)

The set is sold in draft boosters and collector boosters, and contains 361 cards (141 commons, 120 uncommons, 77 rares, and 22 mythic rares, plus the Prismatic Piper, a special helper card who appears more frequently than a common), plus a selection of 32 legendary reprints from past sets who appear with an all-new foil-etched treatment in collector boosters and, on rare occasion, in draft boosters as well. Two preconstructed Commander decks, "Arm for Battle" and "Reap the Tides," were also released alongside the main set.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Negotiation, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Bribery, Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, King of the Hill, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Jamaica: Event Cards
description:
Add these 6 new card to get more fun in the treasures deck.
When a player take reavele it, all players must apply the effect.

Released by the publisher at Paris Ludique Convention in July 2022.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Il Sangue del Barbaro
description:
Relive the mythical deeds of the barbarian described by the pen of Robert E. Howard in an anthology at crossroads between mortal trials, monstrous creatures and evil sorcerers taken from the original tales of the master of the Sword & Sorcery genre: The elephant tower, The palace of the the dead, The God in the Urn, The Palace Intruders and The Ice King's Daughter.

For the first time the best Italian authors of interactive fiction join forces to create a story with numerous alternative endings set in the unexplored corners of the Hyborian continent, from the Cimmerian villages to the corrupt heart of the City of Thieves, passing through the icy peaks of Nordheim.

Antonio Costantini, Andrea Tupac Mollica, Alberto Orsini, Lorenzo Trenti and Valentino Sergi are the exceptional signatures of this project for which an innovative Deck System has been created consisting of 3 different sets of cards. Now it's time to take up the sword and go on an adventure! For Crom! A truly epic game book!
categories: Adventure, Book, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dodos Riding Dinos: Servit & Aureus
description:
Aureus Fulgen from Dragonbond joins the race in Dodos Riding Dinos.

His Radiant Majesty allows you to exchange your hand of cards with another player if you are not in the lead.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – Flying Higher
description:
Let’s Rocket!

Zordon has been captured! Led by Astronema, the Princess of Evil, the forces of Dark Spector are spreading out to conquer the galaxy. Only Andros and his Space Rangers can save the universe from being plunged into darkness. Hop on your Galaxy Glider and rocket into action!

Play as Andros and his team of Space Rangers as they join the roster of heroes. Astronema and the lieutenants of Darkonda make their appearance as playable villains! Featuring new ways to play and win the game using the Dark Specter and Zordon objective cards!

This expansion requires the Power Rangers Deck-Building Game Core Set or Zeo – Stronger Than Before to play.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Team-Based Game

name: Maximum Apocalypse: The Few and Cursed
description:
In a post-apocalyptic world where 90 percent of the planet's water just disappeared, humanity was forced to learn to survive at any cost. Seventy years have passed and the moral codes that maintain society are increasingly folklore - it is now every man for himself and the strongest wins.

Based on the indie comic, The Few and Cursed, this expansion features a brand new Curse Chaser class based on the heroine of the series, the Redhead. With 60 monster cards, a 31 card Curse Chaser deck, 5 promo cards, 8 map tiles, 3 standees, 6 curse tokens, the Few and Cursed expansion introduces you to a brand new apocalyptic world full of dangers. This expansion introduces the Cursed status effect which affects how the cards and map tiles interact with your character. In this alternate Old West, the meek find an edge or they perish. Will you perish?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver
publishers: Boom Boom Games, Rock Manor Games

name: Amoebunnies
description:
Amoebunnies is an asymmetrical game for 2-6 players that takes approximately 10 minutes per player to complete. It's family friendly and stars 6 cute amoeba-like bunny creatures who are helping the lands near their home of the Rainbow Mists.

Each character has a unique goal to accomplish and the first player to complete their task wins. The characters also have unique movement and special abilities. Master your favorite or play them all.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Different Dice Movement, Move Through Deck, Race, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Bloodborne: The Board Game – Forsaken Castle Cainhurst Extra
description:
Expansion to Bloodborne: The Board Game, containing the Reiterpallasch Hunter. This expansion adds a single Hunter to Bloodborne: The Board Game to add another character for players to choose from. The Reiterpallasch Hunter makes good use of dodging in its base form to damage enemies and can use quicksilver shot in its transformed form to destroy weak enemies without retaliation.

This expansion contains a single character, including its character sheet, sidearm, and figure. It does not adjust the gameplay of the core game and does not add any campaigns.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mroczny Amulet
description:
Dark Amulet is a cooperative, role-playing card game for 1-12 players in which you must defeat the Living Curse to return to our world. The problem is that you are just ordinary people.

In this game, each of you takes on the role of an ordinary person from the Character penalty. On your turn, you become the Amulet Holder, and you will create obstacles using Problem cards while the other players overcome them using Solution cards. As the Keeper of the Amulet, you choose the solution that suits you best and pass the turn to the next player.

The fate of your characters will be decided in the Finale, where, after overcoming the last problem, you will undo the Living Curse together.

You do not need any experience in RPR sessions. You don't need a Game Master. Just start playing after opening the box and reading the short instructions.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Divinity Original Sin: Nightmare Dungeon Expansion
description:
Step into an island of possibilities with Dungeon Mode: a rogue-like adventure with hundreds of permutations, where each playthrough is an expedition into the unknown. Whether a seasoned veteran or a new adventurer, Dungeon Mode offers completely unique location and enemy combinations you'll never experience in the main campaign - all in a single gaming session. Dare you face what surprises await you inside?

Or, for those who seek a greater challenge, put your skills to the ultimate test in Nightmare Mode: a difficulty expansion for both Dungeon Mode and the main campaign. Nightmare Mode features 20 modifiers that infuse the island's Monsters with nightmarish strength and abilities. Brace yourself for a trial that will seperate the valiant from the faint-hearted.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Legacy Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: DIEX AÏE 2: Return of the Danes
description:
DIEX AÏE 2 ("God helps" in Latin, the war cry of the Duke of Normandy - Pronounce "Dooss Ah-yeah") is set in England just before the battle of Hastings in the second half of the 11th Century. It depicts the numerous fights that Saxons fought initially against invaders from Scandinavia and the Continent to resist the "Norman Yoke". DIEX AÏE 2 includes a campaign game: It is used to generate tactical scenarios which are played on the standard maps of the series.
DIEX AÏE 2 is a companion game to the popular GUISCARD 2 game. Like this one, DIEX AÏE is a complete boxed game with counters, maps, rules, scenarios and play sheets.

This new version includes all the materials of the original game, but with counters printed on much thicker boards, new additional counters and map. New scenarios featuring the Danes are also provided.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Harpoon V: Modern Tactical Naval Combat 1955 - 2020
description:
Harpoon is the flagship of the Admiralty Trilogy Group's games. First published in 1980, it has undergone several major revisions, with the last, Harpoon4.1, being printed in the late 1990s. Although the system has remained fairly stable, naval technology has continued advancing, and there have been further developments in the game systems as more information has been acquired. Harpoon 5 consolidates this knowledge and standardizes Harpoon with the other products.

The era of modern naval combat began on October 21, 1967 when Egyptian missile boats launched four Soviet made Styx surface-to-surface missiles and sank the Israeli destroyer Eilat at a range of 13.5 nautical miles. The face of naval warfare changed forever!

Harpoon 5 handles all aspects of modern maritime combat: surface, sub-surface, and air. Harpoon 5 is a system of detailed but comprehensible rules covering the many facets of modern naval actions. Consistent rating systems and evaluations of the capabilities of modern naval vessels, aircraft, submarines, and helicopters make it possible to achieve realistic results when simulating known situations, by extension Harpoon 5 also achieves realistic results with hypothetical scenarios.

Harpoon 5 can answer questions like:

Are carriers powerhouses or sitting ducks?
Can transatlantic convoys survive in a modern wartime environment?
In the cat-and-mouse games between US and Russian submarines, which is better?

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: The Cauldron: Adrift (fan expansion for Sentinels of the Multiverse)
description:
The Adrift set for the unofficial fan expansion The Cauldron, intended for use with the Sentinels of the Multiverse card game by Greater Than Games, includes new heroes, villains, and environments.

The following decks are included in this set:

Heroes:

Drift
Gargoyle
Gyrosaur
Pyre
Terminus


Villains:

Dynamo
The Infernal Choir
The Mistress of Fate
Mythos
Screamachine


Environments:

Catchwater Harbor 1929
The Chasm of a Thousand Nights
Nightlore Citadel
Vault 5
Windmill City
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroscape: Samuel Brown
description:
Samuel Brown is an official entry to the Heroscape collection. He was approved, tested and designed back before D&D Heroscape came out.

Character Bio (From Colby Dauch designer): "A while back Wizards asked us to design a couple of potential repaint exclusives. We made Agent Skahen and one other. The other was a patriot by the name of Samuel Brown and he was never used. We recently asked Wizards for permission to release the card and were granted permission."

Samuel Brown can be made by converting one of the figures of the 4th Massachusetts squad available in the Utgar's Rage "Minutemen and Wolves" pack.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Treasure Chest
description:
This is a big box, with the outward appearance of a treasure chest, which was the last stretch goal of the Ancient Chronicles Kickstarter campaign. It houses the Wave 1 components, mostly as retail boxes.

The Kickstarter campaign had just one pledge level, Legendary Hero, which was broken down into three parts:

Ancient Chronicles Core Set and Campaign
Kickstarter Bonus Set
Challenge Set


Two bundles of add-ons were offered. The Bronze Bundle consisted of:

Tristan Hero & Ally
Metal Crowns
Doors & Chests miniatures
Extra Dice set
Critical Hit bag


Tristan, the Metal Crowns, and the Doors & Chests were not included in any other combo, while a dice set and a critical bag were already part of the rewards.

The Gold Bundle grouped the remaining add-ons:

Myths of the Arena (Wave 2)
Chaotic Familiars (5 miniatures, cards, reference sheet)
Lawful Familiars (5 miniatures, cards, reference sheet)
Genryu/Shakiko Hero Pack (6 miniatures, hero sheets, enemy sheets, cards, tokens, reference sheet)
Sigrid/Sigurd Hero Pack (6 miniatures, hero sheets, enemy sheets, cards, tokens, reference sheet)
Alternate Hero Set (5 miniatures, cards, tokens, reference sheet)
Ghost Soul Forms (5 miniatures)
Alternate Ghost Soul Forms (5 miniatures)


All of these, except the Myths of the Arena, are in the Treasure Chest.

The Treasure Chest also includes five more boxes that accommodate most of the remaining Kickstarter rewards:

Spawn Gates and Gods' Altars (7 miniatures)
Minions (20 miniatures)
Nemeses (6 miniatures, venture card, enemy power card, enemy cards, enemy scrolls, tokens, 2 reference sheets)
Act I Challenge Set (16 miniatures, cards, enemy scrolls, reference sheet)

Gods of the Arena
