RPT22 Convente Beato Sante: Mombaroccio, Italy, 26 August 1944: Canadians infantry and Churchill IVs must clear a reinforced German platoon from a half-board 15 hilltop pillbox/trench complex. Game Length: 4.5 turns.

RPT23 The Bavent Recce: Normandy, France, 9 June 1944: A Canadian Airborne platoon must clear check points and find a German mortar platoon, while avoiding casualties. This tense tournament action portray one of ASLs rarest situations- the reconnaissance patrol. This scenario uses board 24. Game Length: 4.5 turns.

RPT24 Farmyard Affray: Normandy, France, 7 June 1944: Canadian Airborne conducts a raid on a board 42, German-occupied farm and and then must withdraw, while a German PzIVH and infantry pursue them. This is tournament action at its finest. Game Length: 5 turns.

RPT25 Cornwalls' Rum Ration: Bruggerhof, Germany, 19 November 1944: German infantry supported by StuG IIIGs and a FlaK Pz IV/37 must make a tough choice is this split objective attack on a British defended village set on boards 22 and 42. Game Length: 4.5 turns.

RPT26 A Cross In Gold: Gunstett, Germany, 16 March 1945: This is the big honkin' scenario of the pack in which American infantry, Shermans and M-10 GMCs must cross a stream under fire and establish a bridgehead in the face of a determined group of Germans supported by Jagdtigers. This scenario uses boards 41 and 50. Game Length: 6.5 turns.

RPT27 Sycamore And Succotash: Namur, Kwajalein Atoll. 1 February 1944: U.S. Maries storm a Japanese held island (board 49) and have nearly cleared it when a torpedo magazine explodes. Can you clear the Japanese out of their bunker before the torpedoes explode? Game Length: 5.5 turns.

RPT28 Polozkov Push: Kirpercheny, Romanian Bessarabia, 6 April 1944: The Russian 170th Tank Brigade with T-34/M43s and SU-85s try to penetrate German screening force of infantry Panthers and PzIVs and exit. This scenario is set on boards 17 and 44. Game Length: 6.5 turns.

RPT29 The Sound Of Hoof Beats: Mielewo-Glinki Region, East Prussia, 2 September 1939: Mike Faulkner designed this Polish cavalry attack on a German defended village set on boards v and 12. Game Length: 6.5 turns.

RPT30 Knocking On The Front Door: Narva, U.S.S.R., 14 March 1944: Brian Williams designed this Russian Guards attack supported by KV-1Ss and T-70s. German SS units must try to defend a cemetery and church on boards 53 and 54. Game Length: 5.5 turns.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Prophecy of War
description: A set of 1/300th scale (6mm) generic science fiction land warfare miniatures rules designed to quickly handle around 100 models in a 4' by 6' table space.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Flax Wild Animals
description:
This game has 32 cards, each one representing a wild animal, with its name, a photograph, its habitat on a world map, and its value in 5 attributes: Size, Max Speed, Weight, Lifespan, and Danger Lever (the latter from 1 to 10). There is also a card that just says "Flax". And, two rules cards, and a title card that advertises the other versions: Flax Dinosaurs, and Flax Creatures of the Sea.

The Flax basic game is War-like. All the cards are dealt out, and everyone looks at their top card. The leading player picks one attribute and reads it out loud ("Okapi, Max Speed 35 mph".) Everyone lays their card down and the card with the highest value in that attribute takes the lot; they go to the bottom of the winner's pile and he leads to the next trick. The "Flax" card wins any trick but only may be used once. The ultimate winner is the one who gets all the cards.

In the advanced game, players may look at their whole hand. The leader chooses a card and a category, and only players who can beat it play to the middle. The one who takes the trick leads next; but the game is won by the player who gets rid of all their cards first.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: MVP Baseball
description:
Adapted from the designer's website:

MVP Baseball is a dice & charts baseball game that lets you quickly play a game, while giving you individual stats for key players that you choose.

With MVP Baseball, you can easily play out a team's entire schedule, and get full season statistics for the one or two Team MVPs that you choose to follow. You can see how your favorite players can do in a full season replay.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Front Est
description:
A book for Blitzkrieg with


New army list (Finland and paratroopers for USSR)
New scenarios and campaigns ( Finland, Barbarossa, and the battle for Berlin)
A big map for Kursk
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Mecha! Spirit Warrior Empire
description:
From the Publisher's website

Spirit Warrior Empire is the first expansion for Mecha! The focus of this supplement are the Azteca, a space faring race whose holdings comprise what is now known as the Spirit Warrior Empire (hence the name of the book - clever, huh?).

Included in this book are more missions, new mecha designs, and the complete history of the Azteca and their portion of known space.
If you enjoy the anime-style wargaming, then Spirit Warrior will give you whole new realms to discover in the Mecha! universe.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Twilight: Skirmish Miniatures
description: Twilight is the setting for a fantasy miniatures wargame, with a range of unique models that are available direct from Hasslefree Miniatures. It is however more than that. It is the culmination of a vision for a fantasy setting that avoids the normal races derived from the works of Tolkien and the ever-applicable excuse that 'a Wizard did it'. Twilight has a deep and complex history in which creatures and cultures have evolved, each in their own way. The game of Twilight explores this world, beginning in the settlements of the Empire, under constant attack from the vicious Devanu tribes that scrape a living by preying on livestock or unwary travellers. However, this is just the beginning and there is much more to be uncovered, as the world of the Fubarnii themselves is on the brink of change.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Holideck
description:
The deck for holydays. Promotional game fo a tourist company, it includes two card decks with court cards in holyday clothing. Besides seed and value of a regular 52-cards deck, each card shows a letter, a die result and a number. The manual gives rules (in Italian) for 11 different games:

Stai a galla: get one of the allowed combinations of cards as close as possible to 31 points.
Il gioco dei VIP: find VIPs' names with randomized starting letters.
Trentuno: play number cards without going over a total sum of 31.
Non più mille: bluffing game raising (or pretending to raise) value of card combinations.
Stock market: get combinations of dice symbols before the others.
Aggiungi la lettera: use all the letters on the cards to form words.
La vocale proibita: find words with given consonants and without a given vowel.
Codice segreto: guess a hidden combination of numbers.
Poker solitario: solitaire game with poker combinations.
Quarantacinque: a variant of Shut the box with cards.
Up & Down: guessing game about higher and lower cards.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Game System, Number, Word Game
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Trading

name: Parlinks
description: Golf simulation in which players choose a club for their shot and roll the corresponding combination of (usually two) dice, then check the chart for the hole to see where the ball ends up. The shorter the shot (or putt), the smaller the range of possible results, thus the more likely that a shot will be accurate.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Storm
description:
Storm is a 2 player game played on a hexagonal board.
On each turn,the player moves a friendly stack.
To move a stack,you take the whole stack.The bottom piece is put on an adjacent cell,the second bottom piece on an adjacent cell to this cell and so on.
If it is a player´s turn and he cannot make a legal move,he wins.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: NUTS! The Big Hurt
description:
NUTS! The Big Hurt is an expansion to the NUTS! World War 2 tabletop miniatures wargame. From the publishers website:

The Hürtgen Forest was the site of America's most costly European battle of World War Two. Within its fifty square miles the US suffered more casualties than anywhere else. The Hürtgen Forest was a densely packed hell of tree-bursting artillery and machinegun fire. It was a trap where the infantrymen of the Allied First Army fool heartedly walked into. Virtually unsupported by armor and artillery, the numerically superior American forces would dash themselves against the hardened defenses of Hitler’s West Wall.

The Big Hurt is a supplement for NUTS! - 2nd Edition. Although intended to be played from the American side, The Big Hurt play's just as well from the German side. The Big Hurt can be played solo, cooperatively with all players on the same side or head-to-head.
Packed with 21 linked scenarios, this book covers a variety of small-unit and medium sized actions through the four months of the Hürtgen meat grinder.
Track down German infiltrators. Raid an enemy outpost. Capture a dam. It’s all up to you.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battles: The Knights
description:
Fast and easy to learn tactical wargame about medieval battles.

It is a card driven game, with historical leaders, cavalry charges and countercharges, infantry defending in fortified terrain, crossbow fire and bombardment, and much more. The unique combat system and a new way to visualize the battlefield makes this game a new quality in the world of the tactical wargames.

There are many scenarios in the base game, concerning battlefields of the:
- Wars of the Roses,
- Wars of Scottish Independence,
- Hundred Years' War.

The modular board and cube-based way to visualize troops on the battlefield, let players to create an infinite number of scenarios of the whole medieval era.

Thanks to the "play and learn" rulebook composition, this game can be played with equal pleasure by two experienced players, as well as by a father and son.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Dobókocka Futamok
description: Very simple roll-and-move game (or replay simulation) of auto races. Drivers get their rolls in the order of their current standing on track. They are moved according to the number rolled. If a car arrives at a unit of 10, 20, 30 etc (marked previously on the track) then he must make the so called 'action roll' and follow the appropriate instructions. Different tracks and teams can be downloaded.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pollux
description:
From the designer : Try to connect the two opposite sides of the board by placing a continuous line of cubes.
Players own two towers (Castor and Pollux). On his turn a player has to move one of his towers and shoot an arrow from the new position of this tower to a hex cell. The players places a cube of his color on this hex. If a player is not able to make the movement and the shot he immediately loses the game.
This game may be seen as a "connection" between the classic Hex game and the game of Amazons.
mechanics: Enclosure, Network and Route Building

name: Dispatches from the Bunker #32
description:
A magazine dedicated to Advanced Squad Leader. This issue has an analysis of VOTG 18 ‘In Sight of the Volga’, Tactical Tips and perspectives on four scenarios. Also included are four scenarios:

DB086 Lack of Communication - German infantry assault the US perimeter in an attempt to destroy the Bridge at Remagen during the 1945 push to cross the Rhine.

DB087 Jumonji Pass - A Russian combined arms force assault dug in Japanese infantry in Manchuria 1945.

DB088 No Rest For The Weary - A 1945 attempt to relieve an encircled Silesian village on the Eastern Front by a combined arms German force meets a heavily armed Russian defender.

DB089 Get Tito - This scenario covers the 1944 attempt by German forces to kill or capture Marshall Tito the leader of the Yugoslavian partisans.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Nénufable
description:
Nénufable is a wooden game for children (and adults).

It's a race between frogs where the goal is to be the first frog under the balcony of the princess to be kissed by her.

Players can move ahead, put a stone or waterlily to make a road, push opponent in the water or move the princess to another balcony.

But beware... there is a sorceress in the castle who randomnly move from balcony to balcony, and if you finish under her balcony she push you in the water, and you have to restart from the begining...
mechanics: Network and Route Building

name: Command Combat: Civil War 1861 – Core Rulebook
description:
In Command Combat: Civil War, you take the role of a real, historical general leading his forces into battle. Choose who you will be, and what brigades you will have in your force, and lead them against other historical figures utilizing the unique Command Combat system, which streamlines combat to a simple format which focuses on how the personalities of the various generals effect the result of combat.

Play as the stoic Grant, the flamboyant JEB Stuart, the cautious, yet beloved George McClellan, or even the marble man himself, Robert E. Lee. There are many generals and specialized units to choose from.

Command Combat not only puts you in the general's seat, but also gives a sense of how difficult it is to control an army. Players only have control over the generals they are playing. All other units are restricted to a color coded group of orders that are given to them, and can only break out of those restrictions when given new orders. This, and other specialized rules give the game a more realistic flavor, and helps the players understand why certain battles went the directions they did.

Put on the general's uniform and lead your men to victory in the most dynamic struggle in American history.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: The Great Italian Wars
description:
This is an innovative card game that recreates the atmosphere of the Italian late Renaissance (1494-1527) during the famous period called the "Italian Wars".

In the game players can play 3 cards in hand each turn with the scope to realize historical events such as Treaties, battles, political weddings, Leagues, and artworks represented by the cards. There are also strategic zones like Palace, Prison, Duchy of Milan, or Kingdom of Naples among event cards.

The player with the most victory points at the end of game is the winner.


(in italian)

E' un gioco di carte innovatico che ricrea l'atmosfera del tardo rinascimento italiano (periodo di gioco dal 1494 al 1527) durante il famoso periodo chiamato "Le guerre d'Italia"
Nel gioco ogni giocatore può giocare 3 carte ogni suo turno con lo scopo di realizzare eventi storici rappresentati da carte. Ci sono anche zone strategiche come Palazzo, Prigione, Ducato di Milano o Regno di Napoli.
Trattati, battaglie, matrimoni politici, Leghe, capolavori possono essere realizzati nel gioco.
Il giocatore con il maggior numero di punti vittoria alla fine del gioco è il vincitore.

Gioco in Italiano ed Inglese
categories: Card Game, Political, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Die Fighting II
description:
Horse and Musket miniatures rules for the period 1700 to 1900.

This is an innovative set of miniatures rules that uses both cards and dice to control various aspects of tactical battles, designed by Bob Jones of Piquet and Zouave fame.

Play templates are provided to enable several wars within the period to be played immediately, while the players can easily adapt and modify other periods or even the base rules.

The rules allow for a tactical scale battle and will work with most figure sizes, with the emphasis on 28mm.

Update: The game has been reissued as Die Fighting II with many improvements and new mechanisms. It is now in a Enhanced DVD Multimedia format which includes a 1 hour professionally produced and chaptered video; a slide show in both PDF and Quick Time Movie formats, and printable PDFs which include templates for a wide variety of periods from 1699-1902, player aids, Phase cards,a Rule Summary keyed to the video and slide show, and several other player aids.
categories: Age of Reason, American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Anima Tactics: Lilian Virgil
description:
Lady Lilian Virgil, Knight of the Fifth Heaven, is a fighter of indisputable talent that combines her sacred powers with her martial skill to serve the Empress.

Light Empire Warrior/Mystic - Lv. 45
At 5 | Dm 4 | Df 8 | Ar 2 | LP 13 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Aura of Protection: Any friendly Unit within Lilian's Control Zone (except herself) gets +1 Resistance.
o - Breath of Life (Magic, Effect)
All friendly Units that are in base-to-base contact with Lilian get Healing Lv 1. Limit: Once per Turn.
ooo - Sacred Seal (Magic, Attack)
While making this attack, Lilian has Critical Mastery. If this attack causes damage, the target suffers Seal Lv 2. Effect 16.
oo - Inspiration (Special, Effect)
This ability may only be used at the end of the Recovery Phase. Any friendly character within Lilian's Control Zone may Charge for one less Action Point than normal this Turn. Special Charges are also affected by this skill. Limit: Once per game.
A part of Team Weapons of Azrael along with Macbeth.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Module P1
description:
From the front cover:
This is the first of a series of informal modules containing various material from future Star Fleet Battles products. The "P" stands for: Preview, Prototype, and Playtest.

Contents include: Chaff, Chain Reactions, Death-Riders, The Frax, Hydran DD Variants, Scenarios, Tournaments, Total War Rules, and F&E Setup Charts.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Module R107 The Nicozian Concordance
description: This playtest module presents all the rules for the Nicozians, a species which lives on a neutron star that is about to go nova and has dispatched exploration ships to search for a new home. Due to their environment, individual Nicozians are no larger than a grain of rice and their largest ship is no bigger than a drone! This module presents their unique rules for movement (Skipwarp), weapons (Skipwarp missiles, subspace auger, pulse phasers), and collapsium armor. Included are four SSDs (cruiser, light cruiser, destroyer, and frigate), four scenarios, and appropriate annexes.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Captain's Log #39
description:
Publisher's Blurb:

The issue begins with a major fiction story (Burden of Duty, Debt of Revenge) about a old Federation CA which catches a Klingon DX raiding behind the lines. Other fiction, and Part 4 of the Developmental History of Heavy Superiority fighters are also included.
The communications sections includes news, tournament reports, After Action reports on recent products, Command the Future, Jean's Pet Peeves, the Proposals Board, new ships for Starline 2400, Why, and Awards.
Fans of Federation commander get four new ships, rules for early years, tactics, and two new scenarios.
Fans of Star Fleet Battles get ten scenarios, six new ships, the Energy Monster, Sniper Squads, Ask Admiral Growler, Kzinti vs Romulan Anarchist ships, the Truth about Federation fighters (most of which did NOT have gatlings), a campaign update for the Early Years, Battlegroup Sector Patrol, a Branthdon Primer, Victory at Five Nations, and Term Papers.
Venues includes Star Fleet Command, Star Fleet Warlord, Play by Email, Fog of War 6 report, Prime Directive, Galactic Conquest, SFBOL, and commando ships for Star Fleet Battle Force.
F&E Fans will find new rules and rulings, their own Proposals Board and Why articles, the Ship Information Table for the new ships, and lots of tactics.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Test Match Replay
description:
Statistical replay game of cricket. This expands One Day International into the longer game rather than the one-day game.

New rules and newly rated teams and players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Walkers
description:
Orsay is a quiet rural town 22 km from Paris, which dawns infested with grotesque creatures, undead, they multiply rapidly and roam the city looking for new victims ... The year is 1899, you are a survivor in this hell on earth, you should survive or become a WALKER!

Walkers is a board game for 2-6 players created by Julio Trois, which is about a zombie apocalypse at the turn of the twentieth century, where you must survive with a small group of people, using equipment found in a city taken by undead creatures.

Players can play with the heroes or the zombies, each turn move the board, collecting equipment, fighting zombies, seeking to perform the missions of the game. Walkers is a fast, easy, strategic, collaborative, where players view the action from the start!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Lylicalion
description:
Translated from the box back
The circle of fate for the girls is starting to turn…

Lylicalion is a double hand management game, where the players compete for the attention of six characters from Lylican Nanoha. The players first draft themselves through the draw deck consisting of magic cards and friendship cards. Once the deck is depleted, cards drafted to a certain face down pile will be auctioned out with the cards players have in their hands. At the end of the game, for each character, the player with the highest total of friendship gains the points that character is worth.

Re-implements:

Biblios
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Gazala Gallop
description:
The Gazala Gallop is an Operational level board-wargame set during World War 2 in North Africa.

The Basic Game - which is the active one - uses the popular 1st Alamein/Battles for Alamein wargame system. It is regiment to division unit level, 5mis/8kms per hex, and has 14 2-day gameturns. (The Advanced Game is still there for its map, for anyone curious.)

The Afrika Korps has superior speed/maneuverability, while the British 8th Army's 2nd and 22nd Armoured Brigades (which had the notoriously unreliable Crusader tanks) are subject to the British Breakdown Rule. The American Lend-Lease Grant medium tanks are the backbone of the most powerful British unit, 7th Armoured Brigade, while Valentine and slow, plodding Matilda British infantry tanks are in the 1st and 32nd Tank Brigades.

Airpower is abstractly modeled, as in Battles for Alamein.

The Allies have the option of a non-historical deployment, but are penalized in Victory Points for utilizing it.

As historically, Allied units are slow to activate/respond, so the Axis Player must hit fast and hard to flank and/or penetrate the Allies' Gazala Line and finally take Fortress Tobruk, to win.

Rules are provided - subject to revision.

12Nov12: I've broken the German Recce Gruppee down into the 3 divisional Recce bns - three 1-1*-5s instead of just the one 2-2*-5.

And KG Hecker is now a 2-2-4 ... although maybe that should have just been a 1-2-4.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Legends of Time and Space: S.O.S.
description:
A starship has transmitted a distress call from the distant planet of Lemm. Mysteriously, the distress call contains no details about the nature of the predicament. You command one of the most qualified rescue ships in the fleet, and have agreed to answer the distress call.

This is a free adventure from Dark City Games to introduce new players to their Legends of Time and Space series. Players create a party of characters, determining their attributes and equipment, much like a traditional RPG. Players then read paragraphs in the adventure book. Each paragraph is numbered, and presents the player with a choice. Depending on the player's choice, he will be directed to another numbered paragraph. For example, Paragraph #1 may describe a room as having a door leading to the east and a door leading to the west, then read "To go through the east door, go to paragraph #2. To go through the west door, go to paragraph #3." When characters encounter enemies, players use a hex-and-counter map. Instructions are given for the enemies' attacks.

The S.O.S. adventure book is separate from the core rulebook for the Legends of Time and Space system.
categories: Adventure, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Malifaux: Beckoners
description:
The Beckoners are two minions that expand the tactical options for the Neverborn. They are particularly suitable to be added to the Dark Debts crew.

From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki page:
The Beckoner is the Rotten Belle of Lynch's crew, and is just as essential to him as the Belles are to Seamus. They also hold the dubious honor of being the first ladies of the night in the game that are not zombies.

Beckoners are control pieces and function to pull enemy models into your crew and spread the Brilliance characteristic at range. They have a gun, Honeyed Words, with a moderate range that attacks Wp instead of Df and ignores cover. Models damaged by this attack receive the Brilliance characteristic. Their gun also has a highly useful trigger, First Taste's Free. This trigger reduces a target's Wp or Df by 1 and is cumulative. Additionally, the debuff does not end during the Closing Phase, but rather last's until the Beckoner's next activation. This trigger makes them an attractive (pun intended) option for Zoriada or Pandora crews, both of which are heavily dependent on Wp effects. One strategy would be to have the Beckoner activate early in one turn, apply the debuffs, and then activate late the next turn; giving the maximum length of time for the debuffs to be in effect. In addition to the gun they have a melee attack with their nails, which has a low damage spread but automatically provides poison.

Come Hither
This is the bread and butter spell of the Beckoner and the reason for taking them in a Lynch crew. This spell works in a very similar way to Lure, pushing the target toward the Beckoner and then moving her toward it. The twist is that if the target has Brilliance than they push their charge rather than their walk, and the Beckoner has a trigger where if the two models end within melee range of each other, the spell target gains Brilliance. This spell works for your crew on several levels, pulling enemy models away from the safety of their crews or away from objectives, providing Brilliance at range, and if they end the move in melee range of a Beckoner, locking that enemy down with a model that they cannot hit due to Irresistible and Don't Bite the Hand.

Sales Pitch
This spell removes AP from a target's next activation, 1 per mask in the Ca value. This can be used to neuter an opponent's heavy hitter for one turn, but be aware that the spell only effects general AP and targets can still use AP generated by Melee Expert, Casting Expert, etc.

The Party Never Ends
The reason other than Come Hither that the Beckoner gets taken in Lynch crews--all models within 6" of the Beckoner do not lose the Brilliance characteristic at the end of the turn.

The Beckoner's optimal turn occurs when they begin within 12" of a target. The first AP is used to fire their Honeyed Words attack at a target model, wounding it and giving it Brilliance. They then use the (0) action Know My Client to buff their stats versus models with the Brilliance characteristic. Finally they cast Come Hither on the original target (relatively easy with a Ca of 8), pushing that target its charge towards the Beckoner and the rest of your crew.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Dust Tactics: SSU BR-47 Self-Propelled Weapon Platform – "Red Rain / Red Fury"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Dust Tactics, the SSU is always working to find ways to support their tremendously effective infantry with more firepower. The SSU BR-47 Self-Propelled Weapon Platform has proven an inexpensive and potent method for bringing some anti-tank weapons to the battlefield. The Red Fury configuration wields a massive 100 mm M1946, capable of dealing damage to even the heaviest tanks and hardiest infantry. Known as the Red Rain, the second configuration features a 200 mm Heavy Mortar for devastating artillery strikes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Hong
description:
Hong, named after a two-headed dragon in Chinese mythology, is a tile-laying game of asymmetrical goals for two players, invented in December 2012 by Néstor Romeral Andrés. Two players – MORE and LESS – share a common pool of identical squared pieces depicting two dragon heads and one dragon segment. A hong is a straight line of one or more segments with a dragon head on each end. The MORE player must create as many hongs as possible, while the LESS player must prevent that many hongs from being created.

Note that open-ended dragons or pairs of heads with no segments in between them are not hongs.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Triple Crown
description:
Triple Crown is a trick taking game for 4 players that can be played with a regular deck of cards. Players play individually, but temporary alliances with occur.

There are three possible ways to score points. Which of these three goals you need to achieve is determined by the cards you are dealt. The player who is dealt the Ace of Spades will be trying to win 5 tricks playing alone. He/she is known as the High player. The player who is dealt the Two of Diamonds also plays alone and will be trying to go nil (lose every trick). He/she is known as the Low player. The two players who were dealt neither the Ace of Spades nor the Two of Diamonds are on a team for the hand. The team players will score points by preventing the High and Low players from achieving their goals.

Whether you are the High player, Low player, or on the Team will be secret at the beginning of the hand. What goal you are trying to achieve is only revealed through play. Therefore keep a poker face and play smart. Be quiet and unreadable or loud and deceiving.

This is a fun and exciting game for all skill levels. Easy to learn rules and play for beginners. Plenty of strategic depth for more experienced players to master.
mechanics: Acting, Trick-taking

name: Waaargh the Orks
description:
Waaargh the Orks is the first expansion covering the Ork race for Rogue Trader. Its contents cover the history and society of the Ork race, details of the Orkish castes, a study of the six great clans, uniform and painting guides for the Orks, and a introduction to the Orkish language and glyph alphabet.

104 pages, hardback
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Tymor
description:
Tymor is a fast-paced, easy-to-learn, and highly replayable fantasy strategy game for 2-4 players. Set in a compelling world struggling to recover from a legendary apocalypse, it features a modular map that changes every game, an innovative season mechanic, and three ways to score victory points.

The goal of Tymor is to excel in three categories of leadership: Kingdom building, trade, and battle. Throughout the game, players will dispatch their Priests to build and upgrade Settlements, their Merchants to trade in other players' lands, and their Soldiers to claim and defend territory. The player with the most victory points at the end of the game is crowned King or Queen of Tymor.

Tymor's unique season mechanic not only determines the productivity of the players' territory, but their odds of success in battle as well. To prevail in Tymor, you must anticipate the chaotic seasons, outwit your rivals, and build a new kingdom of legend, just as the long dark of the world seems to be lifting at last.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Orient Express Supplement #2
description:
From the cover:

This supplement contains 10 new cases for Orient Express Mystery Detective Game. It can only be used in conjunction with that game and is not a complete game in itself

It contains:
Clue book for Cases 21-30
Solution pad for Cases 21-30
Detective notepad
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Gemstone
description:
Gemstone is a quick and easy-to-learn set of rules for playing fantasy miniatures games ranging in size from small skirmishes between a couple dozen figures per player, to much larger battles between table-spanning armies.

The rules are intended for 25mm (or similar scale) miniatures, though they are not tied to any specific manufacturer's models and could be used with other scale figures.

The system emphasizes quick gameplay and unpredictable reversals of fortune, while alleviating players from having to reference copious amounts of unit data, perform complex math, or remember numerous rules.

Expanded by:
- Gemstone Companion
- Gemstone Adventures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Across the Board: Refills Plus Four Additional Tracks
description: Refills of the game's original race track sheets—40 each of: Churchill Downs—USA, Epsom Downs—England, Woodbine—Canada, Longchamp—France. Plus four additional race tracks—40 each of: Melbourne Cup—Australia, Auckland Cup—New Zealand, Rothmans July—South Africa, and Mexico's Derby—Mexico. Includes seven copies of Handicap and Auction News for each of the new race tracks.
categories: Animals, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Game Night Kit 2013 Season Three
description:
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game - Game Night Kit 2013 Season Three includes 3 nightmare decks:
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Hills of Emyn Muil
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Dead Marshes
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Return to Mirkwood

and a playmat. The artwork depicted is Hands Upon the Bow.

Game Night Kits are technically only available to retailers and not for general purchase. Game Night Kits contain 3 Nightmare Decks, Tournament rules, a Poster and a Goodie (Playmat, Deck box). It is a limited release, which is meant to support FFG's Game Night program. Later on, only the Nightmare Decks are released as Print on Demand to the general public. Those decks are sold individually.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Wolf The Game
description:
Wolf The Game is a social party game around deception, deduction and perception. Based on the traditional games of Mafia and Werewolf, Wolf offers a balanced and multifaceted approach to this beloved category.

Players take on the roles of villagers, trying to cope with an influx of murderous werewolves. Some players will be villagers and must try and work out which other players are secretly werewolves before the wolves kill everyone!

With 11 different roles available in the base game, Wolf offers small to large groups a great way to get to know each other and having some quality lynching time together.
mechanics: Acting, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Skoklaarg
description: Skoklaarg is a two-player, abstract strategy board game that is played on a 5x9 board. Each player commands one monarch and sixteen minions tasked with capturing the opponent's castle while protecting their own. Opposing pieces line up on both sides of a row of blue squares representing a river. Minions can move one square to any unoccupied space. Monarchs can move one or two squares in any linear direction and are allowed to capture opposing minions that are two squares away. Monarchs can jump over their own minions but cannot jump over an opposing minion unless they capture (sacrifice) their own on the other side. A player wins by moving their monarch onto the opposing castle space from two squares away.
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: VOR: The Maelstrom – Razorfang's Exodus
description:
It's Time to Fight!

Earth is playing host to a legendary showdown. The Zykhee Wardyn Myntokk has caught up with his sworn enemy, the notorious Growler Alpha Chieftain Razorfang. With the safety of Earth at stake, the Union and Neo-Soviet forces are on the hunt as well. Will Trowlers continue to flourish on Earth? Will Myntokk succeed in slaying Razorfang? These questions can only be answered by you! Now it's in your hands...

Razorfang's Exodus is a series of special scenarios chronicling the Growler presence on Earth. When you return the enclosed VOR Battle Card, the result of your campaign will directly affect VOR's future storyline. The book offers new rules and characters for the Growlers, Union, Neo-Soviet and Zykhee, and provides race-specific campaign record sheets.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Sayrun
description:
Year 2350.
The characters are miners and belong to an expedition sent to the depths of Planet Sayrûn for organic minerals. Collect liquid Diamond Torium is your main goal. But everything goes wrong when a collapse occurs. The earth moves. Now survival is the main thing, but can not return empty handed ...

Players must work their way through organic stone, and dodging the dangers, to find the exit of the mine before it collapses. We will leave the mine with at least 2 vials of Diamond Torium.

Descripción en Español

Año 2350.
Los personajes son un grupo mineros que pertenecen a una expedición enviada a las profundidades del planeta Sayrun en busca de una extraña especie de mineral orgánico llamado Torium. Pero todo va mal cuando se produce un colapso. La tierra se mueve. Ahora la supervivencia es lo principal, pero no puede volver con las manos vacías ...

Los jugadores deben abrir camino a través de la piedra orgánica, esquivando los peligros y encontrar la salida de la mina antes de que se derrumbe. Deberemos salir de la mina con al menos 2 viales de Torium Diamante.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battleground: Hostile Intentions
description:
It is the near future. A rebel coup has destabilized a small corner of the world, and border nations are moving in to grab whatever territory they can.

You command the forces of one of those nations. You have established a command center in a section of the country, but you face rivals for control of the area. Now you must build up your command center by erecting defenses and constructing facilities that train soldiers, manufacture weapons, tanks, aircraft and other vehicles.

Achieve victory by destroying your opponents’ command centers or capturing and holding critical objectives located throughout the area.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Battlegroup: Fall of the Reich
description:
Back of the book:

1945, GERMANY... the heart of Germany is threatened by the remorseless advance of Allied armies from the east and west. From the borders of France, Belgium and Holland, US and British armies fight their way through the West Wall and on to the river Rhine, then over it and into Germany's industrial heartlands. In Poland, the unstoppable tide of the Red Army sweeps across the Vistula river and strikes for the Oder, beyond which lies the ultimate objective - Berlin, and the final bitter battles of the Second World War in Europe.

BACKGROUND
A general history of the war from Germany's borders to the streets of Cologne, Konigsberg, Bremen and Berlin, covering the period from January 1945 to the ultimate defeat of the Third Reich in May.

ARMY LISTS
Four army lists designed to play with the character of the principal combatants: German 'Defenders of the Reich', to create the ad hoc battlegroups thrown to fight the invasion. These scratch units, mixing a few veteran survivors with Volksturm and armed civilians, must face the power of Russian, British and American armoured spearheads as they drive ever deeper into Germany.

Also game data for all the late war tanks, guns and equipment.

SPECIAL RULES
New special rules to adapt core Battlegroup game to the battlefields of 1945. The rules recreate the desperate last stand nature of much of the fighting in 1945 whilst retaining game balance, despite the German Army's collapsing morale. Special rules include a new battle counters set as well as new innovations like jet fighters and infra-red sights.

SCENARIOS
Four new general scenarios, including an 'Urban Assault' and a mini-campaign 'Breakthrough to Berlin', of six linked historical refights set on the Seelow Heights.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Sechs-Tage-Rennen
description:
A deceptively simple racing game with the possibility of high levels of meanness and co-operation during each brief race. Players sequentially play one of their cards to move. The opening hand is 4x1, 4x2, 4x3, 3x3, 2x5, 1x7, which is enough to get you only halfway around the circuit. If the space you move to is occupied by other cyclists, you gain a jump move of the card you played multiplied by the number of other cyclists in the space. You only get a bonus move from the first space you move to.

And that’s it! There are 2 sprint lines at one and two thirds distances, and 2 special spaces (miss your next turn, exchange your hand for a set from the replacement deck, which can re-energise a cyclist who’s burnt his best cards) but the beauty of the game is in the movement mechanism. Because of the necessity to get bonus moves every turn you have to stay with the pack while using mid-value cards. Usually there’s a few turns of this, then there’s a slight increase in speed and suddenly someone is playing their 7 card to try to get back to the pack.
mechanics: Race

name: ECHO
description:
In a futuristic world where humans are established in several galaxy, a large magnetic storm hit the galaxy Virgo, destroying most of the high end technology. Hundreds of years later, scientists from ECHO, the largest planet in the galaxy Virgo, recreated rockets capable of traveling between planets at very high speed. Then, Globocorporation appealed to young spirited ECHO's heirs for conquest the galaxy Virgo!

In the game ECHO, players assume the role of entrepreneurs running a business of conquest. They will take control of certain strategic points on the board while managing their resources and keeping an eye on their opponents.

ECHO is a real time game that is played primarily in teams of 2 players (even if there are multiple additional modes to the game). Players must occupy different roles within the team. Here are the main roles found in the game ECHO:

- Resource Management Mechanism (worker placement, marketplace management and hourglasses)
- Device Management (moving on the board mechanism and rolling dice)
- Management of mini-games (mazes, tile placement, gambling, puzzles)


Dans une monde futuriste où l'humain est établi dans plusieurs galaxie, une grand orage magnétique a frappé la galaxie Virgo, détruisant la plupart de la technologie de pointe. Dans centaines d'années plus tard, les scientifiques d'ECHO, la plus grande planète de la galaxie Virgo, on recréé des fusées capables de voyager entre les planètes à très grande vitesse. Globocorporation lance alors un appel aux jeunes héritiers fougueux d'ECHO, reconquérir la galaxie de Virgo!

Dans le jeu ECHO, les joueurs incarnent des entrepreneurs à la tête d'une entreprise de conquête. Ils devront prendre le contrôle de certains points stratégiques sur le plateau tout en faisant la gestion de leurs ressources et en gardant l'oeil sur leurs adversaires.

ECHO est un jeu en temps réel qui se joue principalement en équipe de 2 (même s'il existe plusieurs modes de jeux supplémentaires). Les joueurs occupent doivent faire la gestion de différents rôles au sein de l'équipe. Voici la liste des rôles principaux que l'on retrouve dans le jeu ECHO :

- Gestion des ressources (mécanisme de workerplacement, marketplace et gestion des sabliers)
- Gestion des unités (mécanisme de déplacement et de roulement de dés)
- Gestion des mini-jeux (labyrinthes, placement de tuiles, jeux de hasard, casse-tête)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Seven Years War: Frederick's Gamble
description:
The Seven Years War: Frederick's Gamble (7YW:FG) is a wonderful wargame based on the innovative and still ever popular card driven game engine from Designer Mark McLaughlin: The Napoleonic Wars (TNW). If you’re familiar with TNW or its successor games, Wellington and/or Kutuzov; you’ll have little difficulty getting into enjoying this debut Game Design effort by Greg Ticer with game Development by Fred Schachter.

The game’s title stems from Frederick the Great, King of Prussia’s 1756 land grab of the independent central European State of Saxony, right on his arch-rival Imperial Austria’s doorstep. Frederick “gambled” he could get away with this annexation without triggering a general European War. He failed, and when Austria was joined by its Ally France (Imperial Camp) and then Prussia's Ally Britain (Coalition
Camp) entered the fray with its mainland interests in Hanover/Hesse, that European War expanded into one of history’s first Global Conflicts.

To reflect the global nature of this conflagration, 7YW:FG has
“mini-maps” off to the side of the main European theatre: one for North America and two areas of the Indian sub-continent. These maps use a point-to-point map of “Duchies” similar to TNW. An abstract “Naval Control Track” accommodates the war on the waters so players can concentrate on the exciting action ashore.

There are aspects of the game cards and rules which make this very much an Eighteenth Century, rather than TNW Nineteenth Century, gaming experience.

Mark McLaughlin is the original game system designer (The Napoleonic Wars)

Greg Ticer is the designer of The Seven Years War: Frederick's Gamble

Fred Schachter is the game developer/editor for The Seven Years War: Frederick's Gamble
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: 18 Card RPG
description:
18 Card RPG is a semi-cooperative storytelling card game in which players work together to tell a story while individually working to complete their characters' personal goals. Players will choose attributes and goals for their characters from a hand of cards and will then pick from one of two scenarios: "Lab of the Mad Wizard" or "Shopping with Humans."

On a player's turn, the other players pick one of the active character's attributes and one of her goals and narrate a scene of how that attribute gets the character into trouble while she pursues the goal. Then, the active player must describe the character's attempt to get out of that trouble and meet the selected goal using her other attribute.

For example, let's say your group is playing the scenario "Lab of the Mad Wizard." Your character has the attributes "Short term memory loss" and "Sarcasm" and the goals of "Needs to burn the place down (even just a little bit)" and "Wants to hurt the feelings of character on right." The other players might narrate a scene in which you completely forget where you are and what you are doing and then notice a book of matches on the table. You start playing with the matches, which draws the attention of a quivering tower of sentient slime who wants to swallow you and your pretty matches. Now you must narrate your character's effort to get out of this situation using her sarcasm while she tries to meet her goal of burning the place down. Can you manage to crack a sarcastic remark that gets you away from the monster while lighting fire to something?

More importantly, can you tell the tale convincingly enough that the other players will vote for your success? They will decide if your attempt was successful or not and whether or not your goal was met, and they will narrate the results accordingly.

Players WIN who manage to meet the goals of their characters before four rounds have passed, and they celebrate by narrating the fates of their characters freely. Players LOSE whose character's goals are not met before the end of four rounds, and they must narrate the deaths of their characters.
mechanics: Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Gremlins (Wave 1)
description: We're entering a new world of hurt and this box contains all the guns, swords , and brutality you will need for you to survive your next fight. Inside, you will find every single stat and upgrade card for Gremlins featured in the second edition book. Now fight for your spot at the top of this twisted food chain.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Gremlin (Wave 2)
description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Star Wars: The Deckbuilder
description: A first in utilizing the franchise and its concepts of "Light vs. Dark" in designing a deckbuilder. Players start with a deck loaded with emotion; light and dark; and set on a path to recruit heroes of the light side and villains of the dark side in a quest to speed to planets across the galaxy and complete missions for the glory of the rebellion (or the empire?). Decide the fate of the galaxy in Star Wars: The Deckbuilder. For 2-5 players, apx. 20 mins. per player. First game in a newly designed Deck builder model.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: 8 Kingdoms
description:
8 Kingdoms, a fantastic collection of card games for 2-8 players, features characters and artwork from the world of Royal Strawberries and Imperial Harvest. Includes:

Kingdom Quest
2-8 players
30 minutes
Ages 12 and up

Summary: Players start with an Emperor (representing themselves and their realm) and are given a hand of cards from which they must draft/recruit new champions to their Kingdom. Points are obtained through a combination of melding sets (identical champions from multiple realms), runs (a string of champions from the same realm), collecting Kingdom Cards (champions from your own realm), and completing specialty Quests.


Control & Chaos
3-8 Players
45-90 minutes
Ages 12 & up

Summary: A 3-suited, trick-taking card game where players earn points for successfully completing their bids. After 5 hands, the game ends and the player with the most points wins! Can you maintain Control or will the four Chaos Cards disrupt your play?


Scourge
2-6 Players
45 minutes (full game); 15 minutes per round
Ages 8 and up

Summary: Players start with an identical hand of cards (their kingdom's champions) and simultaneously bid on cards revealed from the Scourge Deck. High cards win treasure cards, low cards win scourges (which have special abilities), and all ties cancel out. When all cards have been claimed, the round ends and players tally up their scores from accumulated treasures and scourges. The first player with the most points after 5 rounds is the winner.


Redemption
3-8 players
20 minutes
Ages 8 and up

Summary: Players take turns guessing how many cards of each suit are held by all players. When another player believes someone has guessed too high, that player may challenge the acting player. When a challenge is made, the loser must continue playing with one of his cards facing toward his adversaries. New hands are drawn with successively less cards dealt out each round. The last player to still hold cards is the winner.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Game System
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Blocks Series: Early War Card Deck
description: The EARLY WAR Card Deck is an expansion for the Blocks Series and consists of 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Blocks Series: Middle War Card Deck
description: The Middle War Card Deck is an expansion for the BLOCKS SERIES and consists of 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Blocks Series: Late War Card Deck
description:
The LATE WAR Card Deck is an expansion for the BLOCKS SERIES and includes:


1 card deck, with 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Pergame
description: Inspired by Homer’s Iliad, PERGAME is a turn based strategy game that simulates the battle between Achaean and Trojan forces during the Trojan War. Keeping true to the spirit of time and the epic, the game focuses on the actions of heroes and constant involvement of the gods who are always ready to lend a hand to one side or the other. Common soldiers also have a role to play, and initially, their role comes down to guarding their champion. But beware, without a phalanx to support him, even Achilles may be felled by the hand of well-trained rank and file troops. During the battle, each player will try to defeat the opposing army in the field or to push it back to its base – Troy, or the Achaean camp. And then, when the going gets rough, and the battlements have to be breached, every single warrior is precious. Only good coordination of all elements – the power of heroes, the much needed support of the soldiers and timely interventions of the gods, can secure victory. Tyche be with you!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Glider Assault Tactics expansion
description:
The Sergeants Tactics Modules are usable with both Sergeants Miniatures Game and D-Day Sergeants.

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 16 cards and 6 panels
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Zlatiborski brzi voz
description:
Zlatibor mountain is the most visited tourist destination in Serbia. Zlatiborski brzi voz (Zlatibor fast train) is the old name for a donkey that was once mostly used as a mean of transportation on this mountain. Board for this game represents a map of the mountain Zlatibor with all the sights.

The task of each player is to visit as many sights and photograph them (to collect as many counters by stopping on marked field next to counter). The winner is the player who collects the most counters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Daikaijuu Monogatari: The Miracle of the Zone
description:
Each player controls a roster of five summoners　and battles to race up to 50 victory points.

In turns, players can summon monsters on their top, left and right positions and a Help card at the bottom of the summoner, if you can't summon or play a Help card, you must play a card face down. To summon a monster, the summoner need to have matching symbols on their card to summon the monster next to them. Each round ends when players placed four cards on their top, left, right and bottom of their summoner. Players can decide to play SP card as a card below the Help card, an SP card is placed faced down and revealed at the same time, if both players play the same SP card, there will be no effects on the board.

When a round ends, the board is checked to see if there is a "combo" or a side that has a higher monster power. The winner of the round receives points equal to the number of cards used on both sides, multiplied by a number according to the combo.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Amada Printing, 株式会社フューチャー・ビー (Future Bee)

name: CPS Ekspres
description:
Board for this game represents a modern city. CPS Ekspres is a company that drives packages to different locations around the city. Packages are represented by counters. The company has six drivers all have the information where to deliver the package. Markers are collected by stopping on marked field next to counter. Each delivered package brings one point. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.

Figurines (vans) move around the city respecting all traffic rules. The game has an educational character - playing the game, players learn the traffic rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Conflicts in American History: The Civil War – Module 1
description:
Conflicts in American History: The Civil War - Module 1 is a SPI published soapbox size wargame consisting of 9 copies of Antietam and 9 copies of Cemetery Hill both wargames from their Blue & Gray series.

There is an additional teachers instruction booklet, 2 historical briefings booklets, two test questions booklets and one Bulletin board poster to promote the class activity. The entire collection can be used for teaching in the classroom.

This wargame is extremely rare.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Boot Loot: A Pirate's Dice Game
description:
Pirates are always thieving and plundering! They are constantly on the search for treasure. Sometimes they gain it by deception and stealth, and other times they just get lucky!

Being a Pirate has its risks, to be sure. They could get caught and land themselves in jail, or drink too much rum and miss out on their shot at more gold!

Boot Loot is a strategic dice game in the world of Pirates! You will need 2 or more pirates to start your treachery. Thieve, plunder, and deceive your way into gaining your 12 gold coins!

The object of the game is to be the first pirate (player) to get twelve coins. You'll do this, simply enough, by rolling dice. Initially you 'll roll three voyage dice, and then you'll have to decide whether you call it quits, roll an additional three voyage dice or try your luck with a roll of the action die. With risk, comes reward - but you just may lose it all.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Galeon "San Martin": Flagship of the Armada Invincible
description:
This expansion ship may be added to your base game to represent the second of the two Spanish ship cards enclosed and allow players to play 2 vs. 2 ship games.

The scale model features fine detail including fully unfurled sails complete with rigging. It includes three alternative ways to assemble the model and two bases, making it perfectly suited for use as an additional gaming piece.
Enclosed: 1/350 Scale Model Kit. This kit includes one plastic model of a Spanish fighting ship from the golden age of sail, complete with decals. Model supplied unpainted. Assembly required. This “snap fit” model can be assembled without glue.

Historical Notes:

Built by the master shipwrights of the Kingdom of Portugal shortly before Portugal was joined with the kingdom of Philip II of Spain in 1580. The Spanish were so impressed by the quality of the Sao Martinho (as the Portuguese called it) that they made it the flagship if their enormous fleet—the Armada—and placed it under the fleet’s commander-in-chief, the Duke of Medina Sidonia.

Rechristened the San Martin, this enormous fighting ship measured nearly 40 meters long and had a beam of 9 meters. She was armed with 48 heavy guns in two gun decks, as well as many smaller weapons, and a crew of more than 350 sailors. This was a “square-rigged” vessel with three masts.

The San Martin was critical to the defense of the Armada during its fighting with England, at one point keeping a dozen English ships at bay for an hour on her own. After suffering severe damage at the Battle of Gravelines (July, 1588) in battle with Sir Francis Drake and his Revenge. After escaping from the superior numbers of the English, San Martin was badly damaged in a storm and had to take refuge in Laredo.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Anjos & Dragões
description:
In Anjos & Dragões two or four players control factions of bionic dragons and magic angels. Each player must first take down five protection shields to finally give a killing blow to the opponent and rule the planet.

The first brazilian edition has four factions, each one with 50 cards. A faction have four copies of 12 common cards and two copies of 1 evolution. You can play with them right out of the box or mix non-opposing factions.

Players use they cards as Generals, Allies or imediate effects. During a player's turn, he/she will put Generals in play to attack the opponent. The defender can use one of his Generals to block or put in play a new one from his hand. There are no mana or any type of resources to summon Generals: you can use all your cards in an attack, but remember that you will need defense later!

Each card have a General Strength and a Ally Strength. While some are strong when leading an army, others are better following orders. Also, some have special abilities when performing a specific role. A combat is resolved comparing total opposing Strengths. During an combat, the player with fewer strenght total is allowed to add allies to a General to revert the situation.

Some cards can also be discarded from hand to have an imediatte effect, which can change completely the result of a battle. Effects can vary widely, from keeping some nasty units out of battle, destroy allies, give extra attacks or protect valuable combatants.

The cards used as shields, when destroyed, reinforce the owner's hand and can be played just after. Choosing wisely when forfeit a block, can give you precious resource to win the next battle and become the new attacker.

With 13 distinct cards per deck, each play allows you a unique experience combining powers and imediate effects.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Sail and Steam Navies: Naval Battle System 1840 to 1880
description:
Sail and Steam Navies is a PDF set of rules designed for 1/600 scale miniatures, but has information for use with 1/1200 scale miniatures. The period covered is 1840 to 1880 when most warships were equipped with sails as well as steam power. The basic rules are 40 pages long, with charts, markers/templates, an example of play, and conversion information for 1/1200 scale. The Under Both Flags module is included and adds six scenarios, a scenario generator, and log sheets for the ships. There are over 1000 log sheets representing almost every ship involved in the American Civil War and a number of forts and shore batteries. Sets of 1/1200 scale counters in PDF format are available separately for use instead of miniatures.

Players may fight historical battles using one of the 6 scenarios provided or create their own using the scenario generator. Game length will vary depending on the number of ships used and scenario victory conditions. Most scenarios played at conventions with multiple players last 3 to 5 hours.
The game uses D10s for resolving combat and other actions. Usually you will only need one or two dice but more will be required for most damage checks. D6 dice are used to record momentum for each ship. A player aid and a sheet of markers/templates will need to be printed out for use. As with most miniatures based systems any flat playing surface can be used and a ruler or measuring tape is required for checking range and movement.

The turn sequence is straightforward; it starts with writing speed orders for the turn (how fast the ship will go for the turn), followed by combat (cannon fire, musket fire, boarding/melee), then movement, and finally morale checks and repairs.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Halberstadt CL.II
description:
From the publisher:

The Halberstadt CL.II was a German two seat escort fighter/ground attack aircraft of World War I. It served in large numbers with the German Luftstreitkräfte in 1917-18. The CL.II proved extremely successful, with its excellent maneuverability, rate of climb and good armament, allowing it to match opposing single-seat fighters. It was flown by German pilots such as Paul Schwarze and Max Niemann.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Grand Central Station
description:
from the developer's website: Grand Central Station is a dice game set in the early days of steam when railroads first became big business. You will be in competition with several other leading magnates of the 19th century that are all vying to build a controlling influence in the industrial cities of the American Northeast.

Your dice represent the rolling stock of your railroad that you roll and place each turn in various enterprises around the edge of the board. This is the business engine you must use efficiently to get resources and other benefits needed for your expansion. Obtaining more dice is essential and will generate further opportunities for growth.

With enough growth and the strategic placement of your locomotives, you can control several major city stations for additional advantages over your competition. Each station has a unique ability - so chose your path of expansion carefully; but beware, someone may try to take your place. Perhaps it would be wiser to first invest in some R&D to expand your technological edge. Once the dice are cast you must decide...
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Operation Martlet: The 49th Infantry Division Face 12 SS Hitlerjugend West of Caen – A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
Operation Martlet is the fourth of Pint-Sized campaigns for Chain of Command, designed to be played using the campaign handbook At the Sharp End.

Twenty eight pages long, Operation Martlet follows the established Pint-Sized Campaign format, with an overview of the forces involved on both sides, their deployment shown on period maps and the course of the campaign described in detail before going on to present a mini-campaign covering this combined arms operation launched by the British 49th Division immediately prior to Operation Epsom to seize the Rauray Spur from the defenders from 12 SS Hitlerjugend.

The campaign is a total of six game tables with the duration running between six and eleven games. Briefings are provided for both sides, along with measurable objectives, period maps, force and support option listings and everything you need to play this campaign through to its conclusion.

Like all of previous Pint-Sized campaigns, it is available for the price of a pint in the local pub of the publisher.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Diamond in the Rough: The Battle for Fort Driant, October 1944
description:
The Battle for Fort Driant marked the end of Patton’s campaign in the Lorraine. Following the breakout of the US Third Army from Normandy and its drive across France, Patton’s forces had fought hard and victoriously. However, by the end of September shortages of fuel and ammunition forced General Dwight D. Eisenhower to order a halt. Those supplies that did get through were diverted to British General Bernard Montgomery’s forces to the north for the upcoming Market-Garden offensive. Frustrated, Patton ordered a “reconnaissance in force” to take Fort Driant, the last German-held position barring Third Army’s way to Metz.

Believing the fortress to be held only by rear echelon personnel and demoralized remnants of units that had retreated into its works, Patton felt the position could be easily taken by a reinforced battalion of the 11th Regiment of the 5th US Infantry Division (nicknamed the “Red Diamonds”), the only unit he could provide sufficient fuel and ammo to continue offensive operations. However, the German garrison was well prepared to resist, with elements of the 17th SS (Kiss My Ass) division nearby for support.

In actuality the US forces attacking Fort Driant would be outnumbered and outgunned. The ten day battle that raged at Fort Driant was marked by bloody and fierce fighting that at times was waged hand-to-hand and both sides calling in “final protective fire” upon their own positions. In the end the 5th Infantry’s “blood and guts” would not be enough, and Patton would order his only retreat of the war from Fort Driant. Can you do better?
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Nocturnal
description:
Vampires are running rampant and you are the world's only hope. Players create teams of vampire hunters in a race to hunt the most vampires. The trick is you only have two actions on your turn. In order to gain extra actions you must help equip your opponents hunters, giving them a leg up.

In Nocturnal, cards can be used in three ways. As currency to hire and build hunters and bases to your team. As equipment to help your hunters ready for the hunt. And as Hunters, bases or artifacts for your team.

Players can take two actions on their turn. Actions are; draw a card, hire a hunter, build a base, equip a hunter, or kill a vampire.

To hire a hunter, a player discards cards equal to the hunter's level. Same with building a base. A player can equip either their own or an opponents hunter. When equipping an opponents hunter, players will gain extra actions according to the hunter equipped. To successfully kill a vampire, a player's team must be properly equipped with weapons and hunter types.

The game is a race to kill vampires, with the amount needed to end the game scaling for player count. After the last vampire is killed players tally their points from killed vamps and hunters, bases and artifacts in their team. The player with the most points is the winner.

Components:

113 Cards:

- 55 Hunter cards
- 24 Vampire cards
- 10 Artifact cards
- 8 Bases cards
- 8 Starting Hunter cards
- 4 Starting Base cards
- 4 Action player reference cards
- 1 double sided rule sheet
- 1 double sided card summary sheet
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Magic Realm Light 30 Asterisk Expansion
description:
Since Magic Realm Light 30 is a light version of Magic Realm that plays in 30 minutes, it makes sense that any additional material that will ramp up the game a bit (and requires some extra Effort) should be called the Magic Realm Light 30 Asterisk Expansion, or MRL30*.

This expansion introduces Sunlight Actions, the Alert action for Magic chits, Treasures at Dwellings, 6 Weapons/Armor, 6 Treasures, 2 Spells, the Chapel along with a Knight denizen, and the Wish, Curse and Power of the Pit tables.

"Light 30 Asterisk" (or L30*) is a Magic Realm game term, meaning "something Light-weight that takes up 30 units of time and costs one Effort Asterisk".
mechanics: Action Queue, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Sheridan in the Valley
description:
Sheridan in the Valley depicts the duel between Generals Philip Sheridan and Jubal Early in the Shenandoah Valley during october 1864. This module uses the rules, maps and informational counters from Stonewall in the Valley - the only additional components required are this rule booklet and the included countersheet.

Two basic and a campaign scenarios.

Published on MMP's website (see link section).

(source: from the rules and BGG user)
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – The Black Hand
description: Black Hand was the sixth card set for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle to be published by White Wolf. The set spotlights the Sabbat, with a focus on the Black Hand, naturally. Accordingly, many of the reprinted cards in the preconstructed decks are drawn from the Sabbat or Sabbat War expansion sets.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Incredible Courage 100 Days: Wavre
description:
This game completes the 4 game set on Napoleon's 100 Days battles. Marshall Grouchy gains a 'Wasted Victory' and fails his primary mission of preventing the main Prussian Army from reaching the Waterloo Battlefield. It uses units provided in the Quatre Bras and Ligny games. The map in this game connects with the Waterloo battlefield maps.

Scenarios include:

Battle of Wavre on 18 June
Battle for Wavre on 18 June
Battle for Limale on 18 June
The option that allows for the movement of the Prussian Army to Waterloo


Key Features

(12) 11" x 17" game maps of the Wavre area
Variable combat strengths
Reduction by Levels of Order
Wavre Rules Supplement with National Doctrinal Rules
Approximately 200 Die Cut Markers
Infantry and Cavalry units at the company and squadron level and artillery at the section level
Battalion level infantry and Regiment level cavalry units
Scenarios that allow play on smaller parts of the battle or the entire affair
Excellent Solitaire Play


(from Grognard sim's website)
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Imperium:  From Republic to Empire
description:
In Imperium: From Republic to Empire, players control factions of influential Roman Senators, each with a unique combination of attributes. Factions gain prestige points by successfully leveraging the strengths of their senators, political opportunities, senatorial influence, and treasuries as they engage in various aspects of Roman politics. Prestige gained through popularity and success but can be just as easily lost through failures and conviction. Victory is declared when one senator or faction has gained sufficient prestige as to be crowned the First Emperor of Rome.

However, success will require both competition and cooperation as all factions must work together to ensure the stability of Rome. Failures of the Senate and unmet public demand will increase civil unrest, leading to revolt. Excessive war involvement will overextend Rome’s military resources. Spending more funds than what is available will bankrupt the State Treasury. Any of these situations could ensure the fall of Rome causing all players to lose the game.

The game is played over approximately 10 rounds until a victory condition is met or until all players are defeated by the game. Each round is made up of six distinct phases:

Election Phase:
Each player will take turns choosing offices to assign to Senators within their faction. High Offices include High Consul, Low Consul, and Censor. Lower offices include Praetor and Proconsul (assigned to govern one of the many provinces of Rome). Player initiative is based on the overall faction prestige and 'bribes' made to the Assembly.

Senate Phase:
Factions vote to raise legions, purchase grain subsidies, and deploy legions to war. The more senators your faction has, the greater your ability to influence these decisions. Beware—an ‘Assassin’ or ‘Mob Incitement’ card in the hands of a jealous senator played at the appropriate time can severely upset the balance of power.

Republic Phase:
Senators now perform their duties in positions throughout the Republic. This may include: Proconsuls hiring auxiliary legions to enhance provincial defenses, Senators in Rome attempting to persuade others to joint their faction, and even certain senators engaging in corruption to gain needed funding. Rome must also respond to random events such as public demands, barbarian raids, provincial insurrection, and plagues.

War Phase:
Wars are now resolved. If victorious, the general returns to Rome with additional prestige and the potential of war spoils. A stalemate will cause the general to return to Rome having lost prestige due to eroding public confidence. A defeat will end in death for the general, an increase in public unrest, and the affected province being overrun. Victorious generals also have the option of “crossing the Rubicon” to engage in civil war with the Roman State in an attempt to secure an early win.

Trial Phase:
The Censor will prosecute corruption charges of the Senate. For each successful conviction, the Censor gains additional prestige while the accused may either lose prestige or (in the case of murder or treason) be executed.

Intersession Phase:
Because time is the great equalizer--Senators may die randomly of natural causes. Victory conditions are then checked and the game is reset for the next round of play.

Imperium: From Republic to Empire was designed to be a simplified, more accessible alternative to Republic of Rome (Avalon Hill, 1990; Valley Games).

Version 2.3.1 was submitted for publication in March 2022.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Halloweeja
description:
What's your favorite scary movie? If you were invisible, who would you punch in the face? Turn a Tom Hanks movie into a horror film. How would you answer these questions? Bet you have an answer already!

Ever want to act like a scarecrow in front of your opponents? Ever want to throw playing cards through the air and be rewarded for it? Ever want to punish someone for holding up your game night by going to the bathroom? Ever want to make everyone trade seats in the middle of a game? Ever want to stop a game from being over so you can win instead? Creature Cards let you in this game!
