This is Halloweeja: the Halloween party, board game where you talk to the living, and bring your party back from the dead! Horror fans, haunters, and Halloween enthusiasts will enjoy Halloweeja year round, but anyone who observes All Hallows Eve will find this game frightfully delightful.

Take turns asking each other wacky, Halloween themed questions from the Book Of Hijinks. There are no right or wrong answers. Match players to their replies. Each YES lets you move that much closer to a letter you need. If the Halloweeja Board reveals your PASSWORD first you win.

But beware: Creature Cards can be either a trick or treat, and help or hinder anyone in the game. And that letter you revealed may be the exact thing someone else needs to win too.

DISCLAIMER:
For entertainment purposes only! Manufacturer, distributor, creator, and owner cannot be held responsible for the misuse, and nonuse of this product. Not a ‘spirit board.’ ‘witch board,’ ‘talking board,’ or other trademarked board that sounds like wedgie when mispronounced, and definitely not a surfboard. Do not use as a personal flotation device or you may die. This product was tested on animals (the cat enjoyed it.)
mechanics: Grid Movement, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Nightcrawler
description:
Description from the publisher:
Nightcrawler possesses superhuman agility, the ability to teleport and can climb walls and other obstacles with ease. He also has indigo / blue coloured skin, which allows him to become nearly invisible in the shadows and he has a prehensile tail. A devout Catholic, Nightcrawler's name is Kurt Wagner and he is from a small village called Witzeldorf in Germany and was part of a circus act until he was recruited in to the X-men. Later in the comics it is found out that Nightcrawler’s parents are Azazel and Mystique.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: The Vision
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Vision is a synthetic android created by Ultron and Dr. Helen Cho, but programmed by Tony Stark and Bruce Banner by uploading the J.A.R.V.I.S. system for his personality. Placed within his forehead is the Mind Stone, one of the Infinity gems and provides him with his power. Vision is a polite, calm, and thoughtful being and unlike Ultron, he values life and humanity. Also Vision is one of only a handful of beings that are worthy enough to wield Mjolnir and with it the power of Thor. Visions capabilities include a Synthetic Body, Invulnerability, Density Manipulation, Superhuman Strength, Intangibility, Levitation, Interfacing with computers, Superhuman Speed, Shapeshifting, Energy Beams and of course the power from the Mind Stone.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Striker!
description:
Striker! is a set of straightforward rules for playing realistic miniature football (or soccer, depending on your side of the pond) matches on the tabletop. Each match plays just like a wargame using miniatures to represent players. Challenges, passes and shots on goal are resolved by rolling dice. Many strategies and tactics that are employed in a real football match also apply to this game: midfield pressing, tiki taka passing, switches of play, and many more. If you can do it on a football field, Striker! allows you to do it on the tabletop. The game is meant for 2 players, but can also be played in groups or even solo, taking about 90 - 120 minutes to play.

Just like the real game there are red cards, yellow cards, and shots on goal. Each phase of play is broken into stages: the attackers move their players, or pass, or dribble etc, and then the defenders get a phase to counter, and cover the attacking runs. Players move specific distances, just as in a standard wargame. The game lasts 40 phases (20 attacking and 20 defending phases for a half of football) with each phase ending after the defenders finalize their moves, or when a pass goes astray and possession is turned over to the defenders through a tackle or wayward pass.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Annexe
description:
Description from the designer:

Annexe is a two player strategy board game built around the subject ‘Colonization’. It throws light on the nuances of discreet exchanges taking place in the process of colonization and the hidden transactions that happen inconspicuously. It is these unseen exchanges that define the future of a culture, hence constructing its crux.

The two player represent the native leader and the conquistador each and while the conquistador tries to claim their land with the power of money and army, the natives try to counter them by using their indigenous wisdom and the knowledge about the natural resources. But the play can take overturn if any of those two can manipulate the heritage in the process to their own favor by strategising well.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Murmansk Run:  Arctic Convoys to Russia
description:
Game description from the designer:

Simple/abstracted. 9 seasonal turns, Spr42-Spr44. Hidden task force movement until recon/contact. Destroyer divisions (4 ships) and individual warships of higher classes, from Koeln to Tirpitz for the Germans and Scylla to Alabama (to Victorious) for the Allies. 8 of 12 freighter loads must make it to Murmansk and/or Arkhangelsk per season - more than 1 convoy may be necessary. Loss of a capital ship can alter season victory outcome.

Could be multi-player game, and - as for my Malta convoys game Lion's Lair - surface battles could be resolved by miniatures instead of the boardgame's rules/mechanics.

Each season can take from 30-75 minutes, because of point by point possible U-boat attacks - let alone the Wolfpack - so the campaign game is much longer than Lion's Lair.
categories: Bluffing, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Warp Speed
description:
Warp Speed is a sci-fi, anime themed, space exploration game, for 2-4 players.

Use your navigation skills or warp yourself through space in order to answer distress signals, take part in battles or trade and recruit new crew.

The movement of the ship is done by using boost green crystals, but as the game evolves you will be able to upgrade your ship and use warp speed to travel a lot faster!

Each player takes the role of a starship captain that is sent into an unknown galaxy, to sweep its sectors from asteroids, discover new planets and by completing objectives, earn fame points and win.

Fame can be earned by completing 2 objectives of the same color. After you get those objectives, you must travel to a corresponding planet and get your reward from the remnants of that planet.

Cards are used to reveal events such as encounters with other pilots, finding new planets etc.

While on your mission you will definitely have to trade as you reach a new planet, otherwise you will be in a tough spot!
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Thing
description: "IT'S CLOBBERIN TIME!" The famous words bellowed from the mutated human Ben Grimm known as "The Thing", protected by his rock like body The Thing can shake off almost any blow that would kill a mere un-mutated human.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly Card Games: Free Parking and Water Works
description:
Free Parking
Feed your parking meter and run your "errands" before time runs out. Visit the health club, renew your driver's license, take flying lessons... But watch out for Officer Jones, because if your meter's time "expires" you could be in deep trouble. Feeling lucky? Draw a second chance card and maybe Mister MONOPOLY will help you turn panic into points. Score the most points and you win!

Water Works
Be the first player to complete your own "pipeline" from valve to spout by connecting enough pipe cards in between. But beware - your opponents are building their own pipelines and will be delighted to ruin your best laid plans by springing "leaks" on your pipeline. You'll have to repair those pipes or make detours. Call for the plumber (Mister Monopoly)! Complete your pipeline first and you win!
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Cretacea: The game of gargantuan survival
description:
From the Rulebook:

Cretacea is a game designed for using miniature dinosaurs in skirmish style wargaming where the primary objective is to survive and dominate. Cretacea is inspired mainly by the great dinosaur documentaries of the late 90’s.

This short gaming rule set will allow you to grab some dinosaurs, terrain and be gaming in no time. Cretacea is designed to be used with 1/100th scale dinosaurs (roughly similar to 10mm regimental scale) but you could use any dinosaur toy or model as long as their scale is relative to each other. Bases of the dinosaurs should not exceed their physical dimensions to any particular extent and they should be based individually, even small and tiny dinosaurs. Tokens have been included in this set for every dino listed! Each game lasts about 30-45 minutes and is more about acting on your opportunities than being overly tactical in this way the game often keeps you on your toes
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Aventuria: Orkfamilie Promo Card
description:
Third promotion card for the Aventuria card game (03 P)

This is a foe card with a family of four Orks.

After every attack as soon as the life points are zero or below remove one of four tokens from the card. After the last one is gone remove the card from the game.
The Ork family hits with a roll of 1-2 for two 6-sided dice damage, at 3-8 one dice damage and from 9 - 20 nothing happens.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Batman Miniature Game: Joker's Crew
description:
You..You really are incorruptible, aren't you? You won't kill me out of some misplaced sense of self -righteousness, and I won't kill you because you are to much fun. I think you and I are destined to do this forever? - The Joker

The Joker is one of Batman's oldest and greatest foes. A mirror of the Bat himself, the Joker stands for everything Batman is against. Chaos, disorder and crime without reason.

Possibly one of Batman's greatest failures when the Red Hood fell into a vat of chemicals, the Joker has plagued Batman, his allies and Gotham City ever since.

Nobody knows who he really is and even the Joker himself has told several different origin stories. If he's going to have one, he would prefer it to be multiple choice.

Seeing murder, chaos and his 'dance' with Batman as one big joke, the Joker is one of the most dangerous men Batman has ever faced. Using countless resources including his own Joker Gas, he tries to take down Gotham and 'Batsy' again and again. Only to end up each time in Arkham Asylum.

During one stay in Arkham, the Joker met Dr. Harleen Quinzel. A psychiatrist that developed an obsession with the Joker that led her to become Harley Quinn and follow her 'puddin' on his journey of insanity.

Some of the Jokers worst crimes include paralysing Barbara Gordon / Batgirl and killing Batman's own sidekick Jason Todd / Robin. Batman has sworn not to kill, but can the Joker push him over the edge?

Using a Joker crew in the Batman Miniatures Game is to bring chaos to the table.

A dangerous man in his own right with weapons like a poisoned knife, one shot gun and explosive teeth, the Jokers true strength comes from his ability to change his crews plans at the last minute with the use of Kaos Agent. This means your opponent can never really know what you are going to do until it's too late.

Having Harley Quinn as a Sidekick can help with the mass chaos as she can even change your opponents plans while her True Love for the Joker means she can become very dangerous if her 'puddin' is taken down. Or if you need some muscle instead, Mr Hammer is happy to help.

The Jokers Clown Henchmen are very basic fighters all armed with a range of different weapons. They are easy to take down one by one, but being cheap to hire, there can be enough on the table to pull off any crime. There are also a few Elite Clowns if you want some Henchmen that are a bit more resilient and hit harder.

The Joker crew has access to all sorts of Free Agents to help them out. Killer Croc adds some serious muscle to the crew when it's needed and is quick to move around to where he is needed via the sewers. Scarecrow can help keep the insanity under control while also messing with the opponents plans further by forcing models to activate first.

Overall, the Joker crew is great for anyone to play. Kaos Agent makes it easy on new players while messing with your opponents plans can be fun for more experienced players.

Contains:

4 metal miniatures:
- Joker
- Clown
- Ringmaster
- Contra-Auguste
Stat cards for the characters
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Anarchy War
description:
Description from the publisher:

Anarchy War is a tabletop game where you will use miniatures, ten face dice, ruler, cards and scorecard. With a set of 22 unique Figures and a endlesly customizable scenario you can play as the captain of the Xydroid or the Mosgul army.

Choose your faction: destroy the World Union Empire who is trying to delete from the planet your race, genetically created by the Union for fight the II Intergalattic War but get out of controll, using the Mosgul army or suppress the rebel creatures and re establish the control and the order for the Union using the Xydroid army.
The core game will include 4 unique campaigns consisting of 16 different Missions that will send your army to the core of the battle. Or play in a free mode using the missions cards, and create each time your fame and fortune earing credits for encrease your army and make it stronger.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Aces High 1940
description:
User summary:
Aces High 1940 The battle of britain it is the largest air battle of the Second World War, unleashed by the Germans and the British, in this game we can take control of them and fight until we win.
The objective of the game is to accumulate 10 victory points, the Germans do it for each bomber that arrives in England and the British gain 2 points for destroying a bomber.

User summary (Spanish):
Aces High 1940 Se trata de la contienda aérea mas grande de la segunda guerra mundial, desatada por alemanes e Britanicos, en este juego podemos tomar el control de estos y luchar hasta vencer.

El objetivo del juego es acumular 10 puntos de victoria, Los Alemanes lo logran por cada bombardero que llegue a Inglaterra y los ingleses ganan 2 puntos por destruir a un bombardero.

https://www.wargamevault.com/product/380826/ACES-HIGH-1940
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Principe de Asturias 1794 / San Hermenegildo 1789
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Príncipe de Asturias was another of the Spanish three–deck 112–gun ship of the line, based on the Santa Ana design by Romero Landa. She fought with a British squadron on 14 February 1797 in the Battle of Cape St Vincent, with 10 killed and 19 wounded. At Trafalgar, the ship suffered 50 killed and 110 wounded. After the battle, she had to be towed by the French frigate Thémis and undergo major repairs in Cadiz. She returned to fight in the Peninsular War, capturing many French ships. She crossed the Atlantic to Havana with Santa Ana to avoid capture by the French. In 1814 she struck a rock and was scrapped three years later.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Meregildos class “San Hermenegildo 1789.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Urban Tribes
description:
Description from the designer:

We’ve all thought about it. What would we build if we could create our perfect city? The only problem is you’re not alone. The hipsters, preppies, soccer parents, and rednecks all want in. In Urban Tribes, you control one of these factions and compete for cultural influence over the town. Build businesses and cultural institutions, secure city council seats, and watch your pile of cash and cultural influence grow over time. Strike deals with other players to launch joint projects one moment, like a Yoga Studio for the Hipsters and Preppies or a Scout Hall for the Rednecks and Soccer Parents. In the next moment, use event cards to send lawsuits and campaign attack ads to undermine your opponents’ best laid plans. After all, only one tribe will end up with the city of their dreams.

Urban Tribes took first place at the 2016 KublaCon Game Design contest. It is a combination negotiation, territory control, and resource management game for 2-4 players. The territories are sections of town and the resources are Cash, Mojo (the unit of cultural influence), and City Council Seats/Building Permits. The optimal strategy is highly contingent on the actions of your opponents but will certainly include the premise of coopetition – choosing the right time to partner with which opponent.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Take That, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: W.O.R.L.D.S.
description:
Description from the publisher (translated):

Preserving life is our priority. Life on earth comes to an end. We must find a new planet capable of welcoming us as a species, allowing us to live in it and to which we can call home. For this, you will serve as Valkyries, arcane-technological ships that have been developed thanks to the discovery of some alien planes. To this day, these ships are already irreproducible. They are our key to the future. They are our last hope.

W.O.R.L.D.S. is a cooperative / competitive card game in which 2 to 4 players will try to be the first to find a planet fit for life, the new cradle of humanity.

In the course of the game, players will pilot their ships, the Valkyries, and will play planetary characteristics on the explored worlds, collaborating to find one that is totally suitable. Now, you have to be the first to achieve it... In addition, you have to get it before the earth loses all hope of being saved.

W.O.R.L.D.S. is composed of 24 world tarot size cards, with the aid of which we will travel with our Valkyries to find a planet where all humanity can be transferred. To check if a planet is fit for life, we will have 60 planetary characteristics counters. And to direct our Valkyrie we will use command panel letters and navigation cubes in order to achieve our goal. But do not lose sight of the fact that the planet Earth does not have much time left and that we have to reach our goal before the asteroids end all trace of life.

Description from the publisher:
Preservar la vida es nuestra prioridad. La vida en la tierra llega a su fin. Debemos encontrar un nuevo planeta capaz de acogernos como especie, que nos permita vivir en él y al que podamos llamar hogar. Para ello, os serviréis de las valquirias, naves arcano-tecnológicas que han sido desarrolladas gracias al descubrimiento de unos planos alienígenas. A día de hoy, estas naves son ya irreproducibles. Son nuestra llave hacia el futuro. Son nuestra última esperanza. 
W.O.R.L.D.S. es un juego de cartas cooperativo/competitivo en el que de 2 a 4 jugadores intentarán ser los primeros en hallar un planeta apto para la vida, la nueva cuna de la humanidad. 
En el transcurso del juego, los jugadores pilotarán sus naves, las valquirias, y jugarán características planetarias sobre los mundos explorados, colaborando para hallar uno que sea totalmente idóneo. Ahora bien, hay que ser el primero en lograrlo... Además, hay que conseguirlo antes de que la tierra pierda toda la esperanza de ser salvada. 
W.O.R.L.D.S. está compuesto por 24 cartas de mundo hallado de tamaño tarot, gracias a las que viajaremos con nuestras valquirias para encontrar un planeta donde se pueda trasladar toda la humanidad. Para poder comprobar si un planeta es apto para la vida, contaremos con 60 fichas de características planetarias. Y para dirigir nuestra valquiria utilizaremos cartas de panel de mando y cubos de navegación para poder conseguir nuestro objetivo. Pero no hay que perder de vista que al planeta tierra no le queda mucho tiempo y que hay que alcanzar nuestro objetivo antes de que los asteroides acaben con todo rastro de vida.
Si queréis saber más sobre W.O.R.L.D.S. seguid atentos. Iremos publicando todos nuestros avances por encontrar un planeta que sea apto para acogernos.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Lantern Year 3 Candy & Cola Crossover
description:
It's been 3 long Lantern Years, but Candy & Cola continue to survive in the nightmare horror world of Kingdom Death!

Wielding her broken heel as a weapong, Candy & Cola have just escaped from the Traveler's arena of death.

The Traveler is a huge entity moving on hundreds of pairs of horse-like legs. Those that hear its deep horn-bellow are drawn to the constatly moving titan, where they are forced to fight to the death for the amusement of its dark passengers.

Contains:
1 Miniatures
1 Small Booklet
Story Events (est 1-2)
Unique Base Insert
Candypopism Philosophy
Secret Fightning Art
3 Gear Cards

Lantern Year 3 Candy & Cola is classified as a "Wanderer" which is a new campaign-related system introduced in the Advanced KDM rulebook.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Santimanitay: Race to the Stage
description:
Description from the publisher:

WHAT IS IT?

Santimanitay: Race to the Stage, is an action-packed board game based around Trinidad and Tobago Carnival. Two to eight players compete to reach their ultimate goal - The Stage. The path to their ultimate goal is filled with challenges; players must avoid Hard Luck spaces, get past Midnight Robbers, take advantage of Warrahoon cards AND display their knowledge of Trinidad and Tobago Carnival. As unpredictable as it is enjoyable, Santimanitay is a must have for anyone interested in Carnival, board games or just having fun.

WHO’S IT FOR?

Santimanitay was conceptualized as a game that captures the spirit and fun of Trinidad and Tobago while preserving important aspects of our history and culture. The game is designed for 2 to 8 players, making it suitable for any situation or occasion, from a quite evening at home to the highlight of a Friday night lime. The ability to choose characters with different attributes can give an advantage to those who may not be as familiar with Trinidad and Tobago’s culture and history, making Santimanitay universally enjoyable. From age 8 to 80, choose a character and start the race!

WHY DO IT?

Known as the greatest show on earth, Trinidad and Tobago Carnival is a festival of beauty, colour, and pageantry. All aspects of Carnival have a rich and storied history; music, costuming, performance. As well-known as the festival may be, not many people know in what year the first Panorama was held, or who was the first winner of the International Soca Monarch competition, or even when the Canboulay Riots occurred in Port of Spain. Santimanitay was developed to help share and preserve this knowledge through engaging game play, memorable characters and challenging questions.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Ophidian 2360: Hostile Takeover
description:
Full expansion for Ophidian 2360 Futuristic Gladiator Combat Game! Original mechanics, great art, with new keywords, mechanics, and more!

This expansion adds additional Minions, Quick-Hits, Pumps, and more!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Fortunate Sons: The Anonymous Battle, March 26 1970
description:
The NVA laid a clever trap for their nemesis, the 1st Air Cavalry Division, in the remote northern region of Tay Ninh Province, not far from the border with Cambodia. Charlie Company of the 8th Regiment, 1st Air Cavalry was dispatched to inspect suspicious activity by the NVA north of Fire Base Illingworth. On March 26th they were ambushed by the 1st Battalion of the NVA's 272 Regiment, 9th Infantry Division. Deep in jungle terrain, Charlie Company was cut-off and unable to call-in accurate artillery or air support. The jungle canopy also made impossible any extraction by helicopter. It looked like the Communists were about to wipe-out or capture over 100 US soldiers.

Four kilometers away was Alpha troop of the 11th Armored Cavalry, along with Alpha Company of the 8th Regiment of the 1st Air Cav. Commander John Poindexter, monitoring the increasingly desperate radio messages from Charlie Company wasted no time in ordering his men to "Saddle Up!" in order to rescue their trapped comrades. Busting through jungle and risking ambush, the rescue and battle fought here in March, 1970 rank among the war's most epic and amazing fights.

Fortunate Sons is the companion “sister” game to Bad Moon Rising: The Battle for Firebase Illingworth. The two games use the same design and scale. Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate units and resolve some game events, as well as a six-sided die.
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting

name: 66D6
description:
The boardgame 66d6 is a two-player tactical game with simple rules and lots of dice. Easy to learn, hard to master.

Players both have an army of 33 minions (dice) at their disposal, to take to battle with the enemy forces.

Dice rolls determine composition of your army. How you use your army is up to the player. There are no bad rolls; merely changing tactics.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Reap!
description:
They is a competitive resource management strategy game where you command a flying saucer and your task is to gather food for your dying planet. Disseminate feeding tubes to terrestrial sites and harvest food from various sources. Upgrade your saucer and improve your food production. Fill up your craft with nutrients and be the first to be awarded the Honor of the Mother.

Your turn consists of moving your player token on the Mothership and taking the corresponding actions.
The Mothership is constructed from 2 concentric circular discs each with 8 sectors each containing multiple action symbols. This means that each spot on the circular track has 2 corresponding actions. The inner disc may also be rotated to change the makeup of the actions for each sector.
Move your player token on the Mothership up to 3 spaces clockwise on the circular action track and take the actions of that space.
The actions include scouting new sites, placing feeder strings onto a site to retrieve Nutrients, and assembling Cargo Tiles from Nutrients and adding the tiles to your saucer to fill up your ship. The requirements for each Cargo Tile is specified at the Foundry Ship, and can be modified during the game. Upgrade your saucer for efficiency, unique abilities, and extra VPs. You can also collect entire sites of different type to get lots of VPs.
Then the turn passes to the player on the left, and this continues until a player fills up their ship with cargo, or one of the other end goals is triggered.
mechanics: Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Box Battles: Cold War Evolution
description:
Box Battles: Cold War Evolution is a game of tactical conflict between the forces of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) and the Warsaw Pact (WARPAC) during the escalating Cold War. Whether you are a historian, a devout fan of the military channel or simply fascinated by this game genre, you too can now be a miniatures collector with the convenience of terrain, play rules and playing aids, all in one box. Assembled for 1/285 scale miniatures games, included within are:
NATO Forces:
12 M113 Armored Personnel Carriers
12 Infantry Squads
1 HQ Platoon (6 vehicles)
5 M60A1 Tanks

WARPAC Forces:
10 BMP-1 IFV
10 Infantry Squads
2 Towed 120mm Mortars
4 T-62 Tanks
Game play terrain surface 24"x36"
Rule booklet
8 Vehicle Information Cards
12 Command Cards
3 Dice (d10, d12)
1 Tape Ruler, 2 ruler card playing aids
50 marker counters
2 Large buildings, 4 small buildings, 2 sandbag emplacements and 10 cubic inches of foliage terrain
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling

name: Spearhead Division: A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Formed during the U.S. Army’s 1941 pre-war expansion, the Third Armored Division fought its way from Normandy deep into Germany. Breaking German resistance, the division suffered enormous casualties – over 16,000 of them, 2,500 of them killed in action (including division commander Maurice Rose). Late in the war, the division took the name “Spearhead” to note its achievements.

Spearhead Division is a supplement for our Panzer Grenadier: Elsenborn Ridge game, featuring 88 new die-cut, mounted pieces displaying the division’s units in their own special color scheme. There are also 25 scenarios, and with four “battle games” that link them together.

Spearhead Division is not a complete game; everything you need to play all 25 scenarios (and the battle games) in included in the book and the boxed game Elsenborn Ridge. No other books or games are required to play any of the scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Tacto
description: Out-program your opponent in a new spin on the classic game of Tic-Tac-Toe! Set orders and execute their demands in this quick, yet addictive strategy game. Great for learning coding logic.
mechanics: Action Queue

name: Project Z: Motorbike Gang
description: Expansion for Project Z. Includes 8 plastic miniatures (have to be assembled) and 25 game cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 1848: Year of Revolution
description:
"1848: Year of Revolution" is a wargame simulation of the series of popular revolts that swept across continental Europe in that year. The revolutionaries involved wanted to overthrow the reactionary and repressive regimes that had been in power since the Treaty of Vienna in 1815. Prince Metternich of Austria, ‘the coachman of Europe,’ had kept order and stifled change for over 30 years with his continent-wide system of police spies and divisive diplomacy. The revolts had a number of contributing causes: nationalism; liberalism; the emerging radical doctrines of socialism, anarchism, and communism; the changing structure of the economy due to industrialization and urbanization; and even Romanticism. Initially, the rebels succeeded in getting concessions from or even casting out their rulers, but internal dissensions and determined counterrevolutionary reaction erased the gains they had made by the end of 1848.

In the game, 2-4 players (up to three Rebels and one Reactionary) take the role of the leaders of various political forces in different areas of Europe. Generally, the Rebel player or players' objective is to spread revolt and seize power while the Reactionary player's objective is to retain power.

140 double-sided counters, 11×17″ area-movement map of Europe, abstract troop and time/action scale.

Designed 1997, as an act of creative procrastination while battling writer’s block on finishing an article for "Strategy and Tactics" magazine on the event. I used to make individual copies for anyone who asked; it just took me until 2015 to start making nicer-looking ones in advance.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Get Egg
description:
HaPi, KuPi, JiPo, and IPo want to make strawberry cake, so they need to collect the main
ingredients of the cake: eggs as well as up to ten grains. When the eggs are collected, it turns out some eggs are cracked and cannot be used.

In Get Egg, help them collect good eggs to make delicious cakes.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Roamer Booster
description: This booster pack contains 6 Walker miniatures to bulk out your herd, along with a set of Event cards designed to bring more of the dead onto the table and make your games even more challenging. You will also get a set of equipment cards exclusive to this set, including the Chainsaw!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Armageddon War: Special Dice
description:
These are THREE special dice that can be substituted for regular Armageddon War dice while playing. These are NOT needed to play Armageddon War. Here's the scoop.


This is a set of 3 dice, one in each color. They will have a different color ink than the normal dice so you can tell them apart).
You can choose to substitute one or more of these dice on your roll.
Red die (measured fire die) - Takes the best attacker faces (star-star and star-star-shield) and replaces it with star-symbol and star-shield-symbol. If you roll the face with the special symbol, you remove 1 action step from the attacker after combat. This means the attacker would not have an action step after firing, or would take 1 less damage from any counterfire. However, this is at the cost of doing 1 less strike to the target you were shooting at.
Black die (suppression die) - Takes the best attacker faces (star-star and star-shield) and replaces it with star-symbol and shield-symbol. If you roll the face with the special symbol, it does 1 strike to a different unit in the same hex as the original target.
Green die (shoot & scoot die) - Replaces the star faces (there are two) with a symbol and makes two faces with 1 shield instead of 1 face with 2 shields. If you roll the face with the symbol, you may retreat 1 hex away from the defender after the attack resolves, and this does not count as an extra action step.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: The Red Flag is Still: The Third Counter Encirclement Campaign
description:
The Red Flag is Still: The Third Counter Encirclement Campaign in Central Soviet is a two-player wargame of the third encirclement campaign against Jiangxi Soviet in 1931 during the Chinese Civil War.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Third_Encirclement_Campaign_ag...
mechanics: Hexagon Grid
publishers: Kilovolt Design, The Later Han Games

name: Minty's Bootiful Football Game
description:
The BIG Match in a Tiny Tin!

This is a 2-player card and dice game recreating the ﬂow and pace of a football/soccer match between two teams (Red and Blue), and is easily playable within 15-20 mins. It was originally designed to fit inside a standard Alto Mint Tin.

Using two standard ten-sided dice (2d10), this cracking little game helps to recreate all the ﬂow and jargon of a real football match, with substitutions, injuries, free kicks, corners, penalties, last-ditch saves, formation changes, players getting sent oﬀ and own goals too!

Players compare team strengths in three outfield areas (Defence, Midfield, and Attack) to determine a basic modifier to the Target/Progress Roll and then roll the dice to try and move the ball between their outfield areas in an eﬀort to score goals.

Included are playable Bonus Action Cards for each team, Event Cards that are drawn every time a Progress Roll fails (allowing formation changes, introducing injuries, providing second chances, adding injury time and tactical changes, etc), and an Xtreme Event deck that allows for those extra special moments when things go amazingly good, or disastrously bad!

If you download and play this game, please do leave any comments/feedback about your experiences — several players have asked if I'm planning a larger, full-card version, with more options and events, varied time segments and tighter controls, and this is certainly something I might be taking a look at over the next few months... Others have asked if I'm planning any expansions with real football player and team names, and to be honest I'd encourage anyone who wants to do this to freely supply replacement team/player ratings if they prefer. Better yet, upload and share them here!

Thanks in advance for taking the time to download and try it!

If you get to play it, please do rate it and add a comment -- all feedback is appreciated.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Math, Number, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Panzer (second edition): C3i #28 Scenarios
description:
Two scenarios for the Panzer Second Edition Game:

Scenario C3i-3: Treads over Dedushka: Estonia, 25 July 1944.

Scenario C3i-4: House of Soviets: Stalingrad, 30 September 1942.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Chibi Commander
description:
Chibi Commander is a strategy game for 1 to 4 players. You command a squad of specialists. Try to fight against the Aliens or take over the command of this dark minded Enemies yourself. Play together with your friends in coop or against them. Or even play it alone against the game itself.

Play missions in many different locations, single or in campaign mode. Rescue civilians, try to steal technology, defend or attack targets, kidnap enemies and much more. Place trees, covers, craters, streets, giant mosters and hole UFOs which landed on the map.

Control 4 totally different races with a total of 80 units including civilians and animals. After each mission you will gain victory points which will allow you to upgrade your soldiers in secret.

The rules are very optimized and allows playing whole campaigns during one evening.

—description from the publisher
categories: Horror, Modern Warfare, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Storytelling

name: Aurochs
description:
A trick-taking card game of cave drawings before the hunt!
Before the great hunt, shamans of the tribe gather in the cool dark of the sacred caves. There, in ochre and ashes, they draw images of their ancestral spirits on the walls in the hopes of great bounty. Who will find the greatest prizes?

Aurochs is a trick taking, point scoring card game for 3 or 4 players. Each round, each player in turn plays a card from their hand. The person who played the highest ranking card takes all the cards played that round and sets them aside for later scoring. Rounds continue until all cards are played, then they are scored. The first player to end a round with over 200 points is the winner.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Eden: Survive the Apocalypse – Burn Out
description:
Burn Out is the first expansion for Eden, the post-apocalyptic skirmish game. Burn Out gets the better of Eden the game. It starts with its original universe and its efficient gameplay, and it adds what it is necessary to get into the game by another aspect.

In Burn Out, setting up a game is simple, making the game easier for beginners. Games are scripted and the rules allow a better interaction with the scenarios. Simply, you read the scenario, set up the game table, and the game begins!

This also allows you to create your own scenarios and so to play on crazy tables ! You have always dreamed to play on a dock filled with containers, in city in ruins or the footbridges of an industrial complex ? With Burn Out you can !
The accessibility of this game will delight novice players, while additional rules will give new sensations to veterans.

Finally, Burn Out is also a campaign with more than ten scenarios, during which your fighters will get experience and become more and more powerful ! But be careful, at the end of a game, the wounds of your fighters remain on their card.. Your opponent, if he is weaker than you, will be able to take artifacts. So, be careful to well manage your resources, the world of Eden is violent and ruthless !

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Lilly Booster
description:
Lilly Booster

Plastic Lilly and Smitty Miniatures
Plastic Walker Miniature
Lilly and Smitty Character Cards
Browning Safari Rifle, Coach Gun, Hunting Knife, and Smoke Grenade Equipment Cards
Mantic Points

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: ATS: Leatherneck I
description:
The first in a three module suite for use with the Advanced Tobruk System, depicting small-unit actions in the Pacific Theater during WWII.

Leatherneck I contains three 11 x 16" non-historic geomorphic maps as well as two new map overlays. All of the combat and special counters needed for play are included (one is expected to already have ATS system markers) on five half-sized countersheets. Finally, there are eight new scenarios, all of which employ the provided maps and counters, as well as two sheets of AFV Cards.

Gamers must also own the ATS System Rules and playaids to make use of these products.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Blood Red Skies: Yakovlev Yak-1 Squadron
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes a squadron of Soviet Yakovlev Yak-1 fighters and additional accessories to add to the core game.

Components included in this expansion are:
6 Yakovlev Yak-1 Fighters
6 Advantage Flying Bases
1 Aircraft Card
7 Aircraft Trait Cards
6 Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Aircraft Markings Sticker Sheet
3 Action Cards

The Yakovlev Yak-1 entered service in 1940, a fast and well-armed fighter. With wooden wings and a composite structure, it was a very reliable and easy to maintain aircraft. Although its production suffered quality issues due to the Axis invasion, the Yak-1 always remained popular with front line pilots.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Moth: The Ion Age – Book One: Core Rules – Prydia Aflame
description:
Moth lets you to play out anything from a small skirmish with half a dozen miniatures a side right up to a squad level battle with more than a hundred miniatures in play if you so desire. Play with 28mm miniatures from the Alternative Armies Ion Age range.

This is a game that is fast to learn, fast to play and great for younger novice players and experienced tacticians alike. Moth has a clever central mechanic based around the D10 (ten sided dice) and the adaptable Elan Rating system. This, when combined with fluid squad mechanic allows players to add to and remove from their squads in play. Plus unique features such as Break Shots, Degrade Fire, two action choice among many others makes the game flow excellently and combines tension with fun in battle. Use cover, avoid open ground, call on your fellows for support.

This is a 60 page book containing all the core rules to Moth.

Win the Prydian Civil War for your noble masters!

-description from publisher webpage
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Panzer Grenadier: Soviet Paratroopers
description:
May Day Golden Journal:
Soviet Paratroopers

Our May Day 2017 Golden Journal features our first variant for Panzer Grenadier (Modern), as Soviet paratroopers land in the Negev Desert to march on the Israeli nuclear facility at Dimona. This was an option discussed by the Soviet leadership but never actually executed, and for the 50th Anniversary of the Six-Day War we have the pieces to let you try it out in 1967: Sword of Israel.

The Journal includes a set of 24 full-color, laser-cut pieces depicting a Soviet parachute battalion from the elite 103rd Guards Airborne Division.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Marvel Dice Masters: AvX Promo Cards
description:
This Organized Play promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters released slowly over a 6 month arc in conjunction with the Avengers vs X-men set.

The list of promos cards is as follows:


Teamwork: Basic Action Card
Thor: The Mighty
Rally!: Basic Action Card
Spider-Man: The Amazing
Deflection: Basic Action Card
Wolverine: Walking His Own Path
Teleport: Basic Action Card
Colossus: Phoenix Force
Collateral Damage: Basic Action Card
Iron Man: Phoenix Buster
Takedown: Basic Action Card
Cyclops: Phoenix Force
Phoenix Force: Force of Nature (Card with Unique Die)
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: That's Wizard
description:
That’s Wizard is a two-player simultaneous-action card game about dueling wizards. Both players will design a deck of seven spell cards to defeat their opponent with. Spells are organized into seven different schools of magic, such as Transfiguration, Charms, Divination, etc. There are over a thousand possible combinations to create your deck with!

You have two resources to manage, stamina which represents your health, and power which is the magical energy that allows you to cast spells. Each spell has a range of power that you can use to cast it, such that it has a greater effect the more power you use.

You will also have access to the two special action cards; Focus and Counterspell. Focus will bring you back to full power, while counterspell will prevent your opponent’s spell from have an effect, causing them to waste the power they used to cast it. Counterspell costs a bit of your own stamina however, and that cost increases the more you use it! Knowing when to focus, and when to counterspell is the key to victory!

The game is played with a simultaneous action mechanic. Each round, both players secretly choose a card from their hand to play, and secretly set a special dial to show how much power they are using with their card. Both players reveal their cards and dials at the same time. Spells that use less power will go before spells that use more.

You will play best two out of three matches. As the game progresses, you will learn more about the cards in your opponent’s hand, and be able to better guess when to counterspell and stop them! No matter how many powerful spells you bring a wizard duel, the key to victory is understanding your opponent!

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Zoolphabet English
description:
If your child is already studying English, this game will become an excellent supplement to the language practice. Playing Zoolphabet, children name and memorize letters as well as practice to spell new words correctly. Both the children and adults adore the cute little animals, so the cards motivate the players to learn English letters and work on their pronunciation.

The game method is quite simple: spelling the names of animals with the letters scattered on the table, players memorize their visual images and learn their names as well. You don’t really need to know English to start playing Zoolphabet.

There are several versions of rules for players with different levels of language proficiency. Advanced players can play “Burners” or “Dummy” in English to order to expand their vocabulary.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Anatole Latuile: Le sac qui craque
description:
Leaking pens, stinking sandwiches, Anatole’s schoolbag is full to breaking point.
In this little card game, players will have to use tactics, cunning and bluffing to win the game.

The goal of the game is to collect exactly ten identical objects in two of the three schoolbags that each player has.
There are four types of objects: pens, rubbers, paper planes and sandwiches.
Each card has two sides with two types of objects in different numbers, for example four rubbers or two sandwiches, one rubber or three paper planes…
Each schoolbag can only be filled with one object and you cannot exceed ten objects in one bag.
All the players are aware of the number of objects picked up by the other players.

The active player draws one card corresponding to the number of players (3 players = 3 cards)
One card after the other, he announces the number of objects on one side of one card (he chooses the side), for example two pens, four sandwiches…
The first player who is interested in taking the card may say it and then places it on the side he wants in one of his schoolbags.
If nobody is interested in getting the card, the active player has to take it.
If the player can’t place the card (if it exceeds the capacity of ten objects in one bag), then the card is discarded.
There are three special cards called ‘Crac’ that completely empties one schoolbag of the player who collected it.
Although this card game is suitable for kids, it turns out to be an excellent bluffing game with adults.
If you love smart bluffing and games that offer incomplete information, this game is for you.
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Solo Una Noche
description:
Solo Una Noche is a luchador themed card game for 2-4 players. Featuring 1v1, tag team, and melee modes, this game plays in about 10 minuets per player. Simple math to calculate damage and cards that encourage narrative and excitement make this a great choice for everyone 9 and up.
Solo Una Noche features turn based card play in which players compose attacks from their hand of cards to damage the other player(s). The defending player has the opportunity to respond. Damage is applied and then change turns. Play continues until one player can be pinned, submitted or knocked out.
Solo Una Noche punches above it’s weight class as a great go to game for quick take that fun while you wait for your friends to finish that other long game or for everyone else to show up to game night.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: Courageous Tragedy: The Battle of Belchite, August-September 1937
description:
Due to the stalemate at Brunete the Republicans launched a new offensive further east in Aragon Province. The new offensive would again be spearheaded by the International Brigades by the Army of the East. The goal was to break through the Nationalist lines and take the key city of Zaragosa. Success here would compel the Nationalists to withdraw, bringing relief to the city of Madrid and demonstrating the Republican cause could still win the civil war. The Nationalists had stripped this portion of the front of troops, with only three divisions holding the line. Despite their superiority in men and tanks, as well as the commitment of nearly all of the Republican air force to the offensive, the Nationalists grimly held to their positions and were able to disrupt the Republican attack. The fighting was particularly hard at Belchite, where fighting degenerated into a house-to-house slugfest that left the city in ruins. By the start of September the Nationalists had brought up reinforcements and gained air superiority. However, the Republican’s determination managed to hold off the Nationalist counter-offensive, and by the 6th a stalemate in the war returned here.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts?

Each copy of Courageous Tragedy is composed of the following:

• Two 11 by 17 hex map sheets
• 81 un-mounted, double-sided counters
• 8 pages of rules

As with the other Battles of the Spanish Civil War Series (on Teruel and Brunete), players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units and determine some game events. A six sided die is also used to resolve combat. The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov.

A card set for the game is also available. The card set replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the rules, features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov, and has rules reminders on pertinent cards.

-description from designer
categories: Civil War, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Deadzone: Veer-Myn Faction Starter
description:
This set contains enough components to build 21 bespoke hard plastic and premium plastic multi-part models, including:

15 Hard Plastic Nightcrawlers or Stalkers
Malignus Chem Thrower and Chem Spitter Weapon Options
4 Hard Plastic Nightmares
Chem Thrower, Big Drill, Heavy Chem Thrower and Two handed Drill Weapon Options
Premium Plastic Progenitor with Chem Grenade Launcher
Premium Plastic Progenitor with Spitter Rifle
25mm and 40mm Plastic Round Bases

Can be used in either Warpath or Deadzone
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: One Session Gettysburg
description:
A very compact and fast simulation of the Battle of Gettysburg playable in a single session, as an evolution of the Gettysburg game originally designed by Hampton Newsome as part of his Meade's Turn.

Units accumulate fatigue, losses and disorder like their real counterparts, and stop working long before they are eliminated by combat. Corps are activated by chitpulls and a simple order system (no writing) captures the delays inherent in 19th century campaigning and the unreliability of individual leaders.

Map scale: Half a mile per hex
Time scale: 3.5 hours per daylight turn (4 daylight, one night turn per day)
Unit scale: Divisions, individual army and corps commanders

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: Warfighter: Expansion #33 – African Warlords #2
description:
The African Warlords #2 expansion adds conflicts in Africa to the game. This expansion gives you Hostile cards, Event cards, and Location cards for engaging with African Warlords. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


25 Hostiles
4 Events
5 Missions
5 Objectives
2 Objective Hostiles
12 Locations
2 Eqiupment
1 Skill


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Dragonfire: Fighter Githyanki Promo
description: 2018 GenCon purchase promo. 2 were given: Male Githyanki Fighter and Female Githyanki Rogue both with a pre-printed feature slot: "Geas- Continuous: Pay 2 life and draw 1 card. (Feature may not be covered until Githyanki Silver Sword is acquired)"
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Dragonfire: Rogue Githyanki Promo
description: 2018 GenCon purchase promo. Two promos were given: Female Rogue Githyanki and Male Fighter Githyanki. This promo as well as the other has a pre-printed Feature Slot "Geas": "Continuous. Pay 2HP and draw 1 card. (Feature may not be replaced until Githyanki Silver Sword is acquired)"
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Linear Pursuit
description:
LINEAR PURSUIT

Manœuvre your pieces around the board, capturing and blocking your opponents pieces.
Capture your opponents ‘King’ to win the game.

SET UP
There are two sets of positions, an inner ‘in play’ set on the circumference of the playing area, and directly behind these, an outer ‘out of play’ set.
There are many, many set up options.
Less pieces for a potentially shorter game (‘major pieces’ may not necessarily be the same for each player), provided each player begins with the same number of pieces and both must have a ‘King’.

Players may agree a symmetrical set up, or, they may elect to take alternate turns randomly placing their pieces (not necessarily on their own side of the board).
Players may elect to play with, or without ‘Pawns” in the ‘inner’ (in play) positions.

‘CLASSIC’
‘Major pieces’ (King, Bishops, Knights and Rooks) always begin play in the outer (out of play) positions. Each ‘major piece’, starts with a ‘Pawn’ in it’s inner (in play) position.
“Classic’ set up requires all pieces.
Centrally, on the players own side of the board, place the ‘King’, flanked by ‘Bishops’, ‘Knights’ and finally ‘Rooks’.
A ‘Pawn’ should be placed in each ‘major piece’s’ ‘inner’ (in play) position.

RULES OF MOVEMENT
A piece can only move around the board from the ‘inner’ (in play) positions.
A piece in an ‘outer’ (out of play) position, must first be placed in it’s inner (in play) position, if vacant, this constitutes a players turn. If a major piece in it’s ‘outer’ (out of play) position has an occupied ‘inner’ (in play) position, the major piece is effectively blocked and cannot move.
’In play’ pieces move as follows:

PAWN
May only move from it’s position, along a single line, to a new position.
No use of the circumference is permitted.
If the target position is occupied by another of the player’s own pieces, that move is unavailable.
If the target position is occupied by an opponents ‘Pawn’, that piece is deemed ‘captured’ and removed from the board.
If the target position is occupied by an opponent’s ‘major’ piece (‘Rook’, ‘Knight’, ‘Bishop’ or ‘King’), that move is unavailable (a ‘Pawn’ cannot capture a ‘major’ piece.

ROOK
As ‘Pawn’, however, may capture ‘major’ pieces.

KNIGHT
Once ‘in play’, can only move from it’s position along two
consecutive lines, connected by a vacant ‘inner’ (in play) position. If the target position is occupied by another of the player’s own pieces, that move is unavailable.
If the target position is occupied by an opponent’s piece, that piece is deemed ‘captured’ and removed from the board.
The two lines used, must be a combination of the circumference and an inner line, in no particular order.

BISHOP
Once ‘in play’, can only move from it’s position along two consecutive lines, connected by a vacant ‘inner’ (in play) position. No use of the circumference is permitted.
If the target position is occupied by another of the player’s own pieces, that move is unavailable.
If the target position is occupied by an opponent’s piece, that piece is deemed ‘captured’ and removed from the board.

KING
Once ‘in play’, may elect to move either along a single line (as Pawn/Rook), or, along two consecutive lines
(as Bishop).

VICTORY
Victory is achieved either by capturing your opponent’s ‘King’, or, if your opponent has no legal move available.

(If only the two ‘Kings’ remain, any player, on their turn, may declare a draw).
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Flipside Jam
description:
Flipside Jam is a lightning quick, fun card drafting game for 2 to 5 players.

Pick wonderful and wild music stars as they roar around your table.
Pass the rest of the cards to the opponent on your left.
Simultaneously Flip the card to reveal your selections.

Think fast to outwit your opponents and select the best card combos to score the most points. The player with the most points after 3 rounds is the winner.

Can you roar to the top of the music world?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Battle Hymn Vol. 2: Shiloh and Bentonville
description:
Battle Hymn: Volume Two is the long-anticipated sequel game release to Volume One and includes two complete games: Shiloh and Bentonville. Battle Hymn is the new brigade-level system based upon the latest research into Civil War combat. This new entry introduces a new solitaire system to the series and an extension map for Gettysburg (Volume One) for a complete alternative history of the entire battle. Designed by Charles S. Roberts Award-winning designer Eric Lee Smith.

Shiloh: The First Great Battle depicts the two-day battle of Shiloh. The Confederate army surprises the Union forces of General Grant and a fierce battle blazes for two days, with first the Confederate on the offensive and then the Union turning to the attack on the second day. Shiloh shocked to the nation. Left dead or injured were more men than in all of America’s previous wars combined. The game includes four scenarios.

Bentonville: The Last Great Battle simulates the final major battle of the war. Sherman is marching through North Carolina when a surprise attack by the much-weakened Army of Tennessee catches one wing of the US army exposed. The first day ends in a bloody stalemate, and continues on for two more days. Can the Confederates escape? This game has both two-player and solitaire scenarios, and introduces an innovative new solitaire system to the game series.

Bonus One—Gettysburg ’62: No Lost Orders depicts an alternative history—the Confederates do not lose their orders for the 1862 invasion, Antietam never happens, and Jeb Stuart’s cavalry begins the battle of Gettysburg with a major engagement south of the Round Tops. The battle grows as a Union corps arrives to face off with Heth’s Division.

Bonus Two—the Gettysburg extension map attaches to Gettysburg: The Tide Turns making for a complete alternative history of the entire battle. Plus, a new scenario explores the alternative that Pickett’s Charge never happens; instead the Confederates drive south around the Round Tops on their way to Baltimore.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Lizardmen
description:
Warhammer: Lizardmen is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 104-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Lizardmen faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Lost Kindred
description:
Hidden for ages, unleashed at last

The lineage of the Kindred contains secrets within secrets. Lost and forgotten enemies returning for vengeance. Enslaved creations seeking liberation. A heritage known only through whispers and rumors. Each has its own destiny within the eternal struggle.

Black Chantry’s first expansion for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle is Lost Kindred, which focuses on five of the Kindred bloodlines: Blood Brothers, Gargoyles, Harbingers of Skulls, Salubri antitribu, and Samedi.

This set is a fixed assortment of 120 cards from a collection of 41 all-new cards, consisting of 23 crypt cards and 18 library cards.

Contents are detailed below. The number before each card is the number of copies of that card in the bundle.

CRYPT CARDS:

BLOOD BROTHERS
2 Agi

GARGOYLES

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Principle Dilemma
description:
Principle Dilemma - The righteous pursuit through moral combat.

This intellectual card-based board game gives each player the opportunity to use their creative thinking and moral compass to delve deeper into their own minds, thoughts and discomforts as well as those of their opponents. Players will expand their minds by analyzing some realistic and some not so realistic situations where one is forced to make a moral choice. Some choices may be easy while others may be much more difficult. Players who engage honestly with an open mind may learn some things about their opponents as well as themselves as they challenge each other in a battle of strategic persuasion.

For each round, one person plays the role of the hero while the others play as the tricksters. The hero is faced with a dilemma and must make a moral decision. The tricksters must make use of their cards and their creative mindset to attempt to alter the dilemma in such a way that will cause the hero to change their mind. Those tricksters who can change the hero’s mind score a point for the round. The winner of Principle Dilemma is the one who scores the most points in a predetermined number of rounds, or is the first to score a predetermined number of points.

This party game for thinkers can be played seriously or just for fun. Either way, it shatters the ice in a meaningful way by providing a stage for authentic and exciting conversation between friends and strangers alike. When the stakes are lifted and the variations eccentric, there is freedom to explore outside the box.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling

name: Failure on the Tugela
description:
Failure on the Tugela covers the attempts by the British to relieve Ladysmith following the failure at Colenso on the 15th December 1899. These attempts took place during the months on January and February 1900, most famously at Spion Kop.

The core game will be the same as Redvers Reverse utilizing the same scale for the map and counters. To reiterate the games mechanics - it is at Battalion and Battery level with emphasis upon the leadership of the British at a Brigade level for Infantry and at Divisional level for the Cavalry. The key feature of the game is to present the player with the problems and difficulties that Buller himself faced.

However there are key differences. Most notably is the fact that a game system that previously covered nothing more than a few hours will now cover a number of weeks. This is achieved by giving the player the opportunity to make a maximum of three breakthrough attempts in order to reach Ladysmith. This fits with the historical attempts on the Tabanyana Heights, Spion Kop and Val Krantz. Each breakthrough attempt, and its outcome, will have an impact on subsequent attempts. The player will have a series of predetermined target areas, at three different levels for each attempt. The level of success will determine the starting level of the Boer Confidence track for the next attempt. The more casualties inflicted the more diluted will be the Boer variable strength marker pool. However push too far and you own strength levels will be compromised with the increased likelihood of losing good quality leaders for the next breakthrough attempt. For each attempt you can push on into a second day but this is not without risk and will require you to reach a higher level of target area. Failure to reach any of the harder targets may well improve, rather than decrease Boer confidence levels.

It would not be a British Empire campaign without command confusion and there is plenty of that here. Events cover the situation where, historically, there were three people who believed they were in command during the attempt to secure Spion Kop. In addition whilst Warren is in charge for the first, and probably the second attempt, he must achieve a level of success otherwise he is demoted and either Buller or Clery take charge. If Warren or Clery are in command then Events exist where Buller meddles and further confusion occurs.
There are four possible breakthrough scenarios, the three historical ones and Brakfortein Ridge. You determine which you undertake by rolling on a table; which attempts you have already undertaken and the level of success achieved, will influence where the next attempt is. It is possible that you could undertake an attempt against the same location twice (but not all three times).

One change in the game map is that certain areas are designated ‘Peak areas’ and one area (Spion Kop) is split into three ‘Peak areas’. Peak areas improve Fire distances for artillery, are more vulnerable for defending Infantry (if not in an emplacement) and will be occupied by Boer units if vacant and adjacent to them.

In addition they provide the reasoning behind employing a number of additional Event counters.
Tugela has Event counts, amongst others, for Murderous fire (basically free shots at units adjacent to both Infantry and Artillery in a Peak area), British Surrender, Boer Loss of Nerve, Boer Inspired Leadership and Acton homes (will explain as testing progresses).

Given some of the steep slopes certain movements will require the unit to stay put for a turn before moving again. There will be no searching for Drifts in Tugela, unlike Redvers Reverse, as the four main drifts are well known. There will be three Pontoon bridges which can be laid under certain conditions.
There are a number of addition battles from the Boer War which lend themselves to the system, particularly those concerning the relief of Kimberley. In addition the Natal campaign has more to offer notably the eventual success at Tugela Heights and the siege of Ladysmith itself.

However the third volume of the system will be moving to the Crimean War and the battle of Inkermann. This time, as the British, the player is in a largely defensive roll.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Horrible Haikus
description:
The game - draw cards, make haikus with cards in hand, preform them for the group, and have fun!

To start the game each player draws three 5 syllable cards and two 7 syllable cards. One player will read to the group a "Performance Card". The Performance Card will give all players a note on how they should perform their Haiku for the rest of the group.

Based on this Performance Card, players will use their cards to create a 5,7,5 Haiku. Players may use either side of the 5 and 7 cards to create their poem.

The player who initially read the Performance card will select their favorite based on both the haiku itself and/or the performance.

Each deck comes with 550 Cards! The deck is comprised of 100 performance prompt cards and 450 double sided haiku cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Attack of the Fungoid Trolls: A Reaper Scenario
description:
This eight-page A5 saddle stitched booklet is the only expansion for Reaper Fantasy Wargame Rules, regarded by some as the forerunner to Warhammer. It included a folded A5 sheet of top-down tree images to cut out.

The scenario includes some pre-made army templates as well as suggestions for making your own, based on whatever miniatures you posses. Primarily a large-scale miniatures game, it has some roleplaying elements for adventurers, should the players wish to include them.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Starn's Disciples: Genestealer Cults Kill Team
description:
Ghyrson Starn is a hero of the xenos-tainted cultists who infest the war-torn world of Vigilus, a symbol of resistance against the tyrannical Imperium. To his enemies he is an anarchist and a cold-blooded killer, an assassin who steps from the shadows to slaughter his foes with blasts from his custom autostub pistols. He leads the kill team known as Starn’s Disciples, each of whom would gladly sacrifice their life for the gunslinging hero they idolise. This band of killers has murdered planetary governors, sabotaged Imperial monuments and stolen munitions from Astra Militarum outposts, building their infamous legend with every fresh outrage.

An expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, this box includes 6 miniatures – one of which is an exclusive Commander, a Kelermorph – a scenery set, a background booklet, as well as brand-new Tactics and Mission cards. Included:

- 8-page Starn's Disciples booklet
- 18 Genestealer Cults Tactics cards
- 6 Genestealer Cults Commander Tactics cards
- 4 Mission cards 4 Psychic Power cards
- 2 Genestealer Cults Kill Team tokens sheets
- 6 Genestealer Cults datacards
- A Ghyrson Starn ability tree card that presents a new Genestealer Cults Kelermorph specialism that can only be used by Ghyrson Starn
- 1 multipart plastic Kelermorph (exclusive to this set), armed with 3 liberator autostubs and a cultist knife, supplied in pre-coloured light grey plastic
- 5 plastic Genestealer Cults Hybrid Metamorphs that can be armed with any of a huge variety of Meptamorph mutations. They can be built instead as Acolyte Hybrids that can be armed with any of a huge variety of knives, explosives, claws, hand flamers and heavy mining equipment. All miniatures are supplied in re-coloured light grey plastic.
- 1 set of Ryza-pattern Ruins.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: WWIII
description:
An expansion kit designed to substantially expand SPI's "NATO" and allow it to be combined with the games "The East is Red" and "Sinai". The variant relies on some additional material published in issue #5 of JagdPanther as well as a few articles from their newsletter. The rules describe the three players as the Chinese, Russian, and NATO player, but the units controlled by each player stretch beyond these shorthand designations.

The 11 pages of rules include a combined turn order, strategic movement grids (for tracking movement of units between the three games), limitations on national objectives, victory conditions, and setup instructions. Additional components include three charts for strategic and rail movement, three sheets of additional counters, and several mapsheet extensions that serve to expand the area covered by the NATO mapsheets.

This expansion is currently available in PDF format as Amarillo Design Bureau has digitally rereleased all issues of JagdPanther magazine.

—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., JagdPanther Publications

name: Founding Fathers: Civil War & the Gilded Age
description:
Major expansion for Founding Fathers (2007) by Rick Heli that enables play through the Civil War, Gilded Age and the First World War.

New Features:
- Variable Outcome cards that provide random results when fighting major wars, including the wars of the base game.
- A new player action that enables gaining and taking from others votes in Congress.
- The Election Table that provides a new mechanism for resolving elections based mostly on the way the previous President conducted affairs.
- The possibility of sudden death victory via Regime change.
- New Offices such as the Admiral.
- Initiative cards that offer Presidents more options.

Offers two new scenarios, one for the Civil War, one for the Gilded Age. Rules also permit continuing the base game so as to play from the administration of Washington to that of Wilson.

Adds 198 cards, including 75 Issues and 65 Statesmen.

Requires the base game cubes and some of its cards to play.

Compatible with the Offices & Statesmen and Ladies & Orators expansions.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political, Post-Napoleonic, World War I
mechanics: Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Resilience
description:
Resilience: Facing crisis from the Big Chair deals with the resilience of a nation facing a succession of events trying to hit the nation’s key indicators of vulnerability, mainly its social cohesion and stability of its governance. The game takes the point of view of the Head of Government.

Resilience plays solo or in cooperation (usually 2-3 players) within a chosen scenario. The game acts as the adversary. Your goal is to be resilient enough to survive the scenario and achieve the expected results while putting into effect various strategies.

Resilience is a serious game played in professional and academic contexts (crisis management) but may be used for casual play!

Use a combination of 9 Roles with specific abilities (politics, homeland, foreign affairs...) and 22 Strategies or public policies (Diplomacy, Control of Government's communication, Revised Patriot Act, Cohesion of Intelligence Services...) to fight back and prevent Events and reach victory conditions stated by the scenario (such as Successive Strikes on Homeland, Government Reboot, Social movement is spreading...).

The game has been play tested with various groups of hard-core gamers and non-gamers (mostly defense-security professionals, college students).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Rally Point Volume 16: A World at World War 1937-1945
description:
Rally Point Volume 16: A World at War 1937-1945 is a set of 10 all new scenarios that are set in World War II. These scenarios were originally scheduled to appear in Schwerpunkt Volume #24. Production of future volumes of Schwerpunkt is on hiatus for the foreseeable future, so the Tampa ASL Group decided to publish them in the pages of Rally Point instead. Each scenario was handmade and play-tested to the high standard players expect from the Tampa ASL Group’s fine craftsmen. Each scenario is presented in the Schwerpunkt easy-to-read format on high-quality card stock.

RPT151 Luodian Lament – LUODIAN, China, 23 August 1937: Nineteen squads from the Chinese 66th Regiment attack to clear the defending 44th Japanese Regiment (11 squads) from the village on boards 10z and 70. This medium-sized 5.5 turn scenario is a tense all infantry action that features Chinese OBA.

RPT152 Shaken Not Stirred – VILLERS-MAREUIL, France 29 May 1940: Six R35 tanks and seventeen squads conduct a rare French combined arms attack to seize five buildings from twelve defending squads of the German 57th Infantry. This 4.5 turn scenario is set four half boards: 64, 65, 67 and 70.

RPT153 Run Gurkha Run – ASUN, Malaya, 11 December 1941: The title says it best. A company of Gurkha infantry is forced to withdraw across boards 17 and 72 while being hotly pursued by thirteen squads of the Japanese 11th Infantry Regiment and three supporting Ha-Go tanks. This 5 turn scenario has lots of exciting action that usually culminates in a Banzai charge near the end.

RPT154 Mars Begins – GREDIANKO, U.S.S.R., 25 November 1942: If you like fighting in the snow, this Eastern Front gem is for you. Twenty Russian squads supported by Lee, KVI and T-34 tanks attack to clear eleven German squads from the buildings on board 3a. This action-packed, 5 turn scenario (Designed by Mike Augustine) features German OBA and Russian rocket artillery.
