RPT155 Schutzstaffel Shindig- GRUSCHKI GRAVE, West of Kharkov, Ukraine, U.S.S.R. 31 August 1943: In this 5.5 turn, medium-sized scenario, a company of ten Russian tanks (T-34s and a KV-2) from the 2nd Tank Corps attacks with infantry riders to clear two StuGs and two PzIVF2s supported by panzer-grenadiers of the 5th SS Panzer Division “Wiking” from the hills overlooking the roads on boards 18 and 61. This tank battle will test your nerves and require you to use all your tank fighting skills.

RPT156 Wiking Rescue- ZERCZYCE, and STACJA-NURZEC, Poland, 22 July 1944: Veteran Tampa ASL Group member, “Mountain Man” Dave Brown makes his designing debut with this unique scenario in which both sides get to attack. A full SS panzer-grenadier company mounted in halftracks and supported by Panther tanks from the 5th SS Panzer Division “Wiking” attacks to clear a farmstead and relieve the besieged Penal Battalion 560. Will the fifteen Russian squads and six SU-76ms from the 44th Rifle Division overrun their village before help arrives? This is an action-packed, 5.5 turn, scenario that uses boards 9a, 16 and 43.

RPT157 Ozarks and Frundsbergers – RURDORF, Germany, 2 December 1944: A company of American infantry from the 102nd “Ozark” Infantry Division with five supporting Sherman tanks tries to out-flank and cut off the retreat of seven squads, an SPW251/22 and a PSW 234/3 from the 10th SS Panzer Division “Frundsberg”. This fast playing, 5 turn scenario is set on boards 53 and 72.

RPT158 Hungarian Hetzers – EBED, Upper Hungary, 6 January 1945: Eight Russian squads, four T-34s and an SU-85 from the 22nd Guards Tank Brigade attack to clear the village on boards 1a and 9a. Here, the Hungarian Division “Szent Laszlo” is defending with six squads and three Hetzers, one of which must exit the board. This 4.5 turn scenario is perfect for tournament play and has lots of tense action that is sure to go down to the last CC Phase.

RPT159 Lesson Learned in Lessin – LESSIN, West Prussia, 25 January 1945: The Soviet 9th Tank Corps attacks with a company of infantry, two IS-2s and four T-34/85s to clear elements of the 7th Panzer Division from buildings along a frozen lake. Hidden JgPz IV/70s on the opposite shore pour deadly flanking fire upon the attacking Russians, making this an exciting Eastern Front action in the snow. Mike Augustine designed this 5.5 turn scenario that uses boards 75 and 79.

RPT160 Willie und Fritz – MUSKAU, Poland, 10 March 1945: Elements of the Soviet 112th Rifle Division (17 squads) with two ISU 122s and four IS-2s execute a two-pronged attack to seize five buildings. Fallschirm Grenadier Regiment Hermann Göring defends this town with thirteen squads along with three Panthers and must simultaneously prevent the Russians from exiting two AFVs. This 5.5 turn scenario has multiple victory conditions and a unique tactical situation that provides a lot of re-playability. It is set on boards 2, 3b and 79.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Estates
description:
The first player to accomplish the following four conditions wins the game: 1) Has purchased one of the four estates, 2) Does not owe money to the bank, 3) Has $5,000 in play money and 4) Has his playing piece at home on his estate.

Each player has four plastic pieces of their color. The Home Marker, a large flat piece, is placed over the player's apartment, townhouse or estate to show which is his home. One of the three long pieces is placed on the Salary Record Board, one on the Rent and Salary Board and one on the Home Marker. The Direction Cards are placed on the board face down. Each player is given $500 and someone is designated as the banker. Each player rolls the die and high player starts. Each player in turn selects an apartment or house and places the Home Marker with the long piece atop on it and pays the bank the rent or lease. each player in turn takes the long piece from atop the Home Marker and places it in the yellow circle marked " Downtown and rolls the die. If a 5 or 6 is rolled the player draws a Direction card and follows the instructions which may mean moving the piece to a specific place and paying an amount to the bank. If a 1, 2 or 4 is rolled, the player moves his playing piece in any direction along the marked street one red dot for each count. The objective is to get the playing piece back to the Home Marker to increase salary. Salaries are collected to amass the funds to purchase the estate and liquidate bank debts.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Guild Ball: The Cook's Guild – Hell's Kitchen
description:
The King’s Pud? Lass, if you’re not familiar with that cup, then there’s no hope for you. That battered piece of tin is older than any soul living, and most of the buildings and statues across the land besides. The name of the original king who commissioned it has long since passed from memory, just the same as his kingdom. Pah, the only thing that kept it safe during the war is that the bloody thing is nigh on worthless.

But the prestige to win it? Ah, now there’s a thing to be sought after, and savoured like a lean joint of venison. To a Chef, the King’s Pud is more important than even the Sovereign States, and the rewards twice as lucrative. Usually it’s only our own who compete for the cup, Chefs from all over travelling to the holder’s demesne to compete. But, now we’ve found ourselves in the big leagues, the field is open to all. So, you’d bloody well better shape up, girl. I don’t intend on letting anyone but our own get their filthy hands on the prize, and I won’t be too happy even if another Chef crew does!
- Wellington, Chef’s Guild Team Captain

The Cooks are the fourth of the Minor Guilds to reveal themselves, after the Ratcatchers, Falconers, and Navigators. Allied with the vicious Butcher's Guild, the Cook's ability to whip up a buffet of blood puts these two Guilds in perfect synchronisation.

Ready to cook something up, this set includes Wellington (Captain), Pepper (Mascot), Cinammon, Roast, Sugar, Spice, Roast Ham Ball, Stewing Pot Goal Token, Prep Table 3D Terrain Piece, Tokens and Health Dials.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tales of the Northlands: The Rings of Nudrug – The 'Thank You' Saga Card
description:
A single additional Saga card based upon the long forgotten theatrical performance by Birmingham Repertory Theatre in December 1971. The show was scripted by Oliver Postgate and sets and scenery designed by Peter Firmin. The image on the card is a photograph from the stage production.

The Saga card when completed allows all players with at least one Nog on a supply card (on the Rings of Nudrug Saga) to select one character action from any character currently in the castle for no food cost. Players choose in order starting with the first Nog placed on the first supply card completed. Each player may only take this special bonus once regardless of how many of their Nogs are on the supply cards.

This card was not a promotional item and never available as a free giveaway at a convention or with the base game. It was distributed personally by the designer as a thank you to people who made a significant contribution to the game. Card released 1st July 2019.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Infinity: Daedalus's Fall
description:
Rise and fall of the Tohaa! Years ago, the Tohaa arrived on Paradiso to help humanity fight the Combined Army, but they also had a hidden agenda. The Triumvirate, a Tohaa shadow government, is waging a dirty war against the EI in which Paradiso and Humanity are nothing but pawns. Now, the Daedalus Portal that links the Human Sphere with the Tohaa systems has been destroyed, leaving the Tohaa on Paradiso stranded in the Human Sphere and disconnected from their home. Free from interference, the Triumvirate has created Spiral Corps, a mixed mercenary company that serves as a clandestine way to operate within the Human Sphere with total freedom and helps them achieve their goals.

Daedalus’ Fall includes not only the Campaign Rules for Infinity, but also two narrative campaigns: Paradiso Crossroads and Daedalus’ Fall. There are eighteen narrative scenarios that will allow you to recreate events on Paradiso past and present in the Infinity Universe.

This book also includes a wealth of information and background about new Sectorial Armies for Nomads, Haqqislam, the Combined Army, and NA2 with new Mercenary armies like Spiral Corps, The Foreign Company, and the Dahshat Company. Join them and help form part of Infinity’s History!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Brigade: Fire and Fury (2nd Edition) – Great Western Battles Scenario Book
description:
Great Western Battles Scenario Book

Shiloh
Cornith
Perryville
Murfreesboro
Champion Hill
Chickamauga
Atlanta
Pleasant Hill
Spring Hill
Franklin
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Vs. System 2PCG: H.A.M.M.E.R.
description:
Under the maniacal leadership of Norman Osborn, send "reformed" villains like Bullseye, Daken and Mimic to scour your opponent's deck, in search of vigilante heroes. Let "justice" be served.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Corvus Cabal
description:
Masters of ambush and assassination, warriors of the Cabal tend to possess an unnerving focus, talking little and communicating with a combination of complex hand signals and sharp cries that sound like those of hunting prey-birds.

Conquer Warcry through stealth, cunning and animal savagery with the Corvus Cabal! This warband set allows you to field these shadowy cultists in your battles, containing:

9 multipart plastic Corvus Cabal miniatures – 1 Shadow Piercer, 1 Shrike Talon, 2 Spire Stalkers and 5 Cabalists, with a variety of weapons options
A Corvus Cabal abilities card, allowing you to unleash the distinctive and deadly battle tactics of this warband in your games
6 fighter cards for keeping track of your rules at a glance, plus divider cards for tracking your tokens


What’s more, these warriors of Ulgu are available for use in your Warhammer Age of Sigmar army thanks to a free warscroll available in the Downloads tab.

This set is supplied with 1x 40mm round base, 3x 28mm rounds bases and 5x 25mm round bases.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: BlindFold
description:
The rules of this hilarious party game are simple: using a shared piece of paper, write a word, draw a shape around it, and then manipulate the paper (through folding, unfolding, flipping, and tearing) to ensure that only your words are visible during scoring. Easy, right? Now try it BLINDFOLDED! This hilarious game for 2-6 players will challenge memory, spatial reasoning, and your friends’ trustworthiness as an easy-to-learn premise becomes a complex game of tactics and surprise, as well as a chance to giggle at your friends’ and family’s mistakes—until it’s your turn to put the blindfold on!

BlindFold facebook group
mechanics: Action Drafting, Area Majority / Influence, Map Deformation, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Take That

name: Conspire
description:
Conspire is a social deduction, hidden-role storytelling game. Players can create their own situation or take one of the pre-made topics.

They secretly assign objectives to these in-world characters and shuffle the roles amongst themselves.

Everyone draws a role to play, not knowing who any of the others are or what they are trying to accomplish.

Players win by achieving the most objectives.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology, Novel-based
mechanics: Storytelling

name: Fartzilla
description:
Fartzilla is a push your luck dice rolling card game. Players play as kaiju-esqe "bad guys" aiming to destroy as many buildings as possible.

Players guide their individual character or team of characters consisting of: Fartzilla, Bad Phone, Captain Toenail, Chicken Powerup, Lazer Zombie, and Professor Toiler Paper. Teams can be uneven to make game play more challenging for one or more players.

On each player's turn, she chooses the number of building cards to be attacked. Three damage dice and one super power die is rolled. If the player's roll contains a higher number than stated on the buildings chooses, the player has successfully destroyed the buildings and retains the cards for victory points. Alternatively, each character has an icon the super power die. Should the player roll the super power corresponding to a character on her team, the player will destroy chosen buildings, regardless of damage die result.

Superheros are hidden in building deck and can only be defeated with a super power. If not defeated they return back to the deck.

End of game occurs once building deck is exhausted. Winner is determined by total number of building stories destroyed (corresponding number on building card).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Trump Roast
description:
Trump Roast is a meat-themed party game designed to help America solve the most ridiculous global policies. Trump Roast game is played with a minimum of 3 players and can be played with 12 or more. This game uses real Trump quotes, combined with Fake News, Veto, Collusion cards and complete with Trump cards for extra entertainment.

Use many of Donald's "best words" to choose his Position to the most ridiculous Policy questions that our celebrity president will be pre-occupied with while he's supposed to be leading our nation and making it great again. Packed with all the classic quotes and many nearly forgotten gems, Trump Roast game tackles many important policy questions including:


What does Donald have tattooed on his lower back?
What is the chorus to Ted Nugent's next single?
What does Donald yell when he shanks a drive at Mar-a-Lago?
How will Donald greet the world champion Green Bay Football Packers?
When Mike Pence's gay conversion therapy stops working, what is the backup line?
What are Melania's first words every morning?
How will Donald pardon the Thanksgiving turkey?
Dear Diary...


and many more!

Choose your favorite position quote to answer these important celebrity policy questions, score points and you too can be leader of the free world.

Coming to Kickstarter January 28th, 2020
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Battlebetes
description:
Outwit your friends with pharmacy finesse, daring diet and exercise, noble nutrition and lifestyle choices while avoiding terrible temptations given to you by your friends. Strategize how to get the best blood sugar score and earn the admiration of your family, friends, and general practitioner. Pit yourself against other diabetic warriors in the ultimate battle of diabetes management, Battlebetes.
—description from the publisher

Battlebetes is a card drafting and scoring game played in three rounds where each round each player is trying to be the closest to 100. Each round has two parts: “Drafting Cards” and “Throwing and Scoring”. The player with the highest score after three rounds wins. The first part is a "draft and pass" dynamic like "sushi go" and "7 wonders". This leaves players with five important choices that will ultimately decide their chances of winning. Do you: stack one card or balance cards, directly attack others or choose a card just to prevent another from getting it, save it for later or spend now? In the scoring phase each player throws their resulting food tokens like dice (each side has a number) adding any modifiers obtained resulting in their round score.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bite the pumpkin!
description:
A tenacious Farmer against a herd of Pigs greedy for pumpkins. Who will win?

Bite the pumpkin! is an asymmetrical abstract game for two (or three) players. Each player moves in a different way: while the Farmer just plants a new pumpkin every turn, the Herd of Pigs eats pumpkins and rushes in a chosen direction, until an obstacle is found.

Each player has its own goal: the Farmer wins if he manages to plant all of his 20 Pumpkins, while the Herd of Pigs wins eating Pumpkins until the board contains 2 or less of them.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Pattern Movement, Programmed Movement, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Grave Coffins
description:
Fresh from the DarkStone Forge, we are excited to present the Limited Edition Grave Coffins Set! This set includes 3D versions of the Coffin Tokens found in the Feral Vampires Mission Pack and can be used to replace these tokens with Vampire Mission Pack missions. But, this set also includes an exclusive new mission: "Grave Robbers" which does not use Vampires (the Feral Vampires Mission Pack is not required to use this product).

New Mission - "Grave Robbers"

The nearby graveyards have been hit hard lately, with someone... or something, digging up coffins and carrying them off in the night. No one knows who’s doing it or why, but with that many coffins and bodies going missing, it can’t be good! As the local sheriff was actually in one of those coffins, it’s up to you now to put a stop to this gruesome enterprise.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Taking the Gembloux Gap: A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
Taking the Gembloux Gap is a Pint-Sized campaigns for Chain of Command, designed to be played using the campaign handbook At the Sharp End.

A twenty-eight page PDF, Taking the Gembloux Gap contains an overview of the events of May 1940. as the German panzers rushed across Belgium, to be met by French troops advancing to assist their neighbours as part of ‘Plan D’. If the German armour can break through at Gembloux, the flank of the entire B.E.F. is turned and the road to the sea lies open.

This campaign focusses on the critical actions of the 15th of May as the French 110e Regiment d’Infanterie attempts to stem the tie of 3 Panzer Division spearheaded by 3 Schützen Regiment. This campaign is designed to be used with the Blitzkrieg 1940 Handbook.

The campaign is a total of five game tables with the duration running between five and nine games. Briefings are provided for both sides, along with measurable objectives, period maps, force and support option listings and everything you need to play this campaign through to its conclusion.

Like all of our Pint-Sized campaigns, this PDF is available for the price of a pint in our local pub. We’re sure that you’ll agree, that is great wargaming value!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Si Anak Nakal
description:
A group of Mouse Deer and Sheep have broken into the Timun Saving vault. Just right when about to do the deed of stealing, some of them thought to themselves "Aren't stealing is a sin?". Decide your alignment whether you want to help the thieves or sabotage them! Bluff your way through the cards to make yourself the victor.

Set up the game by placing the score tracker, shuffling the cards, exclude 1 card randomly, and give all the player 1 card. the rest of the cards are placed face down as the vaults. The first player begins by picking any face-down card in the vault, from the 2 cards you have in hand, you can either place one face down and nothing happens, or place them face up then activate the card’s effect. The game ends after all the cards in the vault are opened or game-ending card is revealed in the vault. The score is determined by the card left in the player’s hand. The first player that has achieved 15 points wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Hidden Roles, Open Drafting, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Mighty Midgets (Second Edition): Scenarios for Small Craft in WWII – A Supplement for Command at Sea, 4th Edition
description:
During World War II, battleships and aircraft carriers often overshadowed the exploits of motor torpedo boats and motor gunboats. However, these mighty midgets performed invaluable services, venturing out night after night to face enemy naval, air, and ground forces. They operated in every major theater, from the warm waters of the Pacific and Mediterranean to the cold waters of the North Sea.

This module for Command at Sea fourth edition contains:

Thirty-one scenarios featuring small craft actions in all the major theaters
Ships, Aircraft, and weapons data to support all the scenarios
Sidebars on PT boat tactics and history
Rules for role-playing as a small craft force commander
Two campaigns that use the role-playing rules
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Above the Clouds!
description:
Above the Clouds! is a set of air-combat miniature wargame rules for fighting large air battles from the late 1930s through the 1970s.

The rules are intended to produce a free-flowing and fast game to represent air combat. Although air warfare is a very technical form of combat, rules which focus too much on the technical details quickly lose the "feel" of air combat by turning the game into a slow, plodding simulation where seconds of combat time require hours of game time to resolve.

To avoid this, a fairly minimalist approach was taken in the game design. Individual aircraft have unique capabilities, and pilot skill/experience determines advantages and disadvantages, but the emphasis in the game is rapid execution of turns so that they game moves quickly.

To achieve this, the following concepts guided the game development:

Each player will typically control 2-4 aircraft
Minimal plotting, make a quick decision for each aircraft and move on
Aircraft speeds should matter, but it should not take more than a couple seconds to determine speed changes
Combat should be decisive and quick to resolve
Aircraft damage should not be overly detailed -- aircraft will either be fully functional, crippled or destroyed
It spans the gambit of combat from WW1 through the wars of the late 1930s (Spanish Civil War, 2nd Sino-Japanese War), WW2, and 1950s-1970s (Korean War, Arab-Israeli Wars, Vietnam War)


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Korean War, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: No End in Sight: Cold war and contemporary platoon level campaigns
description:
The M113 is burning behind you, the Reds are coming on strong. the platoon is in bad shape and mortar support is nowhere to be seen.
As platoon commander, you have to rely on your squad leaders to push your troops forward, lay down suppressing fire and win the fire fight.

No End in Sight is a comprehensive guide to contemporary, cold war and near future combat. Lead an infantry platoon through random battles, several campaign styles or scenarios of your own design. Track the progress of your squad leaders as you play.

The rules feature an innovative activation and reaction fire mechanic that leaves you making important and tough choices constantly. Know when to push and when to hold off. Your men have to last for a long fire fight and you may run out of steam when you least expect it.

Combat is written to produce a fairly realistic level of casualties. Most fire will serve to pin and suppress the enemy with modest casualty rates until you close to assault.

Command battle hardened professionals and insurgent militia, dismantle IED's, call in artillery fire, evac the wounded and take on enemy tanks. It's all covered.

The rules are written to be both playable and enjoyable on a small gaming space, using approximately a platoon plus appropriate supports, APC's and assorted vehicles on each side.

Run your own invented campaign or use the included systems to:

Conduct "Hearts and Minds" peacekeeping in a foreign land (or throw the invaders out)
Fight to prevent the "Domino Theory" from coming true.
Engage the NATO/Warsaw Pact while hoping the conflict does not escalate out of control.


The rules have been updated to a brand new second edition.

This updates and clarifies many rules, including a better assault sequence and expanded options for troop characteristics.

More tools have been included to help set up your own forces.

No End in Sight is compatible with any individually based figures.

Game measurements were written with 15mm figures in mind, but can be used for larger and smaller figures.

A typical game features about a platoon on each side, with supporting elements and vehicles.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Godtear: Mournblade, The Soulless & Knightshades
description:
"A fallen champion from a past age, Mournblade's cold heart refused to give up his endless lust for godhood. Heralded by grave wind and dark omens, the Soulless has returned, dead fingers once more beckoning to the world of the living and commanding his Knightshades to enact a deathly curse."

This set includes Mournblade, 3 Knightshades, Mournblade's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Broadside and Salvo
description:
Broadside and Salvo is a set of fast play naval rules for the pre-dreadnought era that allow large actions to be fought out in just a couple of hours.

Generic data for a complete range of ships typical of the era is included.

Note: These rules are included in Splendid Little War and White Bear, Red Sun publications. If you have these then you DO NOT need this product, you already have the rules.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: World of Motor Racing: World of Rallying
description:
Although this is officially Part 6 in the World of Motor Racing series it is a stand-alone module and it uses different design features in many areas whilst conforming to the WoMR format in others. We did not feel confined to following too closely the earlier parts in the series as rallying is a very different form of motor sport from those simulated in Parts 1 to 5, and as such needs a different design approach - we felt it better to end up with a product that captured the feel of international rallying rather than trying to fit it into the strict WoMR formula.

This game allows you to recreate a full World Rally Championship season with real cars and drivers rated to perform as they do in real life. In addition, each Rally venue is rated for its unique conditions from snow, to gravel, to asphalt. Rally data is available for WRC seasons going back to 1998.

Rallying is all about cumulative time, that is time taken to cover the various stages plus time lost in additional servicing 'penalties', and as such presents a difficult design problem. We wanted the simulation to be realistic and accurate (of course) but also fun to play, and not bogged down by masses of paperwork in keeping track of all the entrants. A complete day of rallying can be completed in a little over an hour and an entire rally over the course of about three-four hours.
mechanics: Race, Relative Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Flames of War: D-Day – American Forces in Normandy 1944
description:
The Americans have three basic varieties of troops in D-Day: American. You can field elite paratroopers and rangers, regular troops fresh into battle, or experienced veterans. Each of these has a different play style.

D-Day: American includes three new missions and a linked campaign.

The D-Day: American book has four warriors: Norman ‘Dutch’ Cota, Lafayette Poole, James Earl Rudder, Turner Turnbull.

The command cards introduce a new concept, title cards. These cards have the title of a division and a special rule giving the division’s flavour. The key is that you can only have one title in your force.

D-Day: American Book contains Forces for:

Parachute Rifle Company,
Glider Rifle Company,
Ranger Company,
Assault Company,
Rifle Company,
Veteran Assault Company,
Veteran Rifle Company,
M4 Sherman Tank Company,
M5 Stuart Tank Company,
Armored Rifle Company,
Veteran M4 Sherman Tank Company,
Veteran M5 Stuart Tank Company,
Veteran Armored Rifle Company, and
M10 Tank Destroyer Company.


—description (extract) from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: AstroNavigators
description:
AstroNavigators is a board game simulating the celestial mechanics within a space race themed worker placement game. During the first (astronomer) part of the game, players will be travelling across the Earth in order to complete celestial observations. This way, navigation knowledge (NK) is gathered for the space race endgame. The second (astronaut) part will use knowledge points to tackle technical and navigational obstacles. By efficiently using the on-board lunar telescope, sextant and gyroscope, players will push their luck with their newly acquired and cunning abilities. As an astronomer, players will explore different cultural settings and discover anthropological links with astronomy.

1 ASTRONOMER
While the time keeps on ticking and the celestial bodies keep on shifting positions, players scan the world for clues and means to finish some objectives in order to be the best prepared astronaut at the space race.
Different scientific discoveries will unlock powers of astronomical instruments to shape time and space to your favour. The evolution of astronomical instruments marks new possibilities in obtaining the ultimate skill to reach for the Moon.
During the astronomy part of the game the best and only the most necessary choices need to be made. The optimal strategy with the right cultural ability needs to be exploited to gain the perfect timing to leap ahead.

2 ASTRONAUT
Once players are ready to push their luck, they will shape the future of Earthlings. Whether it is a trip to the Moon a half a century ago, or in the near future, the knowledge of the stars will guide each player towards another world. The investments in past observations and the acquired abilities before launch will help to mark your fate as the best or worst astronavigator.
You need to anticipate moves of other players and take the necessary, yet minimal, risk at the right time! The first able to master all the spaceflight techniques to the Moon and back is likely to become the winner of the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Race, Set Collection, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Deliveries on Track
description:
Trains are the pinnacle of transportation across the country. Start your train line, and compete with others as you try to get a juicy government grant to expand your business. It's not going to be an easy trip with bandits lying in wait, couplings coming loose, and other locomotives trying to claim the grant for themselves.

Players take turns taking one action: get deliveries, cargo, or caboose (end game goals) cards, discard specific cargo cards to make deliveries, or upgrade their locomotive (flipping it over) to increase their hand limit. When making deliveries, players will place their completed delivery(s) behind their locomotive card. There are also special cargo cards which adds some "Take-That" into the game allowing players to play the Bandit and steal from each other, or protect themselves from Bandits by playing the Marshal. While the Loose Coupler causes you to lose one of your cargo from your hand, the Wild Cargo card acts as any cargo from any location.

Not only does Deliveries on Track feature both a standard and advanced mode of the game to challenge both younger and older players, it also has a unique game mode which allows players to choose which version of the game they'd like to play at the same time, creating a Mixed mode with minimal gameplay changes to the younger players. There's minimal text on cards, relying primarily on icons and drawings allowing younger players to be able to play with little issue.

The end game is triggered when a player has at least 5 completed deliveries. All other players have one last turn. After, all players are able to put up to two completed caboose cards on their train. The winner is the player with the most deliveries including caboose card bonuses in Standard and Mixed modes, or the player with the most points including caboose card bonuses in Advanced mode.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Four Against Ragnarok
description:
The monstrous children of Loki, the Mischief-Maker, strain against their bonds, and writhe and twist and plot to end the rule of the gods. Ragnarök, the destruction of the gods and all of the Nine Realms is coming. It is merely a question of when, and for how long it can be held off.

Based on the highly acclaimed Four Against Darkness series of RPG-lite dungeon delving adventures by Andrea Sfiligoi, this is a standalone solitaire or co-operative pen-and-paper game for 1 to 4 players. You don’t need any other books. No GM is needed! All you need is a pencil, two regular dice, this book, and the luck of the gods!
98 pages, black-and-white
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Lost Cats
description:
A solitaire memory game using a standard 52-card deck with a mechanic similar to the shell game.

In this game, the three jacks represents three cats that you must bring back to the queens (their owners). You put them face down in front of you in the middle of trap cards and draw cards to know how you must move them. After 10 turn, you'll have to find them from memory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory

name: Nailed It
description:
Nailed It is an adult party game where players get to celebrate relatable stereotypes we see in our everyday lives. Players will each be given 6 category cards to start the game. On these each card, there are items from 4 categories: location, food, clothing, and ailment.

Players will be challenged to create a story about why a category item (location, food, clothing, or ailment) in their hand is the best fit for the selected Stereotype. Stories can be simple or complex, logical or far-fetched. It’s up to the judge to decide!

Once a judge picks their favorite story and awards the player the Nailed It that stereotype card.

However – be aware that there are several Drop the Hammer cards players might have. If a player “drops the hammer,” the judge must pick a different winner for that round.

The role of judge goes around the table. For 6+ players, the first player to earn three stereotype cards wins the game. For 5 or less players, 5 stereotype cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Games by Bicycle, The United States Playing Card Company

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Skaven Card Pack
description:
Every skaven is egotistical and self-absorbed to the extreme; each universally believes themselves to be the greatest being ever to live and that all their fellows must be destroyed. Organised into different clans, each specialising in a different method of death, these ratmen will take any opportunity to claw their way to the top of the pecking order. All skaven must constantly be on guard against their underlings, for though they are not brave, they are vicious opportunists – and the lands of the Eightpoints are a fine place to organise ‘accidents’ for their rivals.

Sneak-stab and kill-kill your way across the Eightpoints with this skaven card pack! This set gives you the rules you need to use the insidious Skaven in your games of Warcry, giving you a vast range of fighters to choose from and abilities for getting the most out of them. Fast, sneaky and capable of being fielded in massive numbers, this warband is ideal for any aspiring Clawlord.

This set contains:

A faction ability card, allowing you to harness tactics, tricks and abilities unique to this warband, including the runemarks you need to use them. The reverse allows you to identify the fighters in your warband. The set contains a faction abilities card in each of the following languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian.
Fighter cards for 20 types of fighter, including Night Runners, Stormvermin, Packmasters, Rat Ogors, Plague Monks, Clanrats, Giant Rats, and Stormfiends
2x divider cards, used to keep track of any tokens that apply to fighters in games


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Anno Domini 1666: Royal Musketeers – Jean & Natalie Character Pack
description:
Don’t be fooled by the flower basket on Natalie’s arm – there is just enough firepower in there to keep bothersome fools at bay. And in case she needs backup Jean, her trusty bodyguard is always ready to help her out.

Warning: this is not a standalone product. You will need a copy of Anno Domini 1666 Base Game to use the contents of this box.

Contents:
• 2 Highly detailed plastic miniatures
• 2 Character cards
• 4 Item cards
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Spellcaster: The Frostgrave Magazine #6
description:
Spellcaster: The Frostgrave Magazine exists to bring new rules, scenarios, and gaming ideas for players of Frostgrave and Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago.

This double-sized issue contains 18 scenarios including:


Swords Against the Slime Lord – A 4-scenario Frostgrave mini-campaign.



The Frostgrave Immersion Tour pack – including 6 unique scenarios.



Standing in the Eye – A one-off Frostgrave scenario.



Warriors of Athena - Using the Frostgrave rules for playing solo Greek Myth games, including 2 scenarios.



The Witch of Mount Gramos – A 3-scenario mini-campaign for Warriors of Athena.



Giant Tortoises in Ghost Archipelago – Rules for mounts and pack tortoises as well as a solo scenario.



Eye Demons in Frostgrave – Rules for eye demons, plus a new scenario


-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: The World Undone: 1914 – Serbia
description:
The World Undone: 1914 Serbia covers the ill-fated Austo-Hungarian invasion into Serbia at the beginning of the war.

An overwhelmed but experienced and aggressive Serbian army quickly made short work of 3 invading Austro-Hungarian armies during an operational campaign set in dense terrain with frequent counter-offensives.

The Austro-Hungarian forces were ultimately routed and would not return until they had the help of Germany and Bulgaria.

Units are Divisions and smaller. Turns are 1 day. Each hex is approximately 7.2 km.

Players can combine the Serbia, East Prussia and Galicia Games together to simulate the entire Eastern Front in 1914.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: The Space War
description:
The Space War is a fast-paced strategic 2 player card game with both players playing with the same cards.

Each player represents a selected commander with the goal to destroy the opponents space station while defending their own.

Develop your station to draw more cards, receive more actions points or increase your hand size. Use spaceships, missiles and strategy to win the war.

The cards in your hand can always be played and most of the time each card can be played in several ways.

If your station gets damage you have to flip that many station cards. If you have no station cards left to flip you lose the game.

This game is more about how you play your cards instead of which cards you have.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Blood Red Skies: MiG Alley!
description:
MiG Alley was the name given by the United Nations (UN) pilots to the northwestern portion of North Korea, where the Yalu River empties into the Yellow Sea.

The area's nickname was derived from the Soviet-built Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-15 flown by North Korea (some unofficially crewed by Soviet airmen) and the People's Republic of China airmen.

In response to the MiG threat the UN's P-51 Mustang squadrons began to convert to jet fighters... enter the North American F-86 Sabre.

The Mig Alley set contains all the aircraft cards, pilot discs, traits doctrine and equipment cards you need to take your games of Blood Red Skies in to the Jet Age!

A copy of the Blood Red Skies core box is required to use the contents of this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Animal World War
description:
Animal World War is a knock down, drag out battle for survival in a post apocalyptic world where animals have risen to eminence. The right to eat vs. the right to not be eaten. Play as 1v1 or in teams and build strategies with your troops and teammates. Each game has a fully randomised game board which changes as you play. In Legacy Mode, your actions have environmental impacts which can be felt for skirmishes to come. It can be a simple war of attrition, or you can include mission objectives to throw a little more complexity into this wargame.

The simple 1 action per troop gameplay keeps things moving along and allows for many players to join in the conflict based in the rich world of Animal Empire and Animal Empire the Role-Playing Game.

Join the battle, who will reign supreme?
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Legacy Game, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game

name: Tug-of-Warriors!
description:
In a cartoony post-Apocalyptic setting, the remaining survivors now seek new kinds of entertainment...In this case, a simple game of Tug-of-War...over a pit of radioactive waste!

Through strength, strategy, and cunning, lead your squad of thugs, bruisers, freaks, oddballs and other misfits in an all-out battle against your rival! Defeat them, and become the greatest Tug-of-Warriors the End of the World has ever seen!

After hand selecting a team of Warriors to pull for either, each player will then try to defeat their opponent through a combination of strength and cunning (and a little luck!) The game is a series of rounds, with each player’s Warriors going head-to-head. Every round, players choose then place one Warrior card on their side of the Rope until they fill each of their five open Rope positions. Once a player has filled all five of their Rope positions, they then “substitute” in new Warriors each round by placing them on top of their existing Warriors, with only the top Warrior at each position being “active.” Unlike a traditional tug-of-war contest, where the winning team is simply the stronger pullers, in Tug-of-Warriors!, the team who accumulates the most overall points wins the game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Tug of War

name: Contrivance: A Game of Moxy, Mayhem and Machinations
description:
Every want to have you very own Trans-Aether Relocator? How about an Elemental Transmorgrafier? Of course you have, who hasn't?

So gather your components, pass that Esotheric Oscillating Pork Wrench and get to confabulating something amazing! ... Oh, and keep a fire extinguisher handy. Easy and quick to learn, light and fun game.

Players build a Contrivance by installing and configuring Component Tiles of dubious value on a Workbench grid. They compete against each other to keep higher value Component Tiles by Interlocking them using the actions of the Hilarious Tool Cards they are dealt on each turn. Tiles can be moved, rotated, exchanged or even altered in point value depending on the card that is played.

The game ends when a Switch On card is pulled that causes the Contrivance to be activated and the Components are tested. Components that don't blow up and survive activation on each Builder's row are totaled. The Builder with the most points wins!

This is a hand crafted game, made to order with beautiful, engraved wooden components.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Command Cards, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Slide/Push

name: FutureShock!
description:
FUTURESHOCK has arrived, and with it, come brutality, mayhem and carnage, all on a single page that can be printed out, cut and turned into a tiny six-page booklet. FS is a set of incredibly simple skirmish rules for miniatures in your collection, focused on the post-apocalypse, but don't let that stop you from using it to fit whatever setting you prefer.

In FS, players create warbands of thrashers and send them into small-scale engagements, rife with blood, mayhem and slaughter. Skirmishes are played on 1 by 1 foot battlefields with combat beginning on the very first turn.

This inaugural issue of FS contains the complete core rules in a simple tiny booklet, with future installments to focus on: solitaire rules, scenarios, new weapons and items, mutations and much more.

Welcome to the wasteland, Thrasher.

Welcome, to FUTURESHOCK!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: BLASTER: Games Anthology 01
description:
What happens when five of wargaming’s most talented indie designers are teamed up with an incredible graphic artist?

The answer is a unique anthology project. New rules for your favourite indie titles. New games ripped right from the minds of wargaming’s most prolific collective of published writers and insights into the process of writing and creating games.

Join us for BLASTER!

BLASTER: Volume 1 contains:


Martian Racing Federation, a stand-alone game-mode for Gaslands by Mike Hutchinson. You’ve seen Earth's worst, now witness their overlords.
Last Days: TIMELINES by Ash Barker, which takes the Zombie Apocalypse through time; beginning with the Old West.
The Lotus Guilds of the Twilight Seat spring onto the scene in Relic Blade by Sean Sutter along with downloadable assets for these new Seekers.
The Beastmasters, a whole new faction for THIS IS NOT A TEST by Joseph McGuire. With complete rules for these maniac pet-owners in the Wasteland.
Rangers of the Watchtower, a complete mission supplement from Rangers of Shadowdeep by Joseph McCullough that reimagines the game with a fellowship.
Closing thoughts from all five designers on this first volume and the state of wargaming.


—description from the publisher

This PDF document presents print-and-play expansion modules for five miniatures games, noted above.
—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon Dare
description:
Dungeon Dare is a fast paced, lighthearted fantasy theme press-your-luck dungeon delve card game for 2-3 players! You enter the dungeon with only your wits--NO Weapons! NO Armor!--looking for monsters, items, and gold which can be cashed-in to level up! The first player to reach Level 10 of the dungeon wins!

The gameplay is simple: draw a card and then resolve that card. If it is a Monster, you can attack it (and gain XP) or you can avoid it! If it is a Weapon or Armor, you can equip it in your inventory. If it is an Item, you can add it to your inventory. If it is Gold, you can collect it! It is is the Princess, you save her! After each draw and resolve, you must decide whether to continue in the dungeon and risk losing all the Gold and XP you have gained during the turn, OR to stop and exit the dungeon and collect all the Gold and XP you gained during the turn to cash it in to level up through the dungeon. The first player to reach Level 10 wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: BoardGains
description:
Do you wish to bring your workouts to life? Working out on your own could get a little “boring” at times!

Imagine getting a chance to work on your fitness while having a fun time with your friends or likeminded people?

Sounds too good to be true? Well, it isn’t!

Because we bring you the BoardGains – Bodyweight Edition.

It is a fitness board game that lets you work on your fitness while having fun. This game engages you into a healthy competition all while allowing you to hit your fitness goals!

In this game, players or teams roll the dice, move their game piece, exercise, and collect gains. Win the game by collecting the set number of gains before anyone else or by collecting the most gains in a set amount of time.
Oh, and did we tell you that it comes with a twist? You betcha! BoardGains comes with “Lucky? Play Cards” that can either help you gain an advantage in the game or cause a disadvantage. It takes around 45 to 60 minutes to complete, and you can play anywhere.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Race

name: Footballiser
description:
The hottest football game not just for football fans! Footballiser is a board game in which you can conquer the world of football as both a team leader, club owner and a football player. A game where you not only get to use your strategic skills alongside your dexterity, but also have to exploit both if you want to win the cup!

The objective of Footballiser is to be the first player to obtain all 6 Stadium Development Items and to win the league final! Footballiser is a turn-based game, meaning in each round players get to decide what action(s) to take. Each round comprises two phases: using of an Action Card and carrying out an operation. An operation may be opting for a Stadium or Team Development (either via trading in trophies previously won for successful matches, or by rolling the Development Dice), or playing a match.

Stadium Development Items are to be put on one’s Development Board, except at the start all 6 sections of the Development Board are occupied by a certain number of flags. To remove flags and therefore to make place for possible Stadium Developments, one has to win matches. When it comes to playing matches, a player has to draw a Match Cards. Match Cards come in four different difficulty levels, often depicting famous football situations. All 50 Match Cards are unique, providing you a pool of possibilities that would be extremely hard to get bored of. The Footballiser Field consist of numbered cells, making Match Cards easily understandable, and the footballer figures easily placeable on the board. One must flick the figures in a way that the figures push to ball to a selected few cells that count as a successful pass, and repeat the process a few times to kick the ball through the goal line.

After winning the match, the player gets to decide which section to free up for Stadium Development, although it shall not be random, as the usage of Action Cards and Power Cards are often conditioned on a certain level of Stadium Development. Power Cards provide you with a higher chance of winning matches, for example by allowing you to try again certain shots or skip otherwise necessary passes on your way to the goal. Action Cards either provide help for your development in game, or offer up an opportunity to set someone else’s development back, for example by having them put Development Items back in the pack or by making them skip turns or limiting their choice when their turn comes. If all the flags are taken off of the Development Board, all Stadium Development Items are placed on their rightful places on the Development Board, you may proceed to play the league final. When you win that, you win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Fozzy Football
description:
A classic battle of skill, played shuffleboard style, that lets opponents engage in a game of American-rules football.

Players slide a shuffle puck toward run and pass targets. Look out for penalties, interceptions and fumbles!

It an action-filled, fast-paced game that gets the adrenaline pumping and competitive juices flowing.

The game requires a mobile app, free download from either the Apple or Google Play store. The app keeps track of down, yards remaining, line of scrimmage, timeouts, the play clock, game clock and score. It also includes an announcer that adds color commentary to the game based upon the outcome of each slide.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Simulation

name: Terra Loop
description:
There’s an epic quest for all great explorers! It’s a race to find amazing ancient artifacts. You have to travel across the world collecting priceless ancient currency - the TOLAR. Beware of your opponents, they’re looking to steal all your wealth! This is a treasure hunt of the greatest scale!

In Terra Loop, you take part in a special race to collect a priceless ancient currency - the Tolar. All Tolar is in denomination of 50,100,200 and 500. Each player begins with one Robot Peg and a console mat, with two sections - Unsaved Tolar and Saved Tolar. The game board is placed in the middle. you start at home and on your turn move around by rolling the dice. The goal of the game is to collect and save maximum Tolar. Whenever you land back at home, all your Tolar in the unsaved section moves to the saved section. There are three main places on the board where you collect Tolar. These are called the checkpoints. All checkpoints are hard stops, which means you have to stop here and cannot skip it. When you reach a checkpoint, roll the dice and multiply by 100. collect that amount of Tolar and place it in your unsaved Tolar section. There are other various parts on the board, where you can either lose or gain tolar, or even an extra dice to roll. When another player lands on the same place as you, they cut you, and get all your unsaved Tolar and you go to a pre-mentioned spot on the board. Remember, you never lose your saved Tolar. ever. so, when someone cuts you only give them your unsaved Tolar. if you have saved all your Tolar, you give up nothing! When you have collected an extra dice, you reach the next checkpoint, roll both dice and multiply by 100. Collect this much Tolar and then place the dice back on the board.
The game ends, when all the Tolar has been collected. each player gets all of their saved Tolar but only half of their unsaved Tolar. The player with the most Tolar wins.

Terra Loop takes your entire family on an adventure like never before. Your kids will never look at learning the same way after this magical educational experience. Enjoy with them as they traverse through various lands collecting a precious ancient currency. See them master operations with numbers and money right before your eyes! Go beyond academics and instill them with life skills and moral values through an engaging game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Race

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Catachans
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Taxi! Board Game: New York
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Choo Choo Game: the train drafting game
description:
Choo Choo Game is a Card Drafting game for 2 to 6 players.
Draft a card from the hand to build the longest train. Train carriages must be built in order, Locomotive, Coal carriage, People carriage and Flatbed carriage, The Box Carriage is wild and can be placed anywhere after the Locomotive. If you cannot take a correct carriage from the hand on your turn you must pay a penalty of one carriage from your train. Once a full hand of cannot be drawn the game is over and who ever has the longest train wins.
Features old style art of Locomotives and Carriages.
A Deck of 55 cards.
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Carcosa Rising
description:
Carcosa Rising is the first expansion for Four against the Great Old Ones. It is based mainly on Mythos-related materials from Chambers and Bierce, drawn directly from the original sources.

The disturbances caused by the upcoming Great Ritual have started to tear apart the fabric of reality, and well-known places have already been replaced by a distorted version of themselves coming from other dimensions. Meanwhile, the King in Yellow and its agent, the Pallid Mask, are manipulating events from behind the curtain, and poisoning the very thoughts of unsuspecting people. And who is the mysterious plump man that appears to be following the group?

Carcosa Rising includes a new Investigator class (the Dreamer), three alternative versions of locations from the basic game, an entire new location (Carcosa), three event tables for traveling, possible attacks from the Pallid Mask (who takes control of the body of Investigators gone Insane), and a final Encounter with the King in Yellow.

This is a non-standalone expansion. Players can choose to add any combination of elements from Carcosa Rising to the base game, mixing and matching materials to ensure that no two games will be the same.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Travel
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Age of Trains
description:
Age of Trains is a retrofuturistic train game in which you aim to pick up and deliver cargo to and from various locations on the map. The game can be played by 2-5 people (depending on the map used). Finishing it requires playing through a certain number of rounds (also determined by the map used), during which we gain Victory Points. The player with the most Victory Points at the end is the winner.

The game’s mechanics revolve around the ‘pick up and deliver’ core - you plan your movement across the hexagonal map board, determine the cargo you want to pick up (originating from both private and public sector), and deliver it to the chosen city or port. The more you deliver, the more you can pick up for future transports. By buying the ‘port stock tiles’ you increase your chance of gaining more Victory Points.

Apart from the map boards (each depicting the real country with the original names on it, but adapted to the game’s mechanics), the game also features:
- the game board (used for determining the players’ actions, monitoring the opponent’s development, and upgrading our train),
- the player’s board (used for monitoring player's progress and the improvements made to the train).
The train’s upgrades are divided into 4 categories (engine, hopper wagon, additional wagons, and hiring a specialist), with each upgrade creating new opportunities for the player. Pair it up with the special cards, allowing you to break some of the rules, and you can be sure that each playthrough will differ and require the players to change their tactics and stay vigilant for the opponents’ moves.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Worker Placement

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Eta-2 Actis Expansion Pack
description:
As the Clone Wars takes its toll on the ranks of the Jedi Order, those that remain must assume even greater responsibilities in the Grand Army of the Republic. The Eta-2 Actis-class Interceptor, developed by Kuat Systems Engineering, is stripped down so that battle hardened Jedi pilots can get the most out of its agile frame.

This expansion puts one of these agile ships as well as a Syliure-class Hyperspace Ring in your hands. Meanwhile, six ship cards offer an array of the galaxy's most notable Jedi Knights to fly it into battle and six upgrade cards invite you to customize the ship with a new astromech, additional Force abilities, and more!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: World War III: Team Yankee – Soviet
description:
This is the third updated book for World War III: Team Yankee.
It features all the great options and units that were in Red Thunder, but with the addition of lots more Formations and Units.
World War III: Team Yankee – Soviet: Soviet expands and enhances the forces available in Red Thunder for the Soviet Army.

What is Different?
There is more choice. More tank options with the introduction of the T-80, T-62M, T-55AM, and more Motor Rifle options with the BMP-3. These add more Formations to choose from with the addition of the T-80 Tank Battalion, T-62M Tank Battalion, and T-55AM Tank Battalion, as well as the elite veteran T-80 Shock Tank Company

There are a bunch more new formation and support Units and vehicles as well. The 2S6 Tunguska AA Platoon, the BMP-3 Recon Platoon, BMP-3 Motor Rifle Company, BMP-3 Shock Recon Platoon, BMP Shock Motor Rifle Company, BM-27 Hurricane Rocket Launcher Battery, and TOS-1 Thermobaric Rocket Launcher Battery.

Don’t worry, all your old favourites are still available. In fact these can also gain access to the new anti-tank, anti-aircraft, motor rifle, and recon options. You can still take a T-64 or T-72 Tank Battalion, or a BMP Motor Rifle Battalion, or an Afgantsy Air Assault Battalion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Star Eater
description:
Star Eater combines innovation, stylised scifi action and gorgeous illustration to create a uniquely satisfying and strategically competitive experience for 2-4 players.

You play as the commander of a gigantic Capital Ship, with multiple weapons and systems to manage as a supplemental force of on-board Corvettes.

Each faction has unique Capital ships to choose from, each with customizable weapons, corvettes and utilities tailored to specific roles. Before the game begins, Commanders will customize their capital ships and corvettes to suit their playstyle and strategy.

Star Eater uses an inertia based movement system. Each turn a commander can fire the capital ship engines to gain, bleed off, or redirect their momentum. Acquired momentum is tracked with tokens and each turn the momentum will continue to affect the capital ships movement turn after turn until it is removed.

Each turn, both players will place face down: an engine Dial with a setting selected and 2 command cards.
When both players agree that they are ready, they will reveal their engine dials at the same time, then apply the relevant momentum to their capital ship. All capital ships on the board are then moved according to the momentum they possess.
Once movement is complete, the players reveal their command cards simultaneously and play out their effects.

Most commands attract cooldown which removes them from the game for a set number of turns after use. The amount of cooldown attracted by a particular command is determined by the components that commander has chosen to outfit their capital ship with.
There are 8 command cards, each of which will activate one component of the warship; main and broadside weapons, point defense turrets and shields, emergency engine power and various special abilities. Controlling corvettes is also done via command cards.

Capital ships are composed of many sections. Each individual piece of the capital ship has its own armor rating, and the ship as a whole has an internal structure health. To damage your opponent's structural health, you must strip away their armor and then land shots in the resulting gap. When a capital ship runs out of internal structure health, it is destroyed and their opponent wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Action Timer, Command Cards, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pet Royale
description:
A fast-paced pet themed resource management game, Pet Royale was created to:

Be easily explained and playable within minutes;
Promote a healthy level of interaction and thinking (outwit, out-do, outmanoeuvre);

Players take turns to place their cards in the map filled with resources, and the pets (cards) battle it out in individual duels to obtain the resource.

The first person to collect six resource tokens or win three battles wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Garden Rush
description:
Garden Rush is a 1 - 2 player gardening themed tile drafting game where you try to plant a better vegetable garden than your neighbour in order to harvest more vegetables than them over the year. It has a puzzly harvesting mechanic that will have you pushing your luck to be able to plant that corn in just the right place to get the most out of it when you later harvest it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battles of the American Revolution: Solitaire Tactics Methods
description:
Table play aid and rules for resolving Close Combat in the Battles of the American Revolution series when playing solitaire.

Regular PvP play has battle tactics determined in a secret selection of tactics by each player; this doesn't work for solitaire play. This accessory provides a methodology in lieu of that method.

—user summary
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Twisted Dungeons
description:
Never venture in the same old dungeon again.

Twisted Dungeons is a supplement for Four Against Darkness, suited for all levels of play, that will change your dungeons forever.

It’s easy to use: just roll d88 (two eight-sided dice) as the adventure starts, and read the corresponding numbered entry. The book will inject unpredictable events and themes into your dungeon exploration: 64 dungeon complications, ranging from mosquito infestation to teleporting mirrors, from slippery tunnels carved out of ice to chambers with magic-enhancing properties. Most complications will come with interesting rewards, in experience or loot.

Twisted Dungeons may be used alongside its companion volume, Twisted Minions, to create even more random variations. With a bit of common sense, it will work with any book in the Four Against Darkness line.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: The Tu'x Rebellion
description:
The Tu'x Rebellion and is based on an entirely new IP. It is a cooperative/competitive Medieval Fantasy Strategy Game of my creation.
In the base game two to four players take on the roles of Noble Houses fighting for the King, gaining favor by winning battles and proving themselves worthy administrators in the midst of a Civil War. Players work together to overcome the rebels while competing with your allies to earn the most favor from the throne.

Key Features:

Factions: Pick from one of four houses to play as during the campaign (House Kel, Lotan, Shobal, or the 7th Corps). Each Noble House has their own individual and unique strategy.
Base Building: increase your power and prestige by constructing military, defensive and economical buildings that can gain access to greater resources and higher quality troop types as they are upgraded.
Resources: As you expand influence and improve your land, you gain access to more resources. These need to be properly handled in order to bolster your power, help you grow and gain favor with the King.
Army Recruiting: Create your own army from core loyalist warriors and elite house troops. Customize your army according to your vision. Train units to meet battlefield demands. Cooperate by sharing units through alliances to defeat the rebels and unite the loyalist factions.
Political intrigue: Internal and External events can quickly change the fortune for you and your fellow loyalists. Manipulate these events to further your own goals while hindering those of your rivals.
Battles: Wage war against the rebels in skirmishes as small as five units or up to a massive battle of forty units. Gather your allies to form large armies to bring the battle to the doorstep of the rebels.


The Tu'x Rebellion is a card-based strategy game similar to other customizable trading card games with battle tactics similar to tabletop miniature games. Players take turns simultaneously. Each round is divided into phases; draw, build, conflict and discard. Simultaneous play means the game is exciting for everyone and no one is left waiting to take action.

Battles are resolved in the conflict phase. One round of battle is split into the: Set up, Draw, Infantry, Ranged, Cavalry, Movement and Discard phases. Action continues for allied players and the player controlling the Rebel Army during the battle.

You win by reaching a certain threshold of favor with the King. However, everyone loses if the loyalists are defeated twice in battle or any player loses all the troops under their command. Players must constantly balance the competitive and cooperative aspects of the game.


—description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: The First Crusade 1096 to 1099
description:
"The First Crusade: 1096 to 1099" is a turn based wargame, for 2 to 11 players, set during the 11the Century A.D. in the Levant area of the Middle East. The game includes 1 map of the Levant 36” x 48” at 24 miles to the inch, circa 11thc A.D., 1,540 military and control counters printed on both sides, player aids, medieval Bezants counters, 3-6 sided and 3-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play the Crusaders, Byzantines, Lesser Armenians, Seljuk Turks, Other Muslims and the Fatimids of Egypt. This wargame can provide the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the 11thc A. D..
See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Words Over Easy
description:
How do you like your words? Over easy, of course! Pop the Letter Eggs into the Egg Sorter to see which letters you can use to spell words. Letter Eggs that fall into the green side are good, while Letter Eggs that land on the red side are rotten. Players scramble to come up with words using all the letters, face-up, on the “good eggs” and none of the letters from the “rotten eggs”. Great for word game players of all ages, so get cracking!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition

name: Murder of Crows
description:
Murder of Crows is a somewhat cooperative, somewhat competitive murder mystery card game combined with tag.

At the start of a round, players gather in a circle and draw one card each, assigning them a role for the round. The player who draws the Crow card has to "kill" the other players.

Each player separates from the other players and goes into hiding, somewhat like hide and seek. However, some players will reveal themselves at times. For example, a character with the Shield needs to pass it on, and so, they will search for others to pass it to. The Hunter wants to be able to observe others in order to find out who potentially could be the Crow. The Crow needs to hunt (seek) the others. Typically the Seer and the Villagers try to hide but also be receptive to finding the Shield. And so, each turn is an interplay between hiding, finding out more information, and finding ways to end the round in their favor.

The Crow "kills" another player by simply whispering into their ear / near them, "You're dead." Alternatively, they can say, "You're dead; you're my Zombie" to the one chosen Zombie character per round. The Hunter "kills" another player by loudly saying, "Bam! You're dead!" then revealing that they are the Hunter. No other player has the capacity to kill, aside from if someone reveals to the the Crow when they are tagged "dead" that they have the Shield.

The other players have to identify the Crow and defend themselves with a "Shield." Some of the other players also have special abilities to partner with other players, defend themselves, or kill other players as well. The Shield must be passed from player to player every minute and is only way other players can protect themselves from being murdered.

Rounds can last from roughly 3 - 20 minutes. When a round is over, the cards are reshuffled, the Shield is reset, and a new round begins with the dealing of the cards. Participants can play as many rounds as they wish. No formal score keeping is necessary. The game is adaptable and comes with extra cards for the option of building out custom rules.
mechanics: Acting, Action/Event, Deduction, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Siege Command
description:
Siege Command is a two-player, lane-based strategy game containing a mixture of simultaneous planning and turn-based strategy. Deploying a variety of Units and casting powerful Spells, players battle for control over the Turrets in each of the 4 lanes in order to destroy their opponent's walls.

In the simultaneous Planning Phase, both players place a Unit card from their hand face-down in front of each of the 4 lanes (or a Bluff card to hide their intent) and Spell cards off to the side of the battlefield. Once both players are ready, they reveal their played cards, pay the combined energy cost, and attempt to predict their opponent's strategy before proceeding to the turn-based Action Phase.

In the Action Phase, both players alternate resolving a single card at a time until all cards on the table have been resolved. Players can choose to resolve any Spell or Unit on the table in any order they wish. When resolving Units, players must resolve all of its Action Points in a single activation and then exhaust that Unit for the duration of the round. The main objective during this phase is to establish and maintain control over the battlefield and Turrets, while trying to keep Units alive long enough to reach the opponent's walls.

After the Action Phase, any captured Turrets deal damage directly to the controller's opponent and the game proceeds to the next round following a quick Refresh Phase. Gameplay continues in this manner over several rounds until one player (or both) reach 0 health. If one of the players remains with at least 1 health, they are declared the winner - if not, the game ends with both players standing among the smoldering ashes of their outpost in a draw.
mechanics: Action Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: BIZKAIA 1937
description:
After an impass on the Northern Front, the revel army starts in March of 1937 the offensive that will drive them to take Bilbao.
Bizkaia 1937 is a card driven solitaire game in wich you´ll have to take Bilbao in the historical period of 80 days (20 turns). Will the history be repeated or will Gen.Mola get out alive from his plane crash?, Will Goicoechea change sides with his valuable information about the Iron Belt or will you have to attack it without knowing its real strength...?
With a 24 card deck and playing a card in every turn, all the games can be different. Every new card from the deck shows what action or actions will carry out the republican side: reinforce, improve their defenses, use their poor air force or to counterattack.
After this, you´ll add the card to your hand, made up of two ones, and you will have to choose with which one of them play that turn. Each card is linked to an event and a number of operations to move, combat, replace losses and use your entire air force. Come on!
mechanics: Action/Event, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gigaton
description:
Gigaton is the name of illegal race held every year in post-apocalyptic terrain that is closed and guarded by 4 Factions. Drivers are not allowed to enter this space but every year it attracts plenty of daredevils, who want to gain underground fame. So year by year the race is being continued against the law and Factions. Even enormous barricades put across main routes didn't stop that madness. Racers quickly found new methods and tricks. Imagine that each supervising Faction is equipped with giant machines: Bulldozers and Transporters. Their only purpose is to wipe this terrain off from all racers. But why not to use their roofs to jump over the barricades and move on? These days all suffer from shortage of oil. So it quickly turned out that Factions willingly accept oil bribes and can help your small car jump over the barricade. However it worked short.
