Soon all racers have been continuously bribing the Factions and using them even against you. The bribe is the bribe. The Faction doesn't care for whom it works. So, prepare for high adrenaline. You will compete with 3 other racers and 4 Factions that will be your friends as long as you fuel them up. And then will go to your competitor.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bribery, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Order Counters, Race, Speed Matching, Square Grid, Three Dimensional Movement, Track Movement, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Akhorne the Squirrel Star Player Promo Card
description: This is a promo card for Akhrone the Squirrel that was contained in White Dwarf #458 (November 2020). This contains all the rules for using the Akhrone star player in your games of Blood Bowl. The official model comes in the Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Treeman kit.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Asymbol
description:
Shapes and lines are essential building blocks in our visual vocabulary. If you look, you will see rectangles, squares, cones, triangles, circles, straight lines and curved lines in everything around you. The ability to identify basic shapes and how they relate to each other is the foundation for understanding and solving more complex geometrical and patterning problems.

Asymbol provides you with 47 unique shapes to pick from as you assemble things, beings, places and events/activities to challenge others to guess your vision!

Object of the Game
Players take turns being an Asymbler (builder) by drawing a card, choosing one of the two subjects and using the various shaped pieces to create their subject. At the same time, the other players try to guess what is being created. The correct guesser and the Asymbler each earn a point. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Setup
Place all 47 Asymbol pieces in the middle of the play area.

Shuffle the card deck, and place it facedown next to the Asymbol pieces, creating a draw pile.

Give each player a pass token to be placed near them.

Hand the scorepad and pencil to a player to keep score for each round.

When starting the game, determine how many rounds to play before the game ends. A round ends when each player has had the chance to be the Asymbler.

The first player to name a shape starts as the first Asymbler.

Make sure the Asymbler can reach the pieces and has enough space in front of them to build.

How to Play
On your turn as the Asymbler, draw the top card from the deck, keeping it hidden from the other players, and choose one of its two subjects.

Pass Token
If both subjects are unfamiliar or too challenging, you may use your pass token to discard your current card and draw a new one from the draw pile. After using the token, return it to the box. Each player has only one opportunity to use their token as an Asymbler, so choose wisely.

Categories
When you are ready to start, announce the category of your chosen subject. Only share the category and not the subject you are going to create.

Assembling and Guessing
To create your subject, use any number of the Asymbol pieces from the play area. You can create with pieces lying flat or by building vertically. Moving the pieces is allowed to show motion and help portray your subject. You may not speak while you build, but making sound effects is allowed. You may use body language (nods and hand gestures) to indicate if a player’s guess is on the right track or not. Once you begin to assemble, all the other players can start guessing. They guess at the same time and can continue to make guesses until someone’s guess is correct. There is no time limit, but you may end your turn if you feel like no one can correctly guess the subject. Otherwise, the turn ends after a correct guess, and play continues clockwise.

Scoring
The first player to correctly guess the subject gets a point. If multiple players guess correctly at the same time, they all get a point. As Asymbler, you also receive a point for successfully creating a subject that another player could recognize. If there are no correct guesses and you choose to end your turn, then no one scores any points that turn. Return all the pieces you used to the play area, and place your card in the discard pile. Play continues clockwise with the next player becoming the Asymbler, drawing a new card, announcing a category and creating their subject with the pieces.

End of Game
After the agreed upon number of rounds has been completed, the player with the most points wins. In case of a tie, the players share the victory.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Jenga: Book Lovers Edition
description: From the instructions in the box: The object is to remove one block at a time from the tower. Read and answer the question aloud that appears on the block and then stack it on top. The last player to stack a block without making the tower fall wins the game. The most avid reader assembles the tower and then goes first. Play passes to the left. On your turn, carefully remove one block from anywhere below the highest completed story of the tower. Use only one hand. Then stack the block on top of the tower at right angles to the blocks just below it. As the block is removed, read the question on it out loud. Answer the question and let the conversation flow as you stack the block on top of the tower. You can touch blocks to find a loose one, but if you move a block out of place, you must put it back in place using one hand only before touching another block. While stacking, always complete a 3-block story before starting a higher one. Your turn ends 10 seconds after you stack your block or as soon as the next player touches one.
mechanics: Physical Removal, Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Chute: Atlético Pantera
description:
Agile, fast and fearless. From Narang, the first women's team comes to the League. It is Atlético Pantera, that with a wild and daring approach proposes to revolutionize the “Chutemundo”. Meet these warriors trained by nature itself, ready to demonstrate their skills on the field of play.

With this expansion you will be able to modify the court with the new "Jungle" cards that will help your players to move and improve their skills. Use them in the correct spaces to weaken your opponent and boost your squad.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Ágiles, veloces e intrépidas. Desde Narang, llega el primer equipo femenino a la Liga. Se trata de Atlético Pantera que con un planteamiento selvático y atrevido propone revolucionar el Chutemundo. Conoce a estas guerreras entrenadas por la naturaleza misma, listas para demostrar sus destrezas en el campo de juego.

Con este mazo podrás modificar la cancha con las novedosas cartas de “Selva” que ayudarán a tus jugadoras a moverse y mejorar sus habilidades. Úsalas en los espacios correctos para debilitar a tu rival y potenciar a tu plantel.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Make Italy!
description:
"Make Italy" is a wargame for 2-6 players that recreates the campaign for the Unification of Italy at the time of the Expedition of the Thousand (1860).
Players control the six Factions involved in the war, each with their own placement and special traits.
By arranging and moving Agents and Troops on the map, players confront each other diplomatically and militarily, forming Alliances and fighting Battles to take control of the future unitary state.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Simulation

name: Start Them Up!
description:
Play as one of our talented entrepreneurs and go on an adventure!
Alone or in a team, carry out your wildest projects and create the most beautiful community.
But be careful, you will experience a whirlwind of emotions to reveal the entrepreneur within… or not!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #64 – Force 136
description:
In a blitzkrieg of just 73 days, the Japanese forces captured the entire Malayan archipelago, including the great fortress city of Singapore. The fall of Malaya was a resounding shock and humiliation to the Allied armies, who had vastly underestimated their opponents. Force 136 was the cover identity given to the Far East branch of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE), which supported resistance and paramilitary groups working in Japanese-occupied territories, carrying out unconventional warfare, sabotage, local aid and reconnaissance missions.

Warfighter: WWII Expansion #64 – Force 136 adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions, including new Hostiles, Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, and Skills:

4 x Player Soldiers
3 x Non-Player Soldiers
3 x Squad Soldiers
5 x Weapons and Equipment
2 x Skills
5 x Missions
5 x Objectives
12 x Locations
15 x Japanese Hostiles
2 x Events

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Fenris Wolves Enemy Pack
description:
These massive beasts of Viking legend, strike fear in the hearts of the greatest of warriors. They give relentless pursuit of their prey through the dark forests of the Norse Lands. We wanted the Fenris Wolves to be really beefed up - real powerhouses. But, the bigger, bulkier version would not easily fit on the 40mm base. We resolved the situation by adding a base topper with chiseled rocks for him to stand upon, ready to pounce into battle! They also appear as Fire wolves in the Caverns of Cynder and Shadow Wolves in the Forest of the Dead and Targa Plateau.

Includes 3 large Fenris Wolf miniatures, Cards, and Rules.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Wordish
description:
WORDISH (ΜΠΙΡΙΜΠΟΛΕΞΟ [Biribolexo] in Greek) is a word formation card game, in which sighted and visually impaired players can play together.

The aim of the game is to create as many words as you can and gain the most points.
First, shuffle the cards well, because they come in alphabetical order.
The dealer hands out 11 cards to each player.
He then prepares a biribaki (stack of 11 cards) for each player, or team of players (if there are 4). The biribaki are put to one side for the time being, and the remaining cards are placed in the middle of the table facing down. They are the ‘closed cards’.
To begin the game, the dealer draws a card from the stack of ‘closed cards’.
The letter of this card will receive double points throughout the game.
Each word can only contain one atout card.
A word must contain at least three letters.
The Atout cards represent any letter of your choosing, but have zero value.
Thereon, the player has a choice:

take one card from the stack of ‘closed cards’, or

Collect all the disposed cards, which face upwards and are visible; the ‘open cards’, but only if s/he can use at least one of these cards, (to either form a word or add letters to already formed words).

The player will form as many words as s/he can, which are deposited on the table.

Then, she/he deposits a card onto the stack of ‘open cards’ (or forms a stack of ‘open cards’ if there are none). This marks the end of his/her turn and the beginning of the next player’s turn.
The letters in the words created are ‘locked’ and cannot be used to form other words. It is however possible to add letters at the beginning or end of a word.

In teams of two, the players must sit opposite each other. One player is in possession of the team’s cards, whereas the formed words are placed in front of him/her.

It is only possible to move onto the second round and receive a biribaki, once the player or team has used all other cards and has completed a word consisting of 7 letters.

At the end of all the rounds, the players sum up the points they earned from the words they created, including any bonuses, and they deduct points lost from the cards they were unable to use, including any penalties.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Spelling

name: Scarlet Envelope VI: Screaming Venice – Art Heist
description:
This tabletop escape-room-style mystery takes place in Venice, 2000. THE SCREAM, Edvard Munch’s famous painting & the art's most haunting face, disappears right before the opening of a posh Art Biennale. Art lovers are confused: anyone knows that such a well-known painting is impossible to resell! Was it stolen for ransom? Or to cover up a larger mystery?

Delve into the world of art crime, recover the precious artifact, identify the art thief, and get all the answers about this art heist of the century!

GAME CONTENTS:

Tri-fold brochure featuring real art of Edvard Munch & other famous artists
Cryptic bookmark, a souvenir from the gift shop
Maps of the gallery's first & second floor
Photo from the crime scene with notes
Letter from the President of the Art Biennale
Art Galery Website
Video Security Footage
Audio guided tour of the gallery
Music Soundtrack


Lots of multi-layered puzzles to solve, from visual enigmas to logic and folding puzzles. You will interpret colors, investigate famous paintings (and educate yourself on the way), as well as search the gallery, and learn about Edvard Munch's haunting legacy. Expect all things ART, spiced up with the charming vibe of Venice!
mechanics: Deduction

name: Kart Dungeon
description:
In a Dark Castle a competition is fought, a group of crazy beings drive at high speed to find out who is the best arcane kart driver, using powerful artifacts and avoiding dangerous glyphs, only one will be the winner.

Kart Dungeon is a fantasy racing game where 2 to 4 players compete on a modular 3/4 cards (double sided) using medieval characters like a crusader, goblin, rogue, wizard, etc (a total of 8 characters, 4 double sided cards) driving on karts and picking up several power ups (artifacts) to take advantage and mess the other players run.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stonelight: The Crazy Magic Tournament
description:
Be part of a crazy magic tournament, where the chaos rules and up to 6 participants simultaneously collect resources and cast spells on each other, trying to sabotage each other's plans to collect 6 Magic Stones and win the game.

Stonelight is a fun-to-play game for 2 to 6 players in which everyone plays with unique Characters and Magic Familiars with the objective of collecting 6 Magic Stones before anyone else. The game is full of funny and mean spells awakening intense emotions and creating amusing moments during the entire match. Stealing resources and Magic Stones, changing the target of other people's spells, or creating big hurricanes to mess with everyone's Magic Stones is a usual thing in this game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleTech: MapPack – Battle of Tukayyid
description:
The map pack includes the following:

Four double sized, two sided map sheets

Deployment Zone
Kozice Valley (CDS)
Lake Losije (CNC)
Holth Forest (CGB)
Racice River Delta (CSJ)
Pozoristu Mountains (CW)
Robyn's Crossing (CJF)
Devil's Bath (CSV)


1 punchboard of fire and smoke counters
Location rulesheet
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Map Addition

name: Tombstone Tinderbox: A Wild West Tabletop Starter Box
description:
Tombstone Tinderbox is a complete starter box for historical miniature tabletop gaming in the Wild West. This box includes everything you need to play our 4-part Tombstone campaign covering the 1881 shootout at the OK Corral and the Earp vendetta ride that followed.

The starter box includes 15mm miniatures from Blue Moon, a felt game mat, historical cardstock buildings, trees from Woodland Scenics, a scenario booklet, custom character cards, dice, game tokens and more!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Team Yankee: Czechoslovak People's Army – Warsaw Pact Forces in WWIII
description:
The Czechoslovaks’ recent history with the Soviets had been rocky.
The liberalisation movement of the Prague Spring was supressed in 1968 by a Warsaw Pact invasion, followed by the reforming government being replaced by a more hard-line communist faction. There is some debate on how this may have impacted the performance of the Czechoslovak armed forces in any future war, but generally by the mid-eighties the army had recovered.
However, there was general unwillingness among the people to support an aggressive war against the west, but they were willing to fight if their country was threatened.

This briefing is a 24-page, full-colour booklet that comes with a complete set of 39 cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Simulation

name: Word Royale
description:
Are you smart and quick enough to win at Word Royale?

Grab up to 8 humans and jump into this quick, fun, and challenging game! This game will keep you on your toes and put you on the spot. Quick thinking will give you an advantage while playing Word Royale.

First flip over a category and then you have 5 seconds to say a word that is related to the category that starts with any of your letter cards!

Nothing comes to mind?
You are eliminated!

Last person standing wins the round!

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Real-Time

name: Pyramid
description:
Bringing four of your stones to the top of the Pyramid doesn’t seem like a big task. However, when your opponent has the same goal, you must outthink him.

A stone has 3 options to move:

RUN Move the stone forward as many fields as you want as long as his route does not go to a higher level. The stone cannot jump over other stones or share their field. If your stone moves to a lower level which is occupied by another stone, the attacked stone is SMASHED and gets removed from the game.
JUMP Move the stone up to the unoccupied adjacent field one level above.
PUSH Take the place of an adjacent stone by pushing it one field further. A pushed stone can also SMASH another stone. If the pushed stone was on a corner field at the lowest level, he FALLS and gets removed from the game.
OSIRIS Apart from SMASHING and FALLING, stones can also be removed by forming an OSIRIS. If one or more stones of the same color get surrounded by the opposing color on the same level and in one line, they get removed.

PYRAMID can end in two ways:


The first player who positions 4 of his stones at the marked victory fields at the high level of the pyramid, wins the game and the glory of the Egyptian gods.




When a player has only 3 stones left he automatically loses and the opposing player wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Slide/Push, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Asedio a Al-Ándalus
description:
“Time is like a sword; if you don't cut it, it cuts you"
(Arabic proverb)

Asedio a Al-Andalus: the Legend of the Wolf & the Serpent (1150-1213) is a medieval strategy, geopolitics and diplomacy boardgame for 3 players that tries to represent the political, ideological and military conflicts that took place in the Iberian Peninsula and its areas of influence between the second half of the 12th century and the early 13th century, in an exciting time of crusades, epic battles and court intrigues.

This is a crucial 63-year interval in the history of Spain, Portugal and the Mediterranean Sea, characterized by a balance of power between the Christian world of the north and the Muslim world of the south: the first, fragmented into five different kingdoms (Portugal, Navarre, Aragon-Barcelona, Leon and Castile) but with a clear expansive and conquering vocation since the turn of the millennium, and the second, reinforced after the rise to power of an austere and powerful North African dynasty with a rigorous vision of Islam (the Almohad Caliphate). However, there was also a third peninsular power, autochthonous Hispanic Islam, heir to the cultural splendor of the extinct Umayyad Caliphate of Córdoba and now, doubly threatened by the Christian crusade and the Almohad jihad, desperately trying to fight for its own independence (the Sharq Al-Andalus, represented by the Levantine emirate of Murcia-Valencia, under the Banu Mardánish dynasty, and by the Pirate emirate of Mallorca, under the Banu Ganiyya dynasty).

In the game, each player will take the role of one of the three main powers (Christian Kingdoms, Sharq Al-Andalus and Almohad Caliphate) that vied for power, hegemony and survival in the Iberian Peninsula during those troubled years. Whether through military force, political cunning, seductive diplomacy, commercial wealth or cultural splendor, the player's objective will be to accumulate the greatest number of victory points to become the peninsular power with more fame and glory.

Mechanically, the game uses a card-driven system, consists of 7 turns and each of them represents a period of 9 years, beginning in the year 1150 and ending in the year 1213. At the same time, each turn is divided into 5 different phases. The game is completely asymmetrical, as each power has its own geographic position, resources, rulers, courtiers, military leaders, allied factions, and totally unique and specific thematic minigames. The game ends if one of the following conditions is met: that a player reaches 50 victory points, that the end of turn 7 is reached (the player with the most victory points wins) or that the Sharq Al-Andalus is annexed (in which case the Christian player or the Almohad player will win, depending on their victory points).

The conquests of Alfonso VII of Leon "The Emperor", the Almohad invasion, the Mediterranean takeoff of Catalonia, the resurgence of an independent Al-Andalus in the peculiar figure of the libertine emir "The Wolf", the Castilian civil war between the feuding families Lara and Castro, the appearance in Navarre of Richard "The Lionheart", the French influence in Occitania-Provence, the commercial relations with the maritime republics of Genoa and Pisa, the last blows of the Byzantine Empire, the offensives in the Maghreb of the ancient Vikings from the Kingdom of Sicily and the Ayyubid Egyptians of Sultan Saladin, Majorcan piracy led by his corsair emir “The Serpent”, the Arab and Berber revolts in Ifriquiyya, the construction of the Seville mosque, the recovery of Aristotelian philosophy by Ibn Rush, the political intrigues of Queen Eleanor Plantagenet, the II, III and IV Crusades in the Holy Land, Simon de Montfort's crusade against the Cathars, the consolidation of the Camino de Santiago, the publication of the Song of the Cid or the epic battles of Alarcos and Navas de Tolosa, are just some of the many national and international historical events that the player will be able to relive in first person throughout the game.

Welcome to a world of swords and shields, castles and sieges, knights and pirates, kings and courtiers, emirs and caliphs, bishops and imams, ambassadors and pilgrims, merchants and philosophers, cathedrals and mosques, holy wars, palace conspiracies, and even, maritime expeditions to the exotic Orient. Will you be able to survive the Siege of Al-Andalus?
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Code 3: Cover Now Officers Pack
description: The Cover Now Officers Pack features six tough-as-nails beat cops to use in your game of Code 3. Expand your roster with some of the most hard charging officers and detectives that the department has to offer.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Formative Years of Gallamut Zeers
description:
Take a journey back in time - or is it forward in time? - to relive the formative years of Gallamut Zeers. Gallamut Zeers, now filled with industry and frowns, was once a land filled with lush vegetation and wonderful beasts. The Lords of Gallamut Zeers settled on this fertile island long ago, but quickly decided they could not share it with each other, because they were grumpy and itchy. Their moustaches tickled their noses something fierce and their socks were made of wool, which is scratchy, you know! So they quarreled and debated and demanded, as all those who feel entitled do, until they concluded who would own and rule the various parts of the fruitful island. Here, and there, and everywhere they bickered! Silly Lords, there’s plenty of space to go around!

In The Formative Years of Gallamut Zeers, players take on the roles of Lords of Gallamut Zeers struggling to gain dominion over the island. Over three years, players will claim roads, occupy cities, set up encampments, and make diplomacy in an attempt to outwit their opponents. The player who employs the most clever tactics and the most efficient strategy to accumulate the most points will win the game!

The Formative Years of Gallamut Zeers is a tactical area-control/majority game which is played over 3 rounds. Each round, players will play four of six available action cards to place and manipulate cubes to score points. Between the rounds, players will take part in a simultaneous secret action selection to take a bonus action or block other players from taking an action. At the end of each round, there are eight categories in which players may score points.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Set-up

name: Kaiju Siege: Kaisen Expansion
description:
Injured kaiju started to retreat to the ocean. Your shogun will have none of that, and has ordered a pursuit to end the kaiju siege once and for all. You readied your atakebune warship and prepared your troops for a battle at sea.

This expansion for Kaiju Siege comes with an alternate game board and 4 new kaiju. Battles may now take place out at sea, where your workers run the risk of falling overboard, and the kaiju can damage your ship's hull and cause it to spring a leak. This understandably introduces a new losing condition - your ship can sink!

The four new kaiju are also compatible with the game board from the base game.

The base game is required in order to play this expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Sic'Em
description:
Sic’Em is a 2-5 player card game with an average play time of 10-15 minutes.

Based on the classic card game “War”, Sic’Em adds depth and flavor by introducing fantastical characters with unique abilities!

Played in 10 rounds, players first set creature cards face down, then simultaneously reveal them to determine a round winner based on the highest numbered card. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins! Characters with unique abilities can be used to shape the outcome of the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Brainwave Painters: Earthlings vs Aliens Expansion
description:
This is an expansion of Brainwave Painters and needs to be played with the main game.**



You will be an alien or earthlings, hurry up and gather your teammates, let us fight against another faction together!


Add 4 new characters, the game expanded to 13 players
Add Teamwork mode & Career system
More questions and Creative questions
mechanics: Action Timer, Cooperative Game

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Bloody Mummer Skirmishers
description: These mercenaries are as cruel as they are talented. Don't be fooled by their colorful outfits!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Beta Cards from Arkham Night 2020
description:
These Beta Cards were designed at Arkham Night, 2020.

Include 2 cards.

Guard Dog (Level 2)
[Fast] Exhaust Guard Dog: Engage an enemy at your location. That enemy attacks you.
[Reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage or horror to Guard Dog: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

Flashlight (Level 3)
Uses (4 supplies).
[Reaction] When you perform a skill test while investigating
or attempting to evade, spend 1 supply: This test gets
–2 difficulty.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Miniatures Set 1
description:
This expansion for Car Wars Sixth Edition adds new miniatures and cards giving you new weapons and equipment customization options for your vehicle builds.

This expansion includes::
>Five miniatures: Scimitar, Joseph Special, Pillbug, Hades, and Hydra. Miniatures are pre-assembled and unpainted.
>148 cards (weapons, accessories, upgrades, structures)
>Car Wars Sixth Edition Colored Bases SJG 2424 - Four colored bases (red, yellow, blue, and green)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Race, Simulation

name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Miniatures Set 3
description:
This expansion for Car Wars Sixth Edition adds new miniatures and cards giving you new weapons and equipment customization options for your vehicle builds.

This expansion includes::
>Five miniatures: Five miniatures: Brimstone, Stiletto, Aristocrat, Avalanche, and Jackal. Miniatures are pre-assembled and unpainted.
>148 cards (weapons, accessories, upgrades, structures)
>Four colored bases (red, yellow, blue, and green)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Simulation

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Stormcloak Faction Starter Set
description:
Take back your homeland with the heroes of the Stormcloak rebellion. The true sons of Skyrim are led by the terrifying Yrsarald Thrice Pierced and Ralof, who stalks the field with bow and axe. Both are supported by three hard hitting Stormcloak soldiers with greatswords.

This set contains five 32mm scale high quality multi-part hard plastic miniatures with separate bases. Requires some assembly. Supplied unpainted. Scenic bases not included.

Yrsarald Thrice Pierced, Stormcloak Commander
Ralof, Warrior of the Resistance

For use with Elder Scrolls: A Call to Arms Core Rules.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #76 – Battle of Crete #1
description:
The Battle of Crete marks the occasion in which the German Fallschirmjäger (paratroops) executed the first major airborne invasion in warfare, only to be faced by stiff resistance from Allied forces, bolstered by Cretan civilians who also took up arms against the invaders. Initial fighting from the defenders was so fierce that the German offensive briefly faltered, before Allied hesitation allowed the Germans to rally and regain the initiative, forcing the Allies to retreat and eventually capitulate. The success of the airborne operation demonstrated the mobility and capabilities of airborne assault forces.

This battlepack adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including New Zealander Soldiers, German Hostiles, Missions, Objectives, Locations, Skills and Gear cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

3 NZ Player Soldiers
3 NZ Non-Player Soldiers
3 NZ Squad Soldiers
4 Missions
5 Objectives
13 Locations
4 Weapons
2 Skills
19 German Hostiles + Events
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kind of a Drag: Operation Durango/Frisco City, April 1967
description:
After a year-and-a-half of being “in country”, the US Joint Chiefs of Staff and many in the Pentagon were becoming increasingly concerned that the war in South Vietnam was not going according to plan. Despite increasingly optimistic reports and news conferences from the head of MACV, Military Assistance Command, Vietnam, General William Westmoreland, the Viet Cong insurgency against the South Vietnamese government, although bloodied and beaten in several major engagements, was still dangerous and growing thanks to increasing aid from Communist North Vietnam.

General Westmoreland put forward in the Fall of 1966 a bold plan to invade the southern “pan handle” of North Vietnam as well as neighboring areas of Laos through which the Communist’s supply line (dubbed the “Ho Chi Minh Trail”) ran. The plan was to take and hold these areas to interdict the Communist’s support to the South, as well as compel the NVA (North Vietnamese Army) to do battle in the open against the US and ARVN (Army of the Republic of Vietnam) to take back their occupied homeland and supply lines. General Westmoreland reasoned this was a fight the enemy could not avoid, and one we could not lose. The cost to conduct the planned invasion was for another 206,000 men (six additional divisions plus support personnel) to be deployed to the region. This would dangerously deplete the US military’s strategic reserve, as well as escalating the conflict to the point of risking global war with China and the Soviet Union. Would this plan have worked in bringing about a military solution to the Vietnam War, or would it have just “widened the stage” of this tragic quagmire for the US?

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and enjoy!

Players will need a standard deck of playing cards including both Joker cards, a D6, and one D10 to play the game. A custom card set, that replaces the standard deck of playing cards is available from the publisher.

Each turn represents 3 or 4 days of time. A hex is about ten miles across. Combat units are either battalions (II) or companies (I). Kind of a Drag is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Knock Knock Jr.
description:
A fast-paced, competitive game for friends and families.
This is a reimplentation of Knock Knock, but with fewer suits and a bit less take-that. It is, as described, a family game to be played with kids.
The remainder of the description is via the publisher's description of Knock Knock:
In this card game players compete to be the first to get rid of their hands.
Like other card shedding games, play proceeds as players discard matching the suit or value of the previously discarded card.
Various special cards also add fun and silly elements such a slapping, nose touching and moose antlers.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Luftkampfspiel
description:
The game is played by two parties with 3 planes each. The planes start at two opposite airfields, fly a circuit and return to their base. Movement is determined by a die. The course has several branches, where the players may choose with course to follow. If a plane gets on a space occupied by an enemy plane, the later is shot down and eliminated from the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The party who gets the most planes back to their airfield wins the game.

The Game was published before 1919, when the company still was named "Gebrüder Bing AG".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: Tusky Joe's Snorkel Adventure
description:
Tusky Joe's Snorkel Adventure is a 2-4 player light-medium family-friendly game about diving for treasures in the sea. The game features a nice blend of dice rolling, engine building and push your luck.

Over 7 rounds, players will be heading out on Tusky Joe's boat, strapping on their snorkels and diving gear and looking for lost treasures in the sea. On your turn, roll your dice and assign them to salvage cards that you'd like to recover. Beautiful treasures are there to be found and worth lots of delicious points. Don't like what you see? Move through the water using the brilliant side-scrolling sea bed.

Trade in your salvage at the shop to buy new gear which will help you in the water to achieve better dice results. Choose your strategy and tailor your equipment. Gain the most points by the end of the game and you're the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: WanderSquares: The Underwood Tunnels
description:
WanderSquares is a fantasy table-top adventure game for players 9 and up. It features an ever-changing map, a choose-your-path adventure guide and 16 inspiring characters to choose from.


An Ever-changing Map - The WanderSquares map is made up of 32 interlocking Adventure Squares. Each square is a tiny story; with monsters, puzzles and treasure. The map grows in endless combinations with each new direction the players choose. Three Special Squares contain major magic items (and mini-bosses). Recover the treasure and you'll unlock the final challenge.
Search for Hidden Treasure - Explore each square to uncover Treasure Cards. You’ll find powerful potions, special weapons, useful gear and magical creatures that will help you in your quest.
The Adventure Guide - Each square of the map has a matching page in the choose-your-path Adventure Guide that describes the scene and the actions the players can take. Once the players choose an action, turn the page to see what happens next.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Events, Map Addition, Modular Board

name: Nuts! Compendium
description:
The Nuts! Compendium - the perfect compliment to Nuts!. With Nuts! and Nuts! Compendium you can play any battle in WWII from anywhere and any time. Two books, that's all you need.

The Compendium contains a series of rules that can enhance and customize your NUTS games and campaigns, allowing you to run scenarios from the blazing hot deserts of North Africa to the frozen steppes of Russia.

We’ve gathered the rules from all the supplements and scenario books and brought them together in one place. Inside you'll find:


Updated Character and figure rules, including new Nuts! Attributes and morale levels like Plucky and Fanatic.
Privation, fatigue and Out of Supply rules for when your games get tough.
Cavalry combat.
Boat combat and amphibious landings.
Night fighting.
Rules for Airborne assaults, Ski troops, K-9 teams and Engineers.
Enhanced artillery and air strike rules.
Additional Chocolate & Cigarette lite RPG rules and attributes such as Wheeling & Dealing and Shell Shock.
Optional vehicle rules, including multi-turreted tanks, top armor attacks, bogging and getting tracked.
New terrain, weather and environment rules including Desert, Jungle, Alpine and Urban.
Additional mission and campaign rules.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Der Taubertal-Express: Bahnbetriebswerk
description:
The strictly limited mini-expansion Bahnbetriebswerk for the new board game Der Taubertal-Express consists of a wooden passenger marker and an additional game board. It brings an additional tactical component to the successful expert game.

How it works: Whenever a player sells goods, transports a passenger to the destination station or uses a black action marker for his moves, this is noted on the fields of the tableau. The player who reaches the last space receives an additional victory point, an additional silver coin or any action marker from the supply.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die streng limitierte Mini-Erweiterung „Bahnbetriebswerk“ für das neue Brettspiel DER TAUBERTAL EXPRESS besteht aus einem Passagiermarker aus Holz und einem zusätzlichen Spieltableau. Sie bringt eine zusätzliche taktische Komponente in das erfolgreiche Kennerspiel.

Zum Ablauf: Immer wenn ein Spieler Güter verkauft, einen Passagier zum Zielbahnhof befördert oder einen schwarzen Aktionsstein für seine Spielzüge einsetzt, wird dies auf den Feldern des Tableaus vermerkt. Derjenige, der das letzte Feld erreicht, erhält einen zusätzlichen Siegpunkt, eine zusätzliche Silbermünze bzw. einen beliebigen Aktionsstein aus dem Vorrat.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Halloween Survivors Series II
description:
A new group of survivors departs into the darkness to find out what awaits. Trick or treat! Packaged in a cheerfully illustrated box, this new hard plastic collection of costumed survivors includes 4 new thematic patterns and pattern gear cards.

The Halloween Survivors - Series II are packaged in an illustrated box that includes:
4 x Hard plastic survivors dressed in costumes inspired by their worst nightmares. Crimson Croc, White Lion, Screaming Antelope, and Gorm survivors.
4 x Large Matte art print of the Series II Halloween survivors.
4 x Pattern cards
4 x Pattern gear cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Corrida de Canetas
description:
Experience the thrill of hectic and challenging races without needing much.

Pen Races is a dexterity racing game in which players race each other to see who completes the circuits before the others. You score points by finishing before the opponents but for every fault you lose points. Some challenges are put into play and if you complete them during your run, you add some points to your ranking.

After 3 races, whoever has conquered the most points win.
The game can be expandable for more players if you put two boxes together.

Who better to combine speed and precision wins the match.

-description from designer
mechanics: Line Drawing, Race

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Scorpion Combo Pack
description:
This Combo Pack contains two XL Dark Stone Scorpion Miniatures and all of the rules, die-cut counters, and cards for BOTH the Dark Stone Scorpions and the nightmarish Bone Scorpions for use in the Blasted Wastes and Forest of the Dead OtherWorlds!

Though the massively mutated Dark Stone Scorpions are renowned for their thick shells, potent poison, and razor edged claws that can snap a man in two with a single powerful pinch, the nightmarish Bone Scorpions that roam the alien desert dunes of the Blasted Wastes and the shadowy groves within the Forest of the Dead are perhaps more terrifying. Equal in size and ferocity with their earthly counterparts, the Bone Scorpions are more agile and quick to enrage, lashing out with the lightning fast retaliatory strikes of its stinging tail at any that draw too near.
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Jiangshi: Blood in the Banquet Hall
description:
Jiangshi: Blood in the Banquet Hall is a collaborative, storytelling RPG about a Chinese-American family making their living by running a restaurant in one of America’s Chinatowns, circa 1920. Despite societal backlash and anti-Chinese laws, they have turned a profit and their quality of life has recently improved.

Players take on the roles of members in the family, spanning three generations, who face threats of Jiangshi (hopping vampires) at night and oppression by day.

Players must balance the responsibility of running and maintaining their family business with protecting themselves and their community from the supernatural forces.

A game session takes place over a number of days, alternating between day and night scenes where the roleplaying scenes take place. During the day characters complete assigned restaurant tasks in order to keep the family business running. And the Game Moderator will out a tableau of Restaurant cards that the family will need to complete before diners start to arrive. Their success is determined by using Resilience slots from their characters to complete the tasks.

Once the tasks have been completed to the best of the family’s abilities, the GM takes any Restaurant cards that were left undone and places them on the central Restaurant board, rotating them such that the consequences face the players and cover the restaurant’s slots.

Prior to starting the morning scenes, each character must see how they’re feeling from the trials and tribulations of the previous day. Each player rolls 1D4 and receives that many Mung cards from the GM which represent the dreams and nightmares of the characters.

Colored Mung cards are good dreams, black-and-white Mung cards are nightmares, and must be used to cover a trait on their Character sheet. Covered traits are unusable until the bad dream is removed via role-play. If a character is unable to remove the bad dream Mung cards that cover up all of the traits on their character sheet, then the character is turned into a Jiangshi, a vampire. The black-and-white Mung cards are flipped over to reveal new skills.

To remove the Jiangshi from the restaurant the players have 10 seconds to write a short phrase or sentence on it that captures how the family of characters stays strong and together. If the group is able to complete the phrase in the 10 second period (GM keeps count) then the Jiangshi is immobilized and can be then healed through gameplay.

The whole group of players (not including the Game Moderator) starts with a Family pool of six eight-sided dice (6D8) on the 1st day. As they progress through the days, player characters start feeling the stress the hauntings on the family, reducing their pool of dice available. These dice are used to overcome challenges, or to help council and care for the emotional health of the family, removing Mung cards from their character sheets.
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Game and a Curry Games, Wet Ink Games

name: Marvel Battleworld: Treachery at Twilight The Collector's Tower
description: The Collector's Tower adds a dice tower with multiple paths/exits and interior baffles that influence the fall of the die. Use the Twilight Sword stand to indicate which Hero gets to use the enhanced attacks provided by the unique Twilight Die which makes heroes more likely to win battles. It adds a new location tile, The Dragon's Tower.
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Warp: Alien Pack
description:
This pack adds 6 new aliens to The Warp for even more replayability. The aliens can be used as Player races, Exiled races or Warp Guardians.

Included aliens:

Orgu Scientists
Nera Seers
Gul Architects
Vens Enforcers
Caler Sentinels
Fal Bounty Hunters


This expansion is also playable with the 5/6 player expansion.
You need the base game to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Grimspire, Intrafin Games, Jumping Turtle Games

name: The Batman Who Laughs Rising: Killer Croc Promo Card
description:
This promo replaced the Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo in the Pack E for the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

The card powers read as follows:

Killer Croc: You may assign one damage to Killer Croc instead of assigning it to another Hero.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Great War at Sea: Caribbean Empires, Part I
description:
In 1823, U.S. Secretary of State John Quincy Adams wrote to the American Minister to Spain, noting that Spanish-ruled Cuba would likely be annexed by the United States within the next 50 years. Despite several attempts, that did not happen, though in 1898 the U.S. defeated Spain and made Cuba a puppet state.

In Caribbean Empires, Part One, the Maine crisis of 1898 brings the United States and Spain to the brink of war, but the newspaper circulation wars do not spill over into an actual armed conflict. That comes a decade later, after both have built up their forces in anticipation of a naval war in the Caribbean basin. And in 1908, the United States finds a pretext to start an invasion of Spain’s Caribbean Empire.

Caribbean Empires, Part One is an expansion set for Great War at Sea: Remember the Maine. It adds 80 new pieces (60 “long” ship pieces and 20 standard-sized ones), and uses pieces and the map from Remember the Maine. The Americans have the pre-dreadnought battleships of the Great White Fleet, plus some other designs that were considered but never built. The Spanish have also built a fleet of pre-dreadnoughts, pouring resources into an effort to keep their empire alive and maintain the long-departed illusion of Great Power status.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Batman Who Laughs Rising: Supergirl Promo Card
description:
This promo replaced the Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo in the Pack E for the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

The card powers read as follows:

Supergirl: After resolving The Batman Who Laughs dice, you may move to his location without discarding a die from your pool.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel HeroClix: X-Men House of X Booster Brick
description:
Mutants are the future, and the future begins now! The stories of HOUSE OF X and POWERS OF X intertwine to reveal the secret past, present, future, and far future of Mutantkind! It all starts when Charles Xavier reveals his new masterplan for Mutantkind, one that will bring mutants out of the shadow of humanity and into the light.

The set contains characters from the House of X series published by Marvel comics The game is played on a gridded map that is 24x36 inches. the game is played with pre-painted miniatures. the goal of the game is to either defeat your opponents entire team or accumulate more points than your opponent in a timed game. Each miniature is allocated a certain number of points printed on the base of the mini.

The game plays much like a miniatures game. Most of the vital statistical information is directly on the base of the characters, which can be rotated as characters take damage from hits.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Moderner Seekrieg: Neues Marine-Schach
description:
Whole title - "Moderner Seekrieg. Neues Marine-Schach" (eng. "Modern naval warfare. New naval chess") is a board game, like chess for 2 players (blue vs red).

Each player controls 18 playing pieces - different warships.
Game play: At the beginning, the game figures are placed in specific squares on the game board (always the same as specified in the instructions). As in the chess, the different figures/ships moves on the game board in different ways and are removed when the square is occupied by another player.

The object of the game is to capture the opponent's Admiral ship (like a king).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Programmed Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Admiral of the Fleet
description:
Admiral of the Fleet (AOTF) is a fast-play system for naval miniatures wargames focusing on medium to large surface fleet actions during the 1880-1945 period.

Looking for a fast-play but realistic tabletop simulation that combines a unique command/signaling system with combat that is as exciting and unpredictable as naval warfare really was? Bored with just moving ships about the table and doing whatever you want, turn after turn, without a mechanism that realistically reflects the difficulties and rewards inherent in commanding a fleet of ships? Then Admiral of the Fleet and its companion publications The Flag Officer's Handbook and AOTF Scenarios Volume I may be just what you are looking for.

Due to the popularity of surface-only engagements and the difficulties inherent in an accurate portrayal of the additional dimensions required by the addition of aircraft and submarines to the game table, AOTF focuses exclusively on surface warfare during the age of the battleship.

—description from the designer
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Hunt A Killer: 1973 Remastered
description:
After the murder of their lead singer Darryl Fanton, FLUF became one of the most popular cult bands of the 1970’s. Although the police ruled it an open and shut case, there are still many unanswered questions and loose ends. 25 years after the murder, can you finally close the case of 1973? This box is packed with high quality items, easter eggs, and is one of the most intricate premium investigations that Hunt A Killer has to offer!

In this all-in-one box you will uncover the hidden story of a legendary rock group cut down in its prime by a gruesome murder.

Solve puzzles, examine clues, and decrypt ciphers to finally serve justice in this decades old cold-case.

This box includes an original album, a FLUF bandana, and other memorabilia that fully immerses you into the story. Each item relates to the overall mystery and it's up to you to find out how.

Difficulty: 4/5 - Medium

This is an updated/revised edition of Hunt a Killer: 1973. The main changes to gameplay include expanding one of the in-game websites and adding a new cipher to it, adding hints and tweaking some of the language found within the box’s clues for a more focused experience, and replacing the t-shirt with a new band poster.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible
description:
Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible is an educational game developed for the UN delegation in Villa María, Argentina. It is a very simple cooperative game in real time and designed for people of any age. The game also has a debate stage where it seeks to raise awareness about the Sustainable Development Goals and think about what we can do from our place to make the world a better place. The game is not for profit.

Cooperative game, where the participants will collect idea sheets and assign them to the different ODS cards to meet their objectives and obtain the best possible score... They only have 5 minutes!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Real-Time

name: Skytear: Embassy Ruins
description:
The battle for Ahasa has reached its apex: as armies breach its sanctums, banners are once more crossed, awakening old rivalries. Where once the glorious Nuptian Embassy ruled, now only a crater dwells, made of crumbled walls and smashed doors. Through its halls covered by debris, Heroes still fight to claim dominion of the Ashen Fortress.

Embassy Ruins is a new and quick-to-play 3-lane battlefield supporting 4 heroes per side. The box contains a neoprene playmat with stitched edges measuring 35x53cm (14x21in).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeon Hero: Volume Two – Giant Beasts
description:
Already played all the adventures from Dungeon Hero: Volume One – Starter Set? Went straight to Volume Three: Bump in the Night and skipped Volume Two? Well, more adventures await! Print these out, fold 'em up, and get questing!

Dungeon Hero: Volume Two features three new adventures centered around a theme of Giant Beasts:


Web of the Spider Queen – The Queen of Spiders seeks to conquer the sunlit world above. Can you stop her before she rises?



Tower of the Terrapin – The Terrapin Cult hoards the only cure a beloved mentor needs. But can friends made in the City of Scoundrels be trusted to help infiltrate the tower?



The Lost Island – Shipwrecked on an island that was nowhere to be found on the maps, you struggle to survive on an island stuck in time.


Bonus Adventure! Also gain access to the bonus adventure:


The New Hill – A massive mound of dirt and sand appears in a farmer's field. What terrors does it herald?


Note: You will need the core rulebook from the Starter Set (Volume One) of Dungeon Hero to play these adventures.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeon Hero: Volume Three – Bump in the Night
description:
Already played all the adventures from Dungeon Hero: Volume One – Starter Set and tore through all the challenges in Volume Two: Giant Beasts? Well, maybe it's time you face off against the terrors that dwell in dark places! Print these out, fold 'em up, and get questing!

Dungeon Hero: Volume Three features three new adventures centered around a theme of paying homage to silver screen horror movies:


Full Moon Frenzy – Something is stalking the night under the light of the full moon. Can you stop its rampage?



The Terror of Talonberg – A fortune-teller has read to you her cards, but can her prophecies really help you destroy the evil terrorizing the town?



The Pyramid of Semerkhet – Dehydrated and exhausted, you see the pyramid on the horizon. If not water, at least shade may be found – but what other horrors await you in that awful tomb?


Bonus Adventure! Also gain access to the bonus adventure:


Creature of the Ebon Fen – A group of scholars have hired you to escort them to a lagoon of biological interest, but are the rare fish there worth the risk of entering the unknown jungle?
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Secret Order
description:
Welcome to the real power that rules the world. Filled with ambitious members, our Secret Order all manoeuvre and connive our way to the highest echelons of humanity. By dominating the five key realms of society we impose our will upon the world.

In Secret Order you all have your own agenda. These power struggles are represented by the gathering of favour tiles. Each favour represents a weapon of manipulation to be used in the subjugation of the realms of society. Using the right power in the right market in integral to achieving your ultimate goal.

As with any behind the scenes machinations, it is unwise to reveal every tool at your disposal. Secret Order is no different. So when playing "The Game" you have tiles in the open for all to see but you also have your hidden agenda, secreted away until the time is right to strike!

Gather favour tiles, spend them to use your powers to disrupt your opponent's plans, hide them away until the time is right or collect the entire set of your desire to achieve victory and domination.

Secret Order is a fast paced game of hidden motives, power plays and ambition that will have you playing again and again.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection, Take That

name: Duo Purple (fan expansion for Mega Man Pixel Tactics)
description:
The Duo Purple Box is a fan expansion collection of every Robot Master from the Mega Man Classic series that did not get a color 8-bit release. The expansion features 8-bit sprites from various fan games, and abilities created by users on Board Game Geek.

The 40 cards can combine with the Kickstarter Rewards pack and the Stardroids Pack to create a 4th and 5th full-sized deck.

The Robot Masters are from the following games:

Mega Man 7 (SNES)
Mega Man 8 (Playstation 1)
Mega Man and Bass (SNES)
Mega Man and Bass 2 (Wonderswan)
Mega Man the Wily Wars (Genesis)
Mega Man Powered Up (PSP)
And a few other surprises
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers

name: Slaughterville III
description:
An expansion featuring a collection of new Villains for Slaughterville!

Includes: The Beeman, The Sleeper, and The Vermes.

Slaughterville Director's Cut or Slaughterville 2 is required to play this game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Bretwalda: Danelag
description:
865 AD. The Great Heathen Army crosses the North Sea to invade England. Rules of Northumbria, Mercia, Wessex, and East Anglia prepare their kingdoms for the inevitable conflict. Take control of the Viking raiders, establish a new mighty Dane kingdom, and spread Danelaw across the Anglo-Saxon lands. Use diplomacy, coercion, and, if necessary brute, military strength to overcome your rivals.

Danelag is an expansion for the Bretwalda base game, taking it to 5 players. The fifth player takes charge of the Viking raiders and a new Danish kingdom established on the shores of England.

Danes begin the game with two ships (making them highly mobile) and in any coastal area not adjacent to an enemy capital area, and they have a different set of Kingdom Tiles as well as Lordship cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Medieval, Miniatures, Negotiation, Wargame
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Variable Player Powers

name: Daiquiri
description:
Daiquiri is a middle-weight domino climbing game for 3 or 4 players.

You will need 3 or 4 sets of double-six dominoes depending on the number of players.

There are no teams; it’s every person for themselves. Your score will depend solely on the position you go out so go out early.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swarm Pack #1 – Hellbats
description:
One of the most numerous and nightmarish of all the void creatures are the HellBats; swarms of slithering demons with leathery bat-like wings that darken the skies and bring ruin on worlds that they infest. HellBats are hatched from grotesque Spires of gnarled muscle built by a Brood Mother, housing countless mucus covered eggs. With a supernaturally fast gestation cycle, these Spires can hatch thousands of HellBats in a matter of days, and are only limited by having a steady supply of fresh flesh to feed upon. When that supply runs dry, the Spires simply go dormant until a new supply can be found, awakening the Spires once more.

An Enemy Swarm Pack is a new themed set of cards focusing on fighting swarms of a particular Enemy Type, as well as a new set of Spawners for that Enemy Type. In this case, the pack focuses on fighting large swarms of HellBats, and has Hatchling Spires that spawn new HellBats during a Fight.

This pack also includes Enemy Record Sheets for the OtherWorld variants of HellBats (BogBats, LavaBats, and LungBats), with the stats and modifiers worked into the Enemy Record Sheet itself, as well as new themed Elite Charts and Brutal sides for these variants.

A new Mission, HellBat Infestation, allows the Heroes to go on an adventure to clear out an infestation of these demonic creatures that is plaguing the area. This set assumes you have access to the HellBat Enemies (miniatures and cards) from the Swamps of Death Core Set, and does include an additional set of 6 HellBat miniatures, giving you a swarm of at least 12.

Hatchling Spires are a new Enemy introduced in this set, that act as Spawners for HellBats. Tall towers of ridged and gnarled demonic flesh, covered in large leathery eggs, the Hatchling Spires twist and sway as the creatures of the Void rapidly gestate inside before bursting forth. At the end of every Turn, each Hatchling Spire in play rolls 2 six-sided dice to Spawn new HellBats. This creates a new goal within the Fight for the Heroes to battle their way to the Hatchling Spires and take them out before you are overwhelmed by the flood of HellBats. This can be dangerous though as the Acidic Burst ability showers nearby Heroes with deadly acid every time a Spire takes damage from an Attack. In addition, the Spongy Sacks of the Hatchling Spire grant it +2 Defense against all Ranged Attacks made from half Range or greater of that Attack.

Contents:

4 Large Enemy Record Sheet
3 Large plastic Hatchling Spire miniatures
6 plastic HellBat miniatures
1 Rule Sheet with new Mission – HellBat Infestation
15 Game Cards
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Challenge Pack #3 – Master of Blades
description:
Of all the Lieutenants within the Fallen Shogun’s inner circle, the Takobake Blade Masters are perhaps the most terrifying. Towering mutant samurai wielding four razor sharp blades in their tentacled arms, the Blade Masters are not only expert swordsmen and strategists, but ruthless assassins, dispatched to carry out the most gruesome and sinister missions for their ambitious master.

Challenge Pack #3 – Master of Blades is themed for taking on a deadly Takobake Blade Master and the army of Takobake soldiers that he commands! This set includes a new deck of Enemy Trait cards called Army of the Takobake that can be assigned to all Takobake Enemies in a Fight, giving them new and powerful abilities and behaviors. These Trait cards are used as part of the included Mission, but can also be applied to Takobake Enemies in your normal games of Shadows of Brimstone, if you want to add extra challenge to a Fight, or to theme a Mission around battling savage beastly foes!

A Challenge Pack is a new themed set of cards with a terrifying new Enemy and a nightmarish new Mission designed to give the Heroes an extra challenge. These cards are all used together for the included Mission but can also be added to your card decks to increase the challenge across your normal games of Shadows of Brimstone as well. Many of these new cards are marked with a Challenge Icon, to be easily identified as extra dangerous.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Wizards & Relics: Awakening
description:
Awakening is a fully standalone game & expansion set to Wizards & Relics with all new cards & deeper strategies.

Choose a mighty Wizard, pick up an ancient Relic and battle your rivals with this easy going, fast paced, magical multiplayer dueling card game for 2-4 players!

You must defeat your rivals by secretly laying down a wizard and a relic. Players have decks of 30 cards that consist of Wizards AND relics. Each round is unique, as there are archaic ruins called Shrines, that give magical boosts/bonus’ to certain wizards.

A combination of your Wizard, Wizard Advantage, your Relic, the Shrine, and your opponents will result in a power score for each player. The highest total power wins the round.

When your wizard wins the round, it goes to the Hall of Immortality.
The number of players determines the amount of wizards needed in your Hall of Immortality to win the game. For 2 players, 5 wizards. For 3 players, 4 wizards. For 4 players, 3 wizards.

Awaken your inner wizard with this versatile expandable card game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Deduction, Hand Management

name: Dogs of War: Alhazred
description:
A new playable dog of war that comes with its own busts and special ability.

Alhazred, special ability: duplicitous (may play any tactic cards as a betrayal card)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Worker Placement

name: Iron Storm: The First World War, 1914-1918
description:
Iron Storm is a two-player strategic wargame that allows you to recreate the entire First World War in a single afternoon. The game uses an innovative card engine system where each player uses their entire hand in one go, to activate armies, resolve operations, and support battles with combat cards. It also simulates human and economic attrition during the course of the war by gradually adding cards to each deck that will have limited use in the hand and take additional effort to remove.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Tug of War

name: Tennis World
description:
Tennis World is a quick-playing tennis simulation using actual player rankings to set up matches. Then, dice and charts determine who wins the pressure points each game but don't rule out changes to your form or an injury altering the balance of the match.

The game can be played in men's and women's singles/ doubles / mixed doubles formats and each set plays out in about 5 minutes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Star Realms: Tournament Kit Season 5
description:
Tournament Kit Season 5

1 Limited Edition Playmat (1st place prize)
Storage Box (2nd place prize) with "War World" card artwork
8 Prize Cards (top 8 prizes)
32 Participation Cards (participation door prize)


The included cards are Federal Transport and Stellar Ray.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition – Dark Nights Metal: Pack #4
description:
Spanning the multiverse are many versions of Earth and its faithful guardians: The Justice League. Yet while many versions of heroes such as Superman and Green Lantern exist, there are many horrors as well. Now with the dimensions opening, our own League must take on The Devastator and The Dawnbreaker, horrors from beyond the dimensions intent on destroying Earth as we know it!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Meteor Heroes
description:
Mysterious meteors are crashing down across Justice City, each capable of turning everyday citizens into superheroes! Your goal is to seek out these meteor fragments, harness their power and become the most famous hero in Justice City.

Meteor Heroes is a loose area control game with push your luck elements at its core. Players will tackle petty crimes, Crisis' and major events across the six districts that cover the board. Fame is a fickle thing however and the public can easily favour a new hero if you aren't there to protect them.

On your turn you will assign your stamina cubes into move, action or trade on your character boards; you then take it in turns resolving these cubes until your stamina is exhausted. A turn can consist of moving to locations around the board, resolving crime tokens, crisis cards, events or claiming powers. Once your turn is over you will add more crime tokens to the board from the crime tower and then move the Police to their next location (hopefully arresting another player on the way).

Once a player has added their last fame token to the board or whoever has the most fame after the last event has been resolved will win and become the ultimate hero of Justice City!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Retrieval, Action/Event, Events

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Sentinel Prime MK4
description:
A Prime Sentinel leads its robotic brethren into the battles of Marvel: Crisis Protocol in the Sentinel Prime MK4 expansion.

A higher-level Sentinel that leads the hunt for mutants, the Sentinel Prime found in this pack features superior strength, weaponry, and protective hulls, making it even more of a threat. Even more dangerously, Prime Sentinels learn from every encounter with an enemy and make the data available to other Sentinels. Leading the new Sentinels Affiliation, the Sentinel Prime works particularly well with Mark IV Sentinels and Cassandra Nova. Finally, two Team Tactic cards further enhance its ability to lead the Sentinels and expand their sphere of influence.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Sentinels MK4
description:
The deadly Sentinels arrive in Marvel: Crisis Protocol to hunt mutants!

A new breed of powerful war machines, Mark IV Sentinels are designed to eradicate mutants with their electric and plasma blasts, catch-web cables, and extraordinary physical strength. The Sentinel MK4 expansion adds one relentless Mark IV Sentinel ready to reinforce the new Sentinels Affiliation to players’ squads. In addition to its built-in armaments and programming, this Sentinel is supplemented by three Team Tactic cards that give it even mores to work with its robotic brethren and the mummudrai Cassandra Nova.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Sidney's Quest
description:
Sidney's Quest is a worker placement board game about beating your friends to the cushiest job in the village.

Get ready, keep your resources under control and strive for Sidney's favor!

Sidney's Quest is played over 8 rounds. Each round you focus on a combination of actions to gather new experiences while being able to pay your bills.

You get points for every goal card you complete and lose points for the ones you don’t succeed with. The player with the most victory points becomes the new village elder.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Contracts, Hidden Victory Points, Income, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Claim Action, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Kingdom Builder: Queenie 4 – The Emperor's Choice
description:
Included in Kingdom Builder: Empire Edition and available separately in the Kickstarter campaign.

The Emperor's Choice includes 8 cards in 5 languages and 2 cardboard standees.

Each card details a rule that alters the way you play a round of Kingdom Builder.

Shuffle all cards at the start of the game and draw only one card to be revealed to all players. Players will have to adjust how they play based on the "Emperor's Choice".

Cards include Volcano, Ferry, Island, Capitol, Plateaus, Caves, Spy Network, and Native Soil.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Summer Goth
description:
Beta Rules - 3 x new Pattern cards and 3 x new Pattern gear cards that were included with the Summer Goth First Run Collector's Edition.

The Summer Goth kit comes with 2 miniatures. A painter's scale model in repose, perfect for painters and a player's scale model for gamers looking for a fun survivor stand-in.
The Summer Goth is packaged in a seasonal box and includes:

-1 x Painter's scale Summer Goth hard plastic miniature
-1 x Player's scale Summer Goth hard plastic miniature
-1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
-Large Matte Art Print
-Character Art Card
-3 x Pattern cards
-3 x Pattern gear cards

On the glass coast of the boiling sea, Twilight Knight Allison waits. She has paid the dark seamstress a vial of her own tears of anguish for the dress and finery that is acceptable at the court of the uncrowned king of Teltia. She awaits a summon at the domain's edge so she may learn how he has created this slice of miserable, sunny paradise.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: The Belligerent: Glory to the Heroes
description:
The Belligerent: Glory to the Heroes is a turn-based modern warfare strategy game about the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

The game is about the Convoy Attack, one of the war's key points, and the effort to stop and destroy the invading Russian convoy approaching the capital from the main highway running from Chernobyl to Kyiv.

In a two-player game, one of the players manages the Russian side and the other the Ukraine side; In four-player gameplay, each player manages one power deck of their country. Both countries have one army and one civilian power deck. Each deck contains intelligence and attack cards, and a Joker card. Each side has a power deck as well as an event card drawn at the beginning of each round, independently of the sides. In the game, which is based on turn-based gameplay, after a series of successive preparation phases, the skirmish phase comes. In the preparation phase, the sides manage their hands; draw a card, change or lay -there is also the mechanic of advancing the convoy of the Russian side-. When it comes to the skirmish round, the dice are rolled by calculating the combos and advantages of the drawn cards: depending on the result, either the Russian convoy was stopped or damaged, or the Ukrainian side's attempts were unsuccessful.

If the convoy reaches Kyiv by capturing the cities on its way, one after the other, until the end of the grand tour, and thereby capturing the capital, it will be successful. On the other hand, if the Ukrainian side neutralizes the invasion attempt by slowing down the convoy or destroying all of them one by one, they win.

Prepare your strategy, follow your opponent closely and wish you luck. Be brave or cautious; The fate of the war is in your hands.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: SMS Emden
description:
The Dresden-class cruiser Emden, known as the 'Swan of the Orient', belonged to the German Oriental Fleet during the First World War. She was to be used in the Indian Ocean to intercept merchant ships. Her captain treated the crews of captured merchant vessels with courtesy and behaviour in accordance with international wartime law, and the ship remained in the spotlight even after she was grounded and abandoned after the battle of 9 November 1914 with HMAS Sydney. The game relives the exploits of the Emden.

"SMS EMDEN" is a single-player (solitaire) simulation wargame. The player controls the EMDEN, which navigates into several areas around the Indian Ocean, and completes missions such as 'coastal bombardment', 'trade disruption', 'raids' and 'landings' to score victory points. The Emden's main mission is to destroy trade, which means that battles with hostile warships are sometimes unavoidable. Players may be forced to fight head-on or, at certain times, to flee.

An important part of the game is the replenishment of 'coal', which is needed to allow the ship to perform her missions. Coal is an abstract representation of Emden's capacity for action. Therefore, resource management, impacting which actions to perform and how much can be performed, is a critical element of the game.

Contents:

120 piece (20mm, 15mm square)
1 map (A2 size)
2 sheets of cards (16 cards)
2 charts (A4 size)
1 rulebook


An issue game of Command Magazine Japan #167.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Fields of War Game Supplement
description:
There is only grim warfare in the war-torn cities and battlefields of Trederra.
