This 15-card supplement adds a grouping of new cards for Trederra, including new Trederran Artifacts, Trederran Encounters, Weapons of War, Darkness cards, and a brand new World Card: No Man's Land.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, American West, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Snotling Team Card Pack
description: Full set of reference cards for Snotling Blood Bowl teams including position players, special play cards, and Star Players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Legends of StormCIty
description:
Legends of StormCity is a roll & write game, in which each player takes the role of one of the heroes of StormCity who will fight against villainous leaders and their henchmen who intend to carry out their evil plans to conquer the city.

Each player will control a hero sheet in which they will write down the damage they receive and the powers they can use. Villains and minions have their own game sheets.

During a game of Legends of StormCity, the villain's team activates first by rolling their dice, depending on the results they play special abilities, then try to activate their main plan and any other plans that are in play, and then initiate attacks against the heroes. Once the turn of the villains is finishes, the heroes’ turn begins. Hero players take turns clockwise, starting with the player who has the initiative token. Players roll their respective dice, depending on the result heroes can activate their special abilities, deactivate enemy plans, and then attack the villains and their henchmen until they are knocked out and they can be taken to Red Cube.

In the game you can assemble your own adventures, you can choose among several heroes, villains, henchmen and different plans. You can also play a campaign mode with pre-built scenarios.

With arts by Daniel Tejerina and Alejandra Catalán.

-description from designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Pass Order, Zone of Control

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Martell Heroes I
description:
Although somewhat removed from the court at King's Landing, the Sunspear of House Martell wields its influence like a patiently coiled viper. It waits, watches, chooses its moments, then strikes with sudden, shocking speed.

Although one of the deadliest warriors afoot, Prince Oberyn Martell's political machinations are not to be undervalued, nor those of his daughters, the infamous "Sand Snakes." Obara, Nymeria, Tyene, and Elia Sand manipulate their enemies both on and off the battlefield with their father's same lethal precision. And Prince Oberyn's loyal ally Harmen Uller is always ready to raise his blade in House Martell's service.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Golden Company Swordsmen
description:
By controlling the Tactics Zone on the Tactics board, knowing Commanders can harness the full use of their Swordsmen’s Tactical Strike, allowing them to Attack with their highest Attack Die Value.

This unit comes with a Golden Company Officer attachment that has the ability to prevent the unit from falling prey to enemy Orders, Tactics cards or Influence. When attached, it also allows the unit to restore Wounds after passing Morale Tests.

Approximate Height
Bannerman: 55mm
Officer: 38mm
Swordsman A: 38mm
Swordsman B: 37mm
Swordsman C: 39mm
Swordsman D: 41mm

Contents:
13 Miniatures
‣ 1 Bannerman
‣ 1 Officer
‣ 11 Swordsmen
1 Unit Cards
1 Attachment Card
1 Movement Tray
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Trederran Banshee Shock Troopers Enemy Pack
description:
Armed with devastating Shockwave guns, the Banshee Shock Troopers of Trederra are close range heavy assault troops, beaming out rays of sonic death to blow apart fortifications and scatter defenders. They are deployed as a vanguard to a larger force, clearing barricades and toppling buildings to clear a path for troop formations and the steel beasts of the tank corps. Formed into small teams of specialists, they often accompany other Trederran formations on the battlefield.

This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to engage the heavy Trederran Banshee Shock Troopers in battle. Included are 3 Banshee Shock Trooper models, the large Enemy Record Sheet for them, the Beam Template and counters, and all of the Threat Cards and Faction Cards needed to add these deadly Enemies to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

Models are Thermal Plastic Miniatures manufactured in the USA and include 3 unique sculpts for Trederran Banshee Shock Troopers, and 3 x 30mm slotted Bases.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: RAF Bomber Command: Wellington
description:
RAF Bomber Command: Wellington is a Tactical-level, narrative-style Solitaire print and play wargame using a tables-based game engine simulating the British RAF Bomber Command nighttime bombing Campaign against Germany during 1942-1943.

As the pilot of a RAF Vickers Wellington bomber, your ultimate goal is to survive a 30-mission tour of duty. You and your crew will be assigned with taking part in nightly area bombing raids against various German cities during 1942 and 1943 in an attempt to break the will of the German people. But it won’t certainly be a cake walk, as Luftwaffe night fighters will be hunting your bomber streams, not to mention navigation challenges over open water and deadly FLAK you will encounter over the target cities.
The player will move his squadron through various travel boxes on a map of the English Channel during each mission on his way to the patrol area, then must successfully return back to home base.

Game components include a crewmen placement mat, strategic map mat, tables book, crewmen status sheet, campaign log sheet, and counter sheet representing individual RAF bombers, enemy aircraft, etc.


The game is available as Print and Play on Wargame Vault.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Great Wall: The Endless Tide Scenario
description:
Originally available as part of Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Air Pack.

A new scenario for 2-5 players, includes the scenario card and 3 new Rampage cards (To The Death, Volley, and Unyielding).
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Elgnirk The Choas Elf
description:
Hunt card sneak peek: Holiday hunt chaos card - Add this to the hunt phase of any campaign occurring during the holidays. At the start of the hunt phase, place Elgnirk on the last space of the hunt board. Whenever a random hunt event result is a double (11, 22, 33, etc.), move Elgnirk one space on the hunt board towards the survivors. If Elgnirk of the survivors move into each others' space, open this holiday card and resolve the even enclosed before resolving anything else. Limit once per campaign.

Elgnirk, The Choas Elf is packaged in a cheerfully illustrated box that includes:

1 x Painters scale, hard plastic Elgnirk, the Chaos Elf with 50mm scenic insert
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 50mm base
Large matte art print
Holiday hunt chaos card
Secret fighting art

Elgnirk was driven mad with grief when its twin soul was lost in the fog of dementia. It carries a glowing cane fashioned from the bough of a forbidden tree, guiding Elgnirk among the naughty and nice, touching them with joy to fill the world with memories for its beloved to devour.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Cats with Covid
description:
Just like their owners, cats across America are ready to leave the house and end quarantine. Protect your cats (or don't) with your arsenal of PPE. Roll the die as your cats re-explore events and destinations. Fully protect your kitties and they'll enjoy tomorrow; fall short with your protections and find yourself with a thin (and ill) litter.

Game contents: 50 state cat cards, 50 defense cards, 16 social cards, 10 event cards and one standard die.

On your turn you'll draw a card from the deck and play it. It may be a mask or vaccine that goes into your hand for later defenses, it may be a requirement to send one of your cats to a social event in the middle of the table, or it may be a start of a social event for all cats in the middle of the table already.

If it's a social event and you hat cats in the social space from previous draws, you'll have an opportunity to give them masks or vaccines to protect them or to play a virtual defense card to have them attend virtually and bypass the event for your cats altogether.

Once everyone has defended their cats to the best of their ability you'll roll a die and determine the threat value. Any cats appropriately protected will survive and return to your home while any cats who didn't have enough masks or weren't vaccinated for the event will be discarded.

The winner is whoever has the last cat(s) standing.
mechanics: Player Elimination

name: Ecclesia: L'épopée missionnaire
description:
Ecclesia is a cooperative, historical and missionary board game. You will dive into the first centuries of the Church, like the disciples of Christ, sent to spread the Gospel in the Mediterranean basin.

You will be led to seek relics, found bishoprics, and accomplish other new missions.

Each player embodies a disciple among the 20 available. Each of these characters has a different charisma, an unique and thematic power, and different talents to exercise game actions.

Ecclesia is an immersive turn-based strategy game, but the objectives are common between the players: the team regularly draws divine calls (objective cards) among the 30 available, so careful choices must be made to get the most out of them. Succeeding between 6 and 9 calls is synonymous with victory.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Dziennik: Zagadkowa podróż przez czas
description:
Karolina, Kazik and the otter Hyacinth continue their pursuit of the mysterious kidnapper of the Puzzlebot. This time they will travel not only through space, but also through time! They will visit 7 different eras where they will meet more friends and face even more puzzles.
• Thoughtful puzzles for young readers
• Independent 2nd part
• Game without internet connection
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil

name: Witchy Cakes
description:
In Witchy Cakes, you play witches competing to make the tallest, most enchanted cake possible to deliver unto an unsuspecting wedding reception.

Pick from adorable Covens to represent your witchy bakery and match colors to stack your cake cards into a tower. Then, throw cake at your friends, vie for coveted Recipe cards, and time your Secret Ingredients just right to have the tallest cake when the bell chimes thrice!

With easy-to-learn gameplay and a quick playtime, it's the perfect game for all ages, starting at 8 years old. Plays 4-8 players for 15-20 minutes. (Did we mention it's colorblind friendly?)
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Take That

name: Fighters of Europe
description:
Fighters of Europe is a fast-paced and simple tactical warfare game of air battles during WWII in the sky over Britain in 1940. Relive the fury of air combat over Europe during World War II as you direct each airplane in multiple fighter and bomber squadrons to lead attacks on the enemy's airfields, manufacturing locations, and other ground objectives.

Move each airplane individually on a hex grid. When you maneuver to get an enemy airplane in your sights, it must try to dodge or else take damage. Some airplanes can use bombs to destroy ground installations. Stay in formation to keep the initiative and dominate your opponent. Each airplane has its own attributes in terms of speed, armor, and special abilities. Each piece is illustrated as close as possible to its historical model to maximize your immersion!
 
The base game contains a large modular board, player aids, and all the tokens you will need to play. This includes several squadrons of Hurricanes and Spitfires as well as Messerschmidt Bf109, Heinkel 111 and Junker 88.

Fighters of Europe is scenario-driven. The base game comes with ten different scenarios. With practice, you will be able to set up your own scenarios very quickly.

No dice, no rulers — only dozens of airplanes! A fast-paced and streamlined game mechanism that plunges you right into the heart of battle.

-description from publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Casting Shadows: Ravaging Draco Promo Card
description:
2023 Convention Promo Card

Card Text
Ravaging Draco
Companion
Each time you Cast an Attack Spell, deal 1 additional DMG for each Resource card in your Spell Book.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination

name: Rougaille Dodo
description: The cards represent different ingredients from the famous Rougaille Dodo recipe (onions, garlic, etc.). A player places a card in front of him, face down, and announces an ingredient to the opponent of his choice. He will then have to decide to accept or refuse (Manze pa manze?) the card. If the player refuses (He must say: “pa Manze”), the person who presented the card takes it back and places it face up in front of him (in his collection); but if he accepts it (he must say “Manze”), he is the one who takes it into his collection! It is also possible to pass the dilemma to another player.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Tank GP: A Racing Game for One or More Players
description:
Tank GP is a racing game but also a wargame. It is not meant to be serious, realistic or historically accurate! It is meant to be fun, quick to play and have opponents which are challenging to race against but easy to operate. Up to ten different Tanks race against, and fire at, each other across ten different tracks with the ultimate aim of being the first to cross the winning line. Tanks range from strong, slower heavyweights such as the Tiger and the Churchill, to weaker, faster light tanks such as the M3 Stuart.

The game has been designed primarily as a solo game but there is no reason why two or more players cannot race against each other. Indeed, tanks controlled by the game system, used in solitaire play, can be added to a multiplayer game to fill out the race as and when desired.

It is also possible for the player(s) to control more than one Tank. More than one Race can also be run by the same Tanks, on the same or different Tracks, to create a competition.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Dice, Racing, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: LOONG VS. TIGER
description: LOONG VS. TIGER （龙争虎斗）The game of loong vs. tiger combines many traditional local poker playing methods in China, such as "fighting for the upper reaches", "fighting the landlord", "1000 points", "whipped eggs", "tractor" and even "please close your eyes after dark". I believe you will feel familiar after playing and inspire more novel ways to play....一款可以供4~6人游戏的卡牌类游戏。在中国传统扑克牌的基础上增加了8张各具特色、特点的功能牌。让游戏不精算也能玩，使之千变万化，变幻莫测。可谓是地主类卡牌游戏的巅峰之作！
mechanics: Acting, Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game
publishers: 龙争虎斗工作室 (Enter the Dragon Studio)

name: Reason for the Season
description:
Welcome to the combat card game where you take on the mantle of a major holiday and duke it out with other holiday mascots - including the big red guy himself - to become the new Reason for the Season.

Players take turns drawing Calendar Cards and performing the actions on the cards. In between Calendar Cards, players can beef up their defenses or attack other players. Once Santa randomly appears, it's an all out brawl for holiday supremacy, with the player who slays Santa being the winner.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Yucatan: Yucatan x Kemet
description:
Small (Game Up) expansion containing:


3 Kemet Power tiles
3 Yucatan Battle cards
6 standees
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Zombicide: Crossfire pack
description:
The Crossfire pack contains both a new type of Guard and a new type of Zombie which you can add to any of your Zombicide fantasy games!

The Crossfire Pack comes with:

12 Crossbow Guard Miniatures
15 Deadbolt Walkers
6 Delayed Ranged Action Cards
6 Deadbolt Walker Spawn Cards
2 Reference Cards
1 Rules Leaflet

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Zombicide: Berserker Walkers
description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive Optional buy brings you 18 Berserker Walkers (in 3 different sculpt variations), 12 Zombie spawn cards, and rules to add these savage Walkers to your game.

A typical strategy to avoid getting hurt by Zombies is to stay clear of them. But these muscled, armored walkers thwart these plans. Each of them may only be eliminated with Melee Actions. Thankfully, game effects that eliminate all Zombies in the Zone also apply to them. Time to put those polearm weapons to good use!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Lords of Hellas: Odysseus Promo Board
description:
A promo hero with the following abilities:

Special Ability: When Odysseus is in a Region with a City/Sparta, that Region's Population Strength is lowered by 1 for you.

Starting Bonus: At the beginning of the game, Odysseus may be placed in a different Region than your starting Hoplites.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Portal Combat
description:
In Portal Combat, you play as powerful entities with control over time and space, and use that power to pit fighters from across time against one another in the ultimate fighting tournament! Send warriors to dominate three different arenas in a comic-book themed card game for two players.

After randomly choosing three combat arenas that have their own unique effects, draft your team of twelve fighters and play them one at a time against each other. Each arena has room for two fighters on each side, where they can use their special abilities to boost each other or take out enemy combatants.

But, as the game progresses past the first round, you gain access to time gems that will make your fighters even more powerful. The player to win two out of three rounds will take the prize and be the ultimate victor of Portal Combat!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Open Drafting

name: Favor: Gods of Oethera
description:
In Favor: Gods of Oethera, players wield 1 of 6 unique characters to explore uncharted lands in a contest to win the Favor of the Gods. The first player to reach 10 points of Favor, or to control all 4 Settlement Banners at once, wins the game!

Using Action Points, players build the map as they search the Forests, Marshlands, Mountains, and Wastelands for Ruin Tiles, earning Relics to buff their stats before eventually offering them to the Gods for points of Favor. Favor can also be earned by capturing the Banner in each Region's Settlement, interacting with NPCs through narrative Events, and fighting other players.

Each turn begins by revealing a God Card and following the God's decree. The Gods can help players, hinder players, or alter the state of the board. Players then take their actions before drawing Action Cards to end their turn.

Favor offers multiple paths to victory, an open world feel, high replay value, and endless opportunities for big plays, sequencing, combos, and turn optimization. Who will come out on top, and win the Favor of the Gods?

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Events, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Steam Expansion: 18xxBelgium – The Road to Mechelen
description:
18xxBelgium: The Road to Mechelen is an expansion for Age of Steam, designed by Alban Viard and commissioned by 18xxBelgium in celebration of the fifth anniversary of 18xxbelgium.

The Road to Mechelen is a limited edition and is released as a paper-only version of 100 copies for the Spring Convention 2023 of 18xxBelgium in Mechelen, Belgium.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Undaunted: Normandy – Promo Scenario 13: Castle Itter
description:
A brand new Scenario for Undaunted: Normandy released with the first printing.

The last days of the war in Europe

Castle Itter – 5 May 1945

The Battle for Castle Itter was fought near the Austrian village of Itter on 5 May 1945, in the last days of the War in Europe. US soldiers joined forces with Wehrmacht Infantrymen, an SS officer, an Austrian resistance fighter, and recently freed French prisoners of war to defend an Austrian castle against an attacking force from the 17th SS Panzergrenadier Division. It has been called the strangest battle of WW2 and is the only known instance of US and German forces fighting side-by-side.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: 1812: Napoleon's Fateful March
description:
THE SITUATION
1812: Most of Europe is under Napoleon´s control, and Napoleon is poised to invade Russia and force them to comply with his Continental System and block British trade.
In the face of overwhelming force, the Tsar reluctantly decide to fall back and adopt a scorched earth strategy. Faced by an elusive foe, the French were forced into advancing ever deeper into Russia and all the way to Moscow itself, even though their logistic system was falling apart under the strain.
The infamous retreat back from Moscow was the culmination of the campaign and the turning point of the Napoleonic Wars. Will Napoleon and the hitherto undefeated Grande Armeé crush the Russian army and capture Moscow, or will they be punished for their hubris in the vast expanses of Russia?

THE GAME
1812: The Fateful March is a 2-player game that simulates Napoleons invasion of Russia at the operational level.
It is an easy to play card-driven system that utilizes secret order placement which ensures constant tension and little to no downtime.
As befits the historical campaign, the game features a strong focus on logistic planning and march attrition with a set of simple but highly narrative mechanics.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Order Counters, Point to Point Movement

name: Arcadia Quest: Viktor
description:
Viktor is the ultimate monster hunter. There is practically no species he hasn’t stalked, and the rarer the better. It began as simple hunting for food and game, but, by his teens, mere animals posed no challenge. He sought far smarter game… but settled for orcs and trolls at the time. As his skills and reputation grew, he sought greater and grander challenges. Mythological creatures, tyrannical warlords, and he’s even said to have hunted a god once (though he only smirks when asked about that). But now, with the bounty out for Arcadia, he believes he’s found his biggest challenge: To hunt an entire CITY!

—description from the publisher

Promotional hero for Arcadia Quest.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Garphill Ancient Anthologies Promo Pack
description:
Hadrian’s Wall, Raiders of Scythia, and Legacy of Yu: Garphil Ancient Anthologies Promo Pack

Garphill Games

A set of three promos for three different games from Garphill Games' ANCIENT ANTHOLOGY series:

Hadrian's Wall: New Fates

Contains 12 new Fate Cards + 1 Rules Card.

During Setup, shuffle all 12 new Fate Cards into the Fate Deck. Some of these cards cause the Picts to attack 2 Cohorts, while others have them not attacking at all.

Using Favours:
When using Favours to ignore Fate Cards targeting 2 Cohorts, a single Favour can only prevent 1 of those attacks. To prevent both attacks, 2 Favours would need to be used.

Raiders of Scythia: Four Heroes

4 new Heroes for Raiders of Scythia

Hirene: Gain 3 Cards
Sarakos: Gain 2 Livestock or lose 1 to gain 1 other Plunder type
Mada: Gain 2 Cards and optionally take 1 Market action
Danube: Gain 2 Provisions and remove 1 Wound

Legacy of Yu: Champion Promo Card

1 x Champion Barbarian Card
1 x Rules Card

This promo provides three ways to increase the difficulty for Legacy of Yu:

After setting up the game, add the new Champion Barbarian Card by placing it roughly in the middle of the Barbarian Draw Pile. He requires 4
Workers of a single colour to be defeated.
Destroy 2 Townsfolk Cards from the top of your Ready Pile before starting the game.
Start the game with 5 Townsfolk Cards and 2 Barbarian Cards along the top of the Board.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Bismarck: Force de Raid
description:
During the 1930’s, France built up a force of modern warships, the Force de Raid, to counter German naval construction. Britain seemed far less ready to stand against Hitler, and French leaders felt they had to be ready to fight Germany again, this time alone.

Force de Raid is a Campaign Study, with fourteen scenarios depicting this Franco-German naval war, the conflict for which the Marine Nationale built its fleet. The French must defend their commerce against German depredations, without the help of the powerful Royal Navy. This is the war for which both sides prepared, and for which they were evenly matched. You’ll need Bismarck Second Edition or Playbook Edition (and only Bismarck) to play the scenarios.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Flawed TCG
description:
Flawed TCG is the world’s most customizable trading card game! Traditional card board cards are sleeved together with clear essence overlays, giving you complete control over how your deck plays in-game. With almost 7,000 possible combinations in set 1 alone, Flawed brings the most diverse gaming experience to the TCG genre.

A game of Flawed is meant to represent a single battle between two warring factions. Players will represent one of six factions by choosing a Shrine to defend. These Shrines are important locations to each respective faction. In a single skirmish, the player who is able to destroy the enemy Shrine is victorious.

Players share turns and alternate actions which creates a unique, engaging play experience. Not only do you customize the cards while building your deck, in game, every card can be played as its base version or used as a resource. So play patterns are very dynamic and player autonomy remains a major focus.

Set in a low fantasy world, filled with lore including unique Epic Characters and cards. Much of the design is story driven and the themes and mechanics are built to reinforce these motifs.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Multi-Use Cards

name: Tales from the Red Dragon Inn: Demo Kit – Kickstarter Ediition
description:
This scenario pack is our convention and retail demo scenario, a taste of what the game has to offer. The scenario, Just Stopping By for a Pint is labeled as 2.5 and intended to be played between scenarios 2 and 3 in the campaign.

The Demo Kit will only be available to demo teams at brick and mortar stores and conventions, and won’t even be for sale to the general public!

—description from the publisher

Contained in the Kickstarter Edition of Tales from the Red Dragon Inn.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swarm Pack #2 – Slashers
description:
An Enemy Swarm Pack is a new themed set of cards focusing on fighting swarms of a particular Enemy Type, as well as a new set of Spawners for that Enemy Type. In this case, the pack focuses on fighting rampaging swarms of hungry Slashers and has a Feeding Burrow that spawns new Slashers during a Fight.

This pack also includes Enemy Record Sheets for the OtherWorld variants of Slashers (Swamp Slashers and Gorged Slashers, as well as two new OtherWorld variants... Larval Slashers and Slashers of the Deep), with the stats and modifiers worked into the Enemy Record Sheet itself, as well as new themed Elite Charts and Brutal sides for these variants.

A new Mission, Feeding Frenzy, allows the Heroes to go on an adventure to hunt down the burrow of these beastly creatures that are rampaging through the area. This set assumes you have access to the Slasher Enemies (miniatures and cards) from the ''Swamps of Death'' Core Set and does include an additional set of 6 Slasher miniatures, giving you a swarm of up to 9 of these savage beasts.

This set contains miniatures for 1 XL Feeding Burrow as well as 6 large Slashers.

The Feeding Burrow is a new Enemy introduced in this set, that acts as a Spawner for Slashers. A large rocky outcropping of Dark Stone, it is the ideal burrow for a nest of Slashers that bury themselves in the ground, feeding on the black rock. At the end of every Turn, more Dark Stone markers are added to the Feeding Burrow, until there is enough to spawn a new Slasher, consuming the Dark Stone as it erupts from the ground! This creates a new goal within the Fight for the Heroes to battle their way to the Feeding Burrow and destroy it before you are overwhelmed by a flood of Slashers. This can be dangerous though as the Dark Stone Radiation of the black rock can add up fast. The Burrow itself though can be a good source of some extra Dark Stone for the Heroes.
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Volfyirion Guilds: Journey Pack Promo
description: This booster contains 6 additional Command, 4 Agent and 2 Wonder cards. It was part of the Volfyirion Guilds Kickstarter as promo/ add-on for the backer.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Jägersro (Second Edition)
description:
Engage in the exhilarating world of horse racing and strategic investments! Your objective is to amass the greatest fortune by acquiring horses, participating in races, and purchasing shares in various companies. Success lies in making smart moves with your horses, companies, and other ventures you are involved in.

Two games in the box: Classic Jägersro with the original gaming experience for enthusiasts and Modern Jägersro - a modern, fast and compact family game.

The game contains a double-sided game board that allows for both game modes. A race book with achievements that allows you to follow your horse's career and see your results in the Hall of Fame and also a legacy variant that changes the dynamics of the game over time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Stock Holding

name: Misty Valley
description:
The valley hides many secrets, but only the most intrepid explorers can uncover them! Join one of two tribes — the Cherrygnawers or the Trailblazers — and explore unknown terrain, competing with your rival for the most valuable resources.

Each turn in Misty Valley, a player adds a valley tile to the playing area from the two on display or the top of the face-down stack; if you place a tile with footprints, you add an encounter tile from that stack, with each encounter showing a forest critter who has one or two demands. Next, place one of your three patrol tiles in hand next to one or more tiles in play. These patrol tiles show your tribe members on various edges, and if you now have more tribe members adjacent to a valley tile or encounter tile than the other tribe, mark that tile with one of your banners.

On a turn, you can move your captain figure to a tile that you control to add 1 to your tribe's strength on that tile. Additionally, you can play one of your three special abilities to rotate a tile, move a tile, play an additional tile, etc. (Each tribe has a double-sided board, and you choose a side — and abilities — before play begins.)

Once the final valley tile is placed, the opponent places a final patrol tile, then you tally points. The more valley tiles you control with the same resource, the more points you earn — and if you've satisfied the demands of an encounter, you earn bonus points for making a fellow critter happy. Whoever has the most points wins.
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Meadow: Adventure Book
description: Meadow: Adventure Book is a story-based experience in which you will explore journeys through different scenarios contained in a beautifully illustrated book. It is a hybrid product combining features of a notebook and a board game that can be played as a legacy-like experience with scenarios building up to a campaign.
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: QUBIK
description:
Qubik is a combination of the classic Tic-Tac-Toe and the Rubik’s Cube that makes a new, challenging, and fun game for people of all ages. The rules are as simple as taking turns to place a cube into a 3x3x3 space until a player creates a straight line of one color to win.
Qubik can be played by 1-7 players. A typical game of Qubik takes around 5-15 minutes. There are 3 modes of play available for you to enjoy: Casual, Competitive, and Solo.
mechanics: Connections, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Second World War at Sea: Bismarck – Les Portes-Avions
description:
Several times a year, when we feel like it, the Golden Journal brings Gold Club members some fun extras for their Avalanche Press games. Our new-model Golden Journal features a “real” booklet, just like a small magazine, and a small set of die-cut, silky-smooth playing pieces.

In 1939, the French Navy operated the world’s fourth-largest aircraft carrier fleet, with one ship. But throughout the 1930’s, plans called for more flattops. The Constructors’ Department of the Marine Nationale provided new designs, but none were authorized until a pair of modern carriers were finally ordered in 1937. Only one had been laid down, but not completed, when France fell to the Germans in 1940.

Golden Journal No. 50: French Carriers provides you with 30 new Second World War at Sea pieces for the lone French carrier, three proposed carrier designs that never would never be laid down, and the one design that did reach the slipway. Plus the airplanes that would have flown off of them. You also get six new scenarios so you can play with them in Second World War at Sea: Bismarck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Photo Tour: North America
description:
Photo Tour is an exciting game that allows you to travel and take stunning photographs of beautiful places in the USA and Canada. As a photographer, you aim to capture attractions and place their cards in your traveler's diary (player's mat). Each photo taken has a unique ability that allows you to build a card engine to make each turn more efficient.

Players take turns and perform 1 of 4 basic actions:


Planning. Choose 1 of the available attraction cards and take it in your hand to visit on one of your next moves.
Movement. Choose 1 available transport dice and move across the game board by the chosen method - airplane, bus, or car.
Photo Equipment Renting. Choose 1 available equipment token and place it in your travel journal to create more interesting photos during the photo shoot.
Taking a photo. While in the right location, place the landmark card from your hand into your travel journal. You can enhance the photo by using camera tokens to gain additional victory points.


The Best Part
Build card "engine." Activate bonus effects of visited attractions or use one-time bonuses of your travel journal. Use strong combinations of bonuses to make each turn better and better.

Why We Love It

Awesome artwork. The game features 58 stunning illustrations showcasing beautiful attractions in the USA and Canada.
Smooth gameplay with no downtime, as players make only one basic action at a turn.
Perfect gateway game. An intuitive approach to engine-building makes the Photo Tour also deep enough for experienced gamers while still engaging for beginners.
A fresh twist on racing-style gameplay. The game rewards strategic thinking over speed. Players can take up to 7 photos, but careful planning can result in a higher score with fewer photos.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gem Getter Gets Better
description:
This expansion for Gem Getter Pro includes 8 additional dig sheets, and 2 new roll sheets. New dig sheets all feature inner edges for an added level of interest, and plenty of variety to offer gem getters a fresh puzzle every time they play!

An updated campaign sheet is included to accommodate the additional roll sheets.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Tiny Tina
description:
Tiny Tina is joining the party ~ as a Vault Hunter!

Contains:

Tiny Tina miniature (Borderlands 2 model)
Vault Hunter Cards
mechanics: Unspecified

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Bolton Starter Set
description:
House Bolton rules from Dreadfort, their ancient edifice in the north. Descendants of the First Men, they are known for their sigil of a flayed man, a practice that they often partake in. Aggressive to the core, they fought in a rebellion against House Stark many years ago.

They have been likened to rabid dogs, lashing out against anyone that gets too close, even their own. Troops in House Bolton often fear their own commanders more than the enemy. Roose and Ramsay Bolton rule with iron, spiked fists. Their reputation for brutality and cruelty causes many foes to simply quit the battlefield. Better to run away and survive than be captured. Woe to anyone who ends up in House Bolton's clutches after a battle.

As with all starter sets for the game, the Bolton Starter Set comes with everything a player will need to get started in the game with the Bolton faction. It includes a rulebook, terrain templates, all necessary tokens, as well as the Bolton Tactics Deck and custom dice for the faction.

Perhaps unsurprisingly, the Boltons don’t have a lot of loyal allies. Therefore, House Bolton will be a mini-faction, with a Starter Set and a few dedicated units to go with them. The Starter Set has two units of Bolton Cutthroats, a unit of Bolton Blackguards (both of which have been previously released as Neutral Units), and a new unit, the Dreadfort Archers.

However, something players will notice is that some of these units come with two different sets of unit cards. This is because while these units can be used as Neutral mercenaries by other factions, they also have unique Bolton Faction cards as well. These are differentiated by the color and border art.

This holds true for other cards for the House. The Unit, Attachment, Commander, Tactics, and NCU cards also come in two forms, one to use when they are hired as Neutral mercenaries and the other when they are for a Bolton-specific army.

The one difference in the Starter Set is the Dreadfort Archers. This new ranged unit is used exclusively when taking an all-House Bolton army. These remorseless warriors will rain down arrows on any enemy, regardless of intervening units or terrain. They also don’t care if said enemy is engaged in close combat with their own allies. They will still attack, damning their own troops to possibly suffer Wounds as well. But, if it takes out more enemies than allies, it’s considered a net positive for House Bolton. Such is life in a House with such casual disregard for life.

The Starter Set also includes all new characters for House Bolton. Jeyne Poole and Fat Walda make their presence felt as NCUs, altering the battlefield from afar. They are not ones to hire themselves out, so they can only be used when taking a House Bolton force.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement

name: Potion Explosion: Lotion of Invisibility – Expansion Pack
description:
Become the perfect thief with the Serum of Invisibility, that allows you to steal an ingredient from one opponent’s Pool or incomplete Potion!

Mix the eight bottles set to the components of the Potion Explosion base game and take on a new challenge!
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Der Taubertal-Express: Würfelpioniere
description:
With the new expansion Dice Pioneers, new dynamics come into play. With each turn the players decide whether they want to take on the role of the train driver, station master, worker, builder or the passenger. If they don't like the associated actions, they decide on three action stones - but this tends to reduce the advantage and is therefore something to avoid.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Movement Points

name: Resident Evil: The Board Game – The Fallen Five
description:
The Fallen Five expansion includes advanced minis and rules cards for all the fallen S.T.A.R.S. from the journey through the Spencer Mansion.

Now, with this exclusive set, all of your player characters can join the advanced ranks as you play, unlocking new abilities, narratives, and objectives

A community-driven add-on, the Fallen Five expansion gives you the chance to give the fallen S.T.A.R.S. a second chance at becoming advanced in the Spencer Mansion.

This expansion includes:

Advanced Albert Wesker mini and character card
Advanced Brad Vickers mini and character card
Advanced Enrico Marini mini and character card
Advanced Richard Aiken mini and character card
Advanced Edward Dewey mini and character card
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Last Aurora: Dice Tower 2023 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available in Pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Electromagnetic Shield

Any Phase: Ignore up to 2 damage counters


Auto-Aiming Scope

Fire Weapon Phase: When you have to reveal an Outcome card, instead draw 2 cards and choose one of them to apply its effects. Then, discard both cards


Cracked Ath-Drone

Exploration Phase: Look at the top 3 cards of the Exploration deck, then put them back in any order
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mindbug: First Contact – Watts Dog Promo Card
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign.

Card description:
Frenzy: Cannot be blocked by creatures with 1 or more keywords.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Take That

name: Reviving Kathmandu: Bhairav Promo Pack
description:
Buy 1 of these shiny holofoil Bhairav cards with your leftover coin to gain extra bonus points at the end of the game.

The expansion includes:

5 holofoil Bhairav cards


—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding

name: Reviving Kathmandu: Rainbow Promo Pack
description:
Give a nice boost to your game experience with these unique wild cards by simply adding them to the Red deck.

The expansion includes:

10 unique wild cards


—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding

name: Crisis in Korea
description:
Two microgames set in the near-future of a collapsed North Korea. Loose Nukes is a two player game that pits S. Korea and the US against China as both sides race to gain control of as many N. Korean nuclear sites as they can. KTO Crisis has both sides pushing to gain as much N. Korean territory as possible without triggering nuclear armageddon. Both games play in about 30 minutes with short rulesets and small counter counts.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Point to Point Movement

name: Topping
description:
The inhabitants of this town adore pizza. The statue of the legendary pizza artisan stands proudly in the square, watching over them.
Every day, pizza makers are striving to satisfy their customers' taste buds.
In this town, a tasty pizza is a given! What matters is meeting the whimsical demands of your customers.

Although customers who order tons of toppings might contribute to your sales, beware as ingredients aren't always in stock!
But, if you look closely, even the most fickle orders seem to follow a trend. Keeping this in mind when stocking ingredients seems crucial. Watch as the whole direction of your business might even change depending on your capital investments.

Oh no! Someone's eyeing your operation.
Yes, it's those pesky rodents. They absolutely love pizza toppings. But dealing with them can be quite costly.
How will you choose to act?
Don't miss your opportunities, manage risks effectively, and aim to be the next legendary pizza shop owner!

To emerge victorious in this game, players must adeptly respond to a multitude of customer requests, accumulate profits, invest in their facilities, and accomplish secret missions. The player who garners the most victory points through these endeavors will be crowned the winner, securing their legacy as the preeminent pizza artisan in town.
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Rifles in the 'Nam
description:
Rifles in the 'Nam, the next installment in Gottardo Zancani’s popular solitaire RIFLES series, this time set in the intense battlegrounds of the Vietnam War. Experience the gritty action of jungle warfare in a uniquely immersive single-player format. Say goodbye to traditional hex-maps; instead, dive into three simplified yet engaging maps (Tunnel, Jungle, City) that capture the essence of the Vietnam Theater.

Engage in thrilling firefights, with five to ten units per side, across various scenarios, including a convoy rescue, tense tunnel searches and fights, city battles, jungle ambushes, and a linked campaign. Utilizing blind chit draws and strategic die rolls, alongside carefully crafted charts, the game offers an authentic taste of the unpredictable nature of war.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Four Against the Forsaken Depths
description:
Delve into the bowels of Norindaal and level up your heroes! This book has all the rules for the Heroic and Legendary adventuring Tiers, and describes the lethal dangers and limitless riches of the Forsaken Depths.


Heroic skills, including Heroic spells.
Legendary Skills,including Legendary spells.
Heroic and Legendary magic treasures.
Full profiles for all the monsters that dwell in the bowels of Norindaal.
Map and content generators for the Six Rivers of the Forsaken Depths, the Citadels and the fearsome Cyclopean Idols.
New tiles for underground dungeons and for the Six Rivers.


This book requires a copy of Four Against Darkness and Four Against the Abyss.
A D10 and a D12 are required in addition to the standard D6s.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Java Sea: Wicked Sisters
description:
In February 1942, the German Navy prepared a top-secret mission, known as Operation Cerberus, to move the battle cruisers Scharnhorst and Gneisenau (known to British sailors as the “Wicked Sisters”) and heavy cruiser Prinz Eugen from Brest in western France to Norway. Without special training operations or any other moves that might alert the British, they would suddenly dart up the narrow English Channel. The daring “Channel Dash” caught the British by surprise, and all three ships made it to German though Gneisenau suffered damage that would never be fully repaired.

As a cover story for the preparations, the German Navy put about the rumor that the three ships would head south, around the Cape of Good Hope and across the Indian Ocean to join the Japanese in the Dutch East Indies. Crews were told of this objective, tropical helmets and uniforms were loaded, and rumors spread through the French dock workers.

Wicked Sisters is a Second World War at Sea Campaign Study making this deception a reality. It’s a set of thirteen scenarios tracing this cruise that never happened. The German squadron is pretty much on its own until they reach safe harbor. The Royal Navy has no intention of letting them get there, and the U.S. Navy has no intention of allowing them to survive.

You’ll need Bismarck Second Edition or Playbook Edition, South Pacific, Horn of Africa, Eastern Fleet and Java Sea to play the scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Disney Lorcana: Illumineer's Quest – Deep Trouble
description:
Ursula is rising to seize power over Lorcana! Stand against her and her horde of entangled glimmers to save the realm. Whether you face her with friends or alone in solo play, your goal is clear: defeat the sea witch and restore the future of Lorcana.

Defeat Ursula
Deep Trouble comes with two preconstructed player decks*, featuring the sorcerer Yen Sid of Disney’s Fantasia and the brave Mulan. Player turns occur at the same time, so coordinate with your team, using abilities and effects on each other’s glimmers to ruin Ursula’s schemes.

Ursula's Army
The sea witch will use all her powers to protect her lair against the Illumineers! Designed especially for the Illumineer’s Quest Deep Trouble, this gold-backed deck features entangled glimmers and mighty natural disasters. Ursula also plays by her own rules, and her powers increase as each move she makes brings her closer to her ultimate design!

Multiple Levels of Difficulty
Where will you fight Ursula: at the site of your first encounter, or at her lair, where her powers are the greatest? Battleground cards determine how difficult the encounter will be, while giving Illumineers unique abilities at the cost of lore. While the first two battlegrounds are great for starting out, two more are included to give players even greater challenges with Deep Trouble.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Glim
description:
What was once a gambling game played by fairies is now an 'Earthly' dice-based, push-your-luck game with elements of deck-building.

The goal of the game is to accumulate 'Glim', the mysterious energy the powers the fairies' magic. 2-4 players choose one of four 'Dominions', each with unique tactics and styles of play.

Players roll up to six custom eight-sided dice and deploy influence tokens to win additional tactic cards, creating increasingly complex strategies as the game progresses.

With beautiful art and a deep backstory, Glim is both a game and an artifact of the 'Emerald Anvil' fantasy universe.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Deth Wizards
description:
Welcome to Deth Wizards, a miniatures-agnostic tabletop wargame where you and your friends take the role of powerful Necromancers, commanding your undead minions against the villages and heroes of the land of Deth. Designed to play solo, co-op, or as an adversarial skirmish game.

Build your rampaging horde of undead minions from any models you like. Skeletons, zombies, ghouls, ghosts, vampires, and more are yours to control. There are 19 different undead to raise, recruit, and create with unique capabilities. You can even create new undead from the heroes you destroy. Choose your minions and lead them to battle in Deth Wizards!

What kind of Necromancer are you? From Dread Horde Masters and their legions of simple undead to armor-clad War Reapers fighting shoulder to shoulder with their minions - you decide how you want to play. There are six different legacies to choose from in Deth Wizards, as well as more than 30 Necromantic Powers and 21 special abilities to make your necromancer unique.

Play through 11 different missions - rob graveyards, assault arcane colleges, kill the king, or attempt your own dark apotheosis. In Story Play, you decide your evil schemes, though beware - the Heroes of Deth will not take your assaults lightly. In Skirmish play, you will square off against other necromancers to see who is the true master of the dark arts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: FootClub Ligue
description:
Don't let anyone else lift the cup!

FootClub is a card game with a tactical dimension in which you control everything: recruitment during the transfer window, team lineup, pre-match strategy and coaching during the game.

Footclub offers a total immersion into the football experience, including the thrill and emotions of a real football match!

FootClub Ligue is a standalone extension of FootClub, which has the particularity of containing more components than the base box.

Stand alone: the box contains a complete set for 2 players, with 2 game modes available. Pee Wee mode (15 min): simple, accessible for all, perfect to discover the game, it will easily attract beginners as well as young players. Expert mode (60 min): strategically rich and with great replay value, it will satisfy experienced players.

Extension: by combining with the FootClub box, discover the League mode for 4 players. This is how FootClub reveals its true dimension.
Manage your recruitment budget in a "tight" transfer window, based on auctions.

Receive transfer offers. Will you withdraw a player despite a great offer?

Focus on your training centre: a young player can progress in a dazzling way to become a superstar!

Do you prefer short game sessions? It's simple and quick with the backup form.

Many new features and optional rules: new Match cards, new player positions, strengths of the goalkeepers, match on neutral ground.
Official rule of the Solo mode available for free download.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Cloudspire: Cloud Spider
description:
Cloud Spider is a landmark minion chip that was the 2020 convention promo chip for Chip Theory Games.
This chip is also available in the Chip Theory Games 2020 Promo Pack.

Stats:
Swamp Landmark Chip
5 Health
* Attack
2 Movement
Poison Talent
Spire Reward - 1 Relic Reward
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Viroid
description:
Human beings are at the edge of existence — but they don't know it yet! Mother nature is about to strike back and reduce mankind to save the planet from being destroyed by the species that calls itself "homo sapiens".

In Viroid, players cooperate in taking the role of a virus and trying to infect people all over the world. They use events like the Olympic Games to spread their deadly effects. To be a step ahead of the human scientists, the players develop special features like infection by blood, infection via animals, or resistance against medicine, heat or cold.

The game is played in clockwise order. On your turn, draw an event card, which forces you to take back one or more of your tokens from the board (healing a city). If it is the last one in this city, the "healing token" on the specific track moves forward and you lose if it meets your marker on that track. The event card also gives you some additional "DNS points", which are akin to money. In the second step of your turn, you spread your virus depending only the methods for infection you have already developed. You gain additional DNS-points for each infection, such as placing new tokens onto the board in the cities. Third, you develop (buy for DNS) more features for your virus like infection via animal, resistance against cold or medicine, or your ability to kill people. Finally, you throw dice according to your skill for killing, and depending on the result, you replace your tokens on the board with dead tokens.

The players win if they have placed all dead tokens in the cities. They lose if the draw pile runs out or the human beings have made enough healing steps on the specific track.

Will you be able to save the planet and reduce the population of the greatest danger for the world — human beings?
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Simulation

name: Vindication: Remnants of the Ancients
description:
Vindication: Remnants of the Ancients contains fifteen new cards to mix into the game.

Companions

STONEWORK GOLEM (Y)
STONEWORK GOLEM (R)
STONEWORK GOLEM (B)


Traits

INVENTOR’S INCLINATION
TRANSHUMANISM


Relics

THE GO-FASTER GADGET
STONEWORK CONTRAPTION
ONE MAN BAND, WITHOUT THE MAN
INSCRUTABLE DEVICE


Pets

A SINGLE GEAR
STONEWORK FLEDGLING


Monsters

ENRAGED STONEWORK STOMPER


Loot

MOBILE PLATFORM
STONEWORK GLOVE
BACKPACK ENGINE
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Creekos: The Card Game
description:
Creekos: The Card Game is a trick-taking card game with a customized deck that pits two partnerships of two players against one another, first in an auction to determine the power of their cards, then in the card play itself.

At the start of the game two auctions take place, one for the number scale – that is, which value on the cards they hold will be used by the partnership – and a second for the trump color. After this, the players then compete in a trick-taking game that uses customized cards in different categories that relate to one another; in the packet "Hercules' Labors", for example, the categories are Events, Gods, People, Creatures, Lifeless. For each trick, players lay one card in the center of the table – with some cards having special abilities that activate thunderbolts or block other cards – and the most powerful card wins the trick. Once all the tricks are finished, players tally their points (subtracting however many points they bid at the start of the game), and the partnership with the high score wins.

Creekos: The Card Game can also be played by only two players, with each player competing on her own.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Mythology
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Memory, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Bravo!
description:
Ladies and Gentlemen! The most important circuses in the world are looking for Aerial artists, Acrobats, Equilibrists, Illusionists, Jugglers and Clowns. To ensure success, in addition to bringing memorable attractions, each circus also must offer spectators unique delicacies such as cotton candy, candy apples and popcorn. The circus that best satisfies its audience will be chosen as the greatest show on Earth!

A game of Bravo lasts 17 rounds. In each round, the Master of Ceremonies chooses one of three types of tiles to be acquired by the players: Inner Ring, Outer Ring or Audience. Once the choice is made, a number of tiles equal to the number of players plus one is revealed. A single bid auction is then held to decide who will be the new Master of Ceremonies, who will have the right to be the first to choose one of the open tiles. In a clockwise direction, the other players choose tiles, being able to spend tickets to open new options on the table. When all circuses are completed, players reveal their Ringmaster tile and all artists in each circus are scored. The value of each artist category is added and then multiplied by the number of that category icons in that circus Audience tiles. The player with the most points is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Rockopolis
description:
In the city of Rockopolis everybody wants to be a rock star, but reaching success is hard.
You've got to recruit members, trying to get the best ones before other bands.
You've got to train in Rehearsal Rooms, buy the best equipment for your rock genre and raise prestige playing in live events.
Don't forget to avoid fights in your band due to different tastes: a Metal guitarist should never play near to a Punk singer.
Be the first to record a Demo CD and win.

Each turn, players choose where to place their pawn: Pub (to search for new band members), Shop (to buy equipment), Rehearsal Rooms (to train and increase the Synergy) or Live concerts (to raise Prestige).
All considering the favourite Rock Genre of the Band Leader and of other Members.
Metal, Glam, Rock-Blues, Punk... Rock has so many faces that you've got to pay attention.

Players will experience all the struggles a beginning rock band have to face.
"It's a long way to the top, if you wanna Rock'n Roll", like someone sings.
Reaching the top is hard, doing it before others is even harder.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Battlestations: By Her Majesty's Sacred Egg Sac
description:
Adventures in the Zoallan Navy

This supplement expands Battlestations to include a campaign based on characters in the Zoallan navy fighting for the right to mate with the queen. It includes rules for the line of succession and special abilities, equipment and new scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Kulikowe Pole 1380
description:
The Battle of Kulikovo was fought between the armies of the Golden Horde under the command of Mamai, and various Russian principalities under the united command of Prince Dmitri of Moscow. The battle took place on 8 September 1380, at the Kulikovo Field near the Don River and was won by Dmitri, who became known as Donskoy (of the Don) after the battle. Although the victory did not end the Mongol rule over the Russian principalities, it is widely regarded by Russian historians as the turning point when Mongol influence began to wane and Muscovite power to rise—a process that eventually led to Muscovite independence and formation of the modern Russian state.

This is a typical hex and counter game. Initiative is determined in each scenario and kept for the entire game. Players perform their actions in order, with possible reactions (when enemy units enter missle range). Example:

1. Player A moves cavalry (reaction fire possible)
2. Cavalry of player A attacks
3. Player A moves infantry (reaction fire possible)
4. Infantry of player A attacks
5. Player B moves cavalry etc.

Movement is determined by terrain and unit type. Battles are determined by comparing unit strength, which is modified by various factors (armor, charge, terrain, leaders etc.), and dice roll. Interesting elements of game mechanics include: fatigue of units, morale and cavalry movement (turning requires more space).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: China-Burma-India: The Lost Theater Part I – The Japanese Invade: December 1941 - May 1942
description:
Defend Burma!

Can you help defend Burma from the onslaught of the Japanese conquerors? Or, can you expand the Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere by liberating Burma from the imperial colonials? You now have the chance to try your skills on the tactical battlefield during the crucial months between December 1941 and May 1942. Squads of infantry, tanks, artillery, support, and even some airpower! The tools are at your command. Can you succeed?

This ASL compatible product from the St. Louis ASL Club contains:
- 59 Page Magazine
- 22"x28" Historical map with 3 scenarios for a campaign game or they can be played as standalone scenarios.
- 12 scenarios for the ASL geomorphic maps
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Diss Jockey
description:
Description from the publisher:

Diss Jockey is a party game where cards are drawn to set the theme of the round, and players take turns playing a song on their mobile device that is judged by one player, the Diss Jockey. At the end of the round, the Diss Jockey awards the best choice a "Hit" Card worth 1 point, and the worst choice a "Diss" Card worth -1 point.

The Diss Jockey has the option to stop the song at any point and move on to the next one by holding up the "Skip" Card.

The Hit and Diss Cards are drawn to set the theme of the round, as well as serving as each player's score. The Diss Cards follow this format: "This _____ Song" and the Hit cards follow this format: "That _______". So the theme is set by drawing 3 of each, selecting the Hit and Diss cards to use, and returning the unused cards to the bottom of their respective decks.

Sample Themes:

This 90's song that reminds you of your ex.
This Pop song that you wouldn't want to hear right before your colonoscopy
This Sentimental song that sucks and everyone is too stupid to realize it.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Negotiation, Voting

name: Battle Pufs
description:
Battle pufs is an action packed game for friends and families.
There are 2 modes battle royale where you win by being the last one standing.
Or timed royale you set a timer and either the last player wins or if there are still players remaining you count the stars at the bottom of your puf cards and the player with the most stars wins. You shuffle both decks and deal 3 puf cards to each player and they get 7 battle cards unless otherwise stated.

Everytime they end there turn or use a card they draw back up to 7 reveal cards face up infront of you. Keep doing this until no one is left or you run out of time.
mechanics: Action Timer, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Player Elimination

name: RoboCafé
description:
In this experimental buffet, two robots compete to prove that their program is better suited to the task than the opponent's. Players are the robots programmed to find the optimal way to fulfill sequentially coming guests' orders about drinks, sandwiches and cupcakes. The game takes place on a 3 x 3 grid of cards, where players move and activate workstations with dice, preparing meals and managing their energy usage. The first robot to successfully serve 4 customers wins, and its program will be purchased from the developer and installed permanently in the cafeteria.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Contracts, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Crystal Collapse
description: Crystal Collapse is a card-driven tactical combat game for 2-4 players with immersive background story. Inspired by the great tactical JRPGs, the game offers exciting battles where positioning and alignment are key to success.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Square Grid

name: Bonaparte Overruns Piedmont
description:
Bonaparte's First Offensive, April 1796

With his commission order fresh from Paris, Bonaparte established his HQ at Nice and took command of a front-line force of 35,168 men of the Army of Italy, ordering them across the mountains and heading for a fight at Montenotte. After Beaulieu's 26,697 men of the Army of Italy escaped from harm's way and sprinted for Acqui, the Piedmontese Army became Bonaparte's next target.

Game features the battles of Montenotte, Dego, San Michele, Ceva (not listed on box cover) and Mondovi. A campaign game linking the battles is also possible.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Beast: Shattered Isles
description:
The Shattered Isles introduces a brand new world, with three new Beasts, three new hunters, two maps, four contracts, and a heap of new and exciting gameplay mechanics.


Vacker, Abuser of Stolen Souls is a narcissistic Beast who utilizes souls collected from the dead to soul charge her abilities for additional stronger effects. Be careful: if you run out of souls, you are immediately revealed on the map.



Thalduk, Lord of the High Peaks is the god of storm of thunder. His Yagi summons can kick unsuspecting targets into harm's way, and with his overload ability, he can deal massive amounts of damage with just one card.



Akkeron, Abomination of the Shattered Isles is the culmination of human hubris. A ritual to become stronger than the Beasts went wrong, and from the ashes of the humans who perished, Akkeron was born. This foul Beast wants nothing more than to spread his foul corruption and consume the world.



Eivind, Skyhunter uses his versatile grappling hook to pull himself around the map or to pull friend or foe to his location. He's accompanied by his owl-like companion Fylgja, who moves around the map in search of trails.



Fara, Flameblade Huntress is as reckless as she is violent. With her Flame Rapier, she can move incredible distances without changing direction, and be rebirthed by fire as she takes on enough wounds.



Valdi, Alchemist is a sinister hunter who excels at his studies of the dead. He brews competent potions and poisons to help his fellow hunters, and to damage the Beast.


New Mechanics


The two new maps feature Hidden Paths: pathways that can only be accessed by characters native to the same habitat the path originates from.



Ruins can be found on the map. Begin a turn in the same location as a ruin to unlock forgotten and powerful magic.



Split Actions can be played in combination with any other card for the highest flexibility possible.


New Cards, Contracts, and more


Shattered Isles comes with 4 new Action Cards, an updated and improved way of drafting your cards, 13 new Items, 13 new Beastly Talents, and 4 new Contracts that change the way you play the game.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: MiniSteel
description:
MiniSteel is an ultra portable, quick-fix, battle royale strategy card game.

Players begin with 10 HP Tokens and 2 Card Draw Tokens to enhance their hand when they choose to use them. The highest rolled die begins.

With 6 cards in hand, the first player chooses to equip for battle, build up shields to defend for a future attack, heal, and/or attack an opponent, all opponents, or the whole table! After two actions, the turn moves to the player to the left until the last player standing wins the battle... unless someone has in hand the Revival Scepter.

The same game is never played twice and epic comebacks feel so, so good!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Flappy Families
description:
Flappy Families is a family-friendly card game for 2 - 5 players where players collect sets of native New Zealand birds while trying to avoid the Predators!

Players will have to engage their memory to try and match birds of the same families. As well as flipping cards face up on the board players will be putting their own cards face down onto the board. They will be able to use this information to try and make future matches - unless another player foils their plan!

At the end of the game the player with the best collection of birds, judged by having large families and by collecting birds from the special bonus point families, will be crowned the winner.

The game features 51 unique illustrations of native New Zealand birds, as well as the fearsome predator: the Stoat. The beautiful illustrations have been made by the talented Auckland-based Sam Kim.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Memory, Set Collection

name: Radetzky's March: The Road to Novara
description:
The game simulates the brief campaign fought by the Sardinian army against the Austrian Empire in 1849.

Several changes compared to the previous edition: bigger map and counters; artillery can bombard, hidden movement, alternative strategic setup and much more.

The maps (2) are bigger, with distinctly different colors and better visual aids; now the various types of watercourses are clearly distinguishable: Major and minor rivers, streams and canals; target cities are clearly visible.
Icons are redesigned and recolored; in some cases completely changed. Larger. Then, in the first edition, I had involuntarily omitted the Italian flag. Now there is!
The combat values have changed, and the counters are more numerous thanks to the new artillery units.
There are multiple elite modifiers in the units.

The big news in the rules is represented by the artillery bombardment; when used en masse very effective. The games are shorter and the players cannot afford to make mistakes!
The activation mechanism is the same; the command range for all formations is somewhat reduced; this requires that the formations not disperse too much during the game. The cavalry charge becomes simpler and more brutal; more risky but which can lead to great results.
The ENGAGED result is eliminated, in its place SHAKEN appears, very different in effect and much less complicated. The CRT changes, it is definitely easier to use.

There is an optional system for playing with DUMMY, in two ways: either by masking the stacks or by using displays showing the groups of counters defined by the DUMMY.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Diora
description:
In Diora, players take on the role of managers of a radio production factory, who will compete with each other to see who has chosen the best strategy that will lead the plant to the best possible development. Thus, he will receive the title of deputy president and will go down in the history of the plant.

Each player alternately sends his workers to perform appropriate actions. The entire game lasts five rounds.

The player who gets the most recognition points wins the game.

The game was inspired by great games such as Marco Polo and Pretor. Therefore, I would like to thank the authors Simone Luciani, Daniele Tascini and Andrea Novac for the great mechanics that were implemented in my game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, End Game Bonuses, Movement Points, Resource Queue, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Friendly Fire Pack 7
description:
Friendly Fire Pack 7 contains eight scenarios featured in the Friendly Fire 2011 ASL tournament.

Scenarios included:

FrF53: Raid Into The Reich
FrF54: KNIL Before The Emperor
FrF55: Forsthaus Clash
FrF56: Saluting a General
FrF57: Warsaw in Flames
FrF58: Order 831
FrF59: Capital Punishment
FrF60: A War of Their Own
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Horse & Musket: Annual #1
description:
Horse and Musket Annual Number 1 is the first fan expansion to Horse & Musket. It will add new scenarios for owners of Volumes I-III and some optional rules for greater realism.

The scenarios include...

The Boyne - July 11, 1690 – Lillibullero

Steenkerque - August 3, 1692 – The End of the Pike

Torroella - May 27, 1694 – The Flight of the Spaniards

Zenta - September 11, 1697 – Hapsburg Zenith

Ramillies - May 23, 1706 – Marlborough’s Greatest Victory

Oudenaarde - July 11, 1708 – “Another hour of daylight…”

Lesnaya - September 28, 1708 – “Glorious Victory at Lesnaya”

Gadebusch - December 9, 1712 – A Battle Won and a War Lost

Stresow - November 15, 1715 – “Is There No God Beside Me?”

Fort Rosalie - November 29, 1729 – “Everything was on fire and covered in blood…”

Villmanstrand - August 23, 1741 – Lacy Smashes Sweden

Campo Santo - February 8, 1743 – The First Victory of Maria Theresa’s Reign

Kars - August 9, 1745 – Nader’s Last Battle

Falkirk - January 17, 1746 – Last Chance for the Jacobites

Bergen op Zoom - September 13, 1747 – “…either hang him or make him Marshal of France.”

Gross-Jägersdorf - August 30, 1757 – Lehwaldt’s Gamble

Breslau - November 22, 1757 – Bevern’s Stand

Wandiwash - January 22, 1760 – “Then followed the battle that gave us India.”

Sainte-Foy - April 28, 1760 – French Canada’s Denouement

Liegnitz - August 15, 1760 - Frederick Escapes Daun’s Trap

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Blood Red Skies: Air Strike!
description:
Blood Red Skies: Air Strike! is a rules compendium that presents all of the rules from the original Blood Red Skies starter set and adds many new ones suitable for expanded air operations: ground and sea targets, bombing, strafing and torpedo attacks, defensive flak and terrain. Jet aircraft are introduced with the MiG Alley expansion and there is additional guidance for historic and competitive play.

The book includes seven entirely new scenarios for Blood Red Skies and re-presents the five existing ones to bring them in line with the new rules and player feedback.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Wasteland Barter Town Daily Event Pack #1 Game Supplement
description:
Every day and night cycle in the Blasted Wastes is a deadly new adventure! Not only in the sulfurous desert wastes, but in the small settlements called Barter Towns as well. As the harsh winds whistle through the protected valleys and underground caverns that hold Barter Towns, you take refuge and re-stock your supplies, never knowing what new excitement the day will bring. Will a Burning Ship tear through the sky, exploding and raining down caustic debris, or will you be called to man the settlement walls to defend against a Sand Crab attack? You may even encounter a local junksmith erecting a huge Monolith dedicated to the Great Kraken! Yes, life is always exciting in the Blasted Wastes. Short...but exciting.

This 15-card Game Supplement for the ''Shadows of Brimstone Blasted Wastes OtherWorld'' Expansion includes a brand new set of Wasteland Barter Town Daily Event cards to liven up your Barter Town Stays.
