The partisans hail from four factions, each determined to fight back in their own way: the Council with its fortitude and bread, the Order with its wisdom of the flame, the Sect with its ingenious inventions, and the Coven with its spells and subterfuge.

Players assemble their crews by drawing defender cards that each correspond with a faction and a habitat type. Each card details a unique animal character that enables that player to take various actions such as moving, clearing pollution, fighting mechs, building camps, and healing across a modular illustrated hex map. Different combinations of defender cards from different factions allow for varied strategies and approaches to achieving objectives and fighting the machines. A machine deck controls the expansion of the machines and their development across the board. As the machines enclose habitats, they build factories and send out hunter mechs while leaving behind a trail of walls and pollution. If players can successfully build all of their camps and rewild the machines' factories before the last factory is built, all players win the game together.

Can the Defenders band together to heal the land and outsmart a seemingly impossible enemy? Or will the woodlands succumb to an endless industrial winter? It’s up to you and your comrades to decide.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Marvel Dice Throne: Deadpool
description:
It's not a party without a Wade!

You become one of Marvel's most (in)famous heroes in Marvel Dice Throne: Deadpool, which includes the Deadpool Hero, 10 Acrylic Tokens, pre-painted Hero Sculpt, and 50 premium card sleeves.

Note: Other Marvel Dice Throne sets will be required to play a full game with Marvel Dice Throne: Deadpool.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mysterio & Carnage
description:
Quentin Beck began a life of crime as a frustrated artist. A successful stunt man and special effects creator in Hollywood, he turned to criminal life after failing to gain the recognition he thought he deserved. Donning the mantle of Mysterio, Beck uses illusions, hypnosis, and trickery to enact his criminal schemes. A longtime rival of Spider-Man, Mysterio's gadgets and intelligence allow him to tangle with his super-powered foe.

The killer Cletus Kasady shared a prison cell on Ryker's Island with Eddie Brock, the human host of Venom. Kasady merged with an insane offspring of the original Venom symbiote, which bonded to his bloodstream, transforming him into the deadly and unpredictable villain Carnage.

Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mysterio & Carnage consists of 2 miniatures, 2 Bases, 2 Character Stat Cards, 3 Team Tactic Cards, and 11 Tokens.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Reinhold Wittig's SPIELECOLLECTION No. 1 Spiele zur Schatzinsel
description:
("Games around Treasure Island")

The first and only(?) book in a planned series of themed game books. Wittig compilation of pirate-themed games complete with rules and instructions to make them by yourself.
Some were published in later years, some were half-baked and asked the reader to add his own ideas or rules.

The 16 contributors included :
- Alex Randolph (with a three person variant of his later Treasure Hunt)
- Reinhold Wittig himself with complete instructions to make and play Piratenbillard and with Pirate Inc.
- Wolfgang Kramer with a predecessor of Duell der Schamanen
- Dirk Hanneforth with Timon
- Knut-Michael Wolf with Goldraub in London
- Roland Siegers
- Johann Rüttinger
- Joe Nikisch
- Hajo Bücken
- Max Kobbert
- Martin Ebel
- Erwin Glonnegger
- Rolf Asche
- Gilbert Obermair
- Rik van Even
- Bernhard Decker

All in all 18 pirate games plus some information about the designers on 150 (large) pages.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Book, Deduction, Dice, Exploration, Nautical, Pirates, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Stratiotika
description:
A FREE full campaign game for use with Hoplomachia (although it is perfectly good as a stand alone boardgame) Right out of the pages of Thucydides! Two full scenarios included!

In Stratiotika, you will now be able to make war at the city-state level; you can enrage city dwellers by trampling their crops, organize markets to feed your troops, build counter-walls to blockade rebellious cities, or infiltrate troops within their walls with the help of traitors and take the town on the sly. Not only can you openly call on their assemblies to vote to join your cause, but you can actually debate with your political opponents using historic speeches to sway those who are
“on the fence”. You can lose allies to the harvest, ships to dangerous waters, walls to earthquakes, and cities to a more cunning and silver-tongued foe!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement

name: The Battle of Armageddon
description:
The Bible contains prophecies about the final days, describing how the armies of the World will fight the final battle and that without divine intervention, no life shall be saved (Matthew 24: 22). Certain Biblical scholars have described how closely these prophecies correlate to our modern times and put forward scenarios for this climactic battle.

The Battle of Armageddon is a 2 to 6 player game dealing with this final battle. The game brings together the forces of the World into the ultimate battle for control of the Earth.

The 17 x 33" game map represents the battleground, stretching from Egypt to Iran. The 216 5/8" counters (die-cut and back-printed) represent the armies of Israel, the Arabs, Magog (Russia), the Revived Roman Empire (Europe), USA and the Kings of the East (China). The 144 playing cards capture apocalyptic events (7 seals, 7 trumpets, 7 vials), special powers (e.g. the Anitchrist, Gog of Magog, etc.), nuclear weapons (tactical, theatre, and strategic) and homeland populations. Battle dice are used to resolve all battles.

Players maneuver their armies across the map and resolve battles using the battle dice. Event cards are drawn each turn, giving players special powers or weapons of mass destruction, but they can also bring on apocalyptic events. Utlimately, the player who best manages the chaos and controls Jerusalem at the end of the game wins!

Note that this version of game The Battle of Armageddon is a significant departure from the original game published in 1999. In line with other main stream games, The Battle of Armageddon provides a simple but challenging game system suitable for both seasoned and casual players. Players are forced to adjust their strategy depending on rapidly changing conditions as dictated by the event cards. Combat is bloody, yet managed quickly and decisively through the battle dice. Players must manipulate allies and opponents to achieve the goal of capturing the Holy Land.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Battlegroup: Blitzkrieg
description:
The next supplement for the Battlegroup World War II gaming rules covering the invasion of Poland in 1939 and France in 1940.

Designed to be played in 20mm and 15mm, this latest book contains army lists, vehicle data and special rules for the first two years of the war, including France’s command chaos, the Luftwaffe's aerial superiority and the swift German Panzermarsch!

Nine new army lists for the early war fighting. The Polish and German armies for 1939 and German Panzer and Infantry Divisions to fight French Light Mechanized Divisions, Armoured Divisions and Infantry Divisions, the British Expeditionary Force and Belgian army in 1940.

Nine historical scenarios from Poland to Belgium and France. All in a lavish 184 page, hardback book. Heavily illustrated with inspiring miniature photographs, historical photographs and artwork.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: The Big Crash: New Rules (fan expansion for Stockpile)
description:
The Big Crash: New Rules is a fan-created expansion for Stockpile. This expansion replaces the original rules with new rules. It will change the game by adding more strategy and tactics but keeping its short play time and feeling.

The fan expansion uses all of the components of the base game and it's also possible to use the Stockpile: Continuing Corruption expansion. Only print the new rules and you are ready for a fresh new game.

Every player is an owner of a big investment company. Starting with a low startup capital they try to spend their money as efficiently as possible. Invest more into your company to get market advantages, or save your money to invest in more/better shares. The big amount of shares all investment companies buy and sell causes fluctuations in the stock market, but be aware! When players start to dump their shares, it could cause The Big Crash! Which player will handle the market the best and will earn the most money?

It's now possible to buy any stock you want (up to 3 per round) and sell any stock you want, so you will have more control. The bidding system is still present, but this time you will bid for turn order. Also the market shifts on the amount of stocks sold or bought.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Stock Holding

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Spider-Friends
description:
The first installation of the Great Power Arc.

Even Super Heroes could use a little help from their friends from time to time. Spider-Man is fortunate to have an amazing array of friends and allies to help him in this latest expansion to Vs. System 2PCG. Look for a variety of spectacular supporting characters from Black Cat to Aunt May! This set also includes an infamous black suit, that while a bit too clingy, does offer some new abilities and Symbiote equipment to our friendly neighborhood Spider-Man.

Vs. System 2PCG: Spider-Friends showcases 55 new cards that are centered on the webslinger and his friends. Including Main Characters, Supporting Characters, Plot Twists, and a Special Location. Vs System 2PCG: Spider-Friends can be combined with any other Vs System 2PCG sets.

This is not a stand-alone game.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: In Deo Veritas: Fast Play Rules for Exciting Seventeenth Century Battles in Smaller Scales
description:
Designed to recreate actual battles, In Deo Veritas focuses on the command decisions needed to maintain the motivation of the army. The six actual battle scenarios provide a range of different challenges from the warfare of the seventeenth century.

Battles are played at the brigade level with all major elements are on 75mm/3" wide bases.
Using smaller scale figures (6-15mm) lets players give their units a realistic feel.
The ground scale of 1" = 40yds means the typical 6ft x 4 ft table is large enough to accommodate most battles of the period.

Most players will already have everything needed to play (d6, tape measure and a deck of cards).

To learn the rules will take 2 hours or so using some of the smaller battles. Once you have become familiar with the core elements then your games will flow more quickly and a larger battle such as Wittstock should last for 3-4 hours depending on the arrival of the reinforcements!

Nothing is certain; but generals that hone their skills are more likely to be victorious.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Etrigan (The Demon)
description:
Etrigan is a demon prince of Hell who was bound to the mortal, Jason Blood. They have walked the Earth (and the depths of Hell) together as both comrades and enemies for over a millennium.

This expansion adds Etrigan (The Demon) to the game.

Season 2 expansion.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: The Thinning Veil
description:
The Thinning Veil is a 1-4 player solo or co-operative board game of horror fantasy inspired by Celtic mythology and Irish legend. It can be played as a narrative based progressive campaign across many scenarios or as one shot games from the Game Night Scenarios book. This gives players the option of an adventure game format or a dungeoncrawl experience. This roguelike system offers elements of puzzle solving, objective based and narrative based scenarios, and compelling gameplay, exploring a world familiar yet fantastical.

Once you have selected a Hero your journey begins! Will you be valorous and pure, or villainous and corrupt? Will your legend help bring humanity to a new dawn of fresh hope or prolong the night, plunging us into ever deeper darkness? Confront treacherous and deceitful cultists with hidden agendas, fight restless spirits and veil-dwelling horrors from the Land of the Dead; combat or outwit the denizens of the Other Side of Midnight, in this exciting game of high adventure!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Devoured: Fallen Colossus
description:
Devoured (Fallen Colossus) is a dark solo narrative-driven tabletop adventure game, inspired by retro horror, 80s role-playing games and ‘choose your own adventure’ books. In Devoured you will take on the role of a lost traveler, making your way through a strange land in the hope of discovering both your identity and the role you have taken in the desolation of the land around you.

Your quest will be extremely tough. The environment is bleak and hostile. You will have to battle brutal enemies, avoid horrific traps, manage limited resources and sometimes rely on fate to get you through this overwhelming task. Only at the end will you discover the truth about yourself.

Devoured has over 100 narrative cards spread over 6 levels, 37 unique enemies to battle, 20 unique weapons, 6 possible endings and a unique health management mechanism that will require clever tactical thinking from you in order to stay alive and complete your quest. Devoured also has extra unique play modes that will keep the game fresh and exciting each time you bring it to the table.

Are you ready to be Devoured?
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: Clans of Caledonia: Industria
description:
Explore new strategies, lead new clans, and adapt to the industrial revolution.

This expansion introduces among other things new clans, port tiles, end of round scoring tiles and a contract refill board.

Milestones and awards increase how players can score points and increase the replayability.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Contracts, Market, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Santorini: Riddle of the Sphinx
description:
Santorini: The Riddle of the Sphinx is a co-operative expansion for Santorini that adapts the competitive experience into an ongoing adventure that players navigate together.

In this expansion comprised of a series of scenarios called "riddles", players will seek to complete tactical objectives to solve the riddles. However, if players exhaust their supply of Santorini tower pieces before an objective is completed, the riddle remains unsolved and must be played again.

Each successfully solved riddle allows players to progress on the adventure map and unlock new gods to add into future riddles.

Can you complete the full adventure and solve the riddle of the Sphinx?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Ancient, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Gray Death Legion
description:
From the back of the book:

The Gray Death Legion scenario set describes major battles fought by the unit, as told in the novels Decision at Thunder Rift, Mercenary's Star, and The Price of Glory. You will follow the Legion's rise from a mere three 'Mechs to a full combined arms regiment feared and admired by both enemies and friends. The set also provides the statistics and condition of the Gray Death Companions and the conditions of their 'Mechs. Also included are 15 scenarios of some of the more notable battles fought by the Legion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Ancient Hearts
description:
Ancient Hearts, the second expansion for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle, reveals the tragic legacies of the Mediterranean Kindred. In forboding cities and mysterious tombs, the Kindred risk corruption and seek redemption. The vampires of the Camarilla pursue lost humanitas, but many of their enemies follow different paths. The assassins of Clan Assamite and the Followers of Set work to fulfill their own dreadful prophecies - one clan seeks to enslave the Camarilla; the other, to eradicate it.

This second expansion features 179 new cards. No new rules are introduced.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Horror, Negotiation
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Las Ligas de la Ñ Galaxia MusiChess
description:
Las Ligas de la Ñ Galaxia MusiChess is a strategy board game for two players based on characters created by MusiChess members. The game symbolizes a battle between two leagues, with the objective of capturing all the opponent’s pieces first.

The game is played on a 6x6 board. The pieces are represented through cards, having each one its own movement.

The player one is the Black League and the player two is the Red League. Players take turns to choose and place over the board the six initial pieces. Every player can only have one piece of each type. The Black League starts. In every turn, players can only move once.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: Doom Pilgrim
description:
This solo card game is a roguelike adventure in the form of 90 cards (2times the size of a classic MtG card) with pictures on the whole front sides and texts on the whole back sides.

You represent a doubtful hero struggling through his miserable fate in a grim medieval open world full of mortal dangers and cruelty.

On every turn, you take 3 cards from the top of the deck that represents your future. From the three cards, just based on the images, you choose one path to reject, one path to postpone, and one path to go. The path you have taken is then revealed - you turn the card, read the story, make some decisions according to the text and apply the eventual changes, losses, or gains to your character sheet or just a piece of paper. This way you build your fate of a medieval pilgrim-hero and you try to survive the whole journey to the bottom of the "your future" deck. There are fights, NPCs, equipment, and many more... just as in a gamebook (a very grim & dark one, full of odd meetings) but there is no dice rolling, everything depends on your decisions and on the path you had gone before. For the next play, you will possibly remember what image hides what kind of event or fight, so you may choose your path wiser, according to your current equipment, and fitness.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Medieval
mechanics: Events, Role Playing

name: Middara: Unintentional Malum – Act 2
description:
The first Adventure Expansion for Middara. Second part of the Unintentional Malum Trilogy.
Unintentional Malum Act 2 contains Adventure Book, Crawl Book, Diagram Book, Plastic Miniatures, new cards plus so much more!

THE STORY CONTINUES
These Adventure Expansions continue Unintentional Malum's epic story. These Expansions contain far more than your typical expansion pack. Each Adventure Expansion gives you a massive amount of content that rivals something close to even our original products that they expand. This is to provide the basis for what Middara is all about, story telling, character growth, and continuity.

Each Adventure Expansion gives you at least 40 additional hours of gameplay by extending not only the Base Game they require, but also the surrounding optional ways of playing Middara, including the Crawl Mode.

NEW LOCATIONS
Each Adventure Pack contains a plethora of beautiful tiles. You'll find airships, exotic floating tombs, deeper levels of the white vaults, and even other worldly locations.

MINIATURES & MONSTERS
The story continues as you take your characters into even higher levels of power and face off against even more dangerous and diverse creatures!
New weird creatures inhabit the world. Learn their lore, learn their weaknesses, and kill them.

MORE CRAWL MODE OPTIONS
Each Adventure Expansion contains a set of unique Crawl Mode adventures to play when you don't have time to enjoy the gigantic story. In addition, you'll find that the Crawl Mode's depth has been optionally expanded and it's balance and options more fine tuned for quick and efficient play for those who want that old school dungeon crawler experience.
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Red Rock Gulch Game Supplement
description:
Description from the publisher:

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Canyons Encounters for Shadows of Brimstone (The Canyons are in the Shadows of Brimstone: Other Worlds – Blasted Wastes), themed for exploring in that dusty locale.

CONTENTS

Card #316 Watchers on the Ridge ×2
Card #317 Smoke Signals ×2
Card #318 The Mountain's Slumber
Card #319 Storm Clouds
Card #320 Something in the River
Card #321 The Hanging Tree
Card #322 Outlaw Trail
Card #323 The Last Man
Card #324 Red Rock Shootout
Card #325 Floating Barrels
Card #326 The Devil's Tongue
Card #327 Firefly Valley
Card #328 The White Buffalo
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Till Death Do Us Part
description:
Two new Principle cards that were included with the Pinpups Intimacy Couple, which is not part of the game.

This cinematic pair is accompanied by new Kingdom Death: Monster promo material: prototype rules. Principle: Bonding is a lasting choice. Decide what partnership means to your settlement and replace your partnership innovation. Will partners strive for a lasting legacy in the future or to leave the biggest mark on the world with their combined fury. These rules are optional content for your game that may have far-reaching consequences for your campaign. Prototype rules are currently evaluated at KD HQ but we enjoy their thematic possibilities and offer this new content as is.

When the lantern light is at its dimmest, there's no one else I'd rather have at my back. The Intimacy Couple faces peril together, unflinching faith in their union to the end, even as it draws near.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Honeybee Hive Mind
description:
A map for advanced players. Players represent bees working to pollinate their network of flower fields, but competition exists against ever-present rival bee populations, making deliveries painfully expensive. Every turn gives players the opportunity to sting their opponents or fall mercilessly prey to other players’ schemes. Embrace the struggle, feel the pain!

-description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Loans, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Selection Order Bid, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Auction, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 2
description:
Iconic Heroes is the latest release in the Pathfinder Battles series of pre-painted plastic miniatures from WizKids Games and Paizo Publishing.

Iconic Heroes Set 2 includes six all-new miniatures featuring legendary characters from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game universe:

Amiri, Iconic Barbarian
Ezren, Iconic Wizard
Kyra, Iconic Cleric
Merisiel, Iconic Rogue
Harsk, Iconic Ranger
Biter, Badger Animal Companion

Each Iconic Heroes set also includes exclusive Cards (one for each miniature) for use in the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game! These special Cards are only available in this Pathfinder Battles product!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Sailor & Gamer Pack
description:
2 new characters's to use with the basegame along with miniatures from Awaken Realms and triple -layered player boards.

The set contains:
4 Sailor figures (2 male and 2 female)
4 Gamer figures (2 male and 2 female)
1 triple-layered player board for Sailor (2-sided)
1 triple-layered player board for Gamer (2-sided)

Rules for the Gamer: One new survivor to take with you on your adventures in Robinson Crusoe: The Gamer. Like all characters in Robinson Crusoe, there is both a male and female side. This survivor is different from those in the base game. They have no invention, using only their wiles and tricks to help the party succeed.

The available actions are as follows:

Dummy Player: "I'm surprised how easy this is!'" Discard 3(D) to gain Brown/Grey Action pawn this turn.

AC Bonus: "Never count your money while you're sitting at the table." Spend 2(D) to ignore one wound when hunting.

Cheat: "I will do the right thing, once I've exhausted all alternatives." After resolving an Adventure card effect, spend 3(D) to NOT shuffle it into the Event deck, and discard it.

Go Fish: "I suggest a new alternative. Let the island win." Spend 3(D) to draw two Mystery cards. Resolve only the first Treasure from the drawn cards. Discard the rest.

Rules for the Sailor:
The sailor is a great swimmer. He can discard two determination tokens to ignore river tiles when calculating distance on the island.

The sailor has a treasure map. For three determination tokens, he can take a special gathering action once on an island tile with a totem icon. If successful, the Sailor draws a mystery card, resolving only a trap or a treasure. This ability may only be used once per tile, even if the tile has more than one totem icon.

The sailor has some tricks to conserve food. For 2 determination tokens, he can change one food into one non-perishable food.

The sailor is also tough. He can discard 1 determination token to re-roll an injury die (brown, grey or green).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Nautical, Novel-based, Territory Building
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Hold My Beer
description:
Hold My Beer is a game that uses a Tarot deck and is a must follow trick taker that features bidding, point capturing and special powers on select cards. If you can’t follow then you must trump and if possible you must over trump.

The game is played over the course of 2-6 hands which consists of 18 cards per player. Players will be predicting what position they finish in a hand based on the number of points they capture.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: The Other Side
description:
Set in the same alternate history timeline as Malifaux, The Other Side covers wars fought back on Earth between human factions and the nightmarish invaders from the other side.

A "battle" scale game, a starter force consists of one Commander and three Squads of nine fighters each. The game aims to combine streamlined rules with tactical depth, and forgoes dice for combat resolution in favour of cards (just like Malifaux).

An extensive miniatures line will be provided.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000: Heroes of Black Reach – Stronghold Castellum
description: One double-sided terrain board for Heroes of Black Reach. One side features a stronghold castle, whereas the other side features a blank battlefield, ready to be included in your fights!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #53 – Iwo Jima
description:
The battle for Iwo Jima was one of the most difficult and hard-fought in the Pacific campaign, from February to March 1945. The Japanese defenders were dug into well-entrenched underground bunkers and natural cave systems on the island, and even though the Americans had numerical, logistical and aerial supremacy, a high price was paid for the hard-won victory. In the iconic photo of the six Marines raising a flag over Mount Suribachi, three were killed in action days after, testament to the ferocity of the fighting.

Warfighter WWII Expansion - #53 Iwo Jima presents new subterranean locations with close-quarter impediments (such as locked doors and booby traps), along with new soldiers and skills focussed on built-up area combat, reflecting the indomitable fortitude of the US Marines over the five-week campaign as they rooted out the enemy from tunnels and holes.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Japanese Hostiles, US Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills:

3 x Player Soldiers
3 x Non-Player Soldiers
3 x Squad Soldiers
2 x Weapons and Equipment
3 x Service Record Cards
3 x Skills
6 x Missions
6 x Objectives
12 x Locations
15 x Hostiles

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: The Shipwreck Arcana: The Restless Hours Promo Card
description:
An alternate Hours card delivered with Atma RPG Kickstarter, with Atma-themed art and the variant Doom rules from the PnP on Shipwreck Arcana site.

Alternate rules for "doomed" difficulty.

Setup:
1. Shuffle the deck of arcana cards.
2. Remove all but 15 cards from the game.
3. Begin play as normal, but without the doom tracker.

Gameplay:
- Whenever doom would be accrued, instead remove that many cards from the bottom of the deck.
- When a faded power is used, remove it from the game instead of returning it to the bottom of the deck.

Winning/losing:
- Players win when they reach 7 points.
- Players lose if no deck remains when a card fades or doom is accrued.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Math, Number, Print & Play
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: The Karms
description:
The Karms is a new finger flicking game with just a dash of dicey luck.

Played on a 13X13 grid players are trying to be the first to flick each of the eight pieces (think backgammon or crokinole discs) across the board.

Pieces are introduced, or moved based on the roll of two D6 dice. A piece can move the value of a single die.

Each player also has a steel guard piece he places at the end of a turn.

The flicking part comes at the start of the 2nd players turn. His first action is to place a wall piece and then user the striker disc.

The striker is 'flicked' and can rebound off the wall. The idea is to push an opponent's piece farther from its goal, or advance one of his own pieces closer.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Bow Down
description:
Bow Down is a card game, focused on amassing an army, deceiving your opponents and destroying the opposition. The game play is fast-paced and the rules are easy to learn. Players will have to not only focus on their own resources, but on their opponents’ as well. Deceiving and redirecting the attention of others towards one opponent is a key strategy to winning the game. Players will also have several cards that they can use in order to cripple the enemy army and turn the tide of the game. As a king, you need to be wise in your actions. If you are, all will Bow Down!

Bow Down is a card game including 72 cards. The package is focused on portability and ease of use. The game requires two players in order to play, but can be played with up to 8 people. One play through of the game lasts 10-20 minutes. Do you have what it takes to make your enemies Bow Down to you?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – TIE/vn Silencer Expansion Pack
description:
The TIE/vn silencer is the most elite starfighter developed for the First Order by Sienar-Jaemus Fleet Systems. Built in the depths of the Unknown Regions with the technologies that once made the TIE defender an unprecedented threat, this dreaded craft can threaten any Resistance ship—provided the pilot can handle its power and speed.

The TIE/vn Silencer Expansion Pack gives you everything you need to add one of these menacing ships to your First Order squadrons. Featuring a beautifully re-sculpted TIE/vn silencer miniature, this pack also contains six ship cards identical to the TIE/vn silencer ship cards found in the First Order Conversion Kit along with reprints of five upgrade cards uniquely tailored to take advantage of the silencer's capabilities.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic Triland
description:
Description from the rulebook:
Magic Triland is a small, forgotten island in the ocean. The island emerged when a volcano erupted a long time ago. The lava cooled to form a terraced landscape and with time the island became inhabited by people. Kingdoms emerged in the three corners of the island, all there to extract noble metals from the lava.
Today, the kingdoms are ruled by the Queens of Copper and Gold and the King of Silver. Alchemists have settled on the misty shores. Alchemists have the ability to transmute the gold, silver and copper into magic pearls. The kingdoms send out messengers to get magic pearls made by the alchemists and to bring them back to the kingdom. All the messengers wear rings made from the noble metals. They’re on the move day and night, exchanging the rings among themselves as alchemists require two different metals in order to make a magic pearl. It is therefore customary on Magic Triland to carry out trades by bartering at every encounter. A kingdom possessing magic pearls, possesses the highest wisdom and magical power.

User summary:
The game is played on a board with hexagonal blocks of different heights, that form a different board every time. Each player has to pawns with rings (metals), that come in each players color. He moves his pieces using cards covering the height difference between the blocks. Exchanging rings between players when playing pieces meet, enable a player to collect pearls along the side of the board. First player to bring home a pearl of the color opposite to his starting hexagon wins the game
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Mayfair Games Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #5
description:
The Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #5 is composed of 3 expansions:

Five Points: Gangs of New York – Flophouse
Includes 1 extra building tile. If you control this building's space at the end of the round, then you can remove up to 3 of your rabble from any neighborhood tile and return them to your headquarters.

Steam: City Growth Special Contracts
Includes 5 city growth markers on 5 colors. They can be used instead of the normal gray city growth markers. You place 1 of these markers on to the city when you are using the City Growth action. Now this city has a one-time demand for that color cube. When 1 cube of the marker's color has been shipped to the city, then the marker is turned to the other side, which is exactly the same as a normal city growth marker.

Alchemist: All for One, Two for All
Includes a new variant cauldron and a 3/7 potion value tile which can only be played on the new cauldron.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module Y3 – Early Years III
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Module Y3 comprises a 100-page SSD book, including:
Early battleships for the Federation, Kzintis, and Gorns.

Warp-refitted command cruisers for the rest of the Federation member states before the unified star fleet was formed.

Warp-driven dreadnoughts for the five member species of the Inter-Stellar Concordium before they coalesced into one nation.

The 64-page rulebook includes five scenarios as well as the ship descriptions and annexes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dust Tactics: Allies P-48 Pelican – "Bellowing Bertie / Diving Dotty"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the world of Dust Tactics, the Allies have been hard at work developing a means to meet the threat of Axis jets: the P-48. The Allies P-48 Pelican is capable of taking off with a very short runway, making this light and versatile fighter easy to deploy. Triple Dual .50 cal machine guns give the Pelican a serious edge against enemies in the air and quickly eats through infantry. Fire rockets from afar with the Bellowing Bertie configuration, or bomb your enemies into oblivion with Diving Dotty.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Orc Army Reinforcements
description: Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Orc Army faction. It includes new types of cards.
mechanics: Variable Phase Order

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Ironjawz
description:
The Ironjawz are the biggest and hardest orruks of all. Clad in thick pig-iron armour and swinging enormous, bone breaking weapons, they live for nothing more than the chance to wreak untold devastation across the realms.

If you’re looking to dominate the Eightpoints for Gorkamorka (or just for a good laugh), then this is the Warcry set for you! Designed to make kicking off or expanding a diverse warband of Ironjawz simple, it also contains a number of accessories to help you in your games. What’s more, you’ll save money compared to getting the models inside separately!

–description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Sword Weirdos: A Skirmish Heartbreaker
description:
If you've never played Space Weirdos, you might wonder what will make Sword Weirdos different from other fantasy skirmish games. Not much! It takes what I like from other games and mashes it all together.

Low model count: 4-10 models or so for each side.
Use any minis you have.
Short but comprehensive. Everything in one 16ish page zine.
Minimal tokens, but still a few because I like them.
No tape measures or rulers, all movement and ranges are measured with 5” sticks.
Uses all your RPG dice (except the d20, d20's get enough love) because dice are fun.
A points system, but you shouldn’t worry about it too much.
Alternating activations, opposed rolls, Maneuver Points, and random tables mean everyone is involved and rolling dice all the time.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight

name: Arydia: The Paths We Dare Tread – Epic Hunt
description:
Epic Hunt will offer to players an exciting new challenge to overcome by adding to the game a new boss enemy.

The expansion box contains 1 pre-painted miniature, 27 cards, and 9 alternates of the skills contained within the base game.

Kickstarter exclusive mini-expansion.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Heroes of Normandie: Steiner Kampfgruppe
description: Heroes of Normandie KickStarter exclusive promo
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Blitz Bowl: Chaos Team
description:
Blitz Bowl is a fast paced sports game that pits two teams against each other in a battle to achieve touchdowns, complete Challenges and score the most Points! The Chaos Team expansion provides everything necessary for use with Blitz Bowl, including cards, bases and a full sprue with Player figures, Coin, Score Marker and Balls.

There are 6 Chaos figures in orange plastic, all with unique sculpts:

2x Blocker
4x Beastman Runner

One card is provided for each type; assembly instructions included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust to Dust
description:
Dust to Dust is a competitive deckbuilding and disintegration game set in a reclaimed world.

In the game, you grew up on an Island in the sky. But they didn’t tell you it was falling into the gene-splicing black sand of the Dust until you became a Diver. Now you race other Divers through the Dust itself, retrieving all the fusion shards you can to be the one who restores your Island to the sky.

To win, you’ll need help from allies recruited from the creatures who still dwell on Urth, like the plant-animal hybrid Biofauna, the newly sentient Machina, or the fearsome remains of humanity called the Colony.

Gameplay
Players draft cards from a market by purchasing them with starting energy coin cards
Players play actions (Allies) from their hand after adding them to their decks, leading to combos
Players also interact with each other by attacking or defending with their actions (Allies)

When the Final Race is triggered, each player takes one more turn, besides the player who triggered it. Fusion Shards are then counted up by each player according to diamond icons on their Relics, Fusion Fragments, and Allies.

The winner is the Diver who accumulates the most fusion shards across their acquired Relics, Fusion Fragments, and Allies.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Retrieval, Market, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Monopoly: Edizione Bergamo
description:
Monopoly Edizione Bergamo, this edition takes in the Italian city of Bergamo in Lombardy.

The board shows the Bergamasque toponymy: places such as Monterosso, Redona, the Piazza Vecchia or San Vigilio.

This edition is published after the city was badly hit by the Covid pandemic in early 2020, and part of its benefits will go to the Mutual Aid Fond setup by the municipality.


Monopoly Edizione Bergamo, questa edizione si svolge nella città italiana di Bergamo in Lombardia.

Il tabellone mostra la toponomastica bergamasca: luoghi come Monterosso, Redona, Piazza Vecchia o San Vigilio.

Questa edizione è stata pubblicata dopo che la città è stata duramente colpita dalla pandemia di Covid all'inizio del 2020 e parte dei suoi benefici andranno al Fondo di Mutuo Soccorso istituito dal comune.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pili: The New Challengers
description:
Pili is a glove puppetry television show from Taiwan. Unlike traditional puppet shows, Pili never shows the puppeteers and relies heavily on CGI and other various special effects during action sequences, which can run the length of the entire episode. Pili has had meteoric success, with at one point having 90% viewership in Taiwan. Since its debut in 1984, Pili has spawned several spinoff series and movies in various countries.

In Pili: The New Challengers, players are new characters in the fantasy world of Pili and will need to quickly enhance their skills and abilities for the epic battles ahead. You will harness qi, gain new skills, encounter legendary heroes, alter your destiny, procure ancient weapons, and challenge legendary characters from the Pili universe. Grow your knowledge and skills quickly as the game ends in an epic battle between players. Will you perish and be forgotten? Or will you fulfill your destiny and become a Pili legend?!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Action Drafting, Follow, Hidden Movement, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources

name: El Rebaño
description:
El Rebaño is not a usual card game... You’ll have to go around the table while bleating like a sheep, howl out loud while the rest of the players hide or be the shepherd that calls out the flock, so all the sheep go running towards him… It sounds crazy, right?

The aim of the game is to get rid of your cards. You play a card from your stack in the center of the table and then the turn will follow depending on the card played: Is it a coloured sheep card? The player with that colour will play the next card. Is it a special card like the wolf, the shepherd or the dog? The players will have to perform the action... It might even get dark and nobody will know which colour is for a while! Stay alert in the pen, don’t make any mistake, or you’ll get all the cards from the center of the table!

El Rebaño is an active, fast reaction card game for the whole flock at home!


El Rebaño no es un juego de cartas como los demás... ¿En qué juego tienes que dar vueltas a una mesa balando como una oveja? ¿O dar un largo aullido mientras los demás se esconden? ¿O que tenga turnos salteados? Por no decir que tienes que hacer de pastor, irte de la mesa y llamar al resto de las ovejas para que acudan corriendo hacia ti. ¿Te parecen suficientes razones para probar "El Rebaño"?

Cada jugador tendrá que deshacerse de su montón de cartas de la mano antes que los demás. Las cartas se juegan de una en una sobre la mesa, pero los turnos van saltando, ya que el siguiente jugador en jugar una carta será el jugador que sea del color de la oveja jugada. Pero a veces en vez de ovejas salen perros pastores (que inician duelos), lobos (que aullan), flores (para comérselas), el rpopio pastor (que llama al rebaño yéndose de la mesa de juego) y hasta se hace de noche (no sabiendo durante un rato que color eres). El primer jugador en quedarse sin cartas ganará la partida.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hot Potato, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Role Playing, Speed Matching

name: Sherlock Holmes Détective Conseil: L'Homme Sans Visage
description:
The 20th investigation for Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective.
In 1887, you're going to investigate across London about the mysterious Man without Face.
Will you solve the mystery?
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: A Touch of Evil: Something Wicked – Dark Revelations Game Supplement
description:
The Dark Revelations Supplement is a Web-exclusive for 'A Touch of Evil' and features 15 new game cards to expand on Card Decks from the A Touch of Evil: Something Wicked Expansion. You must have a copy of the Something Wicked Expansion to use these new cards.

The cards are exclusive to this supplement and will not be available anywhere else. They feature all new artwork.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Ovation
description:
Become one of the greatest classical composers of all time! You'll use inspiration, seek fortune and hobnob with aristocrats to perform musical masterpieces and achieve your legacy in this engine building game for 1-4 players. Get inspired by your rivals' performances to create your own works of genius as the game builds to a crescendo.

Each turn, players choose one of four actions: Seek Inspiration, Seek Fortune, Seek Patronage, or Perform. Inspiration is your primary resource and it comes in three tones - Joy, Passion and Sorrow. Seeking inspiration allows you to gain your resource while all of the other actions will have players spend inspiration to acquire cards. Fortune cards help build your engine, which can allow you to gain bonus actions on your turn. Patron cards can also help build your engine or can give you bonus legacy points for end game scoring. Chamber Music and Concert Music cards give you lots of legacy points, but every time you perform, your opponents can attend your performance and gain inspiration. You will not only have a special ability as your specific composer, but you are also the only person who can compose your very own Magnum Opus. Complete specific goals to gain Maestro cards and end the game.

Compose your masterpiece. Secure your legacy.

—description from the designer
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Music
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlespace: Ultra Modern Solo Skirmish Game
description:
Battlespace is an Ultra Modern military tabletop solo (or cooperative) game.

The player(s) selects 4 pre-made soldiers (a battle card each, containing all the information needed) for his team.
The simple AI directs the opposition, by drawing cards and acting accordingly.

Turns are divided in 3 phases.

Winning is conditioned by succeeding the mission.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Breacan
description:
[for more information on this game and to play online, visit www.allumbra.com]

Lost in the ancient Celtic migration across Europe, this game was played between the clan chieftains to resolve disputes peacefully rather than resort to a costly and bloody war. It was played on a swatch of ornamental cloth familiar to this day as a "plaid". Instead of stones used in the traditional game, this variation presented here uses dice as the playing pieces.

To win at Breacan - and thus resolve the dispute in your favor, you must be the first to weave a path from one side of the Breacan to the opposite side.

Placing the dice
On your turn, place two of your four rolled dice. After your turn has ended, two more dice will be automatically rolled to replace the two you rolled.

Dice can be placed in two ways:
1. They can be placed on a square of your own color (e.g. red on red) when that square has no vertical or horizontal neighbors.
2. They can be placed on any square as long as each adjacent (horizontally or vertically) neighboring die of your color is either one higher or one lower than the die being placed. Note: 6 can be placed next to a 1 and 1 next to a 6.

Winning
The first player to complete a path from top to bottom or from side to side is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Triangle
description: (From the box) Triangle is unlike any other board game you've ever played. Yet it has one thing in common with all the classic games - it doesn't yield its secrets all at once. Played at basic level, Triangle is as enjoyable and as satisfying as draughts. It's almost as easy to play too. Except that the moves with which you capture your opponent's pieces are far more varied and interesting.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement
publishers: James Upton Ltd., Triangle Technologies Ltd.

name: Touch
description:
Every player has 12 wooden pieces ("J"-shaped hexacubes) and must place them on a 7*7 board, one at time, trying to touch the bigger number of already placed opponent's pieces. For every opponent's piece, which the new piece is touching, the player gets one point.
Obviously, the player with most points at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Rhein-Reise
description:
This game is an old version of "Deutschlandreise", but you travel around the Rhine area instead of whole Germany.

Each player receives 9 destination cards. The first card (any color)sets the starting place, the 8 other cards come in two of each color (red, orange, blue, green). The players have to move along the board by throwing a die. The first player who has visited all of his/her destination cards and arrives back in the starting place wins the game. To travel between the cities along the Rhine (blue cards), the players have to use the "Rheingold-Express" (train), where the dice throws count double.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Road to Washington
description:
"ROAD TO WASHINGTON: The Battle of Second Bull Run", is a highly detailed Tactical level simulation of the American Civil War Battle of Second Bull Run, using the "Battles of the War of Rebellion" wargame system on a hexagon grid game map.
Road to Washington includes both Basic and Advanced rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Naval Warfare: World War 1
description:
NWS: NW-WW1 is a continuation of the NWS: Naval Warfare series of next generation comprehensive naval wargames covering entire time periods of naval combat. Easy to learn yet fun to play and detailed for the scale represented thus giving quality combat results. NWS: NW-WW1 is designed to cover many of the major navies that fought during WW1 and includes submarines, seaplane carriers, aircraft, dreadnoughts, pre-dreadnoughts, battlecruisers, armored cruisers, light cruisers, destroyers, coastal batteries, land units, and much more! Data cards show the combat details of each individual class of ship, sub, and aircraft and are represented with detailed side view graphics for easy recognition. Solitaire and multi-player rules are included. Future expansion packs will include even more units and navies. Free downloadable combat assistance program with sound effects and combat animations!


Nearly 700 gray scale unit data cards representing 196 ship classes, 24 aircraft types, 12 airships, 30 submarine classes, 12 coastal batteries/land units, merchants, raiders, and transports.
50 page printed rule book with 20 scenarios in 3 ring clasp folder.
7 Color maps, 2 color combat matrices, and 204 1/2" color counters printed on heavy card stock.
2 search matrices, 2 play sequence charts and 4 reference charts printed on heavy card stock.
90 plastic combat markers, and 2 red & 2 blue 6 sided dice.
Campaigns covering the North, Baltic, and Mediterranean Seas.
Tactical and strategic battles covering surface combat, aircraft carriers, convoys, submarines, aircraft, amphibious operations, etc..
200+ B&W ordnance and color marker cards.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Games of the World
description:
Games of the World: How to Make Them, How to Play Them, How They Came to Be

From the slip cover:

From backgammon to the 3,000-year-old Royal Game of Ur, from Oriental kit contests to the universal tit-tat-toe and tug of war, this richly illustrated volume brings together for the first time more than one hundred of the world's most fascinating and enjoyable games.

Hundreds of color and black-and-white photographs, paintings, and diagrams, and complete step-by-step instructions tell how to make the games, how to play them, and how they came to be. Simple enough for the home crafts person to construct, many of the games will not only provide hours of fun, but will also be unusual and lasting objects of art.

This grand tour of the games of people as diverse as Arctic Eskimos, African tribesmen, and American schoolchildren provides unexpected insights into life in other cultures -- surprising similarities and intriguing differences -- for the games of a people reflect their history, folklore, and traditions.

Based on years of research in over sixty countries, Games of the World should be an indispensable part of any family library -- an enduring and appropriate gift for anyone of any age.
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Bra Böcker, Holt Rinehart Winston, Lademann Forlagsaktieselskab, Wolfgang Krüger Verlag

name: Piquet: Din of Battle – Colonial Warfare 1845-1914 2nd Edition
description:
Din of Battle covers the conflicts between the colonial powers of the 19th century and the native peoples of their intended colonies.

These rules plead no cause - most of the causes for which these past warriors fought are long ago gone. In many cases the "winners" would be surprised if they returned today to view modern South Africa, Egypt, China, or Morocco. So what these rules celebrate is the honor and bravery of men who fought for lost reasons in remote and alien lands and the courage of men who attempted to save a doomed and, in some cases, brutish way of life.

It also commemorates some of the kindest, meanest, most charitable, most selfish, bravest, most craven, brightest and most incorrigibly ignorant people that have ever walked the earth: the Victorian on a mission, the Calif with murder in his heart, the merciless Zulu, the totally mad Gordon confronting the equally mad Mahdi. What color! What excitement! This is the era of the mysteries of the Nile's source, or the hidden interior of Peking's Imperial City!

Expands:

Piquet: Master Rules for Wargaming
categories: American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Mabinogion
description: In days long ago, great Celtic heroes and heroines carved out kingdoms for themselves in the land we now call Wales. Legend tells of their encounters with conceited dragons, evil witches, ferocious giants, terrifying wights, and not forgetting the fickle but powerful Fair Folk. Mabinogion brings Celtic legend to life by allowing you to role play, and share the fate of, those characters. You will fulfil hazardous quests in your search for fame and fortune, whilst trying to prevent your rivals from doing the same. Love, war, luck, and clever diplomacy all play a part as the game unfolds. Mabinogion is a Welsh word meaning ʻstories of heroesʼ, and many heroic adventures await you in the game. So take a journey back to the Dark Ages and live amongst the legend, myth, and romance of ancient Wales!
mechanics: Area Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warbirds in Miniature
description:
Warbirds in Miniature is a game that recreates the epic struggles in the skies during World War II. The game is designed to be played by 2 or more people, although solitaire play is still very possible.

Players select the maneuver that their aircraft will perform from a maneuver schedule unique to each aircraft. Once all the players have revealed their maneuvers, players move their aircraft and then the shooting begins.

The game provides for the use of air/flight stands to be used with miniatures, and is played on a hexmat large enough to hold several aircraft at a time. When planes are damaged, they are marked with either counters or specially made clips resembling smoke or fire.

The Warbirds in Miniature Rules package comes with a 34 page rulebook, 2 double sided sets of charts, 2 double sided sample aircraft sheets, and a CD with over 50 Aircraft sheets covering all the major combat aircraft flown in World War 2. The CD also includes some early Jets for later World War 2 and for use in Korean War scenarios.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Affen Angeln
description: Each player controls an ape, goal is to swing from limb to limb (movement is done over tiles).
mechanics: Race, Tile Placement

name: Bloody Barons
description: A set of medieval miniatures rules covering combat in The Wars of the Roses, in the well regarded Peter Pig rule sets range designed by the RFCM Team. There is a supporting range of miniatures.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: One Bullet, One German: The Uprising and Battles East of Warsaw, Aug-Sept. 1944
description:
One Bullet, One German covers the Polish uprising in Warsaw and the military operations in the immediately envi-rons east of the city in August, 1944. It was critical time for the German: not only was there the Warsaw Uprising to con-tend with, but a few miles east of the city, the German panzers were reeling back from a massive Red onslaught. The only up-side for the German was their keen ability to multitask with weakened forces. The Russians had their own set of problems. The onslaught had created directional problems as their armies approached the Vistula River. Because of this, their strength was divided. Many forces were ordered to seize bridgeheads across this key river south of Warsaw. Others were ordered to move along the Vistula north to Warsaw, still others, simply advance westward. The Russian forces were fast approaching the end of their supply chain after advancing hundreds of miles. Their tanks had also taken a toll from combat and breakdowns. All units had arrived in the area of Warsaw in a tired and weakened state.

The main reason for the Polish uprising was to seize the bridges and portions of Praga, the east part of the city east of the Vistula. It was hoped that the Russian forces would meet them there and cleanse the area of Germans. This is what the game covers: the Uprising and the last panzer victory a few miles east of the city where the 3rd Tank Corps’ was ripped apart by the withdrawing panzers!

The map scale is about 400 yards per hex on the Warsaw map and 1 mile on the East of Warsaw map. Each combat unit is a battalion unless otherwise designated. A game turn represents 4 days of time. Each Polish resistance fighter unit is around 500 men. The game uses a modified system used in ATO's Into the Beartrap game.

Two 11x17" maps, over 300 counters. Rules cover: Unit Activation, Random Events, Polish Ammo Limitations, Sewer Movement, Air Units, Close Assault, Divisional\Corps Integrity, Using "Karl", Barricades, Snipers, Rubble, Airdrops and more!
Map scale: 400 yards per hex (Warsaw map), 1 mile per hex (East of Warsaw map)
Unit scale: Battalion
Time scale: 4 days a turn
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Red Sun, Red Death: War without Mercy in the Pacific Theater
description: The first Theater Expansion for Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers: Infantry and Vehicle Small Unit Skirmish Wargaming in WWII covers the war in the Pacific with the Japanese, the USMC and the Chinese Army.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Drums of War Along the Mohawk
description:
These rules are designed to simulate land combat in North America during the French and Indian Wars, 1744-1766. The rules are geared to lower intensity warfare from skirmish level to brigade-sized actions. They may also be extended to the frontier warfare of the previous century as well as the era of the American War of Independence.

The style of the rules are "Old School" in the sense of relatively high figure density with considerable attention to actual unit organization. Extensive notes and information are provided in the rules book on units such as Scottish Highlanders, American Rangers, Canadian Militia, and Indian Allies among others. The rules also include such "chrome" elements as "How to Portray an Eighteenth Century Leader" (Chapter 4) as well as rules for colonial sieges.

The rules set concludes with the design for a campaign game set during the struggle for Lake George in New York state. An area map is also provided.
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Science vs Pluck
description:
Subtitled: or, Too Much for the Mahdi.

Unusual set of umpired miniatures rules depicting late 19th Century Colonial Campaigns in Africa.

In essence, the referee plays the part of the Mahdists while each player takes the part of an individual officer commanding part of a British force in the Sudan. This is done to simulate the asymmetrical nature of Colonial fighting in that region: the British often had an overwhelming advantage in firepower but were travelling through unknown territory and facing enemies of unknown number.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing
publishers: Hardcover Designs, Pulp Action Library, The (Virtual) Armchair General

name: In the Grand Manner
description:
In The Grand Manner is a miniatures rule set to simulate Napoleonic period land battles.

Each infantry or cavalry figure represents 20 men and each gun represents 2 guns. Each turn represents 30 minutes.
mechanics: Simulation

name: Deep Blue Death
description:
Deep Blue Death is a simple "beer & pretzels" wargame for two players. Each player controls a fleet of submarines and decoys by issuing a limited number of orders each turn. Players must manage their resources carefully to win. Victory conditions depend on the scenario.

The PDF includes rules, counters, scenarios and a map.

From the publisher's website:
In the year 2020 mankind finds themselves with little but submarines after a terrorist attack. Use your sonar to distinguish between subs and decoys. Fire rocket powered torpedoes through the water at 200 miles per hour! Dodge enemy torpedoes with noisemakers or evasive maneuvers. But manage your resources carefully; when you’re out of torpedoes, you’re just a target.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: The TSATF Scenario Portfolio 2000
description:
"Being A Subscription Of 24 Scenarios For Playing Table-Top Battles Of The British Empire"

A selection of scenarios and variant rules for The Sword and the Flame. The sides featured include the British, Dervish, Pathans, Zulus, Egyptians and Boers. In addition there are scenarios for the Sword in Africa variant rules. All scenarios include detailed maps, mission briefings, orders of battle and optional rules.

Expands:

The Sword and the Flame
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation
publishers: And That's The Way It Was...

name: Titan: Battlelands of Titan
description:
This is an expansion to the original Titan from Gorgonstar published in 1980.

Adds over 100 new monster counters to the game. Ten new character types. Eleven Expanded Tactical Displays.

The Avalon Hill edition compiled these two together in a refined release by AH in 1982.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Divide and Conquer
description:
Divide and Conquer is an abstract strategy board game for 2-4 players. As the Commander of a battalion of troops, you plan out and execute troop movements to secure objective regions around the game board. Your opponent’s competing troops will cause you to tangle and engage in conflict taking on causalities and slowing your pace to victory. You must anticipate the other players’ strategies by moving with precision and seizing the initiative. Sometimes your position is defensive to block an opponent from an objective and other times you are invading occupied regions to weaken the offensive of another player.

The game mechanics are based in mathematics and game theory, which provides an additional opponent. If you plan optimally, you will not only defeat the other players, but you will also solve the game with a minimal number of movements.

Divide and Conquer is played with 2-4 players of all ages with play lasting 30-45 minutes.

Home Page: http://www.divideandconquergame.com
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Friendly Fire Pack 3
description:
Friendly Fire Pack 3 contains eight scenarios featured in the Friendly Fire 2007 ASL tournament held in Linköping, Sweden.

Scenarios included:

FrF17 - The Marco Polo Bridge Incident
FrF18 - Through Fire and Ice
FrF19 - About His Shadowy Sides
FrF20 - Adolf's Amateurs
FrF21 - Cavalry Brigade Model
FrF22 - Wunderwaffe
FrF23 - Elephants Unleashed
FrF24 - Forging Spetsnaz
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Dominions of Supremacy
description:
A game about galactic exploration, colonization and conquests.

Dominions of Supremacy is a strategic boardgame that can be compared to classical computer games as Master of Orion, Startrek BOTF, or GalCiv etc. It's a 4X game which means that it's all about the eXploration, eXpansion, eXploit and eXtermination of other players.

The players represent different races that have just started to colonize the galaxy. By developing your home planet, creating new colonies and conquering the planets of your enemies you can win the game. Or, stay in the background and concentrate your strength to conquer the remaining few artifacts left by an ancient civilization, which may hold the key to the Universe's secrets.

The game is played on LinCon, one of Sweden's largest game convents with around one thousand attendants.
categories: Civilization, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: The Long Road North
description:
From the publisher's website:

These are American Civil War historical miniature wargame rules, using the simultaneous movement & firing method. There is a simple & limited written order system to enable the command structure & fog of battle to be reproduced without slowing the game down. To compliment this we have our brigadier system, where miniature generals have to command their forces, & are not just a morale bonus on a horse.

The rules use a scale of 1 figure represents 20 men, although smaller scales are used in some scenarios.

Base sizes are not important in LRN enabling them to be used with figures already based for many other sets of rules. There is also a points system for those who need one.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Knights of the Realm
description:
The King's influence has faded and the kingdom is in jeopardy of falling into chaos. Fortifications are in ruins and the villagers live in fear of the dragons that have come to reclaim the lands for their own.
In Knights of the Realm you control an elite cast of Knights that have been charged with three tasks: to establish the village defenses, rebuild the castles and seek out and defeat the dragons.
However, doing so is an expensive and dangerous undertaking; therefore tribute (gold) must be collected, strategic trades made and battles fought.
But beware, the dragons do not give up their land so easily.
So, remain strong, endure what you must and victory will be yours.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Trading

name: Full Sail: Fleet Actions in the Deep Ocean
description:
Full Sail: Fleet Actions in the Deep Ocean recreates naval battles in the Age of Sail. Made with ease of play and minimal record keeping in mind, Full Sail is geared for naval enthusiasts wanting a lighter, but fun game.

Ships are broken into 1st-6th rate rankings. Initiative is a simple, yet efficient dice mechanic. Movement, which is based on the initiative roll, is easily learned and accounts for wind, ship direction and ship size.

Games can range from a single ship per side to 4-5 ships per player without bogging down. Both historical and non-historical scenarios can be played using this rule set.

Full Sail is based on Brother Aelred Glidden's As Per Margin III rules found in the May/June 1999 #99 issue of Midwest Wargamers Association Newsletter (MWAN). Full Sail includes initiative, wind direction/speed and campaign rules as well as ship record sheets not included in the original rules.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Fighting, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Pirates, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Conquest, the card game
description:
Conquest is an exciting game where the goal is to triumph over your opponents to gain the most land. A player may use a variety of characters, each with an unique ability, to travel to new lands, form alliances, and fight duels. This innovative card game uses each part of the card for different plays, even the backs!

In Conquest the card game, the object is to be the first player to capture the majority of landmarks. Players are dealt 5 cards. There are 9 landmarks in the game. Players can set the length and difficulty of the game at the start by choosing 3, 5, 7, or 9 landmarks or choosing landmarks that are more difficult to reach. Players move to different landmarks by playing cards from their hand that match the combination of terrain icons on each landmark card.

Each player assumes the role of one of 15 characters who may travel to different landmarks to try to take possession of them or duel opponent’s character. Players may also form alliances to avoid being attacked with the added bonus of getting the opportunity to secretly buy the allied player’s land. Some of the characters include samurai, pirate, spy, witch, and ninja. Each character has a unique ability that players can use to gain an advantage.

Players also control armies and officers that can battle to take over other player’s landmarks.

Conquest is not a CCG. It is a complete game with a deck of 63 cards, however, because each card can be used in multiple ways, it feels more like a deck of 200. Each corner on the face of the cards represents a different aspect of the game: characters, alliances, armies or terrain. On the back of each card is a mythological beast which is used to resolve duels between characters.

The game includes 63 cards representing:

15 characters (including 4 officers)
3 mythological beasts (dragon, unicorn, minotaur)
4 alliances (eagle, elephant, lion, bear)
4 terrain types (mountains, forest, desert, river)
12 shield markers
27 army cards
9 landmarks
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Of Aliens and Giants
description:
Of Aliens and Giants

An Expansion for the hex based wargame based on fleet level space combat set in the babylon 5 universe published by Agents of gaming and now out of print.

FA-1013 OF ALIENS AND GIANTS focuses on the Shadows and Vorlons, including background material and all the rules needed to play these First Ones in your Fleet Action games! Also included are three of the League races - the Brakiri Syndicracy, Drazi Freehold, and Vree Guilds! 124 pages of Fleet Action fun!

.from the AOG website.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Forge of War
description:
Forge of War is a free set of tabletop miniature rules for depicting small unit, i.e. squad level, science fiction combat which also includes rules for AFVs and artillery.

Notionally for 28mm scale figures (although it would be equally suitable for other scales such as 15mm) it was originally produced to offer a viable alternative to more complex commercially available rule sets.

With variable unit activation; and with as much emphasis on command, control and morale as there is on the hardware, Forge of War offers a different, yet easily accessible, alternative to more traditional rule sets.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Quactica: Battles for the Soul of Middle Aesopia
description:
From the Introduction (Edited):

The intent behind the game is to provide a set of skirmish rules (one-on-one combat between characters) streamlined enough that games can be played to a satisfactory conclusion. In a suitalbly brief amount of time, with considerably more figures than the usual fantasy role-playing game encounter. In many ways, this is a military adjunct to a Middle Aesopian role-playing campaign, allowing the players to engage in actions larger than a simple dungeon crawl. Even though the basic rules are bare-boned and straightforward in order to help achieve these ends, they provide a solid foundation for the addition of house-rules and additional material.

Although its roots go back a long way, the mythos of Middle Aesopia is a living story that contines to grow on the Skirmisher interactive forum and in it's soon to be released Quactica role-playing game.

Publisher Blurb:

Quactica: Battles for the Soul of Middle Aesopia was one of the new products Skirmisher released at Gen Con 2008 in Indianapolis. This innovative set of miniatures rules was created by veteran game designer and miniatures sculptor Steve Lortz, author of the famous Perilous Encounters rules released by Chaosium in 1978. Set in a world inhabited by various races of anthropomorphic animals - including Ducks, Dwargs, and Porks - the Quactica rules tie in with a beautiful line of miniatures created by Lortz and produced by Skirmisher Publishing LLC.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Forces of Hordes: Trollbloods
description:
Publishers Blurb

For Kith and Kriel
Caught amid the destructive wars of man, the many tribes of the trollkin have united to save their kind and drive out those who despoil their lands. Led by mighty warlocks who can summon ferocious full-blood trolls to their side and backed by hearty trollkin warriors, pygmy sharpshooters, and powerful champions who have banded together to forge their own legends, the trollkin are prepared to stand their ground against any army that dares threaten them.

Unite the kriels under your banner with Forces of HORDES: Trollbloods, featuring:

• Complete faction rules and profiles for using all current Trollblood models in HORDES Mk II.
• New troops to bring to the fight, plus the all-new warlock Captain Gunnbjorn.
• An in-depth look at the history and structure of the trollkin kriels.
• A painting and modeling guide to help ready your forces for battle.
• Trollblood Theme Force lists and rules, which allow you to create armies based on specialized forces from the Trollbloods.

Sate the Hunger of Trolls upon the Carnage of War!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: SAVAS
description:
