SAVAS is a dynamic, diplomatic, war-like strategy game. Each stylized deck comes with 17 numbered cards in 4 different colors of elegant artistry. The challenge is to overpower the other players without drawing too much attention to yourself. Manage your defenses and economy as you make and break alliances to come out on top.

SAVAS is easy to learn and rich with player interaction. Start with a humble hand of 6 to 10 cards, and, if you keep your wits sharp, you might survive. Hold on tight, because in this game you will need every card your deck can spare to bring down your opponents!

In SAVAS, the goal is to destroy your opponents’ cards, and be the last man standing. Gather your forces, but choose wisely: only cards of the same color may attack each other. Everything in the game is upgradeable, from how fast you draw cards to how large of an attack force you can muster. Get 3+ people playing, and a whole new realm of diplomacy enters the field, much more dangerous than any card. Average game length is 30 minutes. 1 deck per person. Includes 3 decks!

(From the publisher)
mechanics: Open Drafting
publishers: (Self-Published), Loafer Gaming, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Behind: Scenario Pack
description: The Scenario Pack adds 6 new boards, 14 scenarios and Die Helfer (The Helper), a new character-class, to the Behind trading card game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Ancient Warfare
description:
Wargames Rules for Entire Battles. From Earliest History to 1400 AD.

A miniatures game for ancient and medieval warfare. The rules use interesting game mechanics, such as random movement rates, to represent the variable nature of warfare in the era it addresses.

Units are rated by a Unit Cohesion Value (UCV) that takes into account the armor, leadership, and training of the unit. For example, Roman legionaries would have a high UCV due to their better equipment, good leadership, and regular training while barbarian tribesmen would have a lower UCV.

Combat is divided into shooting, impact, and melee. Unit's abilities are divided into strengths and weaknesses in these areas. For example, a barbarian unit may have a high impact value, meaning that they have a formidable first charge, but their value in an ensuing melee is less imposing.

The figure scales used for the game is 1:50 (one model figure representing 50 actual men) and the time scale is one turn equals approximately 60 minutes. The game attempts to allow entire ancient battles to be fought out in miniature on the tabletop.

At the time it was published, Milgamex' "Ancient Warfare" emerged as a potential rival to the popularity of WRG's "Wargames Rules for Ancient and Medieval Battles." However, they could not push WRG's rules out of the place they had gained in international competition play. The rules went through two printings, but by 1980, they were difficult to find in stores.
mechanics: Simulation

name: Alien Armada
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Alien Armada is the third book in our series of module using the Starmada game system. This includes ships from the Tholians, Neo-Tholians, Seltorians, and Orion Pirates, along with some bonus ships.There are Q-ships, base stations, monitors, and defense satellites for most empires. Rules for webs, web casters, web breakers, particle cannons. This book requires Klingon Armada to play. The Starmada Admiralty Edition Core Rules aren't required but would add more player options and opportunities.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Majestic Twelve Games

name: Schwerpunkt: Volume 16
description:
A collection of 12 ASL scenarios designed for tournament play by the Tampa ASL Group.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader


Contents:
Designer notes and articles. (24 pages)
12 scenarios SP181-192

SP181 - The elefant of surprise
Gagarinka, Ukraine, USSR, 23 July 1943

SP182 - Vlasov's fist
Sachendorf, Germany, 2 March 1945

SP183 - The last full measure
Awacha, Okinawa shima, Rykuyu Islands, 7 May 1945

SP184 - Cornered beasts
Petushki, Ukraine, USSR, 28 June 1941

SP185 - von Renesse's recon
Radekov, Ukraine, USSR, 23 June 1941

SP186 - Beaufort's feast
Crehan, Belgium, 12 May 1940

SP187 - Stairway to heaven
Near Brunete, Spain, 6 July 1937

SP188 - On the road again
Potpot Barrio, Luzon Island, Philippines, 16 January 1945

SP189 - Hell's last issue
Speldrop, Germany, 24 March 1945

SP190 - Bottcher's corner
Buna village, New Guinea, 5 December 1943

SP191 - Tatra salad
Streno, Slovakia, 31 August 1944

SP192 - Rock the csaba
Keteghaza, Hungary, 26 September 1944
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Relationality
description: This new board game offers a innovative approach to teaching relationship skills - one that’s highly informative, research based and great fun. The game uses role playing and realistic scenarios to help players experience the dynamics of their life choices. With a toss of the dice, players move around the board, facing options about money, education, work, romantic and sexual activity, lifestyles, children and more! Just as in real life, each decision carries consequences which affect emotional and financial well-being all based on independent research. Winning is determined by how many good relationship decisions are made in the game, not by luck or money.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Age of Honor
description:
Age of Honor is both an expansion and scenario book for Age of Eagles I/II (Napoleonic Fire & Fury) covering the Age of Marlborough and Frederick the Great. Thus, the basic rules are needed to properly play this addition. This full color rules set contains a single page Intro - including all necessary rule changes, Unit Data Charts listing all commanders and formations that fought in this era, from the War of Spanish Succession thru the Seven Years War to the War of Bavarian Succession, a two-page Quick Reference Sheet plus Bibliography.

Scenarios contain game play specifics, a full color map, full color labels, and include:

• War of Spanish Succession - Battles of Luzarra, Blenheim and Ramillies.
• Great Northern War - Battle of Poltava.
• Austro-Turkish War - Battle of Peterwardein
• War of Austrian Succession - Battles of Fontenoy, Hohenfriedberg and Kesselsdorf.
• Seven Years War - Battles of Kolin, Hastenbeck, Leuthen, Krefeld, Zorndorf, Minden, Kunersdorf and Torgau.

Age of Honor is sold direct thru digital distribution, though hardcopy versions are available from certain retailers. It is 90 pages long. Kindle formatted products are sold exclusively thru Amazon, while digital downloads exportable to PDF format may be purchased via Google Play.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at http://tinyurl.com/Research-Portal-Age-of-Honor.

- description provided by publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Vortex: Core Rulebook
description:
Vortex is a customizable miniature skirmish game that can be used with any miniature in any setting, using the miniatures and terrain players already own. 2-4 players participate in individual action-packed skirmish games which are part of an endless campaign for an unlimited number of participants. Players are engaged throughout the game with active opposing rolls of a single d10 die each.

The 172 page Vortex: Core Rulebook contains the complete rules of play, extensive tools for building custom combatants, over 150 million possible combinations of scenarios to play, and a complete easy-to-play campaign system that allows miniatures to gain experience and grow as characters.

Set within the genre-neutral Infinite Continua, Vortex can be played with historical accuracy or pure flights of fancy blending sci-fi, fantasy, history, fiction, and fact. Players are free to write the story for their combatants and companies.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Anima Tactics: Erika
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Impetuous and spirited, Erika is the youngest member of the Hand of the Empress. She wields one of the legendary weapons of the Sidhe. Though she is only 13 years old, her destructive power is on par with some of the best fighters in the world.

Warrior - Light Empire - Level 40

Innate Ability:
Mjolnir: Whenever Erika causes a critical hit, the defender loses an action point and the attack causes Throw.

Ka-Boom! (Ki, Effect) - Every enemy unit within Erika's Control Zone loses 1 Action point. Effect 15.

Spin! Spin! Spin! (Ki, Attack) - While making this attack Erika rolls two dice and keeps the highest. This attack effects every enemy unit within two inches of her. After the attack roll is resolved Erika suffers Slow Lv. 1

Taunt (Subterfuge, Effect) - The closest unengaged enemy unit within Erika's Control Zone suffers Berserk Lv 1, Effect 15. Limit: Once per game.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Villanía
description:
Del Editor:

En un reino de maldad, un grupo de súpervillanos peleará entre si, codo a codo para destruir al mundo.

Porque lo único que podría detener a un súpervillano, es la envidia de otro súpervillano!

¡Divertido juego en el que podrás demostrar si es mejor ganar o hacer perder a los demás!"

From the Publisher:

In an evil kingdom a group of supervillains fight each other side by side to destroy the world.

The olnly thing that could stop a supervillain is the envy of other supervillains!!

Fun game where you can show whether it is better to win or make lose each other!

Each player represents a supervillain trying to build a machine to destroy the world. You collect the parts of the machine (represented by cards) and complete it before a rival destroy all your progress. There are several ways (cards) to destroy the progress of a player such as "Sabotage" and "theft " also we have defenses to each of these cards as "immunity " or "divine justice"

The sequence in which you build your machine is:

- 1 machine layout
- 1 Power Supply
- 3 different components
- 1 special component
- 4 final count cards (... 3 ... 2 ... 1 ... KABOOM)

The first player to blow up his or her machine is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Transformers: Heavy Metal War
description:
"Many millions of years ago, on the planet Cybertron, life existed, but not life as we know it today. Intelligent robots that could think and feel inhabited the cities. They were called Autobots and Decepticons. But the brutal Decepticons were driven by a single goal: total domination. They set out to destroy the peace-loving Autobots, and a war between the forces of good and evil raged across Cybertron, devastating all in its path, draining the planet's once rich sources of energy. The Autobots, on the verge of extinction, battled valiantly to survive." - The Opening Narration from "More Than Meets the Eye, Part I

When an elite team of Autobots left Cybertron in search of energon, they were pursued by Megatron and his Decepticons. They crashed on Earth four million years ago and fell into a state of involuntary hibernation. Then, in 1984 they awakened, making Earth into a battlefield, with energon as the prize. Now the heroic Optimus Prime and his valiant Autobots must stop Megatron and the cruel Decepticons from plundering the Earth and fueling a war of galactic conquest.

Transformers: Heavy Metal War is a card game that allows players to command their favorite Transformers from the first two seasons of the classic 1984 cartoon show. Each player must manage their hand and deploy Transformers with a variety of powers in order to complete missions, each giving the victor a unique reward. You will not only have the likes of Wheeljack, Jazz, Starscream, and Soundwave at your command, but also a host of lesser known Transformers, including Tracks and Reflector, as well as cards for human allies and unforeseen events.

So what are you waiting for? "Transform and roll out!"
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: The Deck of Change
description:
The Deck of Change is a deck of 64-cards with 8 numbers and 8 symbols. It is an open game system designed primarily for fun. It is versatile, multipurpose, and mathematically satisfying to play around with.

These cards might just bring out the most fun you can ever have with your family, friends, and even strangers. Kids from age 7 to 107 can enjoy the different games for 1 to 16 players. The deck has 64 cards, 8 numbers (0-7), and 8 symbols (yin, energy, force, space, matter, entropy, time, yang).

There are 3 versions of the deck. They are practically the same deck. The main difference is in the visuals. Deck #1: The AiTiA is designed for functionality. Deck #2: The Gauntlet is designed for imagination featuring artwork by Patrick Enrique. And, Deck #3: The Cauldron has bigger cards designed for creativity and brainstorming.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Death Ride: Halfaya Pass
description:
The 4th Indian Division assault on Halfaya Pass during Operation Battleaxe, June 15-16 1941


Halfaya Pass is another small GSI offering. The game focuses on tactical level combat and maneuver during Operation Battleaxe prior to the Crusader operation that lifted the seige of Tobruk. This is a stand alone game and does not need any other GSI title to be played. It is slightly larger than Hafid Ridge in terms of the number of units and can be played in a relatively short time.The rules are modeled around the seven battlefield operating systems which make them easily understood and easy to learn.

This battle will provide a challenge to both players. The British will find that they need to be very aggressive to push through the anti-tank defense. The Germans have to simply hang on. Either way it's a cliff hanger. The British Matilda's are the queen of the battlefield, until they meet the 88's. Obstacle play is important and significant.

Game play is excellent for solitaire play and moves along very quickly. The game is specifically designed to play in a day.

The Commonwealth forces were made up of 3 infantry battalions and a squadron and a half of Matilda tanks, heavy but undergunned and underpowered.

This game focuses on company / platoon combat and combined arms use. The time scale is either 1 or 2 hours per turn and each hex is 330 meters, depending on the game.

This game comes with:

(2) 11x17 Color Map Sections
(1) Color Order of Battle Card
Approximately 200 Double-sided and Die Cut Counters


(from box and publisher's website)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: A Bold Fight: The Battle of Mobile Bay
description:
One of the most violent and decisive naval battles of the American Civil War. Players use a standard deck of cards to activate their ships and fortress batteries and resolve combat (gunnery, ramming and torpedo/mine).

Play is very interactive and intense, but without any of the tedious record keeping of many naval games. A Bold Fight also plays well solitaire. Components include one 11 by 17 map, 120 single-sided, un-mounted counters and 8 pages of rules and charts. Graphics are by Bruce Yearian.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Anima Tactics: Lilith
description:
Even in a world such as Gaia, that holds so many secrets, Lilith is a mysterious enigma. Though she is an influential and powerful member of the 7th Heaven Knights her name is largely unknown as she mostly operates behind the scenes. As a mere human born into a world that humanity could consider hellish, Lilith has learned has become more adept at magic than many archmages and trained her fighting skills to a level rarely attained in an attempt to shield humanity from the darkness.

Light Empire Leader Mystic Warrior - Lv. 75
At 6 | Dm 5 | Df 9/11 | Ar 3 | LP 16 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 4/5
Innate Abilities: Critical Mastery, Initiative.
Swirling Blades: Lilith uses her secondary Defense value against Ranged Attacks.
oo - Alraune (Ki, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 inches). If you score a Critical Hit with this Attack, you may move the target into contact with Lilith's base, moving them in a straight line. This move ignores intervening obstacles. Effect 18.
ooo - Scorpion Blade (Ki, Attack)
When rolling for this Attack, roll two dice and keep the highest result. This Attack affects all enemy units within 2 inches of Lilith.
oooo - Dream of Lust (Ki, Attack)
+3 Damage (Both Attacks). Lilith makes 2 consecutive Attacks against the same target.
Archmage
Once per turn, Lilith may use one of the following abilities:
o - Healing Light (Magic, Effect)
A friendly unit within Lilith's Control Zone recovers 3 Life Points.
o - Spy Light (Magic, Seek)
+3 to the Seek roll, During the Seek action of this ability, Lilith's Control Zone is increased by 4 inches.
o - Protection (Magic, Effect, Reactive)
A friendly unit within Lilith's Control Zone gets Protection lv. 2
oo - Blessing (Magic, Effect )
Friendly units within Lilith's Control Zone gain +1 to Attack and +1 Defense. Upkeep: o
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Origins: “Fleshed Out” PnP Expansion
description:
The goals of this expansion are to flesh out some of the abstracted technologies within the original Origins (e.g. Obsidian, Iron, Roads) and to avoid the problems of a cycle of “nothing to do” turns that can happen in some games. The other consequence of this expansion is that geography plays a much larger role after Era I and well into Era IV (which seems to be keeping with the intended theme given Phil’s Jared Diamond references). England is well placed to become a powerhouse in Era III and China can no longer be ignored. With a good foothold, the New World has great growth potential. Finally, before this expansion, in many games, Era II only lasted 2-3 turns despite representing over 30 ky and this expansion hopes to make Era II more interesting.

Important: This expansion assumes use of the Age of Reason Expansion (Era IV) and does not use the Animal Farm Expansion (playing from American Megafauna) but can likely be easily adapted and can use the alternate brain maps or be played after Bios Megafauna.

Features:
- 25 Map Hex Overlays: Featured on the overlays are new resources to be
exploited (including Coal, Jade and Trade Crops), a new south Pacific Route to
the New World and the Toba Event.
- 10 New Innovation and Population Actions: Including Interbreeding, Emissaries
and Publication.
- 9 Infrastructure Track Overlays: With new Infrastructure bonuses including
Clipper Ships, Organic Farming and Paved Roads.
- 2 Full Color Player Guides: Includes all the new Actions, along with a Terrain
Guide, Selected Glossary and Slavery Rules. The Color makes it much easier to
read (at least for me).
- A Detailed Manual: Includes Wikipedia based footnotes in the style of the
original manual.
- Rules for porting the game over to High Frontier
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric, Print & Play
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Dust Tactics: SSU Airborne Walker Transport – "MIL MI-46 / Nastasia / Nikita / Nina"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Airlift walkers into the thick of battle with the SSU Airborne Walker Transport. In addition to the transport, this expansion includes a modified KV-47 Walker that can be armed in three different configurations. With so many options, there is a perfect walker for any combat situation! Combining the speed of the SSU Airborne Walker Transport and the toughness of the KV-47 results in a highly effective combat tool. Quickly reinforce your forces or launch a rapid assault with this Dust Tactics and Dust Warfare expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: ASL Comp: Genesis II – The Arab-Israeli Wars
description:
The ground-breaking GENESIS '48 module sold out a decade ago, and has been awaiting a new edition for years. Additionally, the follow-on game, bringing in 1967 and 1973 actions has been waiting patiently for delivery to your gaming tables. Bringing together these two elements has resulted in an all new GENESIS '48 2nd Edition complete with counters and scenarios for 1948 and 1956, with the first taste of 1967 and 1973 actions. The Israelis get a new nationality color and a plethora of new counters are provided for Arab and Israeli armies. What's more, the soldier art is also new, none of that which was used in the first edition is carried over.

Contents: 22 scenarios, 8" x 22" geomorphic map (KB1), 28-page rulebook, 1 page charts, 2 duplicate sets of 4 die-cut countersheets (for a total of 1,616 counters).

Genesis II #01 Sons of Galilee Syrian Israeli 1948-05-20
Genesis II #02 Locust Swarm Egyptian Israeli 1948-12-07
Genesis II #03 Etziongrad Arab Israeli 1948-05-13
Genesis II #04 Buying Time Egyptian Israeli 1948-05-23
Genesis II #05 Triple Play Arab Israeli 1948-06-06
Genesis II #06 Trapping Nasser Israeli Arab 1948-10-19
Genesis II #07 Fatih-Allah Syrian Israeli 1948-06-10
Genesis II #08 I Dream of Jenin Israeli Iraqi 1948-06-03
Genesis II #09 Palestinian Prokhorovka 5.00 Israeli Arab 1948-07-16
Genesis II #10 Edge of the Sword Arab Israeli 1948-01-14
Genesis II #11 Ben-Jabo! Israeli Egyptian 1948-05-29
Genesis II #12 The Whiskey Wager Israeli Arab 1948-04-21
Genesis II #13 Into the Arava Israeli Arab 1950-11-30
Genesis II #14 No Time to be Thamed Israeli Egyptian 1956-10-30
Genesis II #15 The Archers of Um Sheham Israeli Egyptian 1956-10-31
Genesis II #16 Ambush at Mitla Israeli Egyptian 1956-10-31
Genesis II #17 Final Act Israeli Egyptian 1956-11-02
Genesis II #18 Push to Um-Katef Israeli Egyptian 1967-06-06
Genesis II #19 Bloody French Hill Jordanian Israeli 1967-06-06
Genesis II #20 Molotov Inferno Israeli Syrian 1948-05-20
Genesis II #21 Syrian Spirit Israeli Syrian 1967-06-09
Genesis II #22 Isolation Strategy Israeli Egyptian 1973-10-08
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Bear's Claw: The Battles of Kiev-Uman and Smolensk, 1941
description:
Bear's Claw is two-games-in-one; featuring two separate and standalone, operational-level treatments of the German advance and the Soviet counter attack from July to August 1941 during Operation Barbarossa.

Kiev-Uman covers the action of German Army Group South, from the beginning of Soviet bold counterattack on 26 June led by the Soviet South-Western Front comprising four full mechanized corps (more than 2,000 tanks), to the closing of the Uman Pocket on 6 August.

Smolensk covers the action of German Army Group Center, from the German 2nd Panzergruppe's crossing of the Dnepr on 11 July, followed by numerous Soviet counterattacks of the Soviet Western Front led by Marshal Timoshenko, to the climax of operations at Smolensk on 9 August.

Both games share a common set of rules and deliver a quick, yet intensive gaming experience as BOTH sides will have the opportunity to initiate attacks during play. In essence, these are not one-sided affairs as the pendulum will swing in the Soviet's favor as well as they attempt to mount several counter blows to thwart the German advance.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation
publishers: Banner Of War, Consim Press, Six Angles

name: Down in Flames: Operation Leader 1943
description:
A Down in Flames Campaign - Operation Leader Campaign provides for both solitaire and two players. The campaign request both Rise of the Luftwaffe and Zero to play.

Operation Leader was the code name for an attack undertaken by aircraft from the carrier USS Ranger on 4 October 1943 on German shipping along the coast of Norway in the Bodø area. The escorting force included the battleships HMS Duke of York and Anson, the cruisers USS Tuscaloosa and HMS Belfast, and 12 American and British destroyers including the USS Corry.

The task force reached launch position off the Vestfjorden before dawn on 4 October completely undetected. At 06:18, USS Ranger launched 20 SBD Dauntless dive bombers and an escort of eight F4F Wildcat fighters. One division of dive bombers attacked the 8,000 long tons (8,100 t) freighter LaPlata, while the rest continued north to attack a German ship convoy. The bombers severely damaged a 10,000 long tons (10,000 t) tanker and a smaller troop transport. They also sank two of four small German merchant ships in the Bodø roadstead.

A second attack group from Ranger—consisting of 10 TBF Avenger torpedo bombers and six Wildcats—destroyed a German freighter and a small coastal ship, and bombed a troop-laden transport. Three of the aircraft were lost to anti-aircraft fire. On the afternoon of 4 October, Ranger was located by three Luftwaffe aircraft; her combat air patrol shot down two of the enemy planes and chased away the third.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Brink of Battle: Skirmish Gaming Through the Ages
description:
Brink of Battle: Skirmish Gaming Through the Ages is a miniature wargame rule set that allows players to recreate small combat engagements from any time in history. It is designed to allow players to play either one off games or a campaign that lasts over several battles.

Players can choose between three main historical periods, Ancient/Medieval (3000 BC to 1450 AD), Early Modern (1450-1880 AD), and Modern (1880 to present). Forces are created through a point-buy system, allowing players to customize the combat attributes, equipment, and special abilities of their troops.

A typical force is 3 to 20 miniatures, the game is played on a 3'x3' to 4'x4' tabletop, and can be completed in 30-60 minutes.

Three mission modes are included: Raid, in which the attacking force must capture an objective protected by the defenders; Recon, in which each opposing force attempts to cause the other to suffer casualties and flee; and Retrieval, in which both forces seek to be the first to find and secure an objective.
categories: Age of Reason, Ancient, Medieval, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Pike and Shot, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Pz8 Two Pages Wargaming Rules Collection
description:
A collection of miniature wargaming rules that are only 2 pages (A4) long: the Pz8 rules are intended for a small table, ideally with "micro" models, play fast (from 30' to 1 hour) and are solo friendly.

Classic miniature wargaming mechanics are used, in the simplest possible way, but trying to keep a minimum degree of realism and allowing historical tactics. All rules use D6 for resolving combat. Some of the rules, like the WW2 and Modern land, use rulers for movement and weapons ranges, while others use a grid system, like the WW2 and Modern aerial (hexes) the WW1(squares) and the WW2 naval (large areas). Representational scales vary from 1 base of miniatures = 1 Battalion or 1 Platoon, to 1 model = 1 aircraft or ship, again depending on the rules set.

Available as a free .pdf the Pz8 Wargaming Rules Collection includes:

- Pz8 WW2 rules
- Pz8 1950-75 rules
- Pz8 1975-2010 rules
- Pz8 Sci-Fi rules
- Pz8 WW2 Divisional rules
- Pz8 1939-41 Naval rules
- Pz8 WW2 Coastal rules
- Pz8 Space rules
- Pz8 WW1 Divisional rules
- Pz8 1935-65 & WW1 Aerial rules
- Pz8 1965-75 Aerial rules
- Pz8 Colonial Wargame rules
- Pz8 Fantasy Wargame rules
- Legio VIII Ancient / Medieval Wargame rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Eternal Contest
description:
Eternal Contest is all about besting your foes in open combat using an array of diverse characters. The player who defeats the most foes will be crowned the victor. Each time a player is defeated they may call upon evermore powerful characters to stay in the game. Sometimes which character you choose doesn't matter as much as when you pick them.

Some characters rely on speed and evasion, others have handy combat tricks and life saving healing abilities to keep them in the fight. While some fight up close and in the thick of the fight, another may stay at the edge of battle sending ranged attacks into the fray.

Each character has unique abilities and statistics with their own unique combat style. Players roll custom dice corresponding to 4 abilities as well as calling on special abilities unique to each character.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Enigma Nexus, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Malifaux: Ophelia Born on the Bayou
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

Ophelia is a gunfighter, capable of dishing out good amounts of damage from a distance. She leads a crew of her most trusted kin on raids against human settlements, using her prowess with her pistolas to bring back loot. All of her kin are companioned to Ophelia, allowing them to activate together and get the first strike! She is also the only Henchman that Som'er may take, and she is key to his Crew.

However, Ophelia is more than just a trigger finger. She also has a host of abilities to enhance the gremlins around her, making her a fun and useful tool to any gremlin list, whether it is led by Som'er or herself.

Ophelia is an excellent leader to begin your Malifaux collection. She is versatile, intuitive, and just generally good and fun. Also, all of the models which you purchase for her are fantastic models for Som'er, and he is a good master to expand out to when you want a few more options.

The Ophelia Boxed set comes with all of the LaCroix kin except the Young LaCroix:
Ophelia LaCroix
Francois LaCroix
Pere Ravage
Rami LaCroix
Raphael LaCroix

They are all unique models, so the boxed set provides one of each.

After you have that, you will probably want the Young LaCroix (she can take 3) followed by a blister of Slop Haulers and a blister of Bayou Gremlins when you are ready to expand, since they are the two best options for her, besides her kin.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Ninja: Legend of the Scorpion Clan – Himeji expansion
description:
This free Print & Play expansion is a big new challenge for the ninja and his fellow, the intruder.
If you found the original map, a piece of cake, try this one.
The map is based on one of the finest castles, which you can visit in Japan, notably in Himeji. For the purists, I must admit that some walls have been a little squeezed. This was necessary to fit the miniatures and improve game play.
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment

name: Ultimate Soldier Expansion Decks
description:
Expansion decks 1,2, & 3 for Ultimate Soldier:
Contains 3 Expansion Decks:
Revolution: 6 Soldiers, 5 Weapons, 1 Sniper
Civil War: 6 Soldiers, 5 Weapons, 1 Sniper
Wild West: 6 Soldiers, 5 Weapons, 1 Sniper

Use Expansion soldiers and weapons to play the game Ultimate soldier with mercenaries from different eras.

How to use the expansion sets.

Remove 6 soldiers and 4 weapons and a sniper from the base game. Replace them with the 6 soldiers, 5 weapons, and sniper from one from one of the expansion sets and play the game with the same rules. Power weapons for the expansion soldier are listed on their cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Faith, Hope & Charity: Battle over Malta
description:
This game uses the Battle over Britain game system. Included are set of 12 airplane counters for FH&C, Dogfight Display, and Reference Card. Planes included are Gloster Gladiator, Hawker Hurricane I, Vickers Wellington, MC-200 Saetta, SM-79 Sparviero, CR-42 Falco, Ju-87 Stuka, and Me-109E Emil, plus two Historical campaign games, and scenarios.

Each plane is dealt a hand of cards, the number of cards dependant on the plane's speed. Each turn represents just several seconds of real time. You play a card from your hand each turn to try and establish "Advantage" over the opponent... the side with Advantage may (depending on the values of the cards played) be able to fire a burst at the enemy. You will need to consider two main things each turn: your relative altitude (which is suit dependent), and relative fire position (which is card value dependent). When you find yourself "disadvantaged" (tailed), you can try to break off.

Plane ratings make a great deal of difference... for example, faster planes have larger hands, those with superior performance are tougher to tail and tougher to shake once they are tailing you, and an agile plane can "yank the stick" more effectively in a pinch. Firing a burst means you compare the relative fire position cards, roll one die, modify the roll by the plane's firepower modifier, and check the Fire Combat Table to see if you cause any damage (and/or critical hits) to the enemy. (And watch out for those rear firing gunners.)

If you find yourself damaged or out of ammunition, you can always try and disengage. When the deck of cards is exhausted, the game is over. You will quickly be able to "read" each plane's strengths and weaknesses from their ratings. Superior planes are stronger, of course, but anything can happen, and one false move might see you suddenly dodging bullets rather than dishing them out.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Varanasi
description:
Board & Pieces

A decorated board with a line, and 3 or 4 sets of 4 different sizes of disk-shaped pieces are used for 2 or 3 players.

Rules

Players place pieces on the line of the board. Smaller pieces can be placed on bigger pieces. The same sized pieces cannot be on top of each other. Pieces that are placed on the board, both by itself, and piled-up, are called stacks.

When all the pieces are placed on the board, the Game starts.

The player in turn take either of the following actions. No pass is allowed:

a) Take all the pieces in the same colors placed at the top of all the stacks.

b) Relocate stacks: Take one of the stacks and place the pieces all together on top of the other stacks on the board. Stacks can also be moved partially: A part of a stack, a piece or multiple pieces from the top of stacks can be taken and placed on top of the other stacks. Pieces can only be placed on top of bigger sized pieces here. Also, pieces can only be relocated on higher stacks.

The game is finished when all the pieces on the board are taken.

Goal

The player who took that last piece is the winner in the set.

Winner gains the number of the pieces that he/she took from the board in the turn as his/her score in the set. All the other players score 0.

The winner of the game is the player who gained the highest score when all the sets are finished.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Monstrous Arcanum
description:
Gives rules for new monsters and creatures for Warhammer Fantasy Battle. The rules are based on the "Storm of Magic: binding scrolls" rules.

There is also rules for more scenarios and a campaign based on monsters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Sligo
description:
IntroductionSligo is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

This game is a mix of all the placement and movement rules of Corey Clark's Slither and the capture rule and winning condition of the ancient game of Go. Captures are performed after placements. Area scoring is used, and suicide is not allowed. The ko rule isn't needed.



DefinitionsA player's group is a set of one or more orthogonally contiguous stones of that player's color. A portion of a larger group is not a group.

A liberty of a group is an empty point orthogonally adjacent to that group. A group without liberties is said to be surrounded.

A player's territory is a set of orthogonally contiguous empty points such that all points orthogonally adjacent to it are occupied by stones of that player's color.

A weak pair is a set of two like-colored, diagonally adjacent stones such that there is no like-colored stone orthogonally adjacent to both.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, you must either pass or place a stone of your color on an empty point. Before placing a stone, you may also move a stone of your color to an orthogonally or diagonally adjacent empty point.

After placing a stone, remove all surrounded enemy groups. In the resulting position, there must be no weak pairs and no surrounded groups of any color on the board.

Play stops when both players pass consecutively. At this point, the players may agree which groups, if any, can be removed from the board without changing the scores that would result from continuing the game. If there is such an agreement, the agreed groups are removed, the game ends and the resulting position is used for scoring. If the players don't agree which groups should be removed, play is resumed. In this case, when both players pass consecutively again, the game ends and the current position, without further removals, is used for scoring.

A player's score is the number of stones of their color on the board, plus the number of empty points in territories of their color, plus the value of komi (see below) in the case of White.

The player with the higher score wins the game.



KomiThe komi is the number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as a compensation for playing second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides.
mechanics: Chaining, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Pattern Recognition

name: ATS TT: Brave But Doomed
description:
This Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) release revisits Holland, 1944, and depicts squad level actions around the town of Oosterbeek, not far from Arnhem. Players may pit British paratroopers against German SS (with new counter art) in a collection of scenarios played out on the two newly remastered maps.
Also included are the obligatory Battlefield Walkaround and ATS TT variant rules.
Ownership of standard ATS rules, play aids and informational counters are required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Rising Glory
description:
Rising Glory is the fourth game GMT Games is producing as part of their strategic friendship/partnership with Victory Point Games, and the 2nd from their Napoleonic 20 series (Fading Glory was the first). The idea for this and future volumes is that they will take multiple existing games from the VPG Napeoleonic 20 series, add an as-yet-unpublished game to the mix, and create a GMT boxed game with 3-4 games in the box, using larger (3/4") counters and mounted maps.

The Napoleonic 20 series from Victory Point Games are lower complexity wargames which use a common system originally created by veteran designer Joe Miranda, and further refined by developers Alan Emrich and Lance McMillan. The system’s name is derived from the fact that there are generally just 20 or fewer pieces in play on the map at one time (that's 20 pieces total, for both sides). The system is easy to learn and fast-playing, creating a tense, dramatic and challenging situation on the game board where higher echelon troop formations (generally corps) vie for position and dominance. The series features twelve pages of Standard rules, four pages of Optional rules, and one-to-two pages of Exclusive rules for each title.

A hallmark feature of the Napoleonic 20 series is the use of narrative random event cards to help “tell the story” unique to each battle or small campaign. This “friction of war” element, combined with the operational-level maneuver, intense combat, and even periods of inactivity as armies pause to rest and reorganize, provides a thrilling battle full of unexpected twists and reversals of fortune. Morale plays a vital role as both sides can ‘spend’ this precious resource to force march their units, help rally stragglers, or commit reserves to key combats. But look out… when a side’s morale is reduced to zero, it has lost the game! The games also features simple optional rules for limited intelligence/Fog-of-War, the important shaping effects of leadership, and the gradual erosion of troop effectiveness due to fatigue.

The Rising Glory multi-pack features one game each from Alan Emrich and Lance McMillan, and two designs by Kim Meints.

Austerlitz 20(the “Battle of the Three Emperors;” Napoleon vs. Kutuzov, 1805)
Jena 20, 2nd edition (Napoleon vs. the Brunswick & Hohenloe, 1806)
Eylau 20 (Napoleon vs. Bennigsen, 1807)
Wagram 20 (Napoleon vs. Archduke Charles, 1809)

Game Components:

Four 17” x 22” mounted maps ( 2 boards, backprinted)
Approximately 150 3/4" Counters (thick, with Rounded corners, like No Retreat)
48 Event cards (12 for each game)
One 16-page Standard Rules booklet
One 16-page Exclusive Rules playbook
Two Player Aid charts

Individual Games designed by Alan Emrich, Lance McMillan, and Kim Meints

On February 9, 2015, GMT Games deleted this game from their P500 list and gave it back to Victory Point Games.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Micro Ships
description:
The space fleet of the famous Ganuuk trader is for sale. 13 glorious spaceships that any space trader would be happy to put their hands on, and now you have a chance. Each ship is worth worth some victory points or will help you in acquiring other spaceships. The space trader that will earn the most victory points from the new Ganuuk spaceships will be the winner.

Micro Ships is a micro game with 13 spaceship cards, 1 resource value card and 20 resource markers (5 markers in 4 colors).

Each turn every player secretly selects his bidding resources. Simultaneously the players reveal their bid. The highest bid wins the spaceship.
Each space ship gives bidding bonus to bidding based on:

Resource bid
Spaceship color
To a specific spaceship


Once a bidding is done, value of the resources is changed based on the winning bidding resources.

The game is played in 12 rounds and the winner is the player who's ships are worth the most victory points in end of the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding

name: Ski The Mountain
description:
Ski the Mountain is a competitive skiing game for up to six players in which the board is the piste map. The game recreates a real day on the piste with challenges, restaurant stops, and unexpected events.

Players begin at the bottom of the mountain with targets to achieve during the day. Each player plans his route, then sets off to ski as many runs as he can before the sun sets at the day's end.

Each turn players can collect piste cards to add to their hand, travel up ski lifts, or play piste cards to ski runs. Event cards can be played throughout the game to hinder your opponent or give you an advantage. Remember not to get stuck on the mountain when the sun sets!

Players score points for each run completed with additional points for some named runs. Each completed target scores additional points. Whoever has the highest point tally at the end of the day wins.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Game of Tones
description:
Game of Tones is a set of fourteen different music games designed to play with tonalities, chords, measures, key signatures, notes on the pentagram and even the location of the notes on a guitar neck. These multiple games can be played at different levels, depending on the musical knowledge of the players. The deck consists of 52 cards representing musical notes and rhythmic figures, with the help of the Circles of Fifths printed on each card, and with different suits or colors, together with some special wildcards.

It consists of many different games, featuring different game mechanics and goals: getting more points or cards than your opponents, be the first to run out of cards, move cards to certain places on the table, etc. In every game there are two different “levels” to keep track: the Musical Level and the Strategy Level, and both are independent from each other. The Strategy Level depends on the particular game, while the Musical Level can be adjusted in most of the games. Some of the games are up to 10 players, others are solitary type ones, for 2 players, and even some of the games can be played in teams or cooperatively.

Pawns are used in some of the games, and Game of Tones also includes two additional board games. These games are called Pianogram, in which the board represents a G-clef staff or a piano, depending on the orientation in which it is placed; and Fretboard, in which the board represents a guitar (or any other stringed instrument) neck.

Designed from an educational standpoint, Game of Tones includes a list of the musical concepts used in every game, and a teaching guide for music teachers. Game of Tones is not language dependent, except for the instructions, which are available in English and Spanish.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Educational, Music
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: VOR: The Maelstrom – Zykhee
description:
The Flame Burns Eternal.

Masters of melee and mystical combat, the zykhee flow like water across the battlefield, slicing through and slashing down all who threaten to extinguish the sacred flame of the Bael Fire. Thousands of years of tradition have sculpted the current crop of zykhee warriors into the deadliest practitioners of hand-to-hand combat the Maelstrom has ever known.

The Zykhee Forcebook describes the disciplined and wickedly agile warriors of the zykhee, providing detailed background on this alien race. The Zykhee Forcelist offers new units including wardyns, Death Dancers, Soulless, and Stalkers. This book also contains a Vykas-Denox Battle Terrain Table, new campaign rules, new force traits, and five unique personalities to aid they zykhee in their quest to protect the sacred flame.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Fougueux 1785 / Redoutable 1791
description:
An additional French flagged, Téméraire class ship-of-the-line for adding to your forces in Sails of Glory. In addition to the different paint model, the pack includes a set of 'B' maneuver cards as well as stats for two ships using the model. Components are language independent.

This is initially a Kickstarter exclusive ship pack.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Bellerophon 1786 / HMS Defiance 1783
description:
An additional British flagged, Arrogant / Elizabeth class ship-of-the-line for adding to your forces in Sails of Glory. In addition to the different paint model, the pack includes a set of 'D' maneuver cards as well as stats for two ships using the model. Components are language independent.

This is initially a Kickstarter exclusive ship pack.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Ultimate Showdown
description:
The game had a beta release in 2010. After a long hiatus, changes to artwork and rules were made and an official launch of the game is planned for a 2020 release date on Kickstarter.

The Ultimate Showdown is a game of creativity and fun... a game where anything can and does happen. The outcome is limited by a person's creativity not what cards are in their hand. Why play in someone else's world when you can create your own. The game is just as much fun to watch. It’s about one-upping an opponent with wits.

Summary of Rules

The gist of the game is that you have cards in your hand that represent different characters. You are able to use these cards to conquer, control, or disable, the opposing card(s) to win The Ultimate Showdown.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Storytelling, Take That, Voting

name: Death Ride Kursk: Totenkopf
description:
Death Ride Kursk: Totenkopf builds on the existing Death Ride Kursk games for the XLVIII Panzer Korps by adding the IInd SS Panzer Korps Division Totenkopf. This project takes the Death Ride Kursk game system to a new level. The maps for the entire 9 game series have been redone. The design for the new maps was done by Rick Barber and the artwork by Kyle Gebhardt. Game play is still characterized by the BOS, or Battlefield Operating Systems. The rules have been restructured to include all of the rules for the enhancements. They have also been reformatted to make it easier to understand and improve rules clarity. Remember that even though the basic system is an I-Go-U-Go type system the order in which units move and actions occur is very open. Players have a tremendous amount of flexibility to perform firing, movement, and obstacle removal, can be done when the player needs them to be done. This means you get to control the synchronization of the battles activity to suit your plan.

While the rules are now quite large, they are very comprehensive. Players will find great richness and depth in the level of detail. There are now four different levels of game rules play. From Basic to Ultimate. For those wanting to play the basic game system you will still find great depth and detail. For those wanting the ultimate experience you will find plenty of additional rules in the enhancements to make you feel like a real staff officer.

This game will be the base for the three SS games and the follow on games for Leibstandarte and Das Reich will be expansions. Totenkopf will be needed to play the other 2 games. Included in this game will be the counters for the Command and Control and Fire Support Enhancements. These add some great details and rules right from when you make your purchase. The Air, Maintenance, and Logistics Enhancement counters will be sold separately and are not yet ready for sale.

This game will come with:
(16) 11x17 Full Color Map Sections
(10) Unit and Marker Counter Sheets
Death Ride Kursk Rules Booklet
Totenkopf Rules Supplement
(3) d10 Dice
Numerous Charts and Tables
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Tixel: Tix Expansion Pieces
description:
An expansion for Tixel, which consists of 4 extra pieces for each player. Expansion pieces are different from regular pieces in that they are completely square-shaped instead of being hollow on one side. For each expansion piece used, remove one tixel piece from the game.

The expansion pieces can be used to add variety to games, but they can also be used to handicap a stronger player. Simply give the stronger player more expansion pieces compared to the weaker player.

With two expansion sets, the original Tix game can also be played on the Tixels board.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Abenteuerband 7
description:
The booklet Quest: Zeit der Helden - Abenteuerband 7 contains a two-player adventure for Quest


"Stille Nacht, untote Nacht", translates to "Silent Night, Undead Night"


Additionally, all required additional material is provided, such as:

"Questmeisterbogen"
item and character cards
character screen for the paladin
mini figurine for the paladin
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Napolatronics
description:
Napolatronics is a wargame for 2-4 players, set in a wacky world of smartly uniformed robots launching bold assaults from their rocky, island bases.

This is a complete wargame! All YOU need to add are some dice.

Features of this game include...
1) 4 complete armies of robots! Cavalry, Artilery and Infantry.
2) 4 Battle Mats representing the floating island bases
3) A sheet of Terrain tiles! These randomly drawn tiles will give the gameboard a different layout EVERY game!
4) Easy to follow Rules booklet!
5) Cheatsheets! With these you wont have to reference the rule book at all!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Mage Wars: Gravikor Promo Card
description:
Gravikor

Zone Exclusive, Legendary, Epic

Cost 8 Mana
Health 6
Armor 4

All creatures within 2 zones of Gravikor lose, and cannot gain, the Flying trait.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: WIXOSS
description:
WIXOSS (pronounced as We-Cross, from "Wish Across") is a Japanese trading card game published by Takara Tomy. It is the game that the TV anime series Selector Infected WIXOSS is based on.

Two players each use a randomized Main deck (with black card backs) and a LRIG deck (with white card backs) that's always available in its entirety to defeat opponent's avatar called LRIG. It is done by destroying (or "Crashing") all seven cards of their Life Cloth and then dealing the final strike. Players can attack either with their LRIG or summoned beings called SIGNI that come from the Main deck.
Over the course of the game, players can "Grow" their LRIG with cards from the LRIG deck, getting access to more powerful SIGNI and various LRIG abilities. Both decks also have cards with one-shot effects: Arts (in the LRIG deck) and Spells (in the Main deck). These cards, as well as Growing a LRIG, require spending a certain amounts of Ener, which is represented by cards in your Ener Zone. You can put cards from both your hand and your side of the field into your Ener Zone once a turn. It is also the zone where defeated SIGNI and crashed Life Cloth cards go to. Some cards also produce additional effects called Life Bursts if they are crashed from the Life Cloth.
categories: Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Solar Slice
description:
Publisher's Flavor Text:

The year is 2645. Earth’s governments have all fallen. Corporations now run the planet.

After the Fast Food Wars of 2483, pizza corporations emerged as the dominant ruling entities of the planet.

In 2640, life was discovered in six previously unknown galaxies. Recent advances in space travel now make it possible to leap to and from these galaxies in minutes.

Now, Earth’s pizza corporations are in a race to become the most well known pizza franchise in the universe.

Publisher's Description:

Winning the Game: In Solar Slice, each player assumes the role of a Pizza Corporation. At the end of the game, the corporation with the most points wins.

Game: A game consists of 4 rounds.

Round: Each round consists of 4 phases: Galaxy Prime, Marketing, Delivery, and Scoring.

During the Galaxy Prime Phase a launch card is revealed which establishes both the Galaxy Prime (the trump color), and the Scoring values of each galaxy for the round.

During the Marketing Phase players place a Marketing Ring onto the board in any galaxy they choose. This helps to protect their interests in that galaxy from sabotage.

During the Delivery Phase, players make a total of 10 Deliveries. A Delivery consists of each player playing 1 card from their hand The winner of each Delivery advances their pawn in a galaxy of their choosing. Players win deliveries by either playing the highest numbered card of a starting color, or the highest Galaxy Prime card. Any sabotage cards played during the Delivery decrease a chosen player's advancement in a particular galaxy.

During the Scoring Phase, players advance their pawns on the score track according to the values listed on the Launch Card associated with the round.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: TKG ARENA: Oracle Rumble
description:
In a wicked twist of inspiration, the Elemental Kings have decided to choose their champions by restricting all magic to a single source of spells in the form of an oracle.

This game requires the following components from TKG ARENA: The Elemental Kings & TKG ARENA: Rise of the Magi.

FULL SPELL DECK: 1
STANDARD DECK (DECK): 1 for each player.
OINKS: 5 from each element for each player (Default)
LIFE: 20 for each player (Default)

The objective of this game scenario is to achieve the highest number of KILLs in the rumble. A KILL refers to the elimination of another enemy player by reducing his/her LIFE to 0 during a player’s turn. If a player is self-eliminated due to an unfulfilled deck out cost, this will not be considered a KILL. The eliminating player will get all remaining Oinks of the eliminated player. The game ends when it is evident that it is not possible to score more KILLs than any leading player who will become the winner. If all players are self-eliminated or there are players tied with equal number of KILLs, the last player to deck out will be the winner of the game.

Players start the game by each drawing a card from the top of a common shuffled DECK. The player with the highest number starts first and the players get their turns in a clockwise manner. The drawn cards go back to the bottom of the DECK. In the case of ties, the tied players draw again till the turns are resolved. Each player may attack each other according to the rules as described in TKG ARENA: Rise of the Magi.

The FULL SPELL DECK is shuffled and the top 5 cards are drawn and placed face up. During a player’s turn, he/she may choose to expend 1 Oink in acquiring a special card of the same element among these 5 cards. The special card replaces its counterpart card (of the same ELEMENT and FACE VALUE) and the counterpart card is removed from play in the game. After replacement, the DECK is reshuffled. The acquired special card(s) goes to the bottom of his/her DECK and the player draws sufficiently from his/her DECK to recover his/her hand to 5 cards.

If a counterpart card is in a player’s CURRENT HAND during his/her turn to acquire spells, the player may acquire it without cost. A player may make as many acquisitions as long as he/she has the necessary counterparts in his/her CURRENT HAND. If there are no counterparts cards in his/her CURRENT HAND, the player may still acquire the special card(s) by expending the appropriate cost as above. In addition, the player must end his/her turn immediately after the transaction. If the player does not acquire any special card(s) during his/her turn, he/she can choose to engage in battle with any other player in the group and the same rules of engagement (for the usual 2-player mode) apply including the use of the CHARGE BAR.

Every time a special card is acquired by a player, another is drawn from the FULL SPELL DECK pile to replace it. If a cycle of turns (from player back to the same player) passes with no players acquiring any special cards, all the available 5 special cards will be placed at the bottom of the FULL SPELL DECK pile and another 5 new ones are drawn.

Players may wish to use their own customised DECK in tournament mode for this scenario and omit the oracle (spell source) altogether. It is recommended that all players should then be fairly matched to warrant a fair game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Trick or Treat Halloween PnP Boardgame
description:
Players are kids trick-or-treating their way through the neighborhood, performing actions based on dice results and exchanging their bounty for VP cards giving them additional abilities towards being the most successful candy collectors of the evening.

Playable with 2-8 players and easily understandable rules (playtested with age ranging from 9 to 75) this game was created to fill a void of Halloween themed games in my collection that I don't want to keep to myself since it was well received by friends and family.

Available for download here on BGG in English and German.

Happy Halloween!

Update: Thanks to Citie (user e0004252) the rules are now also available in Chinese.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Outcasts (Wave 1)
description: We're entering a new world of hurt and this box contains all the guns, swords , and brutality you will need for you to survive your next fight. Inside, you will find every single stat and upgrade card for Outcasts featured in the second edition book. Now fight for your spot at the top of this twisted food chain.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Neverborn (Wave 2)
description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Blocks in the West: Card Deck
description: The Blocks in the West Card Deck is an expansion for Blocks in the West and consists of 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Blocks in Afrika: Card Deck
description: The Blocks in Afrika: Card Deck is an expansion for Blocks in Afrika and consists of 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Steam: Demanding Suppliers
description:
This expansion was later included in Steam: Map Expansion #5.

Components:

5 Demanding Supplier tiles

Setup:

Either:
Version 1: Place each Demanding Supplier tile on 4 different cities matching the supplier colors and 1 on a gray new city (this must be the first gray city built); reduce the number of goods to be placed in those cities by one.

Version 2: Place each Demanding supplier tile in 5 different towns. Remove one of each color cube from cities on the board (take from a Goods Supply Space if 1 color isn't in play in cities).

Gameplay:

Move Goods: The Demanding Supplier Tile is effectively a goods cube that may be delivered to a city in the color shown.

Each time any goods cube or another Demanding Supplier tile is delivered from, to, or through a city or town containing a Demanding Supplier tile your track points from the move are reduced by 1.

If you move a Demanding Supplier tile for victory points, ignore other Demanding Suppliers and add 2 VPs to your total score along with your track points gained through movement.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Sergeants D-Day: Chapter 2 La Fière Bridge
description:
Your objective, La Fiere Bridge, has an exposed approach which requires deception and accurate shooting to capture.

The war rages across Normandy with the La Fière Bridge expansion. The story continues with 2 Landmarks and 8 new map pieces. New story cards includes People Events for Carter and Thielen from the D-Day Sergeants starter set.

Includes: 16 Story cards and Map Tiles L9, 71, 72, 77, 78

The new locations introduce difficult terrain with extensive cover. The heavily wooded terrain and flooded fields slow movement. The La Fière Bridge flooded pasture present a challenging pair of Landmarks to control.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Sergeants D-Day: German Fusilier Assault Tactics expansion
description:
The Sergeants Tactics Modules are usable with both Sergeants Miniatures Game and D-Day Sergeants.

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 16 cards and 6 panels
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Barricado
description:
Barricado is an abstract strategy game of tile placement and area control. Each turn, players get to choose between controlling the layout of the board (by placing a tile) or claiming territory (by placing lines of tokens). The player's goal is to connect dots of their own color with a line of tokens to block other players from doing the same and to end up with the most pieces on the board at the end of the game.

The layout of the board and the barricades built upon it is always different on each play-through, as each player's strategy (and the number of players) affects the others. Optional rules can adjust play time for different audiences, as well as provide for expanded strategy for advanced players.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Dogs In The Yard
description: Dogs In The Yard is a tile laying game for 2 to 6 players. It's a game of both chance and strategy, where you and your opponents take turns drawing tiles to build out a map one tile at a time with grass and fences, and try to construct yards around dogs to earn points. They also have to make sure their dogs are fed and watered, and can get extra points with toys and treats.
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: U-BOAT COMMANDER: A Solitaire Game of U-Boat Warfare during WWII
description:
BACKGROUND
U-BOAT COMMANDER is a game where the Player assumes the role of a U-Boat Commander during WWII. As the Commander of a U-Boat, you are responsible for destroying Enemy Shipping and reducing the Allies Supplies. In this manner, you may shorten the war.

GAME OBJECTIVE: The objective of U-BOAT COMMANDER is to sink as many tons of Shipping as possible before the War Ends. Campaigns consist of a series of Missions where, as commander of a U-Boat, the Player must attempt to score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist the war efforts. Campaigns can be Short (6 Patrols), Moderate (9 Patrols), or Long (12 Patrols).
categories: Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Skirmish Wars: Colonize
description: Skirmish Wars: Colonize is a standalone adaptation of Skirmish Wars: Advance Tactics. Skirmish Wars is a tactical print-and-play wargame that uses printable, customizable maps for endless variety and simple mechanics to streamline gameplay. The game is based on Advance Wars, a videogame by Intelligent Systems.
categories: Print & Play, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Maalintii Rangers: Day of the Rangers – A Skirmish Sangin Battle Book
description: This 84 page Battle Book includes additional scenarios and rules for the Skirmish Sangin miniatures game. The book includes the key scenarios and all the additional rules to re-enact the Battle of Mogadishu - a battle made world famous, first by the book, then the film of Black Hawk Down.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Washizu Mahjong
description:
It plays like Riichi Mahjong, but needs a whole different set of tiles.

1/4 of the tiles are opaque and 3/4 are translucent.

So, the strategies are a lot different since you may see about 3/4 of the tiles in your opponents hand.

Variant from the Manga Akagi, and there are sets made exclusively to play this particular variant of the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Army Men Combat
description: Army Men Combat is a fast and simple ruleset designed for the nostalgic among us, perfect as an introduction to wargaming for young ones. Dust off your old army men, improvise some terrain, and get ready to fight with toy soldiers like you never have before.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Halo: Fleet Battles – Covenant Assault Carrier (CAS)
description:
Assault Carriers are monumental symbols of Covenant power, and among the deadliest implements wielded by the Prophets in their war against humanity. Each Assault Carrier is a potent instrument of conversion and compliance, capable of deploying thousands of troops and numerous fighter craft, backed by an array of devastating energy projectors that can burn entire continents to ash: a single CAS is sufficient to quell all but the most pernicious heresy, rebellion, or parasite outbreak. Colossally expensive to construct and few in number, the rare loss of an Assault Carrier is mourned by the entire Covenant.

Every major Covenant fleet has at least one Assault Carrier at its heart, if only because carriers themselves require a significant number of support vessels when operating away from High Charity or major outposts. Multiple carriers in a single fleet is unusual, but not unheard of. For example, the crusading Fleet of Sacred Consecration, commanded by the Prophet of Regret himself, is led by twin Assault Carriers, the Solemn Penance and Day of Jubilation. Together, these massive warships have scoured dozens of human worlds and bring righteous destruction to those within the Covenant who dare stand in the way of the Prophet’s holy mission.

1 resin Assault Carrier
1 Medium/Small Sprue
1 custom Formation Base
1 Formation Sprue
4 Covenant Token Sheets
1 bag of 10 Halo Dice
2 Statistics Sheets
A5 Formation Overlay Sheets
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Platoon Command
description: In Platoon Command you take the role of a platoon leader, guiding your platoon into combat in order to capture critical battlefield objectives. Platoon Command is a quick-playing game that uses cards for combat, command and control, fog of war, and attrition. The mission objective is to gain Objective Points by controlling areas of the battlefield. You accomplish this objective by issuing orders to your command group, three rifle squads, and specialized personnel.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Wolf in the Village
description:
Wolf in the Village is a Werewolf-style game.
"Wolf in the village" is a story that kill a werewolf lurking in the village.
Players separate to the villager side and werewolf side, and win by the vote to lynch.
The villagers often have specialists competing against wolves. For example: Seer, Hunter, Medium, Assasin etc.
Wolves are not the only ones lurking in the village. Human Traitor(mad man), neither ally Fox etc ...
Your bravery leads to victory.

English rules
You can get english rules PDF here!
http://wolfinthevillage.dirtylabor.com/english/Villagers%20G...

"wolf in the Village" is a Werewolf-style game.
You can play with 2 types of rules:
Normal werewolf-style rule and One-night rule.

For the Villagers : Kill all of the Werewolves and the Fox.

For 4 to 12 Players.

For the Werewolves : Survive without being executed.

categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Meeple Maker
description:
Meeple Maker is a 2-4 player light strategy game that plays in about 30-60 minutes.

Your goal is to get the most fans. To get fans interested, you'll produce games tailored to their demands. To meet those demands, you'll develop content with help from the internet.

Players take turns and either gain or spend content.

To gain content, they choose which website to move to from one of the next three clockwise websites (skipping over other players) and develop the content shown there (resources). Since each player's token never leaves the board and movement is limited, each move impacts the choices of others.

Players spend that content to grow their company, produce games, recruit people and get fans. All of these aspects are represented together on the cards in their hand or in the common market. These cards and their position determine the type and number of content that needs to be spent, as well as the skills (resource-gathering) and fans (score) the cards offer.

Those cards join their tableau, growing your company and helping players develop immersive worlds (theme), deep mechanics (strategy), valuable components, and wondrous artwork (the four types of content).

As players grow their companies to new sizes, they'll choose and flip tokens on the board. This changes how much resources are available and also acts as the game clock. When the last (eighth) token changes, the final round is played out. During final scoring, players gain resources based on who they recruited, and then spend them to acquire the cards in their hand. The end-game conditions are checked to see who has the most theme, strategy, component and artwork skills in their company and who gets the bonus points. The player with the highest score, i.e. most fans, wins.

The setup is highly variable, with resources being randomly placed on the board, different values for the end game conditions, and a constantly evolving, sliding market. There are also several creators to choose from, an evolving board and many ways to manipulate the game - so each game is a new challenge to face.
mechanics: Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Malifaux Second Edition:  Bound By Law – Lucius Box Set
description:
Box Set for Lucius Crew. It contains Lucius, The Scribe (Lucius's Totem), Captain Dashel (Henchman), Two Guild Lawyers, Two Guild Guards.

Lucius is a Guild/Neverborn master who concentrates on using and manipulating minions. He works well with guard and mimic models.

Set differs from first edition box set in being made of plastic instead of metal, with 2nd edition cards, and additional guard and lawyer, and the Scribe and does not contain Ryle.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Movers 2201: Adventure Expansion 1
description: This pack contains a 5-card Adventure Objective Set for Space Movers 2201. The pack continues the story of the stolen time module and picks up right where the Adventure Objective set included in the base game ends. The pack also includes 3 trading cards with game artwork.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Space Movers 2201: Objective Expansion 1
description: This pack contains 14 new Objective cards to add to your Space Movers Random Objective Card Deck in the base game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Space Movers 2201: Challenge Expansion 1
description: Need some extra challenge in Space Movers 2201? This pack features 10 more difficult UO Pursuit cards and 4 more difficult Event cards. These cards can mix with or replace the UO Pursuits and Events provided with the base game to make the game more challenging.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Space Movers 2201: Bounty Hunter Expansion Pack
description: Now for Space Movers 2201. A bounty hunter has been sent after the Liberty crew! This expansion adds a new element to the game with 3 new Objective cards to add to your Random Objective Card Deck. Will the bounty hunter catch you? The pack also includes 7 wanted poster cards that work with these new Objectives and 2 trading cards which tell the bounty hunter's story.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle –  Dark Sovereigns
description:
Dark Sovereigns is the first expansion set for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle, allowing players to include the elegant vampires, dark labyrinthine cities, and twisted vampire politics of Europe into their games. From the dark halls of Heidelberg Castle to the opulent rooms of the Palace at Versailles, the sinister designs of the eternal struggles are revealed with the grace and style of the Old Country.

This first expansion features 173 new cards, including the first non-Camarilla (Independent) vampires, with additional rules for handling the Independent clans.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Twilight Rebellion
description: Twilight Rebellion is an expansion set for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle, published by White Wolf in 2008, that focuses on the Anarchs. All 60 cards in this set are new cards, with no reprints from earlier sets. Unlike most other expansion sets (including Anarchs, the previous set to share this set's focus), there were no preconstructed decks or starter decks for this set, only booster packs.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Battle of Midway, June 1942: Minigame
description:
From the designer:

This is an even simpler, air group version (for me and my 8 year old son to play) of my squadron level 1990 game Deadly Reckoning, which I am in the process of revising/updating. It nonetheless seems to have all the essential elements and decision points of a depthy Midway game.

90 miles per hex, 3 hour turns, 13 Japanese combat units, 11 American. All icons crafted pixel by pixel by me.
categories: Dice, Educational, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: BaRPG
description:
Description from the designer:

BaRPG is the unholy result of a one-night stand between a drinking game and card based RPGs. From the side of RPG, BaRPG has inherited a melange of exciting characters to play, a definitely sexy level system, dice-rolling and booty (Err… I mean epic loot!). From drinking games, it has inherited a series of ridiculous games that will keep you drinking. Though in the end there will be a clear winner, we like to think the true prize is in the friends you will make along the way…

The game is played between 3 to 7 players. Each player receives a character card, and a level and damage tracking card. Every round all players (except whoever last levelled up) roll a dice, highest roll then checks if what was rolled is higher than their current level. If so, that player levels up, reads out their character's power (which is a drinking game), and the group then plays that game. At the end of the game, someone will have to take 'drinks' as well as take damage. The game then enters a market round, where players can 'buy' additional item cards. These item cards can be used at any time during the game, and can either assist players or thwart the efforts of others. The game then returns to a new round of dice rolling.

The first player to reach level 6 wins, and yes there is even an item that can be played against another player to put him/her back to level 1. There are in total 10 characters with associated games, and these characters will swap during the game as part of the item card mechanics. Additionally, losing a total of 4 'sober' (damage) points will also return the player to level 1, force them to change their character, and lose all accumulated items.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
