mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Storytelling, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Pike & Shotte: The Devil's Playground
description:
The Thirty Years War was a series of conflicts that ravaged large areas of Europe, especially the German provinces, from 1618 to 1648. These conflicts centred on the Habsburg Holy Roman Emperors, Ferdinand II and Ferdinand III, and their opponents. Although viewed by many as a religious war between Catholic and Protestant nations, its roots and causes were also politically motivated. The combination of religious fervour and the political ambition of the European superpowers were to pit vast armies and mighty leaders against each other. The devastation caused by decades of fighting had truly turned Europe into the ‘Devil’s Playground’.

This supplement for Pike & Shotte describes the history, armies, personalities and battles of the Thirty Years War. Included are scenarios based on some of the famous battles and army lists for the main protagonists.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Tanto Cuore: Arisa Hayakawa – Tabletop Day 2016
description:
Cleaning Maid - Arisa Hayakawa

Cost of 5. Allows paying -2. If you do, select an Event card in your Private Quarters, and return it to the Town. Gain Love equal to half (round down) the Employ cost of the card you returned this way.

This was originally given away to celebrate TableTop Day. Unfortunately with this being a new general maid, you would need 10 copies to actually be able to use her in a game. With the International Kickstarter, she was included in a pledge level and an add-on and each place included 10 copies of her.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: BattleTech: Combat Manual – Mercenaries
description:
Some soldiers fight for king and country, some for honor and glory, others for liberty or loved ones. We’ll fight for that too, whatever your cause, as long as the check clears.
For over forty centuries, mercenaries have plied their trade and been instrumental in toppling empires or holding the tides of war at bay. And as mankind expanded to the stars, soldiers of fortune rose to new heights of power. Business is booming, yet along with those riches comes a dangerous life and the scorn of many who see only filthy lucre-warriors. It’s a dangerous life, but as long as you keep your ’Mech intact and your bottom line balanced, the universe is yours!

BattleTech Combat Manual: Mercenaries contains information on the soldier-for-hire trade and their place in the Inner Sphere. This manual takes a look at some of the most renowned mercenaries of the 31st century, detailing their histories, tactics, unit crests, paint schemes, and notable personnel. This Alpha Strike expansion includes special rules for unique character abilities, faction-specific rules, force-building, and a mini Technical Readout—everything you need to field your favorite mercenary command on the tabletop or create your own.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Triumph! Rules for Tabletop Battles Ancient and Medieval
description:
Triumph! is a miniatures wargame covering the ancient and medieval period (up to about AD 1500). Troops are divided into 26 types depending on armament, tactics, and quality, and based on stands of uniform width. All movement and combat is by stand or group of stands. There is no individual casualty counting or other book keeping, casualties are assumed to have negligible impact on a stand's fighting strength until its cohesion breaks and the survivors scatter beyond game relevance. Each player has 1d6 command points each turn to move his troops about the battlefield, whereafter any within range of the enemy fight automatically.

The army list database, known as "Meshwesh", is freely available online (see links).

The basing scheme approximates, but is not fully compatible with, the widely-used WRG/DBX basing.
categories: Ancient, Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Caesar's Glory
description:
Description from the publisher:

Caesar’s Glory is a card game of fast-paced gladiator combat built around the classic principle of Rock-Paper-Scissors. The game is played over a number of rounds. In each round, you will play a card face down. Your opponent will do the same. You then compare the cards played, and whoever has played the winning card will deal damage and may play combo cards from their hand. Each point of damage you deal forces your opponent to discard a card. Whoever runs out of cards, collapses in the arena and loses the game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Ivory Dragon Expansion
description:
The Ivory Dragon extends your campaign by 5 years, establishing a final new threat after the Gold Smoke Knight. It gives the players an avenue to use their experience with the Gold Smoke Knight for further development and gear.

Contains:
1 x 20-30+ pages rulebook
1 x Ivory Dragon miniature (135mm base)
1 x Gate Guardian (50mm base)
2 x White/Ivory Dragon Armor miniatures
2 x Hybrid Gate Guardian + Lantern miniatures
2 x Gold Smoke Knight Armor miniatures
80+ x game cards
1 x Settlement Event cards
60 x gear cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Chibi Quest!
description:
Description from the designer:

Chibi Quest! is an exciting semi-cooperative game for 1-6 players, where you play as a Chibi, going on quests to save your lands from monsters! After your Chibi is prepped for battle, it’s up to you to save your lands from as many monsters as you can! Of course, no quest is complete without an epic boss fight! You must work together to defeat it! By the end of the adventure, one of you will be known throughout the lands as the CHAMPION CHIBI!

How to play overview :


Equip! You quickly search through the available armor in market, paying for any armor you wish to keep! Some armor will protect you and give you lots of hit points, some will give you better dice to fight with, and others will give you special powers! But you must decide quickly... because you only have 1 minute to equip your Chibi for battle!



Battle! Then you battle monsters! You do this by collecting all the dice shown on your armor cards. Some monsters are stronger than others and you must meet the sword requirements to beat the monster, otherwise they damage YOU! If you defeat a monster you then follow the actions listed on that monsters card. Sometimes they give you gold, sometimes they cause you to loose armor, and sometimes they become your sidekick and help you fight!



Shop until you drop! Or in this case, fight until you faint! The first Chibi to cover up all his or her hit points faints! At this point you finish out the round so everyone has an equal number of turns.



BOSS FIGHT! Then everyone will have another minute to equip their Chibis with fresh, undamaged armor. Afterwards, you must fight together to defeat the BOSS!



WIN or LOSE! If you defeat the BOSS you are all winners! But there is only ONE Champion Chibi. You count up all your points, and whoever has the most is known throughout the lands as the Champion Chibi!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Wages of War: The Uncooperative Siege Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Wages of War is a strategy game of medieval siege warfare! Manage resources to produce weapons, and hire soldiers to wield them in battle as you send wave after wave to attack the enemy castle! The player who inflicts the most damage on the castle by the time it is destroyed shall win the game and seize the glory!

In each round, the active player will issue an Order to one of the 5 Encampments surrounding the castle. Each player benefits from the Order based on how many Buildings they have in the Encampment. Use these orders to your advantage in order to muster your army.

Train swordsmen, axemen, and bowmen, and send them to attack the castle with the support of siege towers, trebuchets, and cannons!

Plan your attack wisely, for when the Attack Order is issued you must not only beat the enemy force, but you must be able to sustain the casualties yourself.
mechanics: Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Dwarven Rails
description:
Players build tracks between cities and mines. Each mine corresponds to a single mine card that produces a single type of good, e.g. diamonds, rubies, emeralds. Players build track using their surveyors, claim mines using their agents and operate the mines to produce goods. When their track connects the mine to their base they may ship goods home via transports to earn income. They may also construct passenger routes to gain income. Along the way they hire additional surveyors, agents and transports to increase efficiency.

Features:

Ever-changing market operates following the law of supply and demand
Modular layout makes the game different every time
Variable personnel that you must acquire via auction
Special rules for solitaire play including instructions for virtual players
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Island of Heroes
description: Island of Heroes is a tactical-level game of Sino-Soviet border conflict in Zhenbao Island, 1969. One player commands People's Liberation Army, another player Soviet border guards.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: TrogloDice
description:
TrogloDice is a game where you lead your prehistoric tribe to hunt, gather, and build your way to victory. The core mechanics are some light deck-building and a unique, press-your-luck dice system for hunting dinosaurs that will either score you some resources and victory points or send you running home empty handed. You can cooperate with the other players on specific actions, but this is definitely a competitive game at heart.

TrogloDice will have you recruiting new tribe members, developing weapons and shelters, and striking deals with neighboring clans to take down the biggest, baddest dinos in the land. At the end of the game the player with the most victory points is the winner!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Guilds of London: The Secret Guild of Guildsmen
description: Promo card included in The Cousins' War. Acts as another guild.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management

name: Bloody Bucket: 28th Division Defends Skyline Drive – A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
This Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command is the first covering the battle of the Bulge. The action here covers the initial German attack against the US 28th Infantry Division as the 26th Volksgrenadier Division attempt to clear the ground between the Our and Clerf Rivers in preparation for Panzer Lehr’s advance on Bastogne. What followed was three days of epic action which destroyed the German chances of victory.

Six battlefields provide a campaign which sees the Germans attacking and infiltrating to isolate the US defenders, initially with infantry but soon with armoured support while a gallant band of men fight on to the end.

This classic Pint Sized Campaign is designed to be run using the campaign rules in At the Sharp End and with Chain of Command rules. Can you break through and open the route to the Meuse and Antwerp, or will you make an heroic stand and halt Hitler’s lunatic vision of victory in the West?

Thirty-two pages long, this Pint Sized campaign provides the background history to the campaign with situation maps. Uses period maps to show the location of the actions and then provides a complete campaign with forces for both sides, support options for players to select from and full victory conditions for all six battles and the campaign as a whole.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Pablo: Sofrência
description: Promo pack #02 for the Pablo game, with 10 new cards for sertanejo music.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Singing

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Negan Booster
description: Booster for The Walking Dead: All Out War. Includes three miniatures - Negan, Andy, and a Walker to add to the herd. Also includes character cards and new equipment cards, including Lucille.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Michonne Booster
description: This is a playable Michonne miniature. It was originally a Kickstarter-exclusive figure but was later made available to purchase through Mantic's website with Mantic points.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Meade's Turn: The Mine Run Campaign and Gettysburg
description:
Two division level American Civil War games. Uses the same system as the designer's previous At All Hazards game with two changes plus additional game specific rules.

Corps, Cavalry, and Supply wagons are activated by chit-pull. Each unit on the map is a Division with off map tracking boxes for supply, fatigue, and stragglers for each Division. Divisions have between one and four steps. Turns represent 3 1/2 hours and map hexes are approx. 1/2 mile across.

Gettysburg is won on geographical objectives with step losses counting, too. Mine Run is won solely on the basis of damage to the enemy force.

Only a playtest version produced. The designer also produced an experimental order system inspired by the Gamers' CWB (but without writing).
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: Sunday School Answers
description:
In the same tradition of Apples to Apples and Cards Against Humanity there is a card game for the church generation. If you are a fan of satire, hyperbole, church cultural or making fun of things that take themselves too seriously you will find this game hilarious.

It's easy! 3-5 players can play at one time. One of them puts down a dilemma/question card and the other players have to answer it with their most sassy answer. The judge picks the funniest answer and everyone laughs.

This game is written and created by a Jesus loving educational minister who wondered why his church friends couldn't have more irreverent fun at church culture.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Voting

name: Stawka większa niż życie: Cafe Rose
description: Cafe Rose, an expansion for Stawka większa niż życie. The expansion provides new Secret Service Agents. Also new sectors, items, agents, missions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Agricola: Rancher
description:
Promo card on Lookout spiel website

Whenever, at the start of a round, you are using more farmyard spaces that any of the other players, you receive 1 Wood. (If there is a tie, you get nothing).
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Agricola: Feed pellets
description:
Promo card on Lookout spiel website

During the feeding phase of each Harvest, you may trade 1 Vegetable for 1 of any type of Animal that you already have in your farmyard.
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Agricola: Clay deposit
description:
Promo card on Lookout spiel website

This card is an additional Action space. A player who uses this action must pay you 1 Food and receives 5 Clay. If you use the Clay Deposit yourself, you may choose to take 2 bonus points instead of the Clay.
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Abducted Cow
description:
Abducted Cow is a 2-5 player tactical sci-fi card game.
You play the role of the alien controlling a UFO. Coming to earth you develop an unhealthy fascination for the creatures we call cows. It is a race with your opponents to fill your ship with these animals. To win, you attack, defend and steal the cows of your opponents.

The card draw pile is composed of 4 categories of card: attack, steal, defend and utility. Attack cards kill cows; defend cards defend your cows; steal cards steal the cows of your opponents; and utility cards influence gameplay. You draw to a limit of 3 cards at the start of your turn. In addition, you take one cow token and one energy token from the main supply.

Each card has an energy cost associated with it, with more powerful cards costing more energy. Energy may also be acquired through utility cards, discarding a single card at the end of your turn or discarding 2 cards during.
The winner is the player who acquires 10 cows, or the most cows once the card draw pile is depleted.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Osnabrück
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Kempten
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Ahrweiler
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Missiz Burnzz Promo
description:
Missiz Burnzz is a promotional character for Krosmaster: Arena.

"An Eternal Flame
Close your eyes. Give me your hand. Do you feel my heart beating?"
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: PAH! THE GAME!
description:
PAH! is a fast-paced American Sign Language Themed card game for 2-4 players. Cards use Sign language signs for Numbers 1-9 with the PAH representing 10. Players will try to rid themselves of their personal stack of cards before the other players to claim PAH! Rounds are scored for cards played into the scoring field, Tricks earned, and any losses for remaining cards. The first player to score 350 points wins the Game. The average game last 3- 5 rounds, or roughly 15-30 minutes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: Buck: Legacy (2nd Edition) – Golden Age
description:
Even the longest nights do not last forever, a light will dawn on the horizon.
It is the end of what once was and the beginning of something new:
A Golden Age.

Golden Age is Buck: Legacy 2nd Edition's final expansion pack and features an incredible 27 cards, including:

Alicorn Race Cards!
Gauss Pony Race Cards!
Spirit Summoner Class Card!
Chronomancer Class Card!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Mega Magus
description:
MegaMagus is a simulation game of Mages duels . In fiction the last clash of two Congregations of Magic with their Champions is represented. The game can be played from 2 to 6 people and a game lasts on average from 10 to 45 minutes. In a classic game three MegaMagus on each side clash for dominance over what remains of the known world.
—description from the back of the box

Each player controls a Wizard who belongs to one of the two challenging factions. During the combat each Wizard prepares the type of attack against an opposing wizard like a spell an illusion or physical attack, or summon creatures to send against an opponent, adversary magicians do the same, or prepare healings or magical defenses. A line of life for each wizard suffers damage depending on the attacks suffered, if the line ends the wizard is defeated. Win the faction that eliminates all opponents. The game sistem allowes to add also Heroes like Elf, Cavaliers, dwarfs and so on.
—description from the designer

MegaMagus è un gioco da tavolo di ambientazione fantasy che può essere giocato da 2 a 6 persone.
Descrive le avventure e gli scontri di grandi maghi impegnati in duelli, acquisizione di artefatti
magici e scontri con mostri leggendari, per la conquista del primato di MegaMagus nei Regni.
Il gioco descrive le lotte per il potere nei Regni di due congreghe magiche. Il Capitolo della
Stella Blu (Astaroth l’Esorcista, Baltazar l’Evocatore e Morgana l’Incantatrice) e la Setta
del Cerchio Cremisi (Helena la Strega, Furiol il Negromante e Ekreet lo Sciamano) sono
tra loro alleati, quindi non possono attaccarsi, ma nelle giuste condizioni possono decidere
di supportarsi con magie, carte e guarigioni.
All’inizio del gioco ciascun giocatore sceglie il Magus che vuole impersonare prendendone
la scheda relativa e tutti gli elementi del suo set (Glifi di Potere, Segnalini e Carte Evocazione).
Posizionerà il proprio segnalino PV sulla scala vita della scheda e il segnalino
MegaMagus sul tabellone nel suo luogo d’origine.

DURATA DEL GIOCO
MegaMagus si gioca in dieci Turni Avventura, ciascuno suddiviso in tre Fasi.
I MegaMagus si alternano in azioni, magiche e non, atte a sconfiggere gli avversari o a impegnarsi
in imprese eroiche per la conquista degli oggetti mitici.

CONDIZIONI DI VITTORIA
Vince la partita il Magus che ha ottenuto più Punti Fama (PF) alla fine dei dieci turni, oppure
il MegaMagus che ha ottenuto più Punti Fama una volta eliminati tutti i Magus della fazione
avversaria. I PF si guadagnano eliminando i MegaMagus avversari, uccidendo mostri e creature,
portando a compimento Imprese Eroiche e dando sfoggio delle proprie abilità magiche
utilizzando al massimo i Glifi di Potere.
—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragonfire: Ranger Lizardfolk Promo Card
description:
Ranger Lizardfolk promo character card distributed in Game Trade Magazine #220 (June 2018).

Provides a new Lizardfolk Ranger character for players to use, unique to this promotional distribution.

There are two versions. One Male and the other Female. Only one of the two versions comes in each copy of GTM #220.

This promo card is for a Lizardfolk Ranger with the Hunter's Lore (Nature) ability: During a short rest, make a skill check. Success - Look at the top primary encounter card. You may bury it.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Air Strike: Modern Air Combat for the Whole Family
description:
Air Strike is a simple and fun air combat game for the whole family, that requires only a regular deck of playing cards and a tape-measure or ruler.

Take to the skies in modern jets of all types, launching missiles and trying to evade them!

Suitable for 2 - 10 players. Games last from 5 - 10 minutes.

Air Strike has a basic section with the basics of movement and missiles, then has an optional extra section which adds cannon attacks, ground attack aircraft, electronic warfare aircraft, and SAM sites. There are multiple missions tailored to 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6 players, although 7 or more can be easily gamed using a simple points system.

Printable markers are provided so you can print out aircraft and missiles, or you can use toy aircraft or miniatures.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Destination Earth
description:
Bzzrt....krttt...."This is a distress signal from the exploration starship Frontier...” ksht....“..e ship has been overrun by aliens... almost the entire crew are dead... we are the only ones le..” vzrttt... “We've set a course back to Earth and we'll try to fend the best we can but if anyone can help us... Please... we need help...!".. hssssssssssss....................

---

Destination Earth is a solo dice-rolling placement game in which you take control of the last two surviving crew members (from a choice of twelve) on an exploration Starship overrun by aliens.

On a turn you will use action points to move from room-to-room eliminate aliens and keeping them from destroying the crew members or overrunning the ship.

You must try to keep the crew members alive and the ship from being destroyed over a series of 'rounds' (indicated on a Journey Tracker).

If you do then you will reach Earth and the alien threat will be eradicated.

If you don't, the Frontier will be lost forever.

Can you keep the crew members alive to get the ship back to Earth so the aliens can be eradicated? Or will they succumb to the Alien menace? Only one way to find out.....
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Shinobi Empire
description:
In Shinobi Empire, you are trying to lead your ninjas to infiltrate the castle quicker than all the other players. Infiltration is not enough though, you must get your ninjas to the room where intelligence are gathered.

You do not know the internals of the castle at the beginning of the game but as the game progresses, the castle will slowly reveal itself. This is accomplished by players playing cards to introduce hallways, ninjas and walls to each floor. Players are trying to make the biggest room possible with the presence of their ninjas by capping a hallway with walls. Only the single biggest room will count though: Open ended hallways and rooms tied in size do not qualify.

The first player to successfully places 7 ninjas of his clan in the largest rooms in the castle wins!
mechanics: Enclosure, Take That
publishers: FREAKY DESIGN (フリーキーデザイン)

name: Nuclear Bro-liferation
description:
Nuclear Bro-liferation is a cooperative and competitive card game for 1-4 players. Players take the roles of Jon Johnson and his Special Operation Bros as they battle invading alien monsters. Along the way, players will face terrible social and political mishaps, friendly fire, and special boss monsters. Each game wave lasts 20-30 minutes, with up to four waves of increased difficulty. The competitive mode offers a cutthroat wave of resource grabbing, trophy hoarding, and backstabbing.

At the start of a players turn they will draw a card off the Battle Deck and either place the monster in the Battle Zone or resolve a political mishap. Next they can take one action to attack a monster, buy a item, heal, etc. After their action the player will draw one card from the Grunt Support deck to either aid or hinder the player on their turn. And finally, the monsters attack the player, causing 1 point of damage for every 4 strength. Then play moves to the next Bro.

The game continues until all monsters in the Battle Zone and Battle Deck are defeated. The players loose if all Bros die. If a Bro dies, you aren't out of the game yet! You can continue as a Bhrost and aid your team from the afterlife by drawing from the Battle Deck as normal and drawing 2 Grunt Support cards and choosing the better of the 2.

Competitive mode plays the same, however Bros will total up their kills at the end of the game, applying various modifiers.

The game can also be played solo! The player simply controls all 4 Bros at once, taking their turns one after another.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: Great War at Sea: Cruiser Warfare – Armored Cruisers
description:
This is the twenty-sixth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 20 additional counters for use with Great War at Sea: Cruiser Warfare as well as scenarios and variants for their use.
—user summary

We have the armored cruiser Blücher as re-designed with 11-inch (280mm) guns in place of her actual outfit of 8.2-inch (210mm) pieces. And additional armored cruisers that never existed, for use in Cruiser Warfare, replacement pieces for armored cruisers that had their armament adjusted in the Final Edition of Cruiser Warfare, and finally some ships that appeared in the game on “small” pieces now have the full glory of a “long” piece, like the Canadian cruiser Rainbow or Japanese seaplane carrier Wakamiya.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): The Waaaghs! – Orc Cheerleading Squad
description:
The Waaaghs (Wifes AAAnd GHerlfriendS) are the self-appointed cheer squad of the Gouged Eye. Stronger and larger than most of their male counter parts (you try raising Orc kids) the Waaaghs, disappointed with a poor season from the Orc team showed up one day to properly ‘motivate’ them. Now the Waaaghs can be regularly found on the side-lines whenever the Gouged Eye take to the pitch, hurling insults (and sometimes bottles) at the players, starting crude Orcish chants or egging the Orc players on to give the opposition more of a kicking.

This resin kit contains the components necessary to assemble The Waaaaghs!, a 3-model Orc cheerleading squad. Bulkier and far more intimidating than the often waif-like forms of other cheerleading squads, this lot mean business – their pom-poms (such as they are) are more like weapons, and they’re posed more like they’re looking for a fight than engaged in a synchronised dance routine (because they are looking for a fight…)

These models are supplied with 3 32mm Blood Bowl bases, and rules for using cheerleaders in games can be found in The Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Draconis Invasion: Victory Pledge Promo Cards
description:
6x Transmutation
6x Born of Flame
6x Reanimation
6x Forbidden Quest
6x Dark Forces (Secret Set)

6x Golden Warriors
6x Frost Knight
6x Tree Ent
6x Iron Guardian (Secret Set)
6x Black Sword (Secret Set)

6x Fallen Sky
6x Strange Magic (Secret Set)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: The Obsidian Tower
description:
A shroud of darkness has enveloped the long dormant Obsidian Tower. As it begins to creep unto the surrounding area, skirmishes rife with foul creatures are making a once fertile land desolate and it appears that the kingdom is on the brink of war.

The King has confirmed that this malice is an ancient evil - the Witchlord of Agaroth, also known as the Darkbringer - who has taken refuge within the confines of the sable keep. All willing heroes have been summoned to aid in the battle against this villainy.

Ancient tales surface of secrets buried with the kings of old; travelers whisper of mystical light sources which can penetrate the depths of any abyss; and that magical items are capable of exiling any evil but are protected within the depths of dark labyrinths. However, an ominous shadow soars overhead as fire and brimstone erupt upon the horizon …

Will your party be able to fend off vast insurgencies, make it to the Tower alive, and prevail against this ancient evil?

Adventure awaits only the bravest! Gather your party of heroes in a quest to save a kingdom under siege. Discover 3 hidden relics and make it to the Obsidian Tower to defeat the Witchlord before his minions can lay waste to all of the land.

The Obsidian Tower is an exciting fantasy-based co-operative adventure that supports action for as many as six players, ages 12 and up.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: DunkelRunde
description:
DunkelRunde is a timeless game characterized by its fairytale story, the interaction between the players and the material used. The game board, the characters and the box are made of wood. If you handle it carefully, Dark Round can still be played in 100 years.

Each player plays a girl and a boy. Players must reach a magical linden tree through fairytale scenes on the board. On the way to the tree, the game characters have to pass ghosts, giants, witches, dragons, and other fairy-tale sceneries. The game ends when a boy and a girl reach the linden tree. All players who have a child there at this point win the game. In this way it happens that not only one player alone is the winner.

The rules are explained by a story in the game manual or read on Youtube. In this way, players can better identify with the children they play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Storytelling

name: Rally Point 13: The Yanks are Coming!
description: Rally Point Volume 13: The Yanks are Coming! is a collection of 10 all new scenarios, featuring U.S. Army Actions in World War II. These 10 scenarios were handmade by the Tampa ASL Group’s fine craftsmen and are presented in the Schwerpunkt easy-to-read format on high-quality card stock.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: ATS The Devil's Vineyard: Heraklion 1941
description:
When Kurt Student focused his attention on Unternehmen Merkur, the stage was set to introduce the world to the airfield at Heraklion, Crete. The defenders included British, Australian and Greek soldiers. The write up for the book by by Yannis Prekatsounakis says succinctly, “The Battle for Heraklion - an epic struggle - remained largely forgotten and widely unstudied. Yet the desperate fight for Heraklion had everything: street-fighting in the town; heroic attacks against well-fortified positions and medieval walls; heavy losses on all sides…"

Contents:
- Six 11x16" map panels depicting the Heraklion airfield and surrounding area
- Five half-sheets of counters providing all of the combat counters required
- Eight new scenarios
- Battlefield Walkaround
- One AFV card (British Matilda II)

Players are required to have the ATS Rules, playaids and generic system markers to make full use of this product.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Sword & Sorcery: Galaxy Defenders Aliens Miniature Set
description:
This add-on includes all Galaxy Defenders monster figures (green, blue, red, purple) useful to expand your S&S adventures.

The Sword & Sorcery – GD Miniature Set includes:
Spine Critter: 2x Green Figures, 2x Blue Figures, 1x Red Figure.
Aracnos: 2x Green Figures, 2x Blue Figures, 1x Red Figure.
Xeno-Beast: 2x Green Figures, 2x Blue Figures, 1x Red Figure.
Digger: 2x Green Figures, 2x Blue Figures, 1x Red Figure.
Flying Critter: 2x Green Figures, 2x Blue Figures, 1x Red Figure.
Crimson Nightmare: 2x Green Figures, 2x Blue Figures, 1x Red Figure.
Wormoon: 1x Purple Figure.
Alien Queen: 1x Purple Figure.
Enemy Scrolls and Enemy Cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Gangs of Rome: Bread & Circuses
description:
Election day looms, and the young dominus Hostilius is standing as a candidate for the plebeian aediles. Hostilius has gained and cemented great support from the plebeian electorate by forcibly seizing control of bakeries and giving away bread to the masses.

Now Hostilius has his sights on the next bakery. Said to be the best in the Subura, this bakery is run by the famous freedman Eurysaces. Hostilius, therefore, dispatches his lieutenant Vermio to seize the bakery.

Hostilius’ plans, however, have been unearthed by a rival gang. Vermio’s sister, Bruttia, hates her brother with a violent passion, and—caring not for bread or politics—she determines she will ambush Vermio at the bakery and finish him off once and all.

These two gangs converge on the bakery at sunrise, just as a host of the Subura’s hungry citizens gather, enticed by the smell of Eurysaces’ famous bread…

This scenario box set for Gangs of Rome: Bread and Circuses contains everything you need to play this innovative tabletop skirmish game. This starter scenario box set contains the following:

Gangs of Rome A4 Full Rulebook
Bread and Circuses scenario
6 x Single piece fighters
15 x Mob miniatures
1 Eurysaces the Baker, Incola card and base
6 x Named fighter cards
16 x Equipment/Skill Coins and cards featuring four unique coins for this scenario
1 x Personal Influence Marker card
6 x Activation pebbles (3 x 2 different colours)
7 Roman numeral dice
2 x MDF Movement rulers
6 x Jigsaw Base
3 x Mob Base
6 x Sets of flesh tokens
2 x sets of ID markers ( 1 - 3, two colours)
MDF Bakery scenery by Sarissa Precision
9 x Objective tokens

Packed with all these Gangs of Rome essentials and exclusive content, Bread and Circuses is the perfect way to start or augment your collection. So take your fate in your hands, Dominus, and seize the city.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Paragon: Trials of the Chosen
description:
Set in a fantasy world beset by warring demigods vying to join the eternal pantheon, Paragon: Trials of the Chosen is an expandable card game for two to four competing players. Players choose avatars to represent their Paragon, equip them with powerful items and abilities, and engage in epic combat. The game features no luck, a compelling approach to turn sequence, complete control of your starting hand and draw order, and an innovative combat system that isn’t reliant upon minions. Build your deck using eight disciplines from four schools: Martial, Magic, Mythos, and Mischief. Choose your avatars and battle to be the last Paragon!

Choose Avatars to represent you—the Paragon—then equip them with powerful items and abilities using the ever-growing energy you are granted each round. Engage in epic combat by utilizing your weapons, armor, accessories and abilities, or use the Avatars themselves. Construct a deck by choosing cards from the schools of Martial (physical combat), Magic (wizardry and spells), Mythos (powers of light and dark), and Mischief (precision and (skulduggery). Use your cards to reduce your opponent’s Avatars’ hit points to zero, and become one step closer to the eternal pantheon.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #29 – South Korea #1
description:
Warfighter WWII - Expansion 29 South Korea #1 - This expansion adds 56 cards to your Warfighter Korea Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Hostiles, Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

Cards included are:

13x South Korea Soldier Cards
2x Mission Cards
2x Objective Cards
7x Location Cards
11x Weapon Cards
1x Skill Cards
10x South Korea Hostile - Elite Cards
10x South Korea Hostile - Frontline Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: QWARKS WANTED
description:
QWARKS WANTED is easy to understand and fast to play fun party game for the whole family. You play as a Qwark Hunter whose goal is to catch Qwarks matching several criteria that change each turn. The more your captured Qwarks meet the criteria, the more points you earn. The hunt is on!

How to play:

Display 4 Criterion cards vertically and 1 Criterion card horizontally.

The first 4 cards identify the types of Qwarks you will have to catch. The last card indicates a type of Qwark not to catch.

All players simultaneously reveal 2 Qwark cards and each will try to catch a card with the most wanted criteria on it (but not the forbidden criterion) before their opponents.

The more criteria there are on a Qwark card caught by a player, the more points he will score.

Oh and don't forget to look at cards with rare Qwarks on it because you will be able to earn extra points.

Criteria change at each round and at the end of the game, the player with the biggest score is declared Best Qwark Hunter!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: BattleTech: Shattered Fortress
description:
Shattered Fortress is one of two sourcebooks/scenario books that details the last years of the Dark Age Era (From 3146 to 3150). The events which are covered is the invasion of the Republic of the Sphere's Fortress Walls into Prefecture X and highlights other major events occuring across the Inner Sphere. Included among its rules are other gaming enhancements allowing play in Total Warfare Game Rules, A Time of War RPG & Alpha Strike. Featured in the back of this book are mini-campaigns for various events during this Era using the Chaos Campaign Rules/Warchest Point System. In this book, it discuses the possible methods that made the Fortress Walls and HPG Blackout possible.

From the Publisher:

REPUBLIC IN FLAMES!

In 3146, the Republic of the Sphere hangs by a tenuous thread. The last fragments of Devlin Stone’s dream to shepherd humankind toward a more prosperous future hide behind the impenetrable defenses of Fortress Republic. As the interstellar communications blackout rages, the ambitious Great Houses vie for military dominance, and the bloodthirsty Clans strive to find a weakness in the Fortress’s armor on their path to conquering Terra and claiming the coveted title of ilClan. When the Wall comes down, will the Inner Sphere plunge even further into the abyss of interstellar war, or will this herald the dawning of a new age?

Shattered Fortress chronicles the twilight of BattleTech’s Dark Age, as nations are thrown into turmoil and predators circle the broken remnants of the Republic of the Sphere. This volume provides a year-by-year look at pivotal turning points in Inner Sphere, offers a peek behind the curtain of Fortress Republic, and reveals the fateful decisions that will ultimately decide the future of the Inner Sphere.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Alien vs Predator: Dutch Schaeffer and Linn Kurosawa
description:
Two legendary cyborgs from AvP Arcade Game are now available. Compatible with with AvP board game and Unleashed wargame expansion.

Dutch Schaeffer is a no-nonsense Major in the USCM and an experimental ‘half-synthetic’ cyborg developed by Weyland-Yutani Corporation after his arm was torn off in an off-world colonial resistance against a xenomorph hive. The only other known example of a cyborg in the USCM is Lieutenant Linn Kurosawa, who Dutch famously teamed up with after their supporting USCM squads were all but wiped out during a Xenomorph invasion of San Drad, California on Earth. Interestingly, Dutch and Linn also temporarily allied themselves with two yautja during that incursion, but that has since become highly classified and sensitive information, of which both Dutch and Linn have been programmed to forget about due to many suggestive rumours about Weyland-Yutani Corporation involvement. Schaeffer is a heavy-set Olympian of a man, enhanced by bionics throughout his body and carries an impossible to ignore cybernetic arm which he uses to smash his foes into the ground, grapple them, throw them or simply blast them to pieces with the M56 Smartgun mounted within it. Without the physique Schaeffer has maintained for himself, using this device would be practically impossible for any human to utilize.

Linn Kurosawa is a petite, cyborg soldier, but her size is no means indicative of her combat prowess. Where her counterpart Dutch is a wall of muscle and machine, Linn is a whirlwind of destruction armed with a pair of M7 heavy autopistols and a katana that has been honed to a mono-molecular edge, and able to cut through nearly any armour. Linn’s armaments don’t end there though, as she has an over-flowing arsenal of martial arts techniques which she applies in all kinds of combinations to deal a crushing, but utterly puzzling, blow to her
adversaries. Since the xenomorph infestation incident of San Drad, Linn has continued to command the 13th USCM company and has seen far more off-world combat than Schaeffer, often in unexpected locations. To this day, Dutch and Linn team up in a variety of combat zones against all manner of foe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamp Raptor Egg Nest
description:
Fresh from the DarkStone Forge, we are excited to present the Limited Edition Swamp Raptor Egg Nest! This set includes a 3D version of the Egg Nest for Shadows of Brimstone first appearing in the Swamps of Death Core Set as part of the Map Tile artwork for the Swamps of Jargono OtherWorld. This set comes with one large Egg Nest model (cast in high detail resin) and a brand new mission exclusive to this set! These stand out pieces are easy to paint and will make an excellent addition to your Shadows of Brimstone collection! We have very limited quantities due to the cost and difficulty to cast.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – First Blood: Malkavian
description:
First Blood is a collection of five 55-card preconstructed decks for introductory games of Vampire: The Eternal Struggle. These decks are simpler than tournament level decks, but showcase all the basic mechanics of the game. They are balanced, for a fun and exciting first try of Vampire: The Eternal Struggle. They are fully functional cards, ready to mix with cards from other sets.

To make Vampire: The Eternal Struggle more accessible to new players, Black Chantry will make these introductory decks available to retailers at a reduced price compared to our other products.

Clan Malkavian are seers and lunatics both – eerie oracles of vampire society. While plagued by afflictions of the mind, they are gifted with supernatural insight.

This deck is very aggressive, focusing on heavy bleeding under the cover of stealth, with just a splash of defensive capability.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Horror, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Voting

name: Asterismo
description:
Asterismo is a solo/cooperative abstract game up to 3 players, played on an hexagonal board.

63 colored (blue, yellow and red) disc-shaped pieces are randomly put on the board, forming a compact tree. A piece is "safe" if is connected to at least 2 pieces of the same color, or to at least 3 pieces. The goal for each player is to collect several pieces (in a 3 players game, 10 of a given color; in a 2 players game, 5 pieces of each color; in a solo game, 10 pieces of each color), while keeping every other piece safe.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Recognition, Variable Set-up

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Poor Fellows
description:
The Poor Fellows do not wear fancy armor. Their weapons are whatever was close by when they headed into combat. But enemy Commanders that discount their prowess in battle will soon find themselves overrun by fanatics.

The Poor Fellows Unit Box gives Lannister Commanders a unit full of surprises on the battlefield. Having only moderate combat abilities, their true strength comes from passing Morale tests. That gives them a Faith token that can later be spent to deal direct Wounds to enemies. The unit also continually regenerates its numbers as the battle goes on, calling up new faithful to join their ranks each time they activate. The unit can be on the verge of destruction one turn, then swell back to full combat strength in a couple turns.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: TOKYO CAPSULE HOTEL
description:
With real-time open bartering, land subdivision, a hand drawn map, many custom pieces, and more, TOKYO CAPSULE HOTEL throws a crazy mix into heavy economic games.

Join other investors in Neo-Tokyo as you build attractions, buy and sell franchises, purchase land, and talk your way into profitable situations.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, City Building, Deduction, Dice, Economic, Educational, Math, Miniatures, Negotiation, Number, Real-time, Territory Building
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Income, Investment, Line Drawing, Map Addition, Negotiation, Paper-and-Pencil, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Dominant Reign: Earth Expanse Edition
description:
Dominant Reign brings forth the future where Earth has finally united to face the universe together. As they attain faster than light travel they encounter the Star Elders, a powerful alien race that seeks to keep the peace between the universe's inhabitants from infringing on each others borders. The real threat, the Blight, continues to grow and the universe must face them together.

This non-collectible stand-alone pick-up game is based in a sci-fi universe with four factions; the Earth Expanse, the Star Elders, the Neutral Zone, and the Blight. Select your allegiance at the beginning of the game, stage the playing field, change your loyalties, and bluff your way to victory.

Claim your faction, dominate the universe!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Wander: The Cult of Barnacle Bay – Laughing Le'Sav Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

A new random encounter promo card.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Fire Mountain Gut Busters – Ogre Blood Bowl Team
description:
Ogres are natural Blood Bowl players, with a long tradition of playing for other teams who can afford to feed them (woe betide the coach who fails to account for their appetite). Ogre teams, however, bring a new level of violence to the game, as their rosters feature not just one or two of these massive brutes, but often 4 of them! Of course, they're also accompanied by a veritable swarm of Gnoblars, tiny greenskin runts who have no natural athletic ability, but enough cunning and wit to know they're supposed to grab the ball from time to time whilst the Ogres are busy pummeling their opponents. Once in a while, the Ogres will give the ball-holders a little kick towards the End Zone, thus scoring some points with a bit of luck.

If you want to play some smashy Blood Bowl, you can do no better than an Ogre team. They play unlike anything else, excelling at deleting the opposing team, one by one, until they can walk the ball across the pitch unopposed. You’ll focus on hiring a handful of Ogres, and the utterly replaceable gnoblars fill out the rest of your slots. Ogres are a blast to play, and a nightmare to go up against.

This multipart plastic kit contains all the components you'll need to build the Fire Mountain Gut Busters, an Ogre team for use in games of Blood Bowl, containing 4 Ogres (1 of which can be built as a Runt Punter), and 12 Gnoblars with interchangeable heads! You'll also find a roster sheet, transfers, 2 turn counters and 2 coins, 4 Ogre-themed balls, and a mix of 14x 25mm bases and 4x 32mm bases.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Elemental Mahjong
description:
Elemental Mahjong can be played in the Classic mode with traditional Hong Kong Mahjong rules, or in the "Elemental" mode which includes spell and magic.

In either mode, players are given gems which worth 30VPs (Victory Points)to start with. A game is played over 4 rounds. In each round, players collect and discard Mahjong cards to make a winning hand with a certain pattern. The first player who completes a winning hand wins the round and gains VP gems from other players according to the level of rarity of the pattern. The player with the most VPs after the last round is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Master of Wills: Edgehunter Expansion Faction Deck
description:
Edgehunter brings new elemental powers to the game. Cast out from society they are forced to wander the wastelands looking to survive. When all hope seems lost, they stumble upon a lost artifact that imbues the survivors with elemental powers long forgotten. These new magical abilities cause these outcasts to ban together forming the faction of Edgehunter. With these new powers they will fight for their rightful place.

The world of chaos has bled over into all streams of life. Influence continues to shift from Faction to Faction with no end in sight. New powers have emerged that are shared between all Factions but how they are used is yet to be determined. Combining these technologies with their elemental powers, Edgehunters cans trike and take back their place in the world.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Tavern Masters: Tavern Menu Expansion
description:
20 All new alternate rule cards you can mix and match..

Run things your own way!
Now that you have enjoyed playing Tavern Masters and hopefully even tried some of its expansions, get ready to shake things up in this brand new serving where you can play to 40 gold or draft Patrons every round, or even start with 5 Gold each.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Space & Time
description:
Cosmic characters unite in this second installment to the Assemble story arc expansion for Vs. System® 2PCG®! A powerful and well balanced roster of good and evil, from Odin to Thanos. Join the fray in this MCU-based set that boats iconic imagery from several Marvel movies, joined together for eternity by the Space and Time stones.

Game Unit:

55 Playable Cards
1 Rulesheet


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers – Rouge Racer Expansion
description:
Add to your Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers collection with these individual Racer expansions. Each Racer brings unique "Abilities" and "Powers" of their own to the game. Collect ALL 13 Racer Expansions for the ultimate Sonic collection!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Basic 3
description:
Basic 3 is a reprinted collection of 3 SPI wargames: Leningrad, Across Suez: The Battle of the Chinese Farm October 15, 1973 and The Big Red One: The Game of the First Infantry Division at the Battle of the Bulge.

Japanese language rules with 3 separate mounted maps and die cut counters.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Stuff and Nonsense: A Little More Stuff and Nonsense
description: 12 additional cards for use with Stuff and Nonsense
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Cruel Seas: Close Quarters
description:
Close Quarters! includes eleven new historic scenarios, spanning the seas of this global conflict as well as a random scenario generator.
Also included are expanded ship rosters for the seafaring nations and new rosters for the Finnish Navy and Yugoslav Partisan Fleet.
New rules for amphibious invasions and experimental Q-ships are presented as well as expanded rules for aircraft and submarines.

Close Quarters is a supplement for Cruel Seas, the 1/300 scale tabletop wargame of World War Two naval battles.

A copy of the Cruel Seas rulebook is needed to use this supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Deck Box Dungeons: Quicksilver Sword
description:
Single promo card for the game Deck Box Dungeon, given out at Gen Con 2019.

Quicksilver Sword promo card is an additional Equipment Card that may be used when building a hero.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Statera
description:
Statera is a double-asymmetric strategy game with a huge amount of replayability.

Statera is a double-asymmetric strategy game with real scales. Its stories give players a lot of replayability and modular game map new experiences for each game. Become a leader of a Statera nation or a powerful God, fight for the territory, balance your believers, gather souls, and experience all of Statera's stories.

You can pick a different story for each game to determine the basic game's setup, get a richer experience, and learn more about the game world's story. By choosing to play for the nations of Statera or their gods you can also select the game's difficulty and the game's length.

In the Statera you will play as one of the nations of Statera or their God. The game is double-asymmetric. The first asymmetry comes from the difference between Gods and Staterans, second, there is an asymmetry between the factions. Some rules and patterns apply to the whole game, some only for Gods or Staterans, and some rules are specific to the faction.

The game is story-based. Each story tells a tale from the land of Statera and through that, it defines a number of players, unique victory conditions, setup, and some small rule adjustments. It basically means that each story, when played, feels like a different game.

The scale rising above the game board is a big part of Statera - the game and the world. The Stories already created for the game, are using the scale to count souls, balance them, lean towards a specific campsite, or take souls away from it. This component is simply crucial to play the game!

The important question is - Are you a brave Stateran, or a mighty god? It is time to lean the scale in your favor!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Retrieval, Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Events, Modular Board, Take That

name: Flames of War: Armoured Fist – British Forces in North Africa 1942-1943
description:
The British Army has the Italian-German armies in Africa caught in a vice, and are steadily screwing the jaws shut. The Eighth Army is advancing from El Alamein in the east, while the First Army fights its way through Tunisia from the west. Their armoured divisions combine the dash of fast light tanks like the Honey and Crusader, with the power of the heavy Grant and Sherman. Their infantry divisions have some of the toughest riflemen in the world, backed up by thickly-armoured Churchill and Valentine tanks and massed artillery. Together, they make up a force that can defeat anything the enemy brings against them, a force that will destroy the Axis forces in Africa.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Bad Samaritans
description:
Bad Samaritans is a comic book style card game for people with the worst intentions. The game is best played with three to five players and is quite a brutal deception game.
The Bad Samaritans are a bunch of outlaws, each of them recruited by The Chimp to join the team and battle each other in a twisted attempt to save the world.

The game consists of two dice and three decks of cards; characters, spells&powers, and scenarios. The goal of the game is to defeat the scenarios which can be anything ranging from an alien invasion to helping a sexy lady with car trouble or just dealing with overflowing toilets—beating these, scores you victory points. If you gain enough victory points, you win!

But be careful, because the other Bad Samaritans won't let you win without a fight. With special powers and spells, they will do anything to thwart your victory.
The cards perform unique actions which can create roulette like situations and death. Yes, in this game, you can actually die! Dying is a big part of the game. When someone dies, they start again with a new character, and they remove their powers&spells.

The dice in the game get rolled for random occurrences and checks. Sometimes you'll need to throw a dice to survive.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader, Command Cards, Critical Hits and Failures, Events, Follow, Kill Steal, Layering, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: 'O'Group: Wargames Rules for Battalion Size Actions in WWII
description:
In 'O' Group each player fields a battalion of troops under the command of the Battalion HQ.
The battalion consists of a number of infantry companies, normally three, and will usually be supported by heavy weapons, guns and, of course, AFVs.
This is a typical club-night sized game, although the rules easily and simply allow multiple players to field multiple battalions under a Brigade or battlegroup command if they wish.
The command structure allows for each company having a company commander who attempts to maximise command and control for his company and battalion command who are attempting to influence the bigger picture.
The standard tactical units in the game are the infantry platoon and gun or AFV platoon.
That said, it is possible to operate heavy weapons, guns and tanks as single sections, so maybe a lone Tiger on the prowl.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Anno Domini 1666: Blood Moon Expansion Set
description:
There are rumours of a ferocious beast lurking in. Vienna’s alleyways. Some claim they could hear howling, others swear they’ve seen mutilated bodies. Is there any truth to these blood-chilling stories? Surely, the unassuming Hungarian siblings by the name of Anna and Valerius Farkas have nothing to do with this mythical beast.

Warning: this is not a standalone product. You will need a copy of Anno Domini 1666 Base Game to use the contents of this box.

Contents:
• 5 highly detailed plastic miniatures
• 5 Character cards
• 20 Item cards
• 1 Rulesheet (two new scenarios included)
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Anno Domini 1666: Mercenaries I Expansion Set
description:
Witch hunter. Famous marksmen. Moster slayer. Head of the criminal underworld of Vienna. Very clever and charismatic dwarf. A guitar player who is able to unleash hell with his two double barrelled pistols. You can hire them if you are ready to pay and if you know the right people. You will not be disappointed. In this box you will also find rules for two brand new factions: infamous Vienesse Mafia and righteous Monster Hunters.

Warning: this is not a standalone product. You will need a copy of Anno Domini 1666 Base Game to use the contents of this box.

Contents:
• 6 Highly detailed plastic miniatures
• 14 Character cards
• 19 Item cards
• 2 Faction cards
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood in Space: 2nd Edition
description:
Blood in Space is a micro but complete set of rules for solitaire or co-op skirmish game, set on a sci-fi background. “Micro” refers to the small set of rules, the small time required to complete one game session and the small number of miniatures required (4-10 figures being a common range). Many micro-details are left to the player, only the “important” rules are included in the eighteen pages of the game.

The game includes seventeen Scenarios covering iconic sci-fi scenes like exploring the planet surface, attacking an enemy base, searching an abandoned starship, freeing prisoners. Event markers placed on the Map will create the needed Fog of War and randomize the placement of enemies, events and of course loot! Terrain rules allow to quickly create different planetary conditions.

Scenarios can be played individually or as part of a Campaign game: in this case a flowchart will (randomly) determine the next mission; as an example, after a “Exploration” mission a bad roll could send your characters on the “Ambush” scenario. Characters on a Campaign will be able to improve their characteristics, but with the improvement of the Reputation Level of your Crew, your enemies will also become stronger.

Activation of units (friendly and enemies) is managed with a pool of activation markers, but you can never be sure that every unit will be activated. When an “Enemy” marker is drawn by the pool you will roll on the ENEMY ACTIVATION table in the current Scenario to determine the unit to activate and its orders.

What's new in the second edition

Completely redesigned starship missions, now including

21 Starship Cards
24+ Starship Tiles (300dpi)
Starship Events Table (two pages, 36 events)
New Enemies (Demons, Mutants, Insane Crews, Void Spiders)
PSI Rules: PSI powers for the characters (and for the Enemies as well)
Exoskeletons (civilian and military)
Bionics: enhance your characters with implants.
Madness rules
New Missions
New Weapons and Equipment


Additional free components for the game are available on the Studium CMLXV site.

Blood in Space is fully compatible with the fantasy rules for Blood on the Blade
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Battlestations: The Starships
description:
New minis for the 6 "classic" races of Battlestations (human, silicoid, canosian, tentac, xeloxian, and zoallan), each with their own special ability and play style, plus a planet mini, a fighter mini, and 12 missile minis. Also included is a 24 page booklet containing 8 new missions, new rules for ship advancement, new abilities, and treasure!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for The Magic Carrot: Cake Batter Booster Deck
description:
The Killer Bunnies chefs have mixed flour, eggs, sugar and radiation to take the cake in this pastry-packed permutation. The Cake Batter Booster Deck adds 55 cards to your existing set and 10 bonus KinderBunnies Carrots!

If bunnies are many, and you need to clear room, combine Atomic Pastry and make them go boom! Cathexis bunnies use their power to persuade, to build armies of bunnies of the same shade. Form the big words for Dr. Shoe by putting lettered Carrots in the right queue!

When having no food gives you frowns, you’ll be relieved to see the Honey Hash Browns. You’ll smile each hour, and never be dour, when you feel the power of the glowing flour! Fluffy, delicious and it won’t make you fatter, if you play the latest deck Cake Batter!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Negotiation, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Pirates & Lasers
description:
Pirates & Lasers is a strategic struggle between ghost pirates and incompetent laser-wielding tourists. Keep the ship sailing as long as you can while lasers tear your ship asunder, managing resources and preventing damage to critical areas.

This turn-based strategy game challenges players to survive laser attacks and repair the boat hull each turn to prevent sinking.

Ship Blinks, which have health and the ability to transfer health to any neighboring Ship Blink, and Hazard Blinks, which fire lasers out in three directions, damaging any part of the Ship in its path. A turn has three stages - Rearrange, Repair, and Lasers! During Rearrange, Ship and Hazard Blinks are moved to prevent damage. During Repair, resources can be moved from one part of the Ship to another. During Lasers!, the Hazard Blinks fire off their lasers, dealing damage to any part of the Ship in its path. The game ends when any part of the Ship hits zero health. See how many turns you can survive in a given scenario!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures

name: Unearthed
description:
A three-dimensional treasure hunt on an multi-layered island.
Lasercut with magnetic tiles to hold tools and secret artifacts.

Dig through the several layers to uncover artifacts needed to recover treasures:

terrain
tools
strata.


Uncover tools needed to dig deeper.

Terrain includes fields, forest, rocks, ruins and swamps.

Somewhat akin to the Treasure of Oak Island.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Layering, Race, Square Grid

name: Flames of War: Avanti – Italian Forces in North Africa 1942-1943
description:
The Italians learned about modern warfare the hard way in 1940. Now they are back, showing the world what the Italian soldier can do. Fighting under the famous 'Desert Fox', General Rommel, they form a crucial part of the Italian-German Panzer Army. Tough, determined, skilled, and aggressive veterans, the Italians broke through the British Gazala Line to save the trapped German Afrika Korps, held the line at El Alamein, and opened the way at Kasserine Pass, before holding up the American offensive at El Guettar. Fight or die for the new Roman Empire!

This book gives you a whole new way of fighting in the desert. The Italians are more lightly equipped, but more determined than the Germans and British. Their infantry is as numerous as the Americans, but more experienced.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Ares VS Athena
description:
This game was attached to the ioGioco 16 magazine

Peloponnesian War: Sparta and Athens face off in a clash.
Ares and Athena, patron deities of the two city-states, direct the strategies of their respective sides by communicating with the forces on the battlefield through the souls of the deceased warriors.
But this time, even the gods took the field ... and the clash will be more epic than ever!

In this game the armies of Athens and Sparta face each other. The pawns move on a squared battlefield.
But there is also another squared board, the realm of the dead, where the souls of warriors end up when they die on the battlefield.
Each turn a player moves one token into the realm of the living and one into the realm of the dead.
The position of the souls of the deceased warriors will determine the possible movements of the living warriors who fight together with the deities.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Survive a Nightmare
description:
The objective of the game is to find the required items to perform a conjuring and take them to the conjuring room to win the game. The items you need to find are scattered across the map.

In Survive a Nightmare there are two types of specters, "Ghosts" and "Demons", if you have an encounter with a specter your panic level will increase respectively: Ghost +1 panic point, Demon +2 panic points. If your panic level reaches "5" you will suffer a panic attack and lose the game.

Each player turn has 2 phases, "Player's" phase and "Specters" phase, on the player's phase you have 4 action points, which can be used to move your character marker to an adjacent room, search for an item (rolling a die), use an item (each one has a different effect), activate fuse boxes, use a portal or to activate the rewards track which grants you additional items.

After ending a player's phase, the specter's phase begins. The active player will roll the die twice and resolve a spawning of specters across the rooms. When the specter's phase ends, the active player's turn ends. The game takes place by alternating turns between each player, until one player completes the conjuring and wins the game. Survive a Nightmare has a solo mode and a cooperative mode.

-description from designer
categories: Deduction, Dice, Fighting, Horror, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: World War III: Team Yankee – American
description:
The United States has the most powerful armed forces in the world.
Three army corps stand ready to defend Western Europe from the red horde poised across the Iron Curtain.
Armoured troops’ powerful M60 Patton tanks or state of the art M1, IPM1, or M1A1 Abrams tanks, mechanized infantry mounted in reliable M113 personnel carriers, or the latest M2 Bradleys, light infantry of the 82nd Airborne, and fast attack forces of the 9th Motorised Division all stand ready to stop the red tide.
Cavalry and scouts deploy forward in tanks, M113, M3 Bradley, and HMMWV vehicles to thwart the enemy’s progress, while anti-aircraft troops watch the skies.
The US Marine Corps’ amphibious troops are ready to be deployed where needed with their own tanks, Light Armored Vehicles, and hard fighting infantry, backed by their own support.
Those commies won’t know what hit them!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Judge Dredd: Specialist Judges
description:
Some Judges display an affinity with machines, an understanding of the workings of the human body, or display psionic talents. Such individuals are given special training and access to advanced curricula.

Psi Division moulds cadets displaying psychic talents into Psi-Judges, who bring the Law to the Mega-City in less than conventional ways.

Tek Judges maintain the Justice Department’s vehicles, weapons and other equipment while also aiding with forensics, technological threats, and advanced intrusion techniques.

Med Judges aid Judges, civilians and perpetrators injured in Justice Department operations, often from special quick reaction ambulance units.

Recent Justice Department casualties have been so great that the controversial Mechanismo robot Judges, with full judicial authority, were created by Tek Division.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
publishers: 2000 AD Comic, Rebellion Developments (Rebellion), Warlord Games

name: Sultans and Kings: The Card Game
description:
It's the 12th century A.D. You have been called to conquer the castles and free the cities of the Levant. As you march for glory, you meet a formidable enemy who is on the same mission. Mount your horses, draw your swords, and grab your arrows. This legendary conflict is going to last for centuries...

Sultans and Kings: The Card Game is a strategy card game in which 2-4 players use simple worker placement and hand management mechanisms to achieve victory. By playing soldier and strategy cards onto various cities and castles, which are represented themselves by cards, each player attempts to win a specific city or castle. When all cards have been played, battles are resolved and players claim victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Worker Placement
